review: My friends and I are really enjoying this game. Even though it is Alpha it is certainly one of the more stable and complete feeling alpha games I have ever played.The only thing I suggest is making the throwables better. ATM it takes a lot of time to take the throwable out left click to begin aiming the throw and then clicking to actually throw the item (which still takes the character a secound to execute the throw). I've had a few monents where I feel that I could have gotten a kill or laid a smoke down at the proper time but sadly the enemy team kills me before all those moves are executed.Otherwise I am really enjoying the game and I look forward to putting a few hundred hours into it.Thank you dev team.

review: For those who never really grasp the concept of survival shooters this game is just a multiplayer game of Battle Royale. While the gameplay concept is not too original it stands out because this is probably the only game that came out as expected. The $30 pricing is up for you to decide because while the game may be fun alone or with friends the reward content is a unpredictable and confusing. My first impressions of playing this game gave me the feeling that it should be priced at least $15. Unreal Engine 4 seems daunting but the game looks like any other mod from DayZ or H1Z1. The performance of the game on my MSI GL62M 7RD is pretty bad with texture pop ins and server lag but when things are settled out the game runs from fair to console like performance. If you have a desktop PC it should run prefectly fine. I'm not too quite sure the game wouldn't run on my laptop 60fps at med or low settings. Let's hope it gets better in later months.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: You see you eventually come to the epiphany that this game is an allegory for general life. You are unceremoniously thrown from a plane into a massive sandbox with random chance loot with 99 other players (5% of whom have some kind of cheat) and you kick scream and fight for dear life against these other people and also the environment to be the last one standing only to be rewarded with some on screen text that somehow validates your existence.This is ten percent luck twenty percent skillFifteen percent concentrated power of willFive percent pleasure fifty percent painAnd a hundred percent reason to buy this game.Existentialism 10/10 would buy again.Now if only the game could be properly optimised.......
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG has it's share of problems but it's still an enjoyable game. Best enjoyed with friends but the solo mode is still fun. There are issues with hackers but I've only had one or two incidents where it was obvious someone was using hacks. Game isn't optimized the best so potato computers need not apply. Decent headphones are a must as sound is a big aspect of the game. Games still pretty buggy so if you're the type to take these games really competatively perhaps you should wait till the full release.*EDIT*So release has come and gone and then some but the game still has too many problems. I really want to say I like this game but there are just too many better alternatives coming out these days. I hope in the future PUBG focuses more on fixing the game rather then marketing it as Esport "ready."

review: A refreashing twist to the FPS.If you play the genre there is very limited game styles. UPDATE This game is completely replaced by the much more polished fewer hackers and solid play feel of ROE. They have come far and it really doesnt make this a viable game anymore.It's unique because 1 life (most have respawns) Team play (with exception of games like Overwatch One person if good enough usually can just kill everyone and win) Large map (most games dont have big maps because pc/server requirements) Realistic (Bullet drop over large map is rare concept for non single player) Kills are not required to win (It's "First Person SHOOTER" kills are everything in other games) I'm sure there is more but these are the biggies.Side note there are other games (Ring of Elysium www.primagames.com ) that are similar to this Hunger Games style game but it currently is not easy to install in english etc.There are many negitives to this game too there are hackers more bugs than a finished game should have and pc requirements are currently really high for best experience. But all the other reviews will tell you about the negatives.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The only negative things I have noticed about this game so far are the ocassional glitch causing you to get stuck in walls and what not the game occasionally crashing while trying to load in and it could use more maps. Other than those 3 things (all of which are in work I believe) I don't know why this is still in early access. It feels polished and extremely satisfying to get a kill. The guns that are overpowered are rare and are so risky to get that it is extremely rare to see one. The intensity of 1v1 engagements all while being terrified that some one is going to sneak up on you and get you while you are distracted is one of the most exillerating video game experiences I have every had. Even running through an open field can be a terrifying endevour! I can not recommend this game enough especially to veteran Arma players. It takes all the good about Arma and strips away much of the complexity and makes the whole thing much more fast paced and fun while still requiring tactics planning and thinking on the fly. 9/10 would play way to much and ruin personal relationships.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a good game the games are intresting and last a long time. Its addicting and I love it. There is only one problem the Graphics and the Audio. The graphics settings are unfair so I have to play with Low shadows and in Duo the spectator (Usually helps his teamate) can see through walls and buildings for a few seconds. This can be used to cheat. The audio has bad issues to. For example just a while ago I was playing I hear my footsteps the doors I open and even my gunshots and enemy gunshots but no matter what I change I cant hear the enemy footsteps or doors. so I was playing I got good gear and I close my doors behind me. I turn around to open another door and I am dead by a guy with a shotgun who opened a door silently and he had no footsteps. Still Early Access but c'mon this game needs functionality before adding more weapons. And you cant adjust the volume of voices in Duo or Squad but you can lower the whole game sound down too for some reason.

review: I was always one of the few ppl that not just enjoyed the game but also supported it even though many bugs cheaters etc... We all know that it is hard to fully optimalize game that's 8x8km large full of loots houses vehicles but guuys what the hell? PUBG is almost 2 years old and still nothing? I would say they are trying their best right? Recent updates showed us how they mean it with the game. New map? Yeah we love it. New skins? Alright CS GOs doing the same and it works. Event pass which is the exact copy of Fortnites Battle pass? Wooaah this hit me really hard to me it looks like they are done with the game acquired everything they could from sells and gave us another alternative how to spend another 10 euros. What will be next? Dance moves? I always liked about PUBG how it tries to be realistic (even though it is clearly an arcade) thats why I prefer PUBG over Fortnite. But with this attitude I hope they will lose all the players to finally set the right priorities. Until then I cannot recommend it not even for half a price.

review: About Pubg I have about 150 hours In this game so far and I can say that its the best looking playing and working game you'll find on Early Access this game blows its competitors out of the water being H1Z1 which pu helped work on but this game is very polished for it being in the state its in the team really focuses on optimization and gameplay over graphics they listen to their community about what they want to see out of the game and that alone is a feat. What would i like to see been added to the game So far the games comes with many features i really like but here some things i would love to see being added. Locked 1st person mode Higher Variety clothes and pioneer crates More maps Bigger maps More items binoculairs for example Final Verdict Overall this game is a solid fight to the death sorta deal with a lot more potential in the upcoming updates has a great replay value intense PvP the perfect example of a love/hate relationship and you can find yourself easily getting sucked in and playing countless hours before really noticing this game is on my Highly Recommend List because it is very solid game and has a great team behind it and the hype train will not die on this game as long as they keep the good updates and finding ways to change it up then they will never see a drop in players and for those of you waiting for it to go on Sale good luck the team needs all the money they can get due to company size so that being said the current price tag is way more than worth it for all that you're getting.Highly Recommended

review: I didn't have high expectations for this game but I can say that I am very pleased with this purchase. I haven't played another game in this genre like H1Z1 so I can't really compare it to other games like it. PUBG has a great pace to the game and can vary depending on your play style. I prefer to start off the game in less crowded areas so things start slow and get more intense as players are squeezed into a smaller and smaller part of the map. Other players opt for a high risk high reward play style by jumping into action from the very begining (big cities). Like most games this is more enjoyable played with friends but solo is enjoyable too. This is early an early access game so expect the occasional lag server issues and minor bugs but overall this game for me has been pretty smooth. I had lag issues when I first started but I tuned my graphics settings and ever since then it has run pretty good. I would highly reccomend this game and is one of my favorites.

review: Alright after spending roughly 7 hours running in this game I'm 100% sure this was a waste of my hard earned dollars. I heard a few of my friends tell this game is great with a squad and its extremely fun. In my case this game is neither great to play with friends nor is it fun to enjoy in solo. The game is glitchy and extremely laggy the guns feel so terrible to use. The maps are so large I don't encounter any other players for 15 minutes and sometimes I land with 3 people we fight each other in close range with assult rifles shooting at each other at point blank and missing most of the shots fired at each other. Now they released a smaller map but they're charging another 10 dollars to play on it? That's extremely unreasonable. At first this game seemed to have such a vast amount promise however I would never recommend this game to any of my friends. I don't think I'll ever log back on this either. If your interested in playing a BR game right now I would recommend Fortnite. Its easy to play but difficult to master! Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a terrible game if you wanna play a run simulator I would recommend Minecraft.

review: I want to Keep this review short and to the point so here goes. When I first started playing PUBG it was unique fresh and thrillingly fun! Simply put in its current state I simply do not have a desire to play anymore. It's nothing but run &amp die from the dreaded circle half full/empty servers and hope their isn't a hacker on the server oh and HEY! There is an update every time I open steam. On top of that this game still has poor optimization especially for a game that's a 5/10 in the graphics department. Do I recommend? Unless you pick this game up for $15 then no. You will have a much better overall gaming experience and better more productive time spent playing something else.

review: UPDATE 23RD SEPT 2018Ignore the game. Game is now unplayable. Not only they made it for Esports when it is buggy as but the now the discord pages no longer support rooms for you to find players and play with.Completely disregarded what the community wanted year by year and now 90% of skins you can purchase are only by real money.RIP Pubg you were amazing in 2017 hopefully other devs can learn from this failure. All my respect for Fortnite devs. At least they listen to their communityUPDATE 17TH APRIL 2018Do not get deceived by the popularity and the mass media propaganda. As fun as this game tends to be at times it's worse than H1Z1. Don't be surprised that people play Fortnite and that PUBG will eventually die.1st The game is still incredibly buggy. I just had a perfect run on a game and I died for changing lanes on a road and my bike flipped for no reason. Vehicles are a joke. There are still so many map glitches it's just stupid at this point. You can go under soil vault through walls and much more.2nd Not even CS Source was this laggy back on dial internet. The servers are extremely laggy desync is everywhere. I've had recently an encounter where (in the end I killed the guy) I ducked 2 or 3 times in front of a wall after doing so I got myself headshotted 3 times. I was lucky enough to kill the guy as I had a clear shot and he wasn't kiting.3rd RNG is absolute Don't bother with the first map people leave it cause there are too few places to find a decent weapon like scar or m416. While they ruined the first map in total they made the desert one unfair to the point you just want to uninstall as in go and loot 5 blocks with 10 floors and find the same gear you'd find in 2 ruins. Why ruins what's the point?4th Community is toxic af. Hackers all over the place. We have been asking for almost a year to region lock china and they just don't give a fluck.5th C A M P I N G . This game will be like 90% camping. Because most don't know how to shoot. Example One guy in a game shot me with the scar while I didn't see him and only got me twice. Dude throws a molotov for distraction and for the next 5 god damn minutes was camping on a table near the door in the house he was. The zone gets to him and in the end I sniped him.Where's the fun in a buggy laggy game full of people that have no clue what fair play?UPDATE 23RD DECEMBER 2017As of now I am closing to 1k hours I can say the game is annoyingly fun. The game is still buggy as hell the vaulting system is acceptable but at the same time stupid af. As the key binding does jack It still activate when he wants and not when you do lol.The new map is gargantously huge loads of new content weapons all sort of new But still some things really ruin the game. 1. LAG. Seriously guys you are closing to 1 billion income and you still have this issue. GO TO ING NASA AND ASK FOR SERVERS JESUS.2. HACKERS ( mainly chinese ). Now.. I will have that will come and tell me I'm racist but even my chinese ex agrees that the chinese gamers are super salty bad annoying and cheatsie as hell. 3. REGION LOCK. We need this the most! Prevents the bloody hackers to flood the EU and NA servers and perhaps more people will speak goddamn english .By now the game I could say is recommended as the performance is waaaaaaaaaay better. But as a pioneer to this game I honestly prefer the older version. Good old times.. good old places... good old weapons... Now with the release you barely go to the normal map all I get is desert desert and ocassionaly a c y k a b l y a t. _____________________________________________________________________________Game is cool but only 1 map. Promised another one been 4 months and nothing. A lot of bugs can't spectate anymore problems with connection.. ... and they said in the next update will implement microtransactions for a 30$ game in EARLY ACCESS. Gabe needs to make these things illegal . Until the final product is out microtransactions must be left out. Very dissapointed to say the least.UPDATE 3RD AUGUST 2017 Game is EXTREMELY LAGGY. Never played a game this laggy in my life. 2 Patches ago I would've recommended the game in a heartbeat. Since they've added the latest patch there are severely fps drops and the lag is so annoying I've basically shot a guy with my target focused on him and he got no damage but the bullets went behind him on the door. If 2 days ago I was playing with 50 60 fps now it goes down even to 20 30 sometimes.KEEP IN MIND the developers are the creators of 3 or 4 MMORPGs one I've played called Tera Online which is a huge success and they still haven't updated the lag. The game at this stage is LITERALLY unplayable.Huge dissapointed. I really hope Steam apply some fees on this early access s with their microtransactions t. They made millions of the selling of the game and they couldn't make playable servers. off!

review: Look the game as a whole could use a bit of work that being said... it is a fun game. The main problem is the recent monitization of the game.In Game Currency Basically pointless only can be used to buy crates which are 80% of the time locked for which you will have to buy a 2.50 key with real money to unlock. The other 20% of the time its an unlocked crates which contains nothing good.Battle Pass System Finally introducted something to work towards in the game instead of randomly playing. To bad they have put it behind a pay wall. And even if you pay its only for a limited time and the rewards from completion the missions are pretty For a game that cost $30 you would expect most content to be able to be earnt. Not as soon as you enter please pay us more money to not look like a pleb or to give you something to work toward. I dont have a problem with micro transcations but within reason. If they want a player base that will keep coming back they need to have a reason more than just try and win. In my opintion they need to make battle passes free or AT LEAST can be bought with in game currency. I will keep playing this game infrequantly but if you want people to spend money on a game its better to make them WANT TO not FORCE THEM TO.

review: Used to play lots of Dayz mod on arma 2 had about 1300+ hours on it and absolutely loved that game! then the standalone for DayZ cam out and i hoped that it would be an amazing game i had never been more wrong.So i started looking for that 1 game to rule all Battle Royale games played H1Z1 rust etc nothing compared to the feeling the DayZ mod gave me but the mod was slowly dying and so did my hope for a good Battle Royale game...Until this game hit the steam market! I'm absolutely loving this right now!! Even though it's still in early access the game developers have done way more to fix this game than any other dev team on these kinds of games.I'm giving this game an 8/10 so far there are still bugs in the game and sometimes you run into aimbotting crossbow people but hey just get into another match and kill people! Or.... get killed by a guy 3rd personing a tree for 5 minutes just to shoot you in the while he is still in the blue zone. either way i still love this game and can't wait for further updates!

review: Playeruknown's Battlegrounds is a good game After 100 hours playing this game i feel like i can finaly write a balanced reveiw for it.Currently this is one of the best games in my library and i spend most evenings playing with my friends. The game is well balanced fast paced and an overall enjoyable experience. okay sure sometimes youll land and instantly get shotgunned by someone who was quicker than you and occaisonally the buggy physics will flip your car off the tiniest bit of god damn leaf left on the road. But theres nothing quite like the feeling of seeing the glorious Winner Winner Chicken Dinner screen as you put a bullet between your last opponents eyes. PROS Dont be dissuaded byt the early access label of the game its still more complete than a lot of tripple A games that have been released. Theres no icrotransactions for cosmetics or pay to win items. the game is balanced and thats how the devs like it (however you can trade and sell cosmetics on the steam market but theyr literally a few pennies so i cant complain) if youve ever wanted to kill someone with a frying pan after they have wasted all their bullets on you then heres your game You can play with friends and they are supposedly releasing custom private servers and modding support for the game after its out of early access. CONS Sometimes hit reg with shotungs and rifles can screw you over but they are working on the servers and optimisation. Loot spwans can be very tempramental meaning sometimes ill walk into the first room of a building in some backwater little village and ill get lvl3 armor a sniper and an assualt rifle as well as healing. and other times you will land in a hi pop hi loot area and get a pistol and some new trousers for when you yourself because a team of guys with full armor and Aks walk round the corner You cant always guarantee a fair fight. All the guns can be used to the end game they all have their uses but sometime you will get outgunned purely because you have an smg against a rifle and if the loot spawns are bad theres not a lot you can do about it. Finally Playerunknown's is a fun game that with the state its in and the promised new content releasing soon is more than worth the asking price. i would reccomend getting it now just in case the prices go up after release. iIf you enjoy killing people for no reason other than the great circle of death told me to then heres your game. and hopefully ill see you lying face down in the dirst so i can take your stuff at some point )

review: I grit my teeth every time I boot up this game just to play with my friends who seem to like the game for whatever reason. I have endured this heavily flawed game just for them but seeing that PUBG is taking yet another competitor Epic Games's Fortnite to court I am relieved to say that I will never EVER touch this game ever again.Now it may seem that my main reason for this boycott is because of PUBG's questionable ethics and you're right it is. However this is only one of my reasons. If I were to be blunt as I have already mentioned this game is HEAVILY flawed and the game is simply not fun. And to quote Reggie Fils Aimé the current president and chief operating officer of Nintendo of America "If it's not fun why bother?"I believe PUBG's developers are well aware of this fact which is why they put so much effort in removing their competition simply pathetic.TL DR Game performs inconsistently constant FPS drops lag Hackers TONS OF THEM. Would not recommend this game to ANYONE. If possible I would have had paid someone to buy/take this game away from my library.

review: Update A few patches later and my game is running extremely smooth on both of my systems. Great play alone or with friends and a must have.Pros Good dev team stable game strong fundamentals. The gunplay and loot system are very strong.Cons Campers. Expect a s***load of camping especially in 1v1s. Some people will sit and hide the entire 20 minute+ game until the final 10. Watch out for them.Previous negative review Terrible optimization for my system. I have no issues playing most any other "Battle royale" MMO Survival Sim etc on high/ultra specs yet I can't even manage 20fps on this game despite blowing the minimum specs (which their website claims will get 60FPS on minimal) out of the water. Will give it another go when they release some more updates.

review: After having played this game for a few hundred hours I'm not going to lie there are a ton of bugs and problems with the game but at the same time it's a fantastic experience.The concept of a battle royale game have been around for along time the first iterations starting as simple mods for FPS's Arma 3's Battle Royale really kicked off the genre with the general public and H1Z1's attempt was also a hit but one is a mod and the 2nd makes Call of Duty look like the best game ever. While PUBG still has bugs and issues H1Z1 after Years of development still suffers from a lot of the same problems it did day 1 and it truly seems the development team's focus has been shifted from fixing the bugs and making it a fantastic game and more towards content and milking money from players.Unlike it's predicesors Playerunkown's Battlegrounds is one of the first games developed around and solely for battle royale. It's development is purposed around bettering the players experience in the one and only gamemode and it truly seems the developers are working hard to smash the bugs that currently plague the game and bettering the playing experience to the best of their ability. Yes this is still an early access title yes it's buggy yes you can die by the problems currently in the game but despite the issues i've experienced in the nearly 200 hours i've played this game gives me an adrenaline rush like no other game can. Every single round the thrill of the fight is a fantastic feeling and once you get up to the top 10 and the play circle is only a few hundred meters across you can feel your pulse starting to spike. It's like the thrill you get from a good horror game but every single round you get that rush.Is this game perfect? Hell no. Is it worth the $ in it's current form? Absolutely. The devs have already ironed out a lot of bugs and they continue to do so patch after patch the game is already in a great state and it can only get better. If you've been looking for a game to get you back in the FPS genre and a game that truly keeps you on the edge of your seat you will love Playerunkown's Battlegrounds
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros Generally a fun game if you're into PvP survival. No microtransactions. (yet) Cases are earned in game with in game points earned by playing. Reward can be sold on the Steam Marketplace. Really large map (larger than The Elder Scrolls Oblivion's world). 100 players per game including game modes of Duo (teams of 2) and Squad (teams of 3 4). Realistic gunplay (bullet drop winds penatration etc)Cons Difficult for new players to Battle Royal. The servers are not 100% optimized which leads to crashes freezes and lag. There isn't a huge selection of weapons or items Duo and Squad are A LOT harder than solo. Players with lower end rigs have an advantage with the very low settings. Exp You're on high setting hiding in a bush a player who is on low settings doesn't see that bush but sees you clearly.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pre release last year PlayerUnknown expressed his positive throughts by replying to questions on modding he noted that he is keen on modding and said he would endorse it in his own game and could result in finding a new PlayerUnknown . Current day post 1.0 release. No modding as any mods made could result in a ban.Earlier on last year the PUBG team stated that they were certainly not going to add microtransactions pre full release. Not long after the option to buy keys and crates was added to the game while still in early access.The dev team also believe that they own the right to a genre of game that being Battle Royale. This was reflected in their action of threatening legal action against the developers of fortnight as fortnight added a free battle royale mode into their game. The similarities consist of Lobbies start out with players grouped together. You jump out of a vehicle above the destination you want to go to. A zone pushes players tohether on the map.That s where they end. Let s face it the developers of this game turned from approachable nice people into a group of scummy corporate asshats when their game was met with massive success.Overall the game is solid however far from esports ready . It is a fairly enjoyable experience as long as you are playing with friends. The major downside lies not in the game but in the developers of it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Im actually taking the time to review this game only because it brought me something i was looking on survival shooters.Back a year ago i got H1Z1 and i played that game for a little of 100+h enjoyed the first 5 wins after that it became a joke full of stupid deaths caused by the game itself game patches were an eternity long and only 2 rifles and a shotgun?!?! thats no fun! but since the world is a beautiful place some people got together and decided to remake the idea of the survival shooter that was a trend and make it a enjoyable game even tho it has some issues minor and MAYOR! its been patched weekly with big updates and the developers are really doing what the comunity wants that is PUBG.A lot of weapons different attachments and a really Arma type look this game brings fun to another level competition it really satisfied me more then H1Z1 which to be honest its not a bad game just that is not finished...(over 2 years in Early access....)I would recommend this game if you are into competitive shooters with a unique goal Survive8/10 (till they fix the bugs and release full version) XoladnayeUpdate 09/21/18This game is d o g s h i t.

review: EDIT I am removing my old review and posting this instead F*** PUBG and BLUEHOLE. This is absolute trash. They region locked China and it was phenomenal for the last 3 months. Getting into a game was great. I could speak and communicate with my team. It made the game meaningful and exciting with call outs and social aspects were great.Now with this update from 7/4 or somewhere around there Bluehole have opened the floodgates to this sh*t once again. I can't get into a game with anyone that speaks English. This was the biggest deterrance to the game for millions of US players and they fixed it. WHY F*** IT UP AGAIN? Incompetance and greed. F***. YOU. BLUEHOLE. Now we not only have Chinese hackers and communication barriers but Chinese ADS running at top volume the entire match! F*** YOU BLUEHOLE.I have to back out of 8 10 games before I find a team that speaks English (usually only one player the rest are asian.) I just got into a game after my 5th attempt with two english players and one Asian. We loot for 5 minutes at Camp Alpha. Asian team knocks a teammate. I go to revive and he hits me with a Kar98 and then our other teammate. This unacceptable and completely unecessary move by Bluehole is going to be their downfall. I am done with this game because its impossible to actually enjoy it anymore. I stopped playing before because of these issues and they finally fixed it. Now we are back to the stone ages and they could care less. Go buy Realm Royale or fortnite if you wish. F***this game and F*** Bluehole.Also you dont get sh*t out of the crates you can open for free. I have like 100 crates sitting in my inventory because you have to pay $2.50 to open EACH ONE. In case I havent said it yet.....F*** YOU BLUEHOLE AND F*** YOU PUBG!

review: Now as you can see I have put a lot of time in PUBG since it's first release on early access. I'm also a father of five and work a full time job but this is the only game that I have continued to play every chance I can. Everything about the game just makes you want to come back for more. I have never had that experience where I said just one more and haven't followed through. I am not be any means great at this game and the learning and experience from each game pushes that limit of one more to another level. Constantly being on your toes even when you think you have dropped in a location alone is insane. The loot phase is by far one of my favorite parts of the game. Hoping that next room has a close range vector and a extended mag nearby or seeing that Kar98 and getting excited that you might have an increased chance of winning. All this is just the beginning. You finally make your way to a popular loot spot or see guys running across an open field opens all your receptors into overdrive. Contemplating the best way of engagement. You finally decide to strike or make your move and your adrinaline begins to pump. This is what happens every game. I have become immersed in a way no other game has done. The game is still early access but looks far from it. Sure you have some server issues every now and again and funny glitches that make you laugh but overall you are constantly hooked. The map and locations are beautiful and the reward boxes you claim with your battle points are amazing in the fact you use in game currency to buy them. No need to for out 20 bucks for crates that do nothing but change your appearance. The dev team is also another reason to buy this game. They listen to feedback from everyone and want to make this the best battle royale game known to man. If this style of game is what you want then this is the game you need to get. Buy it and join the hundreds of thousands that say "just one more".
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 222 hours ingame so what about doing a review?I bought this game right at the start. I actually wanted to buy H1Z1 although it received heavy criticism because the developers stopped to work on the game and ignored many problems like bugs and hackers.So when I was about to buy H1Z1 I heard that there is this new game coming out and that the developers were putting really much work into it. I changed my mind and bought this game without even watching gameplay videos or screenshots.The game started sloppy and had many bugs performance problems and even a few hackers.But now that it's out for a few months it improved in many ways the performance is good right now the graphics are somewhat nice and even hackers are getting dumped. At the beginning the developers brought many patches in no time to face really annoying bugs and worked really hard.Now the patches are getting realeased rarely but they do bring a lot of content and fix many issues at once. Furthermore they contain lots of new stuff (weapons). This game is at a very good point. I totally recommend buying PUBG since the performance is great now and it outclasses H1Z1s in every way. So if you're looking for a King of the Hill based game this game is your game of choice. Enjoy.

review: This game used to be amazing. I put hundreds of hours into it from the moment I got home to the moment I went to bed. It was so replayable. The devs were extremly competent listening to the player base and fixing everything that needed to be fixed and adding things that needed to be added. Then fortnite came out. Now I'm not saying that this is Fortnite's fault. They just saw how much money could be made. They made cases which you could not opt out of that needed keys. They wasted time and money on new maps that we didnt want instead of fixing bugs and problems that needed to be fixed. There were hacker infestations that they admitted were almost all from China but when we asked for region locking they called us xenophobes. When requested map selection they had it for about two months then practicly removed it. They sued Fortnite for copying an idea from a movie that they also copied. They then added the event pass. Copying fortnite exactly. They have become a huge money grab. The devs have become incompitent. And the player base has gone to crap.

review: This game was pretty good but sadly it has been plagued with a pretty heavy amount of hackers. It's currently still a problem and looks like it will be for awhile. The devs have been cracking down on the creators of cheats but the issue is still there.Aside from the hackers though this game still has a high amount of bugs and operating issues that are inexcusable for a full release. Things that should have been fully ironed out in alpha/beta are still plaguing the game. Textures fail to load aiming down sites still gets caught on invisible walls when peaking rails models don't match there collision boxes.It's a lot of things that really disturb the integrity of the overall experience. On top of that there are supersized updates almost every other day for seemingly no reason. The game remains the same for the most part but every couple of days a 4GB+ sized patch needs downloading. This may not be an issue for everyone but for those like myself who are on a slow connection the game is never ready when you are. Then there's the new "Event Pass" which is a terrible value and ultimately a farcry from competitors offers. I used to laugh when people compared this game to Fortnite as I was somewhat of a PUBG purest. But when this game started getting hit with the hackers etc I gave Fortnite another chance. Since then Fortnite has done nothing but get better while this remains stagnant or gets worse.The gunplay and realism of physics etc in this game is still something that is very enjoyable but ultimately I can't recommend it over Fortnite to be honest. Save your money and play something else. If you want a BR game Fortnite is your best option.*OLD REVIEW* (Alpha Build)*******The paid content is for a special event!********The amount of people leaving negative reviews simply because the dev has keyed (payed) boxes that are for a special event and internal testing is absurd. The paid content is to support a tournament that is going on during Gamescon as well as to iron out any issues that might be present upon full release. On top of this they also released a whole bunch of free content that doesn't require a purchase to unlock at the same time. You can choose to get a pay for unlock or free unlock crate and if you choose to can completely ignore the pay for items.As for the game itself it has it's issues many of which have plans to be fixed in the near future. Overall though the game is very fun and gets most of the entertainment from the uncertainty of other players. There's no base building nor resource gathering. This is purely a "last man standing" game where you find weapons and healing items. My biggest complaint would be the server speeds. They have a noticeable amount of lag resulting in behind cover shots and all around strange timing instances. That being said I enjoy it but just think people shouldn't expect rust or other games style of play. You work on mastering a few variables to focus on a singular goal. There are plans for more game modes but I can't comment on those as they7 aren't even in the PTR yet.

review: I've only been playing this for a couple hours so far but I'm already loving it. The audio is fantastic if you have a good headset. I really hope the devs keep going with this one and keep adding content and expanding on this game. The concept is great hunger games style survival. Keeps your blood pumping and keeps you on your toes. My only suggestion to add the ability to press an action button to say jump a fence or climb a ladder. I'll probably be following along with this game for hours/days of more gameplay to come! Thanks Devs keep it up and don't let it flop like the DayZ guys did!Edit After putting hundreds of hours in it I can honestly say the devs are more concerned about their pocket books in the short run then they are at actually dealing with the toxic playerbase they now have. I don't mean toxic as in foul mouthed or mean or anything that stuff is all fair play. Their refusal to anything substantial to limit hinder or obstruct hackers in this game is rediculous. I say they are worried about their pocket books because they do nothing more than ban the player name. The play can still buy back into the game under a different name/account. That's not enough! It only pads their pocket books. Ping limit Make it so that ranked matches set players with other players of a particular ping range. It's not that difficult to code that in. If players wanna cheat they can cheat in their own region. That would solve most of the problem for everyone outside of China. Institute holds on BP If you get reported for something. If you're legit and moderators find nothing illigitiment you'll get your BP if it's not legit you wont be able to continually make more money in the market than it costs to buy back into the game. This would ultimately make it fiscally impossible to hack and make more money to buy back into the game. Like I tell everyone. I love this game. The content is excellent but the way that they handle their hacker playerbase is unacceptable and makes the game unplayable. At it's current state I can no longer recommend playing this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Played this game a lot during the early days it was new... inventive... grand! However i've come to learn that this game is more like that highschool girlfriend that you thought was great but decided to move on and try better things. A few months/years down the road you think "hey! i'll look her up and see how things are going" ... so you decide to invite her out on a date spending about an hour downloading I mean preparing for the date... When you finally see her again you realize quickly that she's nothing more than a cheap wh*re these days selling herself for cheap tricks. You think "hey I get it... girl's gotta eat..." but then when you think about going down that rabbit hole again you quickly realize its a gaping stargate of a hole down there having been plowed by God knows who. Nothing but puss and sh*t spews out of it. Having said that I will never ever attempt this game again. Begone THOT!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I got this game after quitting CS GO and started off immediately in First Person. Since then it has been fun to play even alone. What I have noticed is that 99% of the hackers play on the Third Person servers and not the First Person ones with the exception of 2 times out of 300. So if you want legitimite fun then play on the first person servers rather than Third Person. In regards to skins I couldn't care less. If you want them then go ahead don't denounce Bluehole for giving out skins when they are following what Valve did with their games. In terms of optimization and bugs look at skyrim and its bugs absolutely horrid. But when you don't even own the engine the game is built on then it's hard to "optimize" it. All in all I would highly recommend this game if you're looking for a realistic battle royale.

review: This game is alot of fun but it has some drawbacks. Most of the time when I play with friends we run around and gather up a bunch of supplies and its almost more of a survival horror than an fps but its still alot of fun. Solo play and duo play are a similar experience. The problem in this game is honestly the shooting portion which I'm sure a bunch of people will just call me a noob and move on but its pretty frustrating at the moment. The bulk of its problems can most likely be attributed to being an early access game but its still frustrating to stand 6 feet from a guy and shiit him with a shotgun because he doesn't know your there and somehow it misses and then the next game you try the same shot from five times the distance and it hits. It's a lack of consistency that is honestly annoying. They'll probably smooth it out over time but its kinda iffy right now.Overall this is a damn good game the shooting mechanics will improve but it's fun even with kinda wonky mechanics. Would definetly recommend buying it.

review: While it leaves much to be desired when it comes to graphics and maintaining a steady frame rate. I can say this is a great game. The only game I have played that I can compare to this is DayZ and I can honestly say this is miles better. The gearing isn't tedious the action is fairly constant and is a lot of fun to play with friends. There's room for multiple game styles whether it be hiding in the buildings using the terrain to flank enemies or going crazy and shooting everyone on sight you can find something to fit your play style. The gear UI is easy to use and aiming is fairly easy. Only bad thing I would say about this game is the server lag can sometimes be an issue opening doors or getting into cars can be unrepsonsive and requires multiple presses of the interact key. And of course there's the graphics and FPS issues that I already mentioned. However the positives far outweigh the negatives in my opinion. 8/10 in my opinion. Thank you for reading.

I would rather do a 50 player game than 100 people. Too many people jump out of the plane at the same time as you or people get things WAY before you and kill you while you parachute. I still recommend this game but there are a lot of flaws that need to be fixed.

review: Here's the thing...I don't like shooters. Not to say that they aren't any fun but I've never seen the purpose. With this game its a little more clear cut which really helps people like me who don't find the value in it. With this game there's only one option shoot or be shot. The reason? To be the last man standing. For me that's way more engaging then just shooting everyone. I love how focused this game is on what its trying to do. It's not focused on weapon classes or maps although those are pretty important parts. This game puts all its effort into the gunplay and battle royal style action which is much more enticing than other shooters. This is one of those games you could play for hours without even realizing it. Its addicting in its unconventional approach. This is also why I love the shooter "Overwatch" because there's a little more meat than just the shooting. Of course there's the gunplay but there's characters a "narrative" special attacks and many modes. It doesn't even need a single player! Just like this game doesn't need a single player. Now let's get into the stuff that I don't like. Keep in mind that this is early access so things are likely to change but this is just what I don't like at the moment. Although the gameplay is fun and exciting it can get a little boring if you play it for hours on end. Even just the addition of a new mode will keep things fresh. Also I hope that you can make custom servers so you can get a group of friends together to play a match just with them. And of course new maps and weapons would be cool but that's not extremely important to me. In the end this game is the groundwork of something I think will grow to be a ridiculously fun and fresh shooter in a time where most shooters are dull. Yeah there's a few kinks that need to be sorted but if it can turn over a Nintendo fan ike me to play a shooter I think it can continue to wow me in the future.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a battle royale done right. The gameplay is solid everything is straight forward for the most part. There's obvious optimization issues but it's early access and an indie game so I can't bash it for that too much. Other than that the game looks great it's updated decently frequently and issues are addressed and fixed in the patches. I've clocked a lot of hours in this game already and I practically just bought it a few days ago. Lots of fun with friends lots of fun by yourself custom servers (which I feel aren't utilized as much but that's the player base not the game itself) not much more you can ask for. My only complaint is that the matches are very quick but at the same time I do enjoy the quick matches. It'd be nice to play a longer match where you didn't have the playzone wall chasing you down if you don't get to the middle right away.Excited to see where the game is going8/10

review: Very few bugs but the gameplay itself is fairly clunky. DPS is strange at times hingeing on bizarre. Multiple burst shots from an M16 deal little damage but a single shot from a revolver can put you down at times. The third person camera needs some extreme work. Needs ability to change general 3rd person camera side position much like you can when you zoom in and by tapping the lean buttons. Bullet hit boxes are unreliable or the objects themselves have a 50% larger hitbox than the object actually shows. (A 3" light pole extends on either side .75" and a headshot suddenly does no damage and gives away your position.) Aiming in third person around walls is also difficult a red marker appears when the game detects when you're about to shoot the wall in front of you instead of around the wall but 9 times out of 10 even if there is no red marker you still hit the wall and once again give away your position which still refers back to better hit boxes for objects (especially walls and fences). Minor fixes such as make parachuting seperate from vehicle controls so you can set vehicles to arrows and still be able to free fall with WASD. There's a few other things I'm sure I forgot to whine about but none the less though as much as this game has its issues I'm sure they'll be resolved or at least managed to an acceptable level and I have had nothing but fun in this game and highly recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Having played for almost 1000h i can say that the hackers have reduced a lot. review: Game can be super fun when you are playing in a team and playing tactically. I have to say i have encountered one or two hackers unfortunately it seems that Xray vision is one of the most popular hacks at the moment probably because its one of the harder ones to detect and report.Overall i'd give Pubg a 7/10 It is a great game in principle and the recent updates have improved the performance a great deal. I really want to give the game a thumbs up but there's two reasons why I just cant at the moment 1. The latency can be a nightmare at times I've lost count with the amount of times ive died behind cover and on my death cam its shown me standing in the open on the enemy's screen! WTF!2. Loot Crates You can get loot crates with in game Battle Points BP but when you get one you have to use REAL money to buy a key to actually open the crate! What a JOKE BlueHole can stick that mechanic right up their HOLE!So thumbs down for now.

review: STRONG LANGAGE Ok so that's it. I've hoped for more than a year that this game fixes the most basic issues a game can have but now I'm done. After more than 1 billion dollar in revenue more than a year of development AND the 'official release' of an obvious eternal early access game the devs still don't know where they are going with this game. I have more than 500 hours of gameplay and each time I reconnect features are just randomly shuffled and not for the best. They are just constantly modifying the experience never improving and luckily never degrading introducing new bugs and retard features. The only constant in their mind is obviously 'How do we get more money in that game?' Cars and motorcycles get stuck in the most place.Objects fences random holes in the grass All the ramps are at mid waist level apparently exactly where you would aim to shoot someone... and you can basically empty a whole AKR magazine on a small wooden staircase ramp with no effect whatsoever. Your avatar can literally get stuck IN the walls between objects with no chances to get out except hoping your teammates shoots you so you can crawl out of it. People lagging are just desynced with you often giving them an advantage as you often think ''Did that guy just shoot me through a wall''? Loot is you can loot 8 building finding nothing but 8 backpacks and 15 pistols and then stumble on a spot with 2 ARs and 200 bullets There is now 9 different kind of loot boxes all giving you about no chance to get anything but garbage driving prices for interesting loot at heights. Making this whole loot thing a thriving experience for compulsive gamblers.Most games literally gets down to either jump where there is no one or jump where there is people and hope the door you took have something behind it just before you get shot behind the head by the guy who found an AR.Now I know that some of it gets down to gameplay and although I could have handled it if they just didn't try to make it less random I just can't believe that a company that has made more than a billion on the back of their players can't manage to fix basic collision bugs unless they really don't give a about the gameplay itself. It was funny the first 3 months now I'm just wondering why no one gets fired for purposely trying to sabotage the game...Don't buy it hoping it will be fixed someday. It won't. Buy it if you want to gamble on loot boxes like crazy that's basically the only thing they nailed this game is for you.Word of advice for the devs JUST STOP TRYING TO INTRODUCE NEW FEATURES YOU OBVIOUSLY CAN'T DO IT. JUST FIX THE ING GAME. IT S TIME TO END IT AT SOME POINT GODDAMNIT. I MEAN CAN YOU PLEASE JUST DO A FUNCTIONAL LOBBY. JUST THAT WOULD BE SO MUCH APPRECIATED. HOW MORE MILLIONS DO YOU NEED TO MAKE A MENU FOR CHRIST SAKE?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *Update as of 4/12/18*This game is STILL a bunch of lagtastic bool sheet. All that $$$ and we've still got a turd game. P H U C K jew bluehole rename your company to B U T T H O L E because this game smells like A S S

review: Great game the most recent patch has added a little bit of lag. It has also fixed alot of bugs and added some very nice features... I don't think the lag problem will last for more then a few days. As for people complaining about microtrans the items purchasable are purely cosmetic and the Dev's have said the reasoning for this is 1.Test Microtrans2. Fund the upcoming tournament 3.Prize money for tournament4.Donate to charity. Other then that the devs are very responsive and listen to the community. There is no advantage to microtrans nor is there any forced purchase. Microtans are also only going on for a month. If you dont buy this game because of microtrans you will miss out on a great game for a stupid reason.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I understand people are upset that PlayerUnknown broke a promise about micro transactions not being implemented in early access but I've got to say that it doesn't change my opinion of the game personally. The game itself is brilliant and brings me back to my DayZ days only much faster paced due to the contracting circles of death. The fact that it's in early access is just gravy because the level of polish is broadly speaking very good and I can only imagine how much better it's going to get. Also the devs are consistently updating and communicating with the players so yay.Personally cosmetic micro transactions that are obtained through RNG don't bother me because they're optional. I'm also not bothered by the fact that PlayerUnknown went ahead with this despite saying he wouldn't he's not making any money off this initial test of the micro transaction system all proceeds fund a tournament.So... yeah. Get in dere.

review: This game CAN be great however especially for those of us on the oceania servers it is ruined by players in china. Luckily this should be an easy fix for a company that ISN'T a cesspool of greed. Not to mention this isn't a racial issue contrary to Brendan Greene's lies it's rather a question of three main issues. These include ping communication and cheating. Firstly with ping it's pretty obvious for a knee jerk reaction fps game why it absolutely has to be low. It's not exactly fair to be hitting targets only for the damage to not register due to lag or even worse to be shot by a dead player. Players from china are the main reason this occurs as they are connecting to servers waaaay outside of their region causing of course huge lag. Secondly communication. In the team based gamemodes communication is vital to success which is why it can be upsetting when teammates you were matched with can't even speak the same language. Although normally this wouldn't be an issue in shard based "ultima online" styled servers this is. To put it in to simpler terms you would expect someone to speak spanish in a server purely for spain correct? Well this is where the importance of the region lock and the chinese come in to play. You can pick any server which in of itself isn't much of a problem when people understand that picking european servers when you live on the west coast of the USA is a terrible idea as mentioned with the lag point. Since the chinese servers are "bad" they go to the other servers that don't speak chinese bringing up the communication problem. Lastly Not even Brendon Greene can deny the indisputable fact that 99% percent of all hacks in pubg orignate from china. You heard me 99% 99% of all ing hacks for pubg come from china. This is a dramatic amount considering the chinese playerbase isn't 99% of the playerbase. This with the combined effects of ping and communication has just absolutely poisened the game beyond the point or redeemability.Everything I said sounds so grim right? Luckily as I said before it's actually a pretty easy fix. Region locking is the only way to fully fix this issue. This is the only way to actually make pubg playable for westerns and Chinese alike. As since everyone in the Chinese servers has such powerful grip on Brendan's wallet if they lobby him hard enough to fix their servers he'll probably do it. They are his main source of income after all. However Brendan hasn't done this and he likely never will. Instead he has taken the easy way out by labelling critics of this problem (like me and many others) as racists. A copout tactic so lazy it's insulting but it's deliberately lazy. Brendan Greene doesn't give a flying about the western community we've already paid for pubg and not many of us are buying lootcrates he already took our money. The chinese community on the other hand is sucking Green's like there's no tommorow the amount of money they spend on crates and keys (cosmetics) is astounding and has become Green's income as less and less people buy the game and more and more leave negative reviews. Oh well pubg was fun while it lasted. Oh and Brendan if you're ever watching this just know I've always backed you since your early modding days it sucks to see how easily you threw people like me away the people who made you who you are.

review: The premise of PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is similar to the hunger games. You parachute in from a plane before scavenging for supplies while constantly being pushed to a smaller and smaller zone by an incomming "storm". Game focuses on making things like map and weapons realistic unlike some other very *similar* game. While the graphics of this game are amazing I believe that many of the players don't get to experience it because of the crappy performance this game provides. While it will still run on medium specs pcs it a no for lower specs pcs beacuse this game bottlenecks literally everything. It's a multiplayer game with no story that gives you the freedom to approach your problem how you want or to solve an incomming problem that is comming straight at you. Only until recently there havent been any dlcs or a ranking system to this game. With that situation in the past it's weird how people stayed loyal and kept coming back to this game. Now there is a season pass available for purchase which gives you a ranking system and a way to unlock cosmetics. Free users get a change to unlock *SOME* of these rewards on *CERTAIN* levels of the pass with a great slowdown in progress of levels. Gameplay wise you get an option to choose between first person mode or perhaps a third person mode in which first person mode is still available. Gameplay includes standard long range fights or perhaps if you prefer something mid range or close range that is available as well. Game utilises the usage of vehicles to get around its huge and detailed map. All in all if you can ignore the problems of this game like some bugs and a medium amount of cheaters the game at the current price is worth also it's worth mentioning that the event pass is not expensive and it is easily affordable.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Alright here it is. I don't recommend this game (Mostly continue for tl dr). This game is an excellent proof of concept at least until someone puts a copy of it on the Frostbite engine and kills it. The cons list for this game are crippling and if there was any game with a sizable player base and similar flavour the cons list would be a eulogy.1. Loot Crates. You have to play games in earn in game currency BP which is then spent on a random crate. Half the crates require keys that require you to spend money. Remember when Overwatch came out and people were mad but the saving grace was you could just earn crates? Only half true in PUBG. I have like 40 crates I can't open and didn't want. It's very very... brazen. Brazen profiteering. 2. Developers. Let's be real this game isn't well made. It's full of assets that are bought it's horribly optimized extremely buggy feels sluggish to play and has major features (like kill cams) that are broken to the point of being useless. 3. Lack of region locking. It's insane that it takes me 6 8 load ins to get a lobby of 3 other english speakers on the NA servers. 4. Rampant RNG. The "Red Zone" has been hated since it was added by an extremely vocal majority and is still in the game. The circle spawns are bad enough (but on their own fine often adding to the urgency and reward of games) but the random Red Zones are just annoying add no real counterplay/mechanics interacton and actively seperate the player from the core gameplay loop. 5. The Loot system. It's extremely hit or miss and often spawns multiple 2 4 copies of a weapon in a single building. This also happens with grips scopes and meds. There has to be a way to make loot more uniform (not more common) so you don't get games where a 4 man squad can loot all of Prison on Mirinmar get no scopes no meds and literally 15+ grips. Other games on the same patch a squad can leave Prison with multiple level 3 vests too many meds and utilities to carry fully modded weapons of each players preference and 200+ rounds for said weapons. Areas that big should have some form of bad luck prevention to make loot more uniform. Buildings of a minimum size (especially in places like Los Leones) should always have at least 1 weapon and the 'God Buildings' shouldn't be the only consistent places to land. 6. Slow pace of content. This ties into the Loot crate and Developers issues but is also a unique problem. A year in and the vast majority of the content added to this game is content to support the loot crates. Lack of a shooting range area so players can warm up or new players can get acquainted with the gun play. I still leave the SLR and Mk14 where I find them if it's late into a game because I use them so rarely that I'd rather have a weapon like the Mini M416 or SKS that I use often and can rely on to win a game with. Seriously instead of a parachute skin for $5+ why not spend a few hours making the Shooting Range on Erangel an actual testing area? It's already a shooting range for christ's sake. In summary this game is an excellent sales pitch to Activision and Dice and prove that players want a down to earth gritty Battle Royale game with complex gunplay cover and leaning systems and all the other core features of PUBG. I'm glad it exists.If you really are looking for that gameplay experience I'd buy the game. It's not $60+ it's got free content being added and it's generally working. I'd buy it because currently no one else offers a similar gameplay experience. But be warned this game will get ran over by anything resembling Bad Company 2 in the form of BR.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Look It's a good game. The game runs ok if you have a GPU from this gen or last (GTX 970 up) and theres enough content to have fun with. Worth the 30 bucks. However It's hard to get into if you aren't playing with friends. Thats where the fun really is. The games optimization is not where it should be and the servers are quite laggy but with the recent storm of updates they are clearly working quite hard (although possibly on the wrong things) and the game should be able to own up to It's hype soon.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I actually love this game and want it to succeed so ing bad but i don't think it will based entirely on how terribly it's been handled in the last 6 months especially. Wait for a AAA dev to release a game similar that actually works and buy that instead. As it is PUBG is frustrating to play at best. At worst it's infuriating and makes you want to punch things.There are so many problems with this game that i don't know where to begin.Desync due to servers while not as bad as it used to be is still a huge problem. Server connections are unstable. 1 in 10 of my games i get "Network connection error" and i can't recconect to the game.Optimisation wise i run custom settings mostly on high/ultra with post processing and shadows on medium. I get about 90FPS 1080p from GTX1070 but only if i let the fans run at 80% allowing it to stay under 75degrees celcius. If i run the factory Asus "gaming" mode it will throttle and i barely get 65 70fps. This would have been fine 6 8 months ago while it was still an early access game but it's supposed to be a release now and with the volume of sales going through this lack of performance optimisation is not acceptable.Vehicle physics have been horridly unreliable since early access. Every now and then a bug will make a certain vehicle un usable for 3 weeks till they patch it (youtube the 3 wheeler motorcycle and you'll see what i mean). Loot spawn rates are . Probably half my deaths happen in the first 2 3 minutes of a match because i'll land and go through 3 buildings finding nothing but a shotugn or a pistol and the guy that landed in the building over the road got full lvl 2 armour and a decked out AK. "We want PUBG to be an eSport" well then this should never happen in a "competive" game. At least every 2nd large building should have an auto or semi auto firearm SKS mini UMP vector etc etc. Something that you can at least fight with at 20 meters.The blue zone changes they made a month ago where it would travel slower but be less time between zones was brilliant and needed minor tweaks to make it perfect... But because they rushed it to live servers and a few people complained they ing reverted it and now the mid game is STILL SLOW AND BORING.The gun play is actually fantastic... when you don't get bugs pulling you out of ADS and making the reticle on your sights dissapear.Map select means if you que for both maps (crazy that some people enjoy a bit of variety) you'll often get put into a mirramar lobby that just sits there as people join and leave for the next 30 minutes till the game starts with 50 people. "It won't effect matchmaking times" some at PUBG co probably.Updates are rushed through test server sometimes not having been tested for more than a couple of days. The communication from PUBG co to the community about exactly what their balance changes are to weapons doesn't exist. "Slight vertical recoil reduction" is stated but it's left to independant content creators (read WackyJacky) to figure out WTF that actually means from a gameplay perspective.

review: I like this game It's got a great concept. It runs superb on my rig with everything turned on max settings. I am happy to see it's getting a lot more content Especially the zombie mode coming up (Which looks fun but I hope there is more to it than just running in open fields and shooting at zombies).Only gripes I have (More of a idea I hope they add but probably will not)When you die it would be nice to see who killed you? Like in CoD or BF. I think this is just a cool idea as well as possibly help with seeing if the person who killed you may have been cheating or something to that degree. Sometimes when I see people die that I'm watching or if I die it's a little questionable considering where I was standing.Boats I've had this happen and seen this happen to a few of my friends. When they are so close to the shore that they get stuck It would be cool to see some sort of action (or even an animation) to be able to put the boat back in the water even if it takes a little bit of time.Vehicles I haven't seen a vehicle NOT have any gas in it as soon as I get in it (That's just me personally) but I hope to see cars that don't have any just already in it Making it harder for people to move so far in such a short amount of time.That's just my 2 cents. I highly recommend this game to everyone It can be super fun but super aggravating that times too lol

review: Pros Well made for an Early Access Game Fun Gameplay Lots of players Good Game in general Good matchmaking Abilty to play with friends really easilyCons Poorly optimized(If you have low RAM crashes often) Little to no variety in gameplay(Same map only 2 gamemodes which are just 3rd person and 1st person) Sometimes laggy which is caused by the servers Rewards from reward boxes are kinda lame(Just some clothes and gear which doesnt help in game)Overall This is a very fun game and by now you have probably seen gameplay or heard of it. The game is a bit pricey for what your getting. Sure its got good gameplay but its lacking content such as new maps or different gamemodes. So far there is only one map and the only gamemodes are chosing either 1st person or 3rd then decing on whether to play solo duo or squad which really doesn't add that much variety to the gameplay. Gamemodes might be hard to add though considering the whole idea of the game is based around a game mode but I hope the developers add more maps soon. At least one new map would be good especially for newer players like myself who find it hard to go against players who have a lot of expierence in the game and know the maps like the back of their hand. Overall I give it a 7/10 and Im sure that rating will go up a lot really fast considering it seems like the devs are working hard to give people their moneys worth.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First game match?Parachuted into a city with a funny name.Completely lost barefoot half naked.Got into random house found pistol and ammo. Heard footsteps outside.Proceed to balcony to check out footsteps parying I wasn t heard.Look down fully equipped guy didn t spot me. I shoot him in the head. First kill.Loot his and feel like a king.Get greedy and loot other houses.This message about limiting the playzone keeps popping up . 0 given to themRealize I start taking damage. The gas hits the area. I die rich and fully equipped.Great fun. Every game is literally a new game.Play with a friend or in a squad for greater fun!Warning the game has not been finished yet so you might come across bugs and lag.08/10

review: I have had some of the best experiences with my friends on this game. Chicken dinners all day. This game will get your heart rate up and you will probably start sweating when it comes down to the last 10 players. This game should be played with friends in my opinion for the most fun but even solo is pretty fun. The graphics are good and there are some bugs with the game in its current state. Personally these bugs are minor to me and I can ignore them because the gameplay is worth dealing with some bugs. I average around 75 fps with a GTX 1070 overclocked to 1995 mhz and an i5 6600k overclocked to 4.4 ghz. The only time my fps drops below 65 is during the plane ride and when I first enter a large city but it stabilizes after a little and goes back up to 75+. I occasionally get 100 fps towards the end of the game when there are less players and if the play area isn't in a city. Overall this game is great especially for being early access. I am excited for the full game and I would buy this game again if I had to.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG has to be one of the best batte royale games I've ever played the satisfaction you get by visiting a random house only to be greeted by awesome loot doesn't compare to the sudden deathmatch at the end when the built in mechanic of having a circle zone that gets smaller by the minutes forcing you to basically batlle it out and hope that you manage to come out victorious. Although the game may not be well optimized yet the gameplay and enjoyment you get by placing top 5 or maybe going against all odds and managing to surivive getting shot at by 4+ people makes the game in my opinion a buy. The devs have already made significant improvemens to this game and it can only get better from here.

review: As someone that generally HATES shooters with a sizeable passion even I can enjoy this game. I enjoyed trying to use the crossbow and laughing at my own failure to aim as well as seeing the amazing moments this game can give you (One of my highlights being that be someone decided to drive me strictly staying to the roads and then asking for an uber rating on my trip after most of the other passengers had been shot while he drove through the cities).The large updates in this games early stages are fantastic as of the patch im in they have added a new SMG and a bike as well as putting the crossbow back into the game! I look forward to seeing where this game goes in the future hopefully they'll add some attachments for the crossbow to make it more viable then i can live my fantasy of being a black ginger haired Darrell in a circle of death based arena game.Overall i'd recommend this game to people that want a fun casual way to kill 10min per game or so with some mates.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I highly recommend this game if you like Battle Royale last man standing type games. I like how quick you get paired up into a match and doesn't take long before your actually dropping into a play area. The only negative isn't any aspect of the game but is the people that randomly scream or do other stupid stuff in the mic for no reason. Hoping some glitches get patched soon where items will be inside a wall and it doesn't let you pick them up. All in all I'm loving the game in just one day of playing. Looking forward to new maps gear modes whatever they give us.*Edit* Now that I have had the chance to play with more friends we have encountered some issues. One friend had his game crash for a memory issue like I'm about to talk about in the middle of my updated review below. Another friend had frequent crashes. I will say that both friends are playing on laptops. I do know they have both have Intel i5's and one has a graphics card in it but I'm not sure of their settings and other hardware. I mostly was just noticing what seems to be very high Ram usage. At times it would hit 8gb of Ram that the game is using while playing. I also blue screened once I believe it was a graphics issue according to the message I got. My game has also crashed once stating there wasn't enough memory for whatever usb driver it was needed for. Even with those few issues although kinda big issues in my eyes I still love the game. Almost all of my time spent with the game open is actual play time and not me sitting in the lobby trying to fix stuff. I'm hoping the update coming the 27th address' some issues I and my friends have been having as well as the rest of the community. I'm sure the team is working hard on all of the reports they may be getting.

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds started off as an incredibly promising Battle Royale game overshadowing the likes of H1Z1 and similar titles. Initially I was reluctant to pay the full price for a game in Beta especially with the amount of bugs it had during it's testing phases. I had a lot of fun playing with friends 200+ hours worth of fun and giggles. Then came the release of PUBG 1.0 finally the game had transcended from a testing phase to being a full blown released title... you would assume this means that after rigorous testing and tribulations the game would be relatively bug and glitch free. Was this the case? Absolutely not. That's because instead of pushing for bug fixes and fine tuning the game the dev's decided to release crates and premium keys which can be used to unlock certain crates so that you can get that sweet baseball cap worth a fraction of the 2.5 USD you paid for your keys. FPS games have always had a prevalent issue with hackers those lowlife aimbotting/wallhacking scum always seem to find a way to worm their way into our fun and ruin it. Surely the Battle Eye anti cheat system would be able to deal with it right? Wrong again. The game is riddled with hackers and instead of fixing these issues Bluehole wants to push a battlepass out along with this Sanhok update so that was can fund this hot pile of steaming garbage of a game even further? Brilliant another money grubbing tactic to distract us from the issues of the game with shiny rubbish. To sum up this review.. I have two words for this game. E SPORT's READY.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its mean its lean and it sets a new gold standard for early access games. Fast paced to the point of electric that in an instant can meet the suspenseful cut drown sound of silence PLAYERUNKNOWN'S Battlegrounds is a game you cant help be addicted to. Die in the flames of glory and hell fire of bullets? No problemo just exit lobby join a new game and pray the pan gods can give you guidance. It's just good housekeeping. 10/10 would die from a sneaky hole hiding in a bathtub with a shotgun. Or an electricity field that wants to strike you with those volts. Or from a sniper headshot 500m away. Its cool. Eventually you'll get an AR with a suppressor hide in a bush at the edge of the electricity field and kill 10 guys. Worth it!All hail the pan (Y)

review: PUBG mixes semi realism with a heart pounding objective coupled with either enjoyable team match ups or nightmare match ups causing sometimes hilarious but frustrating interactions. In solo play you are dropped from a plane in an area of your choosing. You have to quickly find loot in abandoned buildings to get yourself in a position to hunt or defend yourself. This mode of play can make you jump out of your seat and it can bring you some very satisfying kills. Squad is less heart pounding however it is my favourite mode as you can quickly develop a 20 30min bond with your team mates that feels as if you all have gone through a trial for life and death together. I would highly recommend this game. It is very addictive and well built.Good luck enjoy and always remember China numba 1!

review: The cirlce was enclosing around the beach on mililtary island. My squad was depleted to where there was only two of us left. Having barely made it across the body of water to the beach we hastely ran to shelter perched on a slight hill. As we began to scavenge what little was left in the houses we noticed something... two whole squads swimming across to make it into the "safe" zone. We waited for them to notice each other as we crouched below windows stealthily watching their every move. one of the sqauds members reached the beach first and with no hesitation a barrage of bullets started it off. In an instant we stood up and joined the gunfight both of us with an SKS. I took out two and downed another as my comrade downed two and killed the final man from the enemy squad. It was insanely hectic but we had to quickly keep moving to the next circle. THIS is where it gets exciting... We both died. Thats it. There was a squad of bush wookies with at least one that had a supressor. Out of nowhere we just died almost in an instant. RIP10/10 would witness the invasion of Normandy again.
