New optimizations make the gunplay and mechanics more smooth as well as increasing FPS Really pushing this game over the edge of what "feels" like an early access game. They still have a little ways to go but this is one of the Devs I feel will actually meet their deadline of Q4 2017. I'd rather pay $30 now and hop in on the fun early than $60 at full release. Overall the community is great and if you dont have a squad to roll with then hopping in to squads alone is a great way to find teammates! (thats what I did)

review: If you have ever wondered what it would be like to have the game DAYZ into a battle royale im gonna warn you to stop right there. Only fools have ever progressed in that direction and none can get the several hours they have wasted on this game back. This game is certainly the peak of BETA and is still pretty broken. The combat system is shotty at best and the server lag is still a major problem. Optimization could use a little work but it seems as though they did a solid job for how quickly they produced this game. I think moving towards Esports would be a terrible mistake for this title as the games are heavily decided upon RANDOM WACKY BULLSH*T. All negativity aside this game is fun at times and allows for lots of good laughs and lots of rage. 9/10 would maybe buy again

review: So basically the game overall is good. I like to play it with friends. But where the game goes wrong is it doesnt have any penalties for people that play solo in squad que or sometimes duo. So basically everytime im playing alone and don't feel like doing solo's I hop into a squad game. And sometimes I get nice squads and sometimes after looting an area my squad will see what I have and then kill me for my loot. It is the most annoying and aggravating thing in this game. Other then the fact that sometimes it takes like a whole clip to kill someone. But its fine lets just keep that in the game so it later becomes like the other game that takes a clip to kill someone called H1Z1. Anyways my point is maybe a little balancing and maybe a penalty or small ban of some sort for friendly fire because its really frustrating trying to play and then dying to a teammate. Overall the game is still fun but sometimes its kinda iffy on when someone kills you and when you should have killed them.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Both are being improved but not at the very high rate.

review: This is the best money I have spent on Steam in a long time. I have found myself getting frustrated with other MMO shooters such as Battlefield and COD. Something about the pacing of gameplay waiting to hear footsteps coming around the corner or wondering if there is someone camping out upstairs...and then finding out through a fusilade of gunfire gives me a nice dose of adrenaline. Finding out if you can beat a man to death barehanded before he can load that pistol he just picked up? Can you get into the building before that other dude who landed on the backside of the same building gets in there and gets a gun before you? It is a different game and strategy each and every time. I wholeheartedly recommend.

review: Absolutley amazing game! You can que up in three diffrent modes Solo Duo or squad. Whats intresting is you don't need to be in a squad or team to join these servers but you would be at a disadvantage if you did. The game can match you up with friends but I suggest bringing your own and having voice comms out side of the in game. (Otherwise other players will hear your plan of "pretending to be their friend so we can take their stuff") However teaming up outside of your own group is rare trust no one! When moving around the map you can find cars the mechanics of driving in this game are awesome and the weird physiscs will happen that you can't hapen to laugh at https //clips.twitch.tv/ObservantKnottyBearPrimeMe The game ends when you can hold down to be the last man (or team) standing. The feeling of makign it to the end is truly rewarding and never seems to fail to get the blood flowing https //clips.twitch.tv/PlumpSmellyOstrichRitzMitzHope you enjoyed the clips enjoy the game and if I see you on there.. you're already dead.

review: This game is an absolute blast to play and gives one of the best adrenaline rushes I've experienced in recent years. Every match is filled with silence at first (after the pre game lobby and ear on the plane) unless you drop near someone else. That silence followed by the sudden sound of footsteps or nearby gunfire allow for natural tension as you realize there is someone else nearby who could find and kill you at any moment. Getting cought in a sudden firefight is one of the best things in this game and will take your nerves from 0 100 in seconds and then back down again when one of you dies and dieing doesn't even feel bad in this game as it instantly relieves tension and you can immediately leave and join another match starting the ride all over again. The only major downside is the optimization of the game as it eats processing power like crazy I had to turn the settings to medium on my 980TI as anything higher held a constant max load even when overclocked and it kept my temps at over 70 constantly.Overall this game is fantastic fun solo if you don't take it to seriously and I can only imagine it gets better with friends. I look forward to many tense rounds in the future and hopefully some wins.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing this game for over 700 hours all I can say is that I am disappointed in the PUBG team. It should not have taken them this long to upgrade their servers when this has been an issue for a very long time. Even though they have done this the servers at the start of a game are more than pathetic with the hit registration not being accurate a lot of the time. I honestly must say I had the most fun playing this game between February/March as you could drop and actually find a weapon now you loot for 5 minutes and find a pistol. I understand that there is a certain element of RNG but how is this supposed to be a skill based game if you have no chance of finding a weapon even though you looted the whole of Yasnaya?I honestly think that to improve this game they need to up the spawn rates of items as there is no point in playing if you get handicapped by not finding a gun in 3 houses every game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When connecting to a Northern American server I have more luck finding a Chinese person in PUBG than I do finding Russians in CSGO.Edit My steam account got hacked by a foreign Chinese person after 100 hours in this game. He gave 2 copies of PUBG to his accounts and decided to cheat under my account. He got me banned from PUBG but I got my account back. After emailing their customer support about details behind how I got hacked and what he vandalized on my steam account they emailed me back replying "Unfortunately we cannot assist with accounts that have been hacked and banned. The account owner is responsible for the management of the account and we won t be able to assist with any issues that arise from that. The ban on the account is from the account making violations so the person who did it won t matter in this case. The owner of the account is again responsible for the account and the action on the account. Therefore the status of the account cannot change."How am I responsible for someone randomly hacking my account? That's like saying I'm responsible for my wallet getting pickpocketed my car getting hijacked or my house being broken into. As one of the only games that I devoted paying the full price at launch it's sad to see they treat their customers like this. I will not advocate them in further progression in developing PUBG. I've dealt with their poor optimization terrible community and the destorted view on their place in the overall battle royale genre development but this is by far the worst way to treat a customer after I got one of my most valuable possesions (my account) stolen and abused for three days.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Despite having common problems that EA games have in general. Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is a incredibly fun game to play. The development team is amazing and always hard at work and progress IS actually being made. The team is very transparent with the community and seem to be addressing what the community is asking for (including optimization and server optimization)(slowly but surely one step at a time)Despite all the complaints on how they aren't focusing on this or that most people dont realize that they have multiple development groups per project forsay optimization server stuff new content and so on so on.The gameplay is fun the combat mechanics are true to the real counterparts (EVEN PROPER SCOPE ZEROING THE INCREMENTS ARE TRUE TO DISTANCE) and the game actually requires skill and proper tactics/communication (which make all the difference) Gunplay is ultra satisfying especially when you land that 500m+ headshot on a moving target.Overall despite its flaws at the moment Battlegrounds truly deserves a solid 8/10!(Will change most likely to 10/10 as progress continues to be made!)I also want to point out that this was the first game I have ever reviewed and truly believe that Battlegrounds deserves it!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a great game while buggy sometimes is still very fun. It has great mechanics and while others may disagree I feel that it is far superior to other BRs out there (CoUGHFortniteAHEM). Some of the great things is the multiple maps vehicles and (less) toxic players. I definitely reccomend this game to anyone wanting to give it a shot but is swayed by the "Mostly negative" Recent reveiws. However there is some improvements that I think would make the game amazing. First I think it would be awesome if more weapons were added such as RPG's or miniguns (With balances to them like slow reload time and not so good accuracy RPG and slow reload large mag but low damage/accuracy minigun . More cool things would be adding C4 helicopters (rare) grenade launcher attachment grips for guns (rare) thermal scopes (very rare) and other things. In conclusion this is a great game. Period.

review: While many people have a problem with this game I personally find it to be truly fun. There seems to be a stigma that it will never be optimized properly similarly to DayZ but the devs have already released a patch that allows me to run it about 2.5x better (Weird number but it's not fantastic yet). The game has truly terrifying gameplay especially when you have the jump on someone. You see a man running through the field in front of you do you kill him and take the risk that someone will hear the shots and kill you? I highly recommend it to anyone who can possibly play it. Although I think it would be worth it to drag afriend along too. And there are some excellent user created guides on how to get/make a good chicken dinner
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Amazing game. I'm H1Z1 KoTk player but these game is next level !!!Need some optimisations for FPS to be constant not diping from time to time.Buy IT if you are Battle Royal person just BUY IT !!!The game play is more like DayZ but have best things from H1Z1 KoTk.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've played various battle royale style and survival type games and can honestly say this is the best one out of all.Yes the game needs optimisation.Yes the graphics arent the best at the moment.but when it comes down to what really matters the gameplay is excellent. The map is perfectly sized loot is completely random some games you will land and find 2 SCAR's and an m416 in one room.. other times you will have to search 4 buildings just to find a frying pan (which is beast). Ultimately most of the negative reviews are dumb kids that bought the game with mommy's credit card and failed the read the "early access" warning signs.. it's still in development but it's still a great game to play solo or with a team. Definitely recommend
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 2 word's.............BUY IT

review: Currently one of the best Battle Royale games out! Sure there needs to be a lot optimization but it's only out for 2 weeks give it some time. It's really good playable at this time loads of fun!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Looking for a solid battle royale game well you've found it! Playerunknown battle ground has the realistic feel of arma and the solid looting system of h1z1 kotk without the continuous lack of improvement. Servers are updated weekly and new content is pushed monthly. Finally theres an early access game that shows their dedication to one day leaving that status.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Sadly this is the first game for which i had to ask for a refund. I have a pc that can run the latest games on the highest settings with 60+ fps at anytime. This game however it was impossible to achieve a playable frame rate in dense areas. After trying some of the solutions provided by people who had similar issues i managed to improve the frame rate a little bit but nowhere enough for the game to be playable. The game concept is on point and i would like to try it again when developers have done some more optimalization. It's just sad to me that a game i was looking forward to turned out to be unplayable due to poor optimization. This review is definitely not permanent since the game is in early access meaning that it is normal to have bugs and issues with it. I personally cannot recommend it just because to me it was flat out unplayable. I'll come back to this review if i decide to try it out again once devs have done some optimalization.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a really fun game. Sometimes you parachute down and are killed really quickly or you get into the final 50 and the paranoia sets in as the game area starts to shrink. The gunplay feels fine nothing special though. My only criticisms is the price point. 27 for a game in early access that feels like an Alpha build seems a bit over the top to me. At the moment I think 15 is a fairer charge for this game. I am sure there will be improvement out for the servers because god knows it needs it. Once the server issues are sorted and a bit of optimisation work then this without doubt could be a 27 game. I would say I am very much on the fence about recommending the game.

review: When I originally bought this game it was great. There was the occasional cheater but with all games there are cheaters there was the occasional bug but most games even AAA games like Battlefield have bugs. My problems began when PUBG Corp. did not focus on dealing with the bugs that needed to be fixed. Instead of fixing bugs that affect gameplay they decided to add new crates. The crates are the stupidest thing ever invented don't get me wrong I love crates. Overwatch got a ton of hate with all of their crates so did other games but this game takes it to a new level. Never have I experienced a game where I had to pay money on top of paying money for the game to open a create which I earned. If they decided to only allow those crates to be purchased that'd be fine. For them to practically force me to pay to open a crate just to get an item of clothing which I earned is completely unreasonable. I'd much rather play a game where I can recieve the items I earned without payment. Fix the buisness model.

review: This game had a lot of potential. That's if Bluehole actually cared about the community.I've played it a lot I enjoyed it a lot but always had an absurd amount of issues. That was when the game was still early access tho. I always thought this "Well this is running like At least it's early access it's acceptable". and always had hoped that the game would get a lot better on launch.Did it? No.They changed it a bit fixed like 30% of what was supposed to be fixed and that was good enough for them.Now if you check what they've been working on it's the new map (which is a good thing) a weapon aaaaaaaand CRATES! SKINS! More ways for them to get the most amount of money off of it until the BattleRoyale genre dies.You may say that Epic Games does the same with Fortnite. Yeah they do but not the way Bluehole does.Epic Games releases changes to the map new weapons and skins every week/month. And the best part they actually care about the community and are adjusting the game and making it better every update.Fix your game first Bluehole. You're better than that.

review: At this point I am just saying No to everything about this game. I had a review previously however it was mostly a reaction to the multitude of hackers my friends and I have dealt with. But after taking the time to think about it one thing really stuck out in our mind. The fact that Bluehole thinks they own the rights to the Battle Royale genre of games and then move forward with a lawsuit against the company that allows them to use there engine to make the game in the first place. That was to tell we all needed to realize PUBG wasnt made by people that love gaming or love the game they made. What they want is the money from it. Because if devs actually love the game they make they would actually care about fixing the bugs that make this game more of a annoyance than fun. Optimization is still crap tons of bugs still present after having been "addressed" months ago the anti cheat is garbage and much of the time none of the above even take priority over cosmetics or new maps without ever addressing the original issues.

review: 8/10 Great game Though Deals With Some Minor Typical Early Access BugsOriginal Review April 11 2017*Update since latest patch July 3 2017*Okay so one of the biggest patches has hit this wonderfully brutal battle royale. In this patch they included a couple new weapons (a bullpup style weapon that can only be acquired through airdrops and a fully auto glock found throughout normal weapon spawning) destructible huts and numerous gameplay tweaks to further enhance the experience. All in all so far the devs are working incredibly hard to consistently improve this game. If you haven't bought into the hype yet it's worth it... Really it is. Grab a few buddies and jump into this game. I promise you won't regret it.Let s double tap some of the cons from my first review As for the lag I mentioned it s still pretty rough when starting out in a match. There s roughly a 2 second delay when trying to open a door or pick up equipment/weapons. The devs network team needs to invest in some better network equipment or come up with a more cost efficient way to handle that initial burst to the network (Just please Don t go full retard like Ubisoft does with P2P).Graphics have been significantly improved. Before I mentioned I was getting about 50 70 fps. Now I m sticking around 90 fps. Kudos to the graphical optimizations! It s noticed and greatly appreciated!Still haven t seen any in game bug/error reporting But honestly I haven t incurred any significant issues like everyone else has (i.e. the hilarious yet obviously frustrating constant falling animation). Maybe I m just lucky but I think there should be some way to report in game as reporting through a third party can be too burdening and often skipped due to unwillingness to comply! #obey*Below is the April 11 2017 review*So where do I begin? PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a Battle Royale style multiplayer game where you start off with nearly 100 players on a fairly decent sized map and work to be the last one surviving. Think H1Z1 but better executed (in my opinion).At this point I have 10 hours of gameplay under my belt. From what I can tell this game is primarily inspired by the ARMA Battle Royale mod from a while back (oh... the memories). It's super simple to get into the game you create a pretty bland character (be careful though.. it costs 3 000 in game credits to change/alter your avatar) and click play on the top left of the screen. Personally I haven't experienced any connection issues when trying to join a match but I have read that some players have experienced this. Once you successfully join a match you have 60 seconds to get accustomed to the controls or grab the nearest weapon on a bench and create your own chaos as you prep to load into a C 17 to airdrop your sorry sack o... avatar onto the map. Once the actual map loads you're sitting in a bird waiting to airdrop... Choose your drop location wisely. Pick somewhere everyone else is jumping your chances of survival upon landing are pretty slim (unless you're lucky and able to get inside a building with either an SMG M416 or Shotty). From this point it's up to you. Loot buildings improve your armor and bag space accumulate ammunition and fight your way for that 1st position. As the game progresses and the number of alive players drop the playable area will get smaller and smaller (pay attention to this! If you're outside the playable area you take a bit of damage every second).Now for the review Pros Gameplay is fantastic! Expect an adrenaline rush every time you jump into a match. Especially when you make it to the last 10 surviving.. This is where the game is pure gold. And.. ahh... the hitboxes are precise. Controls are actually pretty good. If you don't like the stock key set you can change them through the options. Controls are precise accurate and comfortable (you'll see what I mean once you get in.. it feels natural). The graphics are really nice. I have noticed some slight texture load errors but after a few seconds they seem to fix themself. Definitely in a better state than other Early Access games when it comes to graphics.Now for the Cons Lag is pretty rough.. Especially in the beginning of the match after you land and start scrounging for some sort of pea shooter. It's pretty common to have to wait at least 1 2 seconds for a door to open. Also seeing other characters rubber banding around is common. Though after you settle in and some players die off you'll notice it improve (Hence is why I recommend parachuting somewhere away from the big crowds.. No matter how tempting it may be). Though I'm sure the devs are tracking this and are working on better optimizing their network capabilities. Remember when I said the graphics are beautiful? That's because I'm running this with a 1080. I have high graphical setting selected and am only rocking about 50 70 fps. This isn't a complete dealbreaker for me since I have such a powerful card. Now for those who don't have at least a 970.. You'll struggle a bit. I've seen reviews of other players getting as low as 20fps with settings on low. Again though I'm sure the devs are tracking and are working on a graphical optimization patch. No in game error/bug reporting. I've scoured all over the game settings to try and find a way to report bugs. Apparently their recommendation for bug reporting is to record your gameplay and upload that recording to a third party website. While I understand how recording gameplay for error reporting is very beneficial why the third party website? How do we know our report is being viewed? This seems a little off. Careful reporting bugs on the steam forums as it's been reported people are getting banned by a disgruntled mod... Great...So overall this is a very polished Early Access game with tons of potential. If you're looking for a good battle royale style game that's better than H1Z1 I recommend picking this one up. If you can handle some of the net lag and are okay with below 60fps at times (hopefully this is a priority for the devs) support the devs and give this a try... I just hope they don't take the money and run like so many other early access developers we're oh so familiar with.

review: First Impressions only 4 hours in so far Pretty much the idea of battle royale from arma and h1z1 but improved. The basics are the same run around and loot as fast as possible then carefully make your way to the circle to be killed.Where this game improves on h1z1 is the variety of weapons and how they feel when you shoot them. Weapons work so much better in PUB than h1z1 adding scopes to a gun makes it so much fun.The vehicles are better in this game but they are still buggy. I've been in a motorcycle that refused to go straight so to go where I wanted I had to tilt to the right. Vehicles flip easy as too and if you jump out going faster than like 15kmh you're gonna lose all your hp.If updates continue to be released for this game then it might become worth $30 but right now I'd wait for a sale and do $20 at most.If any devs read this I'd like to see maybe a powerup system put in place. Not like leveling but maybe put like one mortar drop per town to pick up and use or a rare RPG in a couple spawns. Only because after a while I end up sticking with just my one fav gun.

review: EDIT 28 05 2018 My account is completly buggued. I click the START button and after 3 seconds the Matchmaking has an infinite search for a game (my friends start games almost instantly). I sent already 2 Support tickets and they only answer me that it's a known bug and developers are working on it (almost 1 month from this). They don't prioritize such a blocker bug instead they spend time and money on making new cosmetics and new maps (that some people like me in the world can't play anyway). Terrible developers. Editing this comment again if this is fixed. OLD REVIEW I made a first review of this game about bad optimization but I saved for a PC master race computer (1080 GTX i7 16GB RAM) and now the game works great at 1080p resolution with some settings at High (Ultra is an overkill most of the time) and others in Medium / Low. I don't recommend it for Mid / Low PC rigs.Now that I have good FPS stability this game is the best Battle Royale game I have played both enjoyable in Solo queue or with friends. Really hard to catch up at the beginning but very rewarding when you learn how to loot positioning and strategy and you manage to get your first Chicken Dinners.

review: What is PUBG?PUBG is a catalyst to bring friends together to strive to win. It strings you along with hope that sometimes ends in gloriously sweet victory and other times leads you to the climax then drops you like a sack of rotting meat in the dead heat of August. It has it's flaws which are overly stated for the most part. But it also has it's great points. It's not arcade ish like Fortnite it's not hyper realistic like Arma it's not an 8 bit indie game and it's not Battlefield or CoD. Personally I love this game. I used to play a ton of Solo nowadays I tend to mostly just play with my friends. It's great to sit back get into some intense fights then have it mellow out shoot the shoot other players win lose just take it for what it's meant to be. A really fun game. I definitely recommend picking it up.

review: Great game decent ammount of weapons decent ammount of everything really... Schute in early watch 30 people schute with you and actually get ahead of you even though you've left the plane earlier grab a pistol or a shotgun kill a guy or drop dead. This is what the game is for the majority of people.Visually not that impressive though it really has better graphics than most games out there which is on the plus side.Performance wise it's pisspoor sometimes but do note this is still an EAG(Early Acces Game). Speaking of early access you will run into a crapton of bugs if you decide to get into weird cover spots or just slide down somewhere. BE WARNED! You WILL GET STUCK and drop dead into the forcefield without being able to move. It did happen to me more than once while trying to get into some cool cover spots.Overall the game's a must have if you're an ArmA veteran a shooter addict playing CS CS GO Battlefield COD and so on or just looking to get into a great shooter and start playing for fun. Though you will be dying a lot in this game if you're not used to playing in third person and watching your back while running.A free roam mode would be a plus for me but the game's great already as it is so don't be shy to give it a try.A thing I do hate is the "buy a crate and get clothes system" because i keep getting stuff that's not helping with camouflage or anything really it's better to just run naked half the time instead of putting on a blue shirt and a pair of almost white jeans. Also getting 50 100 ingame currency for a half hour game is kinda bad if you're not even getting goo d loot considering the crates get more expensive the more you buy like double the price to be more precise. What you want in this game is rounds where you're getting 2 6 kills plus top 10 AT LEAST to even get a good ammount of cash for crates.As for my rig I am running W7 SP1 64bit an I3 4170 CPU 3.70Ghz 12GB of RAM as for my GPU I've got the Geforce GTX 1060 6GB overclocked Strix version. The game runs at 30 60 FPS due to being poorly optimized but hell it's early access remember? there's still much room for improvement.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: super fun game ive been having a blast with it even though its an early acces game it seems prety fleshed out.the only flaw ive had so far aside from the random crashes as you get into the waiting loby is the sound bug.i know you can creep and walk slow to make less noise but i literaly just had a guy open a door right behind me and it made 0 sound.. i have a surround sound headset and i play with the volume fairly loud specificaly to hear foot steps and there is no possible way to SILENTLY open the door. please devs fix the no sound from behind bug its so game breaking. Aside from that the game is prety much flawless compared to other early acces games

Here are some things I like about the game...1 Gun Play 9/10 amazing2 (Character &amp Clothing) Customization 7/103 3rd person It feels like they actually tried to make it good in this game 10/104 Grenades 10/10Things I honestly Hate ( Makes me want to kill myself with a spoon)1 Armor is way too powerfull (some if not most people you try to kill will absolutley eat up 5 bullets to the chest)2 Level 1 helmet makes you look autistic3 The zone ( ING MAKE IT SO IT TELLS YOU IN BIG TEXT "YOU'RE ABOUT TO GET ED UP IN 10 SECONDS")4 Take the M249 out or add Semi Auto fire onto it5 Zone again It does too much damage (I've died to this like 30 times on games I could have won. P.S. Broke three keys on my keyboard cuz of this 6 Zone again why the cant I out run it and why the does it go 60+ mph (90 110 kmh)7 Why the does my car flip over from hitting a tiny bump.8 Why does the terrain have random ditches in it.9 Why do black people not have pics in their hair.10 Shotguns can kill you with one blast no matter what (Yeah its realistic but damn i got no chance)11 This game needs a 10 second grace period after touching the ground because you can get punched in the head to 1hp12 why do I float when I jump13 Camping bridges and water 999999 free kills14 Getting shot through the zone... it needs to be more distorted 15 Why does the vector melt people16 China numba 117 21 21 21 savage18 voice is poopy19 Team killing Losing friends20 lil uzi verticle s up21 being on the other side of a vector

review: This game is horribly optimized at the moment. Even when playing the game on the lowest graphic settings you will experience horrible mini lag spikes especially for the first about 10mins of the game until enough people have died off. In gun battles you will get shot when your character model is behind objects and before you even see an enemies character model from behind a corner. It's no wonder most people just camp and play super slow in this game. I also feel there needs to be a smaller map with a faster circle/gas timer so there is more action higher loot spawn rates and first person only a hardcore type mode. Even with all that said I still think it's worth a try and hopefully they will continue to improve the game.****UPDATE*****Game is improving quickly but there is still issues with optimization on the network side. They push out updates frequently which include new weapons vehicles weapon attachments etc which keeps the game fresh and it is really fun to play with friends.

review: I want to recommend and not recommend this game. It should have stayed in early access for a longer time there are many things that still need to be worked out before they add more to it. They are adding more loot boxes to the game and other unwanted things than actually fixing problems. They used to be more focused on the real issues like hackers and glitches but now it doesn't feel like their trying to fix those issues anymore. Like most people reviewing a game I'll give a pros and cons list.Pros Graphics are pretty good on all settings Gun physics feel pretty realistic and balanced Quick matchmaking times A large selections of weaponsCons A decent amount of hackers Car physics are terrible No more game fixing updates like in early access Very inaccurate deathcam You can't have any other program open at the same time and expect to get good fps.

review: I've played a lot of Battle Royale games and I've come to the conclusion that Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is the best game out there in its genre.Pros PUBG actually feels and plays like a fun game. The gameplay is smooth and realistic. There are quite a few different weapons and every weapon is useful. You can add attachments to every weapon to make it stronger. All weapons and attachments can be found while looting.The matches are pretty fast every match takes about half an hour. You can also find a new match in just a few seconds.There are servers for every region out there.You can play solo duo or in a squad.The map is quite large but isn't too big. Loads of buildings contain loot. The loot is well spread.Cons The game can be laggy sometimes in both the FPS and network aspect. Right now the developers are busy fixing both these problems. The game is still playable though and usually it fixes itself in a minute.Vehicles are a little bit dodgy since you can fall over or lose speed pretty fast if you take a wrong turn.Price is quite high but that won't change. If you love survival shooters you're gonna love this game.All in all Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a beautiful Battle Royale game. The developers are going to fix a few things here and there but it's nothing too concerning. As a fan of survival shooters and battle royale games the game is totally worth it. You should pick it up. If you don't like it you can always get a refund from Steam.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great idea great potential superficially fun until you get aimbotted 5 matches in a row or go several hours without having a single english speaking squadmate. Lag Spikes FPS drops lopsided matchmaking (if there even is matchmaking) reduce this game to nothing but a shoddy game of hide and seek where you collect loot for the hackers that kill you. Maybe if you play at the right time of day or night every now and then you'll have a fun match but they are not frequent enough to make up for the onslaught of frustration in between. Meanwhile the developer continues to incentivise cheating by allowing loot crates to be bought and sold on the steam market and continuously coming up with more loot crates to keep the hackers hacking. Whatever anti cheat is in place does nothing more than waste system resources. You can report cheaters but you recieve no feedback. For every obvious cheater you run into there are 9 more who are more subtle and it completely undermines any confidence in the game being a test of skill. It's a 8/10 game until the honeymoon period is over and you realize what is going on then it's 2/10. Do Not Buy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great survival battle royale game played others like it with mods on arma and h1z1 but this game really gets the elements of what a proper survival game is big map loads of guns loads of people little time. either playing soloor with friends this game is lots of fun but with very different approaches.solo you can focus on close quarters or distance combat but without the backup of friends you feel the extra pressure butbigger reward.co op you can work together but get noticed quicker and hard to not get noticed.pros good combatfun mapgreat play with friendsenjoyable and replayablecons graphics and fps is not quite 2017 but its a small developer so core gameplay is a preferencelag and server issues happen all too often and take away from the experienceneeds more maps and gameplay elements but overall its a good startso far ive had lots of fun and can recommend it enough id give it a 7/10simply because it needs more work but i think even in a couple months it will be amuch better game and ill revisit my score.

review: At least one in every five games a hacker is going to win. Some will be running around naked punching people to death with no armor no weapons and apparantly no shame. Those are only the obvious ones there are most assuredly others using programs that assist the m visually or in other harder to detect ways.The game itself is fun the gameplay solid and the overall feel is fast paced (barring the occasional few minutes of camping and hoping for survival). It looks good it runs well (at max settings) on my rig and it is fun. The "drop" system for customizing your character is laughable. Absolutely hilarious as an actual attempt at in game content. increasingly high amounts of the in game currency are needed to unlock a single item of clothing at a time. It feels like the devs are laughing in your face as you're putting in game time to try and unlock some sort of customization for your character. These items (in general) are simply cosmetic so it feels strange that they would be so stingy with them. It wouldn't feel nearly as bad if the character creation itself were better than that of a free MMO from the 80's.In short More (or easier) character customization would be nice The game is pretty solid and is legitimately fun and be prepared for hackers to ruin your experience every now and then. Overall I'd say the game is worth it if you buy it on sale. I wouldn't pay full price and the lack of current content makes the long haul on this one seem unlikely unless they add something more to the experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Definitely worth the $30. Just keep in mind that this game is not fully optimized so it may run poorly on lower end machines.

review: Yeah...I'm just not gonna recommend this game. It's still unopitimized after over a year it gets boring quick and the devs care more about microtransactions instead of fixing the issues with their game. Oh and not to mention that the devs feel the need to sue the company that made the engine this game runs on (Epic Games) because Epic has done a better job with providing a quality game for free. These devs act as if they were the ones that birthed the Battle Royale genre when that simply isn't true as there were at the very least 3 Battle Royale games before this (ARMA 3 BR mod H1Z1 and The Culling). Epic has not infringed on any copyright (unless you want to consider the dropping out of a plane/battle bus and being knocked down in team modes as an infringement on copyright). The devs are just salty that they aren't as popular as Epic's game Fortnite. It's sad it's childish and I will not be supporting these crybabies ever again.

review: Why do I recommend this game? In short the fun outweighs the moments when you get killed by cheaters. I played the game from patch to patch and I enjoy it very much in its current state. The update come more frequently and there is a lot yet to come. Pubg is the only battle royal type game I really tried. I find it more attractive than the others because I prefer the more realistic style. The learning curve is steep in my opinion as the weapons differ greatly in performance and handling. You will need some time to understand the maps where to loot and when to move. The best experience is playing with friends playing solo can be really exhausting and there will be matches where you loot for 20 minutes just so to get sniped. With friends especially in a full four people squad the game gives you more time to breath and the firefights become exciting. A reason to stay away from the game is for me when you look for something that is just easier to learn AND if you do not have a decent PC. From my understanding you want to have enough power to be able to play the game at 1080p and with antialiasing on ultra. It makes a huge difference in spotting enemies as a smoother picture allows you to see moving objects more clearly.Best of luck on the battlegrounds to all that are willing to test their skills! Over and out.

review: This game had so much potential but sadly everything is determined by money nowadays. Funny thing is that if this game was optimised to run at least decently they would also make more money. Lootboxes events and skins are good additions but it is 100% laughable that you have to pay even more money to get something different that an ugly red shirt. The game has a lot core issues that need to be optimized and I know it is hard but at least try. You keep releasing content that is not necesary for the game at the moment while you seem to ignore major issues that determine your playerbase. A full 2 gb patch only to add an event that doesn't even reward you that much for playing it and not a single fix about the major optimization issues of the game. You buy a lootbox with your effort and then you are asked to pay more money to open it. This is absurd. I can see where this is going... And it is sad because this game had and still has so much potential. I 100% don't recomend buying this game at the moment. I hope that the company snaps out of it but I highly doubt it. Everything is run by greed.

review: Paragraph 1 Pregame LobbiesParagraph 2 OptimizationParagraph 3 Weekend Game modes/EventsParagraph 4 ServersParagraph 5 Skins/MicrotransactionsParagraph 6 My opinion/streamers and other potential BR gamesLets first start off with the pregame lobby. When this game first released they had all the weapons spawned on tables and if you got into the lobby early you could grab a gun and shoot it. It made the lobbys fun and gave you something to do during the countdown. I think when the desert map came out they took all the guns away and now you can't do anything in lobby except wait. I'm not very good at the game and I accept that but having the guns during the pregame allowed people who aren't good at the game be able to access and use those weapons. The lobbies now are very boring especially since you have to wait a whole minute. You could sit in a lobby for a few mintues before the actual game even starts. It's such a waste of time and to compare it with fortnite pregame lobbies you only wait 10 seconds.The optimization of the game is alright but not great. I have a hard time determining whether or not I hit someone from a distance unless I have a 4x scope or greater. Picking up weapons and items is a pain as well. there have been so many instances where I will be over a weapon and ammo and the ammo won't come over into my inventory or the weapon won't go into a slot. Also if I'm able to get both weapon and ammo over into my inventory it sometimes won't let me relaoad the gun. I have to drop the gun and then pick it back up for it to reload. It just isn't smooth and its very buggy. The parachuting is terrible as well. Sometimes if you try to land on a house or between two houses you will get stuck and just float in mid air and not be able to move for about 3 5 seconds.Bluehole has been bringing out new game modes during the weekend and they are either a hit or miss. I don't think they even know what they are bringing out. some game modes are pretty fun but the execution is awful. For example the first game mode they brought out was a team deathmatch where 3 teams of 10 would parachute down into a small area and fight it out first to 150 points wins. It sounds great and it was fun if you were the team on the ground. When you died you would respawn back in the plane but the plane only comes over the battle area every 40 seconds. Why every 40 seconds??? Why couldn't the plane just stay in place and you just drop every 3 seconds. there were so many instances where you would drop and die but you would miss the plan spawn and have to wait 40 seconds. That really irritated me but what was more fustrating is that when you died and you came back into the game you had to parachute down again. I can't tell you how many times I died before I hit the ground. I already explained how the parachuting animation is terrible but it made this mode so much worse. If you came up against a decent player they would kill you before you hit the ground or they would take you down to atleast 50% health before you landed. I want to say PUBG started these game modes to try and compete with fortnite's game modes.Servers are terrible especially the past few days. There are times where you can't even get into the main screen of the game. When you start up a game and your playing with a group sometimes it will kick one player and so you all will have to leave the game and restart your lobby. You will be in the middle of a game and just lose connection and won't be able to connect back in. Their servers are not good at all.The microtransactions are terrible. This game is very grindly as well to get lootboxes even though you pay $30 for the game. They have a system where when you buy a crate with their in game point system the next crate is more expensive. The first crate cost 700bp then it goes 1400bp 2800bp 4200bp 5400bp and 700bp. The way to earn points is by playing the game but I'll earn about 80bp per game. It takes forever to earn these points unless you win. If you win in solos you get 800bp but if you win in duos or squads that 800bp is split evenly among the players. PUBG is an all or nothing game. if you don't come in 1st then you don't get anything. You get 20 points for each kill and thats about it. So when you get enough points you buy a crate you get two options. You can choose to get a random crate or you can choose to get a key crate. If you get a key crate you will have to pay $2.50 for a key to open it. It's a complete rip off and depending on what crate you get there is a certain key for that crate. They do have crates where you can open them up for free but you rarely ever get those anymore. It's a joke and the developers don't seem to care anymore about the game. They seem to focus more on skins now then the actual game. They created special skins for Drdiscrespect and Shroud that cost $9.99 each. This game is slowly going down hill and seeing this three months ago I would have said that "it's a shame to see this game dying" but now I'm telling myself that the game deserves to die. I watch big streamers that play this game such as Shroud Choco Taco Drdisrespect Chad Just9n TSM_VISS and these guys have been ranting for months about what is wrong with the game and the developers aren't listening. They are too focused on new maps and crates. I think these streamers are the only thing keeping this game alive right now and when a new BR game comes out they are all going to hop over to it. That is surely what I'm going to do because I can't stand this game anymore. Only reason I'm still playing this game til now is because it's the only BR game I have. I have fortnite but I hate that game but Realm Royale just came out so I am going to move over to that game now and wait for Fractured Lands to come out as well. If your still reading this go look at Fractured lands. This game has so much potential lets just hope that the developers don't mess it up like PUBG.

review: Anyone who says this game sucks obviously never played ARMA 3 Battle Royale. It would often take up to 30 minutes to get into a game with less than 40 people and the game was so broken that you'd be lucky to die to another player. PUBG is a god send for fans of a realistic battle royale experience. I highly reccomend this game to anyone that wants to sharpen their fps skills and strategic knowlege. Just don't be salty if you suck when you first start everyone has to start from somewhere. If you want easy kills and addictive cod like gameplay play fortnite. If you want an immersive battle royale experience that will have you on the edge of your seat cop this game. $30 is worth it for hours of fun and if you can convince your povo friends to buy it you'll be in for a treat.

review: So I really thought long and hard about getting this game. I watched a heap of people play it on various streams saw that many of my steam friends were also in on the action.I knew what type of game it was and could see all the different types of meta in the game.Being the vintage I am I was absolutely convinced that it was probably not the game for me to be playing.But I took the plunge and got it anyway. I can always refund it if it didn't work out right?First few games I was pretty overwhelmed with the black and white of the game. Long periods of travelling and looting with short times of intense firefights.It took a few hours to get the knack of the flow but after that I found myself having more fun than what I thought I should be.This is a good game already and if the next major content patch is anything to go by it could be the next 1000+ hour game in my library.I would give this game 8.5 out of 10 and would definitely recommend it!

review: Late game is basically sniper simulator. So at the end you have to hope you have a decent range weapon with a good scope and suppressor... otherwise you're toast. That's my biggest complaint. It's basically RNG in getting decent weapons as well as camping with a sniper/AR at the endCompared to many other "FPS" type games the explosives and melee are very underpowered. Even the weapons themselves are much harder to use than their COD counterparts (which isn't inherently a bad thing). It's disappointing that gas cans can't be shot and caught on fire like can be done in Left 4 Dead 2. If you want to make friends to coordinate with you're best off asking for their discord handle first then exchanging steam IDs. PUBG's name system on top of Steam's name system is kind of abysmal. Most people don't seem to know how to give you their steam handle so it's something you have to explain everytime you try to add them... so what I'm saying is it should really be easier to find recent players for adding each other. It's almost faster to give people your discord handle then link them to your steam profileAs for the positives it's super addictive. You can either fall in a high population and scrounge for a weapon while a ton of others are doing the same near you... or you can fall off somewhere away from everyone else in a location that will probably only provide you with a terrible shotgun or pistol. It's kind of a strange genre because nothing you do really matters. Yes you can save up your points and buy crates for random cosmetics... but none of it really matters nor seems to help much. You can equip all black which might seem good at first... but it all depends on your terrain. If the white circle end game takes you to the middle of a big field with little shade then you'll just stick out like a sore thumb. I don't really recommend solo mode. The number of people camping with AR/sniper in bushes goes up by a million fold. Even if you're a lonewolf I'd recommend squads or duos. With squads you're more likely to have 25 groups of 4... which in my book is sort of better because they're together and you're less likely to be shot from multiple sides if you get caught somewhere. I've already played over 20 hours and I'm on maybe day 4 of owning it. It has already paid for itself and I'm sure I'll get more hours out of it. Just feel like something is missing right now

review: This is definitely my favorite game of all time which says a lot since I'm an avid gamer. Reasons I love this game and my hopes for the future Big map + 100 people I love the map size and the fact the terrain is a huge part of strategy. It has an open world feel almost that of a Massive Muiltiplayer game. Would love to see this genre develop to the point of 300 people matches with a map 3x the size. The potential is huge for battle royal and now that it's getting support I can't wait to see what the future holds. Realism They did a great job of making things as realistic as possible in terms of look design and feel. I'm enjoying how much the scenery and characters resemble real life.

review: This game is probably the best of its gnere that being battle royale. Even thought its still in early access I have come across little bugs and I know that the devs are constantly working on making this game even better everyday. Most people describe this game as being of a hunger games type of game. While that is true it has it own qualities and aspects. I chose this game instead of H1Z1 King of the Kill because I thought that the graphics seemed a little better and I thought that the mechanics were better as well. Along with Playerunknown who created both games. is no longer working on H1Z1 and is focusing on this game.Here is how a round usually goes You pick a spot to jump out of the plane to and hope that no one else lands in the same place that you are. Then you loot as many houses and buildings as you can before having to run to get into the safe zone or are spotted by another player. Once you have all the loot you need you will usually start moving into towards the safe zone. Some people like to camp out and kill people coming from outside the safe zone. Others like keep moving. I can't tell you which one is better but all I know is that I won my first game my camping out. Eventually the circle will get so small you will be forced to kill eachother and there will be a winner. This person is ofter referred to as "getting that chicken dinner" since if you win it says WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER. Which believe me always makes your confidence boost when you see that.In conclusion I would recommend this game because it's constantly being worked on the growth in player popularity does not seem to be stopping anytime soon its addicting and even though there is only one map as of writing this review each game is never the same and you are always on your toes.

review: I would absolutely recommend this game! If you enjoy scavenging for loot and the thrill of the hunt/being hunted then this is the game for you!PUBG is an arena style Battle Royale taking place on an 8km island. The landscape is dotted with towns and villages which contain weapons armor and misc for you to pick up or ignore. With one life to live and probably on your own you try to be one of the last 100 remaining alive in a Do or Die First Person Shooter experience.To keep up the pace of play the play zone gets smaller and smaller until you're literally on top of each other.While in Early Access this game is very addictive. I cannot wait for the finished product!Game also supports duo/team play. Not recommended for People who want a long play experience (frequently start from scratch most matches last 30 minutes or less) Anyone wanting a story (there is none) People who hate campers Players who can't stand trolling (it leads itself to trolling one life to live and all that)

review: The game is fun although is still poorly optimized. Driving must be fixed. A good thing in PUBG is that you didn't had the problem with exploding cars. Aparently Devs had figured the fact that players prefer to die shooting on a shooting game than having their car exploding or dying of natural causes for any other reason. Not so sure now that they introduced motorcycle that gets you insta killed in any minor bump. While there are videos of people playing jumping over a house in a motorcycle leaving while on air falling and still be able to kill players after the fall WTF!? WHERE IS THE CRITERIA!?Vehicles are a must to cover the map and the fact that we have many is good to avoid running simulators. The way that devs choose to go can kill the game pretty fast. If you want to choose between this and h1z1 i think pubg is the way so far (disclaimer i have not played h1z1 for 6 months). If you are not in a hurry to buy either get something that you like that is complete.Some "improvements" are getting the game even laggier we couldn't see the vehicle spawn now we need to kiss the floor and drink a coffe before seeing the guns.

review: PUBG looked like a fun game when I first checked it out a battle royale shooter similar to H1Z1 King of the Kill which I had already played. I bought it a few days after and was extremely excited to play. However the first week or so of the game I died pretty quickly in games but by remaining dedicated and learning the ins and outs the game became more fun and intense as I was able to get kills and make it into the top 10 more often. PUBG is always able to keep my adrenaline peaked as I play.I love the way the environment and weapons are designed as it makes everything seem real which in turn makes the gameplay experience more enjoyable and intense. Also the varying loot spawns change the way you play each game so you don't feel like you're in a never ending cycle taking the same course of action over and over again. Perhaps one game you'll be focused on stealth trying to get close to your enemy and kill them without knowing what hit them. Or maybe the next you'll be a sniper killing from range. I never have an experience exactly the same as the last which is one thing I like to see in games that I play.The overall gameplay also keeps you on your toes. Death is always a moment away as it never takes more than a few well placed rounds to turn a good game into a game over. It makes you fear everywhere that you go. Is there someone hiding behind one of these trees? Maybe inside of that house? Should you take the quick way through the open field or the long way around the hills? These are the kinds of thoughts that PUBG players will oftentimes have. But sound is an aspect that can turn one plan into another in an instant. Sometimes I'll be walking to a house and hear footsteps inside or maybe I'll be in the house and hear steps outside. Perhaps I'll be in a field and hear a car behind me. These sound cues prompt quick thinking and decision making to prevent the loss of your life and can also be terrifying in the moment. The game does a great job of having a balance of fear and action and forces you to remain calm in every situation. I am also going to include several comparisons to H1Z1 in this paragraph as anyone that has played it but not PUBG like I had might find this useful. For one at the beginning of the game H1 throws you in a random location you don't get to pick where you drop. PUBG does a better job at this by letting you pick where you drop. However to prevent a rinse and repeat experience with drops the plane appears at a different spot and angle each time forcing you to switch destinations as your typical looting grounds might be too far away. Additionally with H1 there's not a lot of learning to do. Once you can control each weapon efficiently that's all there is to it. In PUBG you have to not only learn every weapon but you have to learn how attachments and optics affect each weapon and you have to account for range so that way you can set your zeroing distance for accurate shots. While this does make PUBG more complicated it also makes the experience more fun and rewarding as you get better at controlling everything as it's quite easy to do so. The map is another problem with H1 as you're never certain where exactly you are and this can make getting to buildings and inside of the zone difficult. Taking longer to reach locations wastes time and could end up getting you killed. PUBG allows you to see where you are and reach places efficiently as well as leave markers on the map so you don't have to keep checking. This saves time and keeps you alive. These are just a few reasons that make me believe that PUBG is the better game.In conclusion I highly recommend PUBG to everyone. Even if you've never tried a battle royale PUBG is definitely worth the money and the chance. Just try not to get discouraged as you start out playing the game as you're bound to lose a lot. If you leave the game too early you'll miss out!NOTE Some things said here are my opinions not facts so if you buy the game because of this review and feel differently about the game I would not like to be blamed for it. I am not saying that you will or want to blame me I am simply making it known. But aside from that I appreciate you having read this far and I hope you enjoy your gaming!

review: I tolerated this buggy game for so long..... Omg i am so frustrated. I believed in this game but today it hits me in the balls ! review: Had potential if it released like...a year after it did with the game breaking stuff fixed so they could focus entirely on content it might be different. But since everyone and their mom has a battle royale it's just too little too late.I don't like fortnite at all but i can appreciate that since they initially released they've added so much objectively fun content and with pubg having a 6+ month head start. It's a shame. Personally I think to keep the edge they should have made better map variety. Smaller maps allow them to be released quicker and cure the super boring middle part of a game. It's not hard tower of doom where floors catch fire but there are 25 or so exits to different floors. Underwater map where different domes crash and start to flood. It's based off of which domes get damaged more by bullets and explosions. So to save yourself you could shoot into another area to try and damage it more when the timer counts downGiant cliff side where eventually you need to work your way down to the bottom because of a volcano and instead of supply drops there spawns a safe area. If you manage to be the only team in it when lava takes over your team wins and retires. Why not have several winners for a map. still kill off like 80 people.See EZPZ I can't prove it but i literally came up with the second 2 just now. Here's another one a cave that fills up in segments with flammable gas but is only "lost" when it explodes. I feel like this new map isn't going to fix anything. It needs to provide where no one else does. Map VARIETY. How about a super small map with only 40 50 people. It's going to eventually flood but there are boats. Everyone starts in the center. Less about guns and more about getting a boat first.How about the first team to destroy something? Or the first team to mad max an exit everyone spawns with guns in cars (squad only) and have to drive to an exit. 25 cars all trying to outrun a tsunami. COME ON PUBG I COULD DO THIS ALL DAY.This is fun I'm going to keep editing this with ideasFloating islands to work your way down you have to find parachutes. And 30 seconds before the island blows up a big soft spot spawns that you can land without dieing. adds the delicious spice of betrayal as a squad with 3 parachutes and 4 people has one person who just wanted to survive more then the others.Giant Ball keeps rotating but gravity pulls you down to your death if it rotates too much. The rotation direction changes and speeds up each time interval.

review: Okay Let me just say that I HATED H1Z1. That game was garbage.I swore I'd never buy another garbage battle royale game ever after that.I bought this game ONLY because my friends recommended me to play it with them. I told myself that I'd just play it for a little then try to get a refund before I could get past 2 hours.But......this game...I dont know wtf it is about this game. It just works. After playing it for over 12 hours I still can barely figure out why I like it.I'm a big fan of very Short Loading Times as for this game I've yet to have a problem getting into a game in which case takes about 10 seconds total for matchmaking to start and I'm in a lobby.Performance wise FOR NOW I know it is CPU taxing. But it hasn't been optimized....YET! So anyone you see complaining about performance most likely does NOT understand anything about how early access can work (BTW I'm running a GTX 1060)If you're gonna buy this game and play it understand that You might need to run it on low settingHave patience it WILL be optimizedPlay with friends (that makes it more interesting)Loot Loot Loot Loot..

However i am still imrpessed by this game being that its a 100man free for all on a big island. There seems to be some rampant aimbotters in some lobbies and i hope the DEVs will fix that in the next update. all in all this game is good its too early to tell how if it will be a massive hit but i will give credit where credit is due.

The sound is one area that needs some work but at the same time it is a big part of what makes the gameplay so good. I hope they do not change it too much. Bottom line this is likely game of the year for me. We'll see where it ends up. They've done an excelent job so far creating something that just feels right.

review: This game is a cluster of issues first of all its poorly optimized there will be start game lag for 99% of all players meaning the 1% that manage to actually play can just get a gun and kill you before you are fully in the game.Second of all it's an RNG driven should you land somewhere alone and get plenty of loot options there's still a chance you leave 8 houses with 6 lvl 1 vests anda pistol with 15 bullets and the 1 lucky guy that raided a shack found an sks a level 3 helmet vest and a ing vacation to hawaai with everything paid! of course should you get good loot you also need to make sure you are in the circle what's that the circle is on the other side of the island and you can't find a car? well too bad you lost already.The comes the bugs...ohh the bugs. Hit detection is way off you can punch someone 4 times in the back and they might only get hit once but you can be sure the guy running in a straight line towards ou will hit you and 1 shot you no matter how you dodge. your automatic weapon might suddenly stop firing through no fault of your own bullet spread is random as hell and seems higher if you weapon is on automataic regardless of how many shots you fire climbing a wall is a task shotguns are next to useless unless you're litterally shoving it up someones and firing.But all that could be wrote off as just early development problems it could get fixed and all would be forgiven if just the developer weren't such a money hungry asshat willing to ban anyone killing his popular streamers cause he cares more about sales than the actual people playing his games and should one of his precious streamers call "stream sniping" (even though he's the idiot broadcasting his location to everyone) you cna be sure said guy is gone within a few hours even if he had no idea who he killed and was actually playing legit.All in all poorly made cashgrab with microtransaction in early development devs and bad optimisation. spend your cash on spicy food instead that way you might atleast enjoy it a little before your get's ed

review: I got this game because a group of friends were playing it and I've had some fun because of my friends but the game itself is poorly optimized repetitive and severely lacking in maps features and progression.Though the game was sold at a comparatively low full price the fact that even basic cosmetic progression is locked by an RNG system you have to pay money for (!) and the upcoming "Event Pass" which also costs money makes the game feel extemely unrewarding. New features and maps are very slow to come out so the game gives a low value for the money in itself and especially compared to many other titles such as Rocket League or Overwatch to name a few.Add the creator's pathetic lawsuit against a similar game in an attempt to stifle competition by force rather than improving their own product and I don't see a long bright future for this game.3/10 would not recommend.

review: TL DR Simple game idea totally fine to kill some time with but lacks depth has huge graphics and server issues &amp the devs can't or don't want to fix anything even though they are rolling in cash. Therefore a thumbsdown. 100 people jump out of an airplane on an island last man standing wins. It's an easy game recipe and quite the fun to kill some time with but it lacks depth and has really annoying graphics issues (had to copy the game over from HDD to SDD game was pretty much unplayable otherwise). The server often go full potato as well sometimes with random lag spikes during games sometimes they won't even let you queue. Other than that there are plenty of other annoying things the main menu for example often resets your server choice to Asia for whatever reason doesn't register clicks (I usually can't cancel a queue) and is overall just awful.The game is alright for the given price however I still give it a thumbsdown it's one of the most played and most streamed games on Steam for quite some time now and yet there is still almost no improvement in terms of server performance and graphics performance and no major gameplay update either. At this point it's probably safe to say that this game suffers from the same fate as many other early access games on steam the devs just cash out on it.

So to fix this problem bluehole has scrapted OCE FPP DUO servers and claimed that the low population of the region is the problem where this is clearly a lie. Instead of fixing the problem they have released paid event passes for an already paid game. All they care about is making money and watching this game burn to the ground it is a shame as I did quite like playing the game when I could.

Daybreak and Bluehole will become the next "Infinity Ward" and "DICE" so to speak.But this game itself is a masterpeice. (In a way) Its premise is amazing The attention to detail is mindblowing weather effects are spot onBut what really comes down to a fun and enjoyable game isn't how good it looks for many. Some people just like to rinse kids really fast as soon as they hit the ground.Some like slower paced action and more strategy behind the game.If you like action packed fast paced PvP this is not the game for you. But if you like to have pactience persistence and dedication this might be the game for you!

review: So the game is not bad its okay at best. It was fun for a while but i can't recommend this game to anyone as there is one big issue which is that there are a lot of preformance issues (for me anyway). To try to combat these preformance issues i bought more RAM i went from 8 GB DDR3 to 16 GB. This helped a bit it improved my loading times and how quick things loaded in but i was still laging so i bought a hard drive just for PUBG which only improved my loading times a bit as i was not loading the game from my main hard drive. For my graphics im using a GTX 1060 6GB verson and for my CUP i have a core i5 4460 which could be accounted for a small portion of issues but not on the scale i was having. Also i was running the game at medium to low settings apart from draw distance wich i had on max (if anyone was wondering).Because of these issues i quit playing the game as it was not enjoyable also it became repetitive and boring.

review: What started as a promising and fun early access game with explosive player interest has been left to stagnate by the developer/publisher. They responded to the huge influx of players and cash from early access purchases by focusing on new ways of monetizing with paid crate purchases and now a battle pass scheme instead of fulfilling promises of improvements to the core game which still has many of the same issues plaguing it since early access. Repeated patch regressions and inability to address cheaters make it unclear if they even know how to address the problems if they focused on that instead of monetization.The player base is predictably dying out and it's easy to see why.

review: A Third Person/First Person interchangable game where you can find joy excitement and disapointment all within the same minute. RNG is a factor in your success and failure when up against any number of opponents. With PUBGs taxing requirements your frames dropping if your rig isn't up to the standard will have those added on top of RNG. While not a bad game it just isn't the end all be all game. With teammates it becomes more so a scavenger hunt on who prefers what and who does what better. With attachments like scopes grips magazines stocks and muzzles guns can have increased stats more aligned to how you prefer to play though most times you will settle for what's there promoting adaption to situations as best as possible. There are vehicles which can be as much salvation as much as a death sentence where a motorcycle can flip over and cause your run to come to a sudden stop as soon as you hit the ground or being hit by a vehicle that you just got out of on a slope. There are many factors. As a game though it isn't bad lots of issues I have with it but it's still a good time.In short I recommend this game to people who just like seeing if they can make the best out of a situation.P.S. Also that one bridge where some youtuber said a certain word is now iconic.

review: I would like to comment on mostly the under developed foliage in this game throughout this review.First off everything from the combat to swimming mechanics in this game are top notch 10/10. My favorite aspect of this game is the breathtakingly realistic skyline almost creating a "flat earth" image which I believe in fully.Now the majority of this essay will be about my critiques all of them being PLAYERUNKNOWN'S Battlegrounds' terrible and I mean terrible foliage. My main and most game breaking concern relating to the vegetation in this game has to do with my graphics settings. Due to my economical and erratic mental state my GAMING PC is not as good as the others who play this game. This is good for me as I can see any and all players hiding in tall shrubbery but a major disadvantage for a bulk of the target "gamers".The verdure in the title needs much work especially on the desert map which is appalling compared to PUBG's main map Miramar. I know that a desert's contrast of colors is very minimal yet this is no excuse for the unpleasant and frankly ugly herbage in this world. I would love to meet the degenerates who refer to themselves "map designers" who are nothing but sweaty overweight and unhygienic mortals working for a hive mind developer known as "Bluehole".Now that I've let my bitter complains be heard I would like to recommend an idea to the "map developers" on this game. The underwater scene has to be improved for this application to succeed past its expiration date. The fact that there is no kelp growing from the seafloor drives me to the point of insanity. I have nearly lost mind diving into the realistic waters only to find the unrealistic herbal growth. I would not recommend this game to botanists or plant enthusiasts or if you have schizophrenia. If you are just trying to play a fun and nerve educing battle royale this game is for you.this is hella ironic im sorry to whoever reads this
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As a hardcore BR fan who has played since the beginning of the genre on Arma 2. This fresh idea on BR is nice to play but at its current state I honestly cannot understand why there thought it was releases day ready. IT IS NOT.This version of BR is alot eaiser and when I say that I mean that as it puts everything on a plate for you Tells you your exact POS on the map. Gives you a line that actually directs you to the zone. So if your a OG like me and came from arma this is like playing agaisnt bots for us. It is soo easy forget the days of having to read map cords and trying to figure out where you were on the map. There is now a fat white arrow that you can just follow. The UI is lovely to use also! In the current state which includes Awful gun lag Ping lag Rubberbanding Hackers and awful hitboxes. I cannot recommend it. I think I can help alot of you out who are reading this as I do have 300+ hours and that does not even include the hours on test and pre alpha. So good luck making your mind up.
