review: Product received for free. IntroductionPLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) is a battle royale 100 players open world MMOFPS/TPS set on a massive 8x8km land. The game supports solo duo and squad (3 4 ppl) play. Gameplay is very straightforward you hop off a plane loot weapons armors and equipments from buildings and survive the thrilling PvP bloodbath.PUBG is obviously not the first massive battle royale game out there yet it stands on the pinnacle of its genre. As you may have known PUBG has had a highly successful launch securing a place on Steam's Top Seller game. If you're looking for a good battle royale PvP look no further. You've struck the gold.My claim is not without reason. The following is PUBG's pros and cons in my opinion Pros1. Extremely active and communicative developers. This is vital for an early access game. PUBG is being constantly updated every month. I would speculate that this is one of the major factors in PUBG's success. Other battle royale PvP games are mostly in Early Alpha for years and their devs are too focused on gatherinng as much money as they can from the current players without making any real development progress on the game PUBG is exactly the opposite.2. Great gameplay concept. No pay to win and no grind to win. Apparels are only cosmetics. The only thing you keep from playing PUBG is your skill. The PvP is thrilling and definitely fun to play with your friends.3. Non toxic community. Simply because there is no chat function. Switch your voice channel to team only and you're good to go. I wouldn't recommend teaming up with strangers because of obvious reasons.4. Highly demanding on teamwork and strategy. You can't just hop off the plane and recklessly run around the map no scoping bozos. A learning curve definitely exists not too steep and not too lean. 5. A shooting game that applies semi realistic weapon recoil and bullet drop is always appreciated.6. Various vehicles weapons weapon mods clothings and equipments are scattered all over the battleground to aid you in your quest of survival. 7. Although FPS is not recommended due to limited POV the game supports both FPS and TPS.Cons1. Currently very performance demanding. The game isn't optimized that well yet and runs on very low fps even on high end rigs. The minimum 6 gigs of RAM is an absolute minimum virtual RAMs can't help your 4 gigs RAM PC. One of my friends that is using a GTX980 is suffering from &lt 30fps and extremely slow loading progress.2. Server is lagging badly due to high player base. I would speculate devs didn't expect a huge sale boom and didn't have the resources to support all the players. As an example you were running to cover when under enemy fire. You already reached the cover but 2 seconds later blood squirts out of your chest you fell down to the ground gasping for air as your vision starts to blur. You scream for your squadmate to magically heal your bullet wound by rubbing the grass around you but then...okay you get my point3. Gameplay is monotonous. Similar to CSGO and Dota 2 you only have one type of game. The unique experience relies on various encounters with the squad/enemy in game.4. Melee weapons are terribly inaccurate. Aiming also can be a bit off sometimes. Possibly caused by the server lag.5. Controls are terribly not reactive. It takes some miliseconds for the game to recognize LMB/RMB/'Use' command. Or even failing to recognize the commands at all. It can take three four RMBs to activate the scope. It's kind of annoying when the weapon refuses to shoot when I press LMB because of the input recognition lag. This is a vital issue for a PvP game devs better fix this quickly.As a response to the comments' feedback I have to say that my statement about the terrible control is a rare occasion. Generally 1 or 2 key inputs would be recognized. I would say having to press twice is much more common than 3/4 times like I said. But it does often take some miliseconds for the inputs to be recognized. My point is still valid The controls are NOT reactive horrible for a PvP game.6. Vehicles flips too easily and difficult/too unrealistic to driveConclusionDon't lose all hopes because of my cons list remember that this is an early access game. I know some of the cons can be too much to handle and disturbs the gameplay but devs are very active in updating the game. I dare to conclude that PUBG is currently the best battle royale MMOFPS/TPS PvP game out there. The current state of the game is more than playable. Definitely worth purchasing even when it's not on sale.Well that's all I have to say about PUBG. Hope it can be of help to potential buyers!P.S I already addressed my low playtime hours issue in the comments section. Please kindly read all the comments if you believe my playtime hours is insufficient to write a review.

review: Great game developers update the game constantly and there is much and you can play the game pretty much however you want. For example if you want to be sneaky and passive or aggresive and all in you can do that.*However* there are some issues and micro transactions you need to know about right now you can be straight up banned for killing a streamer doesnt matter if you actually stream snipe or not. When it comes to micro transactions there are on cosmetics and doesnt really give any unfair advantage (maybe the camo jackets will save you 1 in 100 games but thats about it) Lots of people complain about this system which i feel is unfair since you can also earn everything in game This game is also very frustrating in the beggining since you can die pretty much anytime (seeing enemies or not) so if you are getting tilted very easily you are probably better of playing something else.The game for me is easily one of my biggest obsesions in a really long time. I would give it atleast a 7/10 and most things that are problems most likely wont be in the near future because of the great developing team.

review: Battlegrounds é uma excelente mesclagem de um fps realista + survival + third person em um massivo mapa onde 100 jogadores batalham e somente um sai vivo (2 ou 4 se jogar com amigos). Conforme os números de vivos vão diminuindo a tensão e o medo de sobreviver até ao final aumentam proporcionalmente! As mecânicas de tiro são excelentes a mais realista que já esbarrei e devido ao grande tamanho do mapa entender conceitos como bullet drop zeroing comunicar citando a bússola passam a se tornar essências. Saber quando engajar em um combate ou quando deixar dois grupos se matarem faz com que cada decisão sua tenha um peso grande para a sua sobrevivência. PUBG tem sido umas das melhores experiências de online shooters que já tive quase toda partida parece única e mesmo com você perdendo tirar algum aprendizado e proveito dela é algo constante o que torna o gameplay bem engajante e convidativo para tentar diferentes táticas não ter medo de arriscar de vez enquando e saber a hora de ficar escondido ou atirar.

review: Do not entertain this game in it's current state. (I Have warned you)I have a system that is over the minimum requirements yet I can not get the game to load before dying. After scrolling through the help forums and having to add refresh 144 maxMem 13000 malloc system force feature level 11 0 USEALLAVAILABLECORES sm4 lowmemory just in the startup properties tells everyone the game is far from optimised. Without going into specs and starting a debate I run SQUAD on max servers no issues and many other AAA games on High if not the highest of settings. I can not recommend a game that is impossible to play in this state. Basically if you dont have the highest specs of a system you will struggle to run the game. People are even telling the world in the disscussion area that they themselves have been out and upgraded parts of their systems just to get this to work. If a free game by a company that is known for ripping people off 'LAST MAN STANDING' can get the basics right as a f2p game I would expect an early access or not game to be optimized awaiting just more content to complete the game with a few tweeks here and there.I can not comment on the game play as it is completely unplayable. Though I did get in once and got to see that I am not the only player with issues as when the game did load there was 6 other players stood still waiting either to get in ot their client had crashed. Which I happly punched them to death to only get shot from somewhere else that was my 5 minutes of gameplay.

review: Product received for free. This game barely functions as it is right now. I understand that this is early access and that players who buy the game now are agreeing to play an unfinished game but this game is miles away from just being unfinished. It really shouldn't have been released as it is right now.Lag and netcode are probably the biggest issues right now. You have to try 3 or 4 times to pick up items from the ground you'll be killed around walls you'll teleport and you'll see tons of people teleporting all over the place as they mow you down with shotguns.Lots of the mechanics of the game are pretty broken too. Driving sucks. Cars flip over or go sailing through the air after hitting the smallest bump in the ground. Grenades lag through the air at a few FPS giving you no indication they were from in the first place and when you are the one throwing them you're given this horrendous animation where your character holds out the grenade for about 5 seconds before actually throwing it. Movement is super clunky and the playable area is just poorly implemented. I get that these features may be improved upon as more updates come out but so much of the game is so broken that it was just a bad idea to release the game in any way in this state. I mean if you're in third person view the crosshairs aren't actually placed where you're gun is shooting.Look when the game is fun it's really fun but that's maybe 5% of the time. As for the rest 5% will be spent dealing with your game crashing and the other 90% of your play time will be divided evenly between really frustrating moments and long periods of sitting around doing absolutely nothing as you wait for the end game to start.As it is I strongely recommend against purchasing Playerunknown's Battleground.

review: The game itself isn't that bad. However with the lack of vaulting and jumping being an absolute joke moving around the map can be a chore. Opening doors picking up items and getting into vehicles is more unresponsive than AMD's Radeon software. Optimization is a joke for how the game looks it should not stutter and drop frames the way it does. The game looks okay but not good enough that you should need a top of the line GPU CPU and SSD to run it almost stutter free.Personally I'm waiting for optimization patches before I bother playing anymore. Unless your computer is god tier I suggest you do the same.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Was very skeptical about this game when I read about all the bugs and glitches and whatnot.But I decided to give it a shot after all because everyone seems to be playing it.I'm actually positively surprised never have I felt this kinda thrill in any other shooter before.The tension the excitement the fear of running into a flanker while going around that corner the satisfaction you feel when your squad successfully takes out another squad the way you strategize with your squad like you're an actual SWAT team on a battlefield.I play this game on 2560x1440 and default high at 70 80 fps and the game plays super mooth and at the same time looks amazing so personally don't understand the complaints of bad optimization.Also the sound Footsteps (which also sound different per surface) directional gunfire and explosions there's even a difference in sound between a bullet hitting 10 meters ahead of you right under your feet in your legs or in your face.So far the only issues I've had were that I sometimes can't interact anymore (can't open doors or pick up loot with F).Loot spawning halfway inside a wall and you can't pick it up either manually or in the inventory.Sometimes there's a bit of latency lag but I'm impressed by how well the servers seem to handle the load so far.And ... One time when I ended up in the last 3 players with my friend (so we were 2 of the 3) and we both got "Network problem detected" (we were still able to talk on Discord flawlessly so definitely not an issue on our side and we're from a different country so definitely not coincidence) on our screen as soon as we started shooting the other last player and then 10 seconds later it bumped us to the scoreboard saying we were #2/50 definitely something that needs to be looked at because I get the feeling this might be some sort of latency hack (or if it's the server itself still a gamebreaking issue but there was no lag at all that entire game until that moment).In the current state I give it a 7/10 would probably give it a 9/10 if they rooted out the issues I listed and when they add the vaulting and other mechanics (assuming they're properly functional).Definitely looking forward to see what more they'll do with this at this point it could only get better unless they really decide to mess it up for god knows what reason.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Jump out of plane into small town area with 3 or so other people near by Loot house closest to me all I get is a pistol Hear sound of someone shooting a UMP see someone die br&gt Finish looting house hide in 2nd floor behind stairs Wait Eventually UMP guy shows up and starts looting Goes up the stares I get the jump on him and he starts shooting back but its too late Loot get a shotgun and SMG pretty good Realize i'm near the center of the ring not too worried about haivng to move will just wait for other victims less risk Wait a few minutes hear a buggy pull up to the house Guy comes in and starts looting Same thing as last time get a few shots off but the guy survives Don't want a stand off so I jump out the balcony and steal his buggy He runs out of the house and starts shooting at me as I run get hit a few times low health Blows one of my tires I swerve twoards a tree jump out die of low health + falling out of moving vehicle Proceed to laugh my off.10/10 game is harsh and has a steep learning curve players can be annoying at start of match but toally worth the interesting situations you end up in.

review: Ive sunk a decent amount of time into this game and have loved most of the time played. But between the swarm of high ping players(usually chinese) and the god aweful servers i simply cannot recommend this game to anyone. Region lock is a MUST not having it has ruined this game for me im sick of seeing 10+ shots spray blood yet buddy takes 0 damage because im shooting at someone with 500+ ping. i can handle horrid servers. i can handle high ping players from across the world that dont speak english. but when you combine the two you create one of the most horrible online experiences possible in a video game.1.0 my it was only pushed to release for those christmas sales.Edit i would like to further my stance as of the update in May 2018 involving new weapon balance this game has gone to utter i dont know what the they did but hit registery went out the window with this update. shotguns are literally useless at this point you have a better chance of hitting a dartboard blindfolded than killing with them ive hipfired people point blank with the shots just hit the wall behind them. dont ing waste your money some day a compentent company will step up and give us a good game just wait until that day because this games performance goes down with every update.

review: This game is perfect mix between arma3 and h1z1. It takes imersion and movement of arma 3. It has the smooth h1z1 feeling and ofc the gamemode.Spawning is less random since everyone starts from the same CJ 130 and is free to jump out when they wish. This and better hitboxes paired with better netcode make this game more viable for eSports than h1z1. There is not a eSports scene yet but TSM sinced 2 players into a beched PUBG roster.The map is really good big and varied. Map is located in soviet russia.It has everything from military airbases and shooting ranges to large enterable schools and churches. Terrain does not have those big mountains h1z1 has but terrain feels all around more varried and dosnt have too many of these completly flat "h1z1 blackberry" fields. There is generaly less loot in the map when compared to h1z1 but the gas starts moving quicker at the start of the round. There is more vehicles in the map also.There is larger indoor areas than in h1z1. Map has underground tunnels there is castles and fields everywhere when h1z1 has same dang houses everywhere.You can customise your weapons with scopes grips stocks mags and muzzles. You can loot different level of gear from 1 3. For example lvl 1. vest is basic kevlar vest that every officer has in the car. lvl 2. vest is used by police specials forces like SWAT. lvl 3. vest is military vest used by army. There is also multiple weapons of same caliber wich makes getting ammo ezier. This game has more weapons than h1z1 for example it has 3 shotguns (pump saiga 12k and douple barrel)Games UI has more imformation that h1z1s UI. you can see your self in a map. There is also minimap in bottom right corner.PUBG has more vehicles than h1z1. you have UAZ motorcycle with side cart sandbuggys and motorboats.Vehicle physics are way more realistic. Cars dont break if you drive into a bush You cant jump out of a moving car.In conclusion this game is what h1z1 kotk should have been.only is performance but since this game just releaced and its running on unreal engine i belive that fps issues will be fixed. Please dont quote me on that.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Good game as is but if you expect silky smooth performance go elsewhere. This game is TERRIBLY optimized. Textures not loading cant heal teammates cant pick up guns and a lot more game breaking bugs. But once you get through those the game itself is a great game with solid foundations. With only monthly updates it might be ahwile before this game is fully optimized unfortunately. I would only reccomend this if you are patient enough to get through all its current bugs. The gameplay itself is fantastic though and can get quite intense when theres only a handful of people left.

review: This game is truly intense and as the body count rises the tension only increases. So far my best showing was finishing 6 out of 98 before getting my head blown off by a sniper.As a fan of the novel Battle Royale this is my bread and butter. An awesome experience. My one strong complaint is that sometimes it gets so choppy particularly when someone opens fire on me that it is impossible to do anything but die. Tap Z as fast as you want if you are unlucky you will be dead before you can even turn around and not because of a good shot on their part but because of performance issues. My PC isn't a potato either this is in serious need of some optimization.Also the reward crates are toooooooo expensive once you get a few under your belt. I understand the desire to increase replayability but some of us are adults who don't have hours upon hours every day to play a game to unlock a shirt. Paring the bundle cost down would be much appreciated.tl dr Buy this game enjoy the tension but be prepared for frustrating deaths from time to time. Fortunately you can jump right back in on a new match.

review: Okay here's how a usual game goes You drop out of the plane and land as planned on a hotspot you scramble and stress through the building praying to god you find a gun before anyone else in the vicinity does. review: Updated ReviewBluehole has made millions off of PUBG but has refused to put any time or money into fixing very basic problems. As of writing the game is still extremely poorly optimized and riddled with bugs. This is acceptable for some amount of time but given how long this game has been out and the essentially unlimited budget that Bluehole has they have instead turned their attention towards paid cosmetics and multi platform release so that they can make even more money off this poorly coded mess.If you're still thinking about buying this game don't. Like so many other early access games PUBG was a fun fad for a short time but has been ultimately crippled by developers who don't give a Vote with your wallet and don't support s.Old ReviewIs it worth the $30 I spent on it?Hell Yes.Disclaimer This is an online only game and if you have a poor internet connection I do not reccommend purchasing.This is a game that chooses to do one thing very well Battle Royale. Besides that this game has loads of bugs. It is very poorly optimized. It is super smooth at times and super clunky at others. However the overall experience i've had with this game is very good because it's core mechanic is extremely fun whether you play alone or with friends.You like to play for fun? Play a match where you hilariously to run people down with cars instead of playing tactically with guns.You like to play to win? Do your best to be the last man standing in a 100 person free for all and feel your heart race as the clock ticks down and you realize you've made it to the top 10.The true greatness of this game is that you can play however you like and have fun regardless of your goal.

review: PUBG literally just released onto Early Access and it's already in a better state than most the other BattleRoyal style clones. It has lots of varied weapons/attachments 3 tiers of equipment to find and lots of different clothing variations to find. The gun play is in a very good place right now. If you like this style of game this game won't disappoint you.Edit 05/10/2017We are now just about two months into Early Access release and the game continues to get weekly updates. They have been constantly fixing bugs and making server and client improvements. They have so far stuck to their statement of not adding in extra cosmetic features for money until after Early Access is over even with the immense publicity the game has receieved. At the rate they are going I fully expect them to be able to hit their 6 month full release window.

review: Im writting this review while this game is still in early access so bear that in mind.This game is by no means complete. Sketchy hit boxes common crashes and a hand full of bugs are still present in the game. But im ok with that the game is in early access and I've seen something happen in the past weeks what i havent seen in other early access games progress. The devs are working tirelessly to optimize the game and we are seeing pretty frequent updates. The team is dedicated and listens to the community something that is unfortunately rare with games today.Gameplay itself is fantastic there are moments where you are panicking as you scramble to find a weapon and there are moments where you hold in breath as enemies walk past you as you wait for the right moment to strike. Here a quick summary of a basic game you jump off a plane with 99 other players. You trying to either find a quiet spot to land and start looting or maybe you're feeling ballsy and decide to head for a major town and duke it out in hopes of getting great loot.Once looted you try to stay alive as possible while staying in the game zone going from compound to compound or by staying in the forest.End game is never the same. Sometimes itll be in a town sometimes itll be in a forest. But the one thing that is always the same is how you feel ing nervous lol. You go from cover to cover spotting and taking down enemies (or letting them kill each other) before going in for the final kill. Winning a game is honestly one of the most rewarding experiences its certainly more rewarding than winning in a game in say counter strike or BF1.Do I recommend the game? Yes but only if you have a mid tier gaming pc. Having the minimum specs seems to result in frequent crashes for now. The forums are active and also there is an active discord dedicated to helping players squad up and win some matches.https //discord.gg/pB2AygKFeel free to say hi to me in game and im always down to squad up or duo! (Darklord)Happy hunting folks.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I heard about this game I thought it wouldnt be for me and boy was I wrong. The combat is gripping and fast paced the circle is terrifying and I think I get a legitimate adrenaline rush when I get into the top 15. The graphics are pretty good. A little bit of optimising would be nice I have a gtx 970 and it runs pretty meh but I cant complain for an early access game.BUY THIS GAME ITS GREAT

review: Players Unknowns Battlegrounds...I played about 170h and still dont know how I abbreviate this.For Now on lets call it Players.Well first the game engine is like Arma 2 DayZ which results in performance issues performance issues performance issues.Its driving me insane that this game doesnt look like BF4 but runs with 50fps.Problem is everything runs squishy and vague therefore the competition is not between player skill but rather the PC components itself.So if you have a 1000 PC its really fun to play.The Gameplay allows diversity everytime you start and encourage you to play another round after you loose.All in all great game I rate 8/10 and its definitely worth the 25 bucks if you like survival combat shooter and looting.I hope it will hit ist final release in about 1 year and didnt get ed up like rust or so.PS props for the Players Unknown Team for keeping the game alive with new content updates

review: Right lets get into the things that need to be improved on first(even though it is still early access).Improvements The servers can be laggy sometimes but to be fair there is 100 people. The sound is abit messed up it was too quite before but now you can hear people crouching in the next building. One last thing parachutes need to be quicker.That's pretty much the only major improvements for me right now.Right the good stuff....Good It is action packed you constantly see people and can be hunting them for 5 minutes and wait to see if they get killed by other people or you shoot them the most amazing feeling is getting a headshot and downing/killing them with one bullet. The game is no where near as buggy as H1Z1 and the mechanics are alot better. Feel real accomplishment when you win as you think that you just beat over 90+ people and won.

review: So I am just shy of hitting 500 hours of this game been playing it for over a year and what can I say about this game? It is extremely fun met my expectations when it first came out but why the concern and do I not recommend this game? Well besides the hackers and other things there is one thing that has become clear and why this game will slowly start to lose traction or until the developers give up on it. Lately they've made some huge changes to try and pump life back into the game. Nothing wrong with changing the meta but this is the issue. The frame rate drop makes the game unplayable at times and this use to never be an issue for me. I saw the comments of people complaining about the game not being optimized but now it has become clear that the game is a mess. There are times when I am playing I am running over a 100+ frames and then there are times for example during the event mode Desert Knights (I believe is the name) where at one point I was down to 9 frames. I believe that the pressure of Maverick coming to closed beta soon Call of Duty's Blackout mode coming in the fall and then potentially a Battlefield BR that the devs are starting to feel the pressure of keeping up. Right now they are taking risks because they feel they have to or they have the ability because they know that if their players would rather play Fortnite they would have already left (Personally the art style is the only reason why I don't play it over PUBG). My recommendation is if you haven't bought this game don't. There is more options coming to the market so save your money and see how PUBG responds because if they don't do something this game will be dead in a years time.

Until then I can't recommend you get this game unless you want hours of your effort rewarded by problems that are out of your hands.(For reference I'm running this game off an SSD using a GTX 1070 so be warned even if you have very decent specs).EDIT The game is runnning significantly better at this point in time and although it does still crash now and again it is a much changed experience. In light of this I've changed my review to positive and would recommend Battlegrounds to everyone.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ok let me summarize this for you as noobly as possible.You like H1z1 king of the kill? Yes? Then you will love this even more!This game offers a smoother game play and a much more diverse map and drop off points than H1z1 KOTK.Ok fine this game is much more expensive for an Early Access but it is definitely worth the price if not more!The aesthetics and feel are more realistic than any other Battle Royale type of game out there.From the sound of a gunshot from a distance away the sound of footsteps running towards and around you to the sound of the numerous vehicle available. The game also excels in keeping the game active throughout. It makes you want to camp out and be patient but at the same time it gives you the sense of urgency that you have to move or the electric field will devour you. The choice is yours. I must admit that I never had this feeling playing H1z1 KOTK.Ok you do get an occassional server issue like being disconnected midway through the game which is frustrating. But come on this game is still on Early Access and things WILL improve eventually I hope anyway. Overall this game is definitely worth the price tag and am glad that I purchased this on Early Access. TLDR? BEST BATTLE ROYALE GAME EVER!! YES BETTER THAN KOTK!

review: Out of the time I've invested in it which isn't a lot ( like 150 something hours) I can highly recommend this game.Out of a 10 I give it a fair 9.It's not a bad game nor is it the greatest thing to come out like sliced bread but it's good.It would be higher if it weren't for some bugs.Like the optimization issues and some shooting bugs.For example in order for me to avoid getting stuck on a building if I land on it or it being loaded well I set my graphics settings to low then after it loads and I get my gear and ready to roll I set it back to high.After that I have no issues through out the game this issues occurs when I land not in the lobby island.That's my only main issue I have in 98% of the time.But I have bin told it's because of the ram I have 8 gigs.So maybhe if I had more it would fix it and also bin told installing it ON a ssd might help too but I'll figure that out.But for the most part the game is fun and hella addictive well for me and friends.All bugs aside the game is pretty good so far.It is Early Acess after all so the game will improve with time.For me it's worth the time.It's best played with friends but solo is great to sharpen your skills.

review: The idea putting around 100 players on a 64 sqaure km map trying to eliminate each other to the last man standing is pretty simple but very effective. Since a long time I really enjoy a game again.You start by jumping out an airplane with barely nothing but you're underwear or a pair of pants and a shirt if you like. Finding guns and equipment makes a lot of fun. The further you get to the last man standing the more exciting it gets. Heart's starting to pound you reflect every move your about to make. Fighting in a team is even more fun.+ Graphics+ Weapon sounds+ Weapon customization system+ Great 1st and 3rd person perspective Character movement (eg. you'll struggle to climb over an on obstacles like fences or walls) No movable object (on foot or in vehicle) Driving vehicles (don't know just feels awkward) Just one pretty simple map

review: I have played for a while now 31.6 hours i have had the sneaking suspicion that this game could ruin a lot of other FPS games out there. The idea is awsome it takes a minute to switch thinking from those other brands out there. that being said this game will be incredible with different modes objectives i saw 111 000 (ish) players on one evening. great numbers when stacked against the other brands. the co opt game is alive and well in this game 2 and 4 player teams squads you will get the poop scared out of you at least every other game. There isn't a ton of difficult menues to deal with this game has a pretty easy learning curve but don't be fooled there is a current downside to this game besides the optimization issue which obviously this is pre release under construction if you will There is a exploitation issue...plainly the cheaters are starting to ruin the game.pro great price wonderful game concept one large map with many ways the fight can develope over a large vast area.con optimization and the typical cheater exploiter element.

Team chat ability in the lobby. An onscreen indicator indicating from which direction you were hit. More explosive weapons. Triggerable deployment items eg. Claymores. Mode Locked to 1st person view Mode Squad based random mixing with push to talk locked to broadcast to all so you can hear people communicating when you're close to them eg. when you're inside a house and can hear them preparing to breach. Mode Larger squads

review: EDIT 6/13/18 Alright so I have now changed my review from Recommend to Do Not Recommend. As you can see below I wrote a pretty glowing review for PUBG at the time. Well I am getting quite tired of a game that makes progress in all the wrong ways. Since I wrote this review performance got better sometimes. And that is quite ridiculous. MY BIGGEST PROBLEM is the constant "maintenance down times" for the servers. Bluehole stresses this is to help back end performance but there is no other multiplayer game out there that has this many down times. It happens about 2 3 times a week for many hours around 10 PM Eastern Time which is a peak time for a large percentage of PUBG market. I play this when I got off work usually but now I get off work and "HEY SERVERS ARE DOWN!" Great thanks BlueHole. Thanks for the stupid crates you keep adding and those much needed Shroud and Dr. Disrespect Skins. I like this game so much and continue to play it but the annoyances have become something that makes me quite angry. I do not recommend this game because they are not going to fix any of these issues. Just flat out they are not. Don't buy unless you just absolutely feel left out or something. It is a fun game but the developers are completely incompetent now. OLD REVIEW FROM WHEN I HAD HOPE Wow I thoroughly have enjoyed this game. I was beginning to think I wouldn't find another multiplayer game that I genuinely rushed home from work every night to try and log on before my freinds did. I have currently enjoyed this game for 175+ hours and have no intentions of leaving it soon. PUBG has an element of simplicity I haven't been able to get from any other veryyy popular multiplayer shooter out there. PUBG doesn't take that long to get used to and within a few matches if you have common sense and have focus you may just become a great threat in the presence of good loot. You will lose many games but you will also love the rush of the FINAL 10 and finally winning your first chicken dinner. Game is great whether or not you play Solo Duo or Squads. Each one has an element of its own. Here are some pros and cons if you wish to see ____Pros_____ Very random no one can dominate EVERY round. Yes there are some people are exceptional at this game but even then the pros die to people in better situations. Sometimes you will drop in a city and find level 3 everything a billion scopes the best rifles and a suppressor from the get go with the circle going around you each time it shrinks and a sprinkle of Player Unknown's luck. OR You may have a game where you drop only to get no loot and be miles away from safety forcing you to drudge to safety. Somewhat stable I have many friends who tend to be elitist when it comes to game performance and visuals. But in my honest opinion if you play with the settings enough you'll find that perfect set up where the game runs fine. Yes it can get a tad laggy at the start if you land with 40 people but I believe thats a server problem. Nothing to fret. Multitude of guns Prefer shotguns? No problem. Prefer snipers? No problem. Prefer an SMG? You get the drift here. If you can find it there is a gun out there for everyone and if you play with a squad you all can switch guns to fit your playstyle. The game has a multitude of guns that will spur excitement when you come across one. Especially a rare gun in a supply drop. Simple PUBG is rather simple. There are modifications and attachments for every gun but I am known for being terrible with naming guns from past games like COD and Battlefield. I am always the guy having to explain what a gun looked like to my friends because I was lost in a sea of names and different options. PUBG doesn't overwhelm you with fancy options or fancy things to be distracted by. It is simple. And that is just what I need. Crates! Boy oh boy!! I usually play enough to buy 2 weekly crates and sell them immediately on the steam market for about $1 per week. After a while I was able to get Fallout 4 and Don't Starve Together for free just because of the crates in PUBG. I don't care about clothing in the game so I essentially got my $30 completely. Pretty awesome if you ask me.______CONSS______ Stability &amp bugs Alright I know I was bragging on stability earlier but I do need to note that there are times where I've simply lost a gun fight due to something that was out of my control such as server disconnect or something not loading on my screen. This is not a huge issue as it rarely happens. Sometimes bugs are funny too. So just have fun Hackers It gets to the point where I am experiencing one hacker each day. NOT EACH GAME I just mean each day. IF I play a few hours at night with friends. We most likely will see one hacker that night. It hasn't gotten out of hand yet but it is frustrating to get late game and then all of a sudden you are headshot in a windowless bathroom by some guy 3 miles away who totally had no way of seeing you. Or when you see some Barry Allen looking fella running entirely across the map in two seconds. Just be aware. They are out there Shadowplay doesn't work(at least for me) I used to love having the choice to keep some clips from a high kill game but it refuses to work for me now. I hate this so much. I don't really know what to do. I have it enabled in game and in GeForce Experience. Oh wellOVERALL I think it is a great game. If you need me to rate it I give it 8.5/10. This is better than I would give for Overwatch Battlefield 1 GTA V or any multiplayer game simply because it really hasn't lost its shine to me. I will keep playing and I hope to meet one of you out there one day....so I can loot your body lol

review: Got this game last summer when it was on early accessInitially guns have low recoil and fightings are fun and interesting like CSGOGave up on Overwatch and CSGO at that time considered this as was the best fps game. Eating chicken and winning games are the most satisfactory experience ever.Then more and more hackers are coming to the game and in every single match. Your so called "optimizations" are bringing more fps drops in game. Now absolutely every single game there's tons of hackers and leaving regular players absolutely no way to counter them and there are always people selling hacks in game and bluehole's not even trying to ban them. Also there's no more a thing called "rank" because in every single game I could see players that are incredibly "professional" or hackers rather than ranking different players in different games (which it SHOULD happen in most competitive games).The game is no longer fun and has more toxicity. Now everyone is hiding in somewhere only wishing to kill others by one shot because there's no way one can win the fight with hackers.In conclusion the experience I had in this game in general is bad and I have had no more fun than before. I am considering it as DEADGAME and not recommending them to my friends any more. Going back to play old fps games and will be trying PUBG mobile and Fortnite instead. Thank you bluehole.

review: Ok my original review called this game a steaming pile of garbage. I felt like I should edit that and explain.First off its a bit of a resource hog. My pc has enough legs to run it but it struggles. I feel like they should have bumped up the "minimum req." a bit as even at low settings there will be some issues. Mainly as you air drop in there will occasionally be significant texture lag where you are waiting for nearby buildings to load properly. Until this happens you cannot go into buildings and pick up gear. The solution to this is to deploy your chute earlier and hope that it loads on your way down sometimes it does. Or drop into less populated areas as you will be at a major handicap if you drop into the mansion with 3 other opponents and you cannot enter a building and they can. Basically youre insta dead. Land a little farther out scout some smaller towns first or hunker down behind a building and hide for a moment. Its manageable but if your pc isnt 30% more than the minimum req you will have to learn to deal with it.Now that being said this game is fun as hell. Its early release so Im going to assume that some physics glitches will be sorted out later. Ive crashed cars and barrel rolled them for seemingly no reason. Ive died going over the bars on a motorcycle in a smooth open field. Not often but occasionally you will just get killed by the game. I dont want this to sound all bad... just a buyer be aware review. This game is super fun and addictive. Graphics are pretty good albeit a bit resource intensive. The gun play is super well done vehicles are very fun to drive and have good physics (minus the occasional glitch) . All in all this is an awesome game and well worth the thirty bucks.

review: back down to 2 stars...Same old copy cat/cash out game with no real improvements.I am very disappointed. You have played this game before but just on a slightly different map and if you hope this will be that style of game minus the jankiness you will also be disappointed.Edit1 New update has helped the game a little and I am also playing more and getting more used to the game so I am upgrading my score just a little to 3 stars....but I can forsee this game now getting better and maybe one day soo changing my recommend to YES instead of no.Edit 2 I have played a lot more and have finally won my first game with also coming in top 10 quite a few times and I am enjoying the game much more. I am very close to changing my reccomendation to "yes" but I made the mistake and played some more Tom Clancy Ghost Recon wildlands again tonight.... that game has everything I want a game of this style to be.The graphics controls and sheer size and scope would be perfect for this style of game...maybe someday.Hope new patches will raise PUBG up one more notch but right now graphics and controls this game feels like it is from 1993 compared to Ghost Recon and Ghost Recon feels like it is from the future compared to PUBG.I would gladly pay 60$ for a top tier big budget battle royal game.New edit I am actually lowering the games score to 2 stars for the moment. It is not only NOT getting better quickly enough but it is getting worse because the of the sheer amount of cheaters in the game.Who really has the time to invest in a game where they carefully move along taking their time just to get wall hacked and aimboted? So much cheating in such a new game is a bad sign.The devs have promised to take action but I fear it may be too late and they may not have the resources to be up to the task.Sad.

review: Product received for free. Variety is lacking but what can you expect from a game still very much in development?Otherwise it's amazing fun. Drop in from a C 130 die a few times withing a couple minutes until you get the hang of what you're doing and then you will probably place middle of the pack for awhile. People can be bullet sponges at times which it shouldn't be like that. Honestly 6 7.62 rounds should not be required but eh they're working on balance so that's expected to change. I will update my review as the game gets changed.Oh I should mention PLAYERUNKNOWN is spear heading this himself and they actually listen to the community so it's great overall I have high hopes for this game which I didn't have with Rust.My specs are a FX 6120 4.2 GHz and a R9 270X and trust me this game runs like garbage unless you're on very low. Which I don't really understand because I can play Arma 3 on Ultra with more than playable frames. Maybe Unreal Engine 4 just sucks because I have the same issue with ARK and that game has been out for awhile too.Anyways do I recommend it?No not as of right now give it another month or two because servers are not at their best (5 second pauses are very common and freezes less so but still happen way more than I would consider reasonable) and also it crashes a lot too. My friend on a 4770K and 980ti crashes about once every 2 3 games which is a huge no for me. Though I would like to mention that my AMD system has no problems with crashing and in fact my game has yet to crash.Rating 7/10TL DR Wait a bit to get this if you're only here to play a game. Otherwise throw some dollars at it and support the development and play while it's made better.

review: FIrst you are afraid of everything....even your own footsteps. Then after some hours into the game you are getting more comfortable with the fact that in order to see someoneelse you have to be exposed in some way. So you have to scan your sourroundings constantly listen for gunfire footsteps have a look on the map to know where the circle is etc. It is not a game where you wildly run around and shoot at everything that moves. The game is very exiciting because every step can be your last. In order to succeed you have to be very concentrated and be able to anticipate the movement of your fellow players. Besides all the caution involved when moving and looting the gunfights themselves are usually very quickly resolved wich makes for a really nice pacing during the matches. If you like a challange and have some patience this game is for you...

review: While I still enjoy the content and the Battlepass the points you can earn from playing the game is capped to 80 daily.I spend two hours to complete the mission "Reach top 3 without killing anyone in Solos" just to find out it's buggy and you have to die as 3rd to accomplish the mission.Brandon Greene seems like he has forgotten everything which would make this game good like a leveling system which rewards you with cooler animations (reloads vaults healing and so on) or an open platform with modding support. It seems like he is not interested in developing this game anymore and now thinks he is a good manager and has to press as much money out of the playerbase as possible.In my opinion they should never have gone that route with lootcrates especially if you think about the dropchance for the good items (1/10 000). Which means that you have to pay roughly 20k to get any item worth less than 1k.The Battlepass is the fairer route here but they still it up. At this stage I cannot recommend the game to someone this is mainly because I lost the trust in Brandon Greene as the head of the development team. It seems like the dollar signs in his eyes blurred his vision for the game.They have zero new ideas on how to improve the game and everything they copy they implement poorly.

Playing with teams is great thanks to the "downed" system where you aren't killed immediately but are knocked into a wounded state where you can only crawl. The performance on my PC at Ultra settings are around 100fps with A 4770K/GTX 1070.

review: TL DR It's OK nothing more nothing less.This is a review for all who play sometimes (2 3hrs per week) besides family work social life. For adults over 30.I like to play shooter on and offline. Nowadays mostly BF1 and Rainbow Six Siege.I noticed this big hype around PUBG a couple of weeks ago and never played any battle royale game. Because most of them are in in a early access state and seem to stay that way.But then I thought let's give it a try PUBG for me is kind of trashy but in a good way most of the time. The graphics are decent the performance underwhelming but still playabale and the gameplay kind of fun. Why just "kind of"? Because most of the time you just looting that you never are gonna use because when you get in a gunfight most of the time they are very quick. Either you win or not. And if you lose you start from the beginning. And yeah I know that is the concept of the game and it has charm and thrills sometimes but sometimes it is just frustrating. And motivation wise hmm I still don't know why to keep playing this game. As I wrote in the beginning I spent most of the time for other things than games therefore I also do not need big progression systems cosmetic items etc. I am too old for this and do not have enough time. But PUBG is kind of underwhelming.So for everyone who has a similar "access" to games and time I will put it that way If you do not have to worry about money and you want just to try something different in the shooter genre you can try it out. I guess you will have a couple of hours fun.Is it worth 30 bucks?Not really. But then I had some fun and do not really care about this amount of money especially for a early access game. 15 for early access and 30 for the finished game would be better (fair) imho.And because perfomance is a huge topic here are my specs which are enough to run the game playable 95% of the time i5 650016GB RAMGTX 107027" 144Hz 1440p ( &gt with G Sync which is a bonus for such games with unconsistent frame rates) InGame settings medium to high

review: The game is very fun and addicting especially if you have a friend(s) to play with the game is a diamond in the rough but there are some really annoying things that need to be fixed #1 Region locking This game needs to be region locked to keep other players with really really high ping out of matches majority of the time I see nothing but Chinese players in the U.S. Servers (NA) this is a problem because it s the equivalent to lag switching back in the Halo 2/3 days #2 Desync it s still a major issue in this game look up a YouTube video or twitch ones with Dr. Disrespect he will tell you all about it #3 The 4x Scope is unpredictable sometimes it works as it should sometimes it is so off you won t even be remotely close to the target #4 "Early access" Everyone tries to defend the dev s by saying that the game isn t finished Let me tell you what go look at the majority of games that started as early access and still are in early access 4 plus f****** years it s a joke and bad business practice #5 The motor cycle mechanics are ridiculous and you will hit random bumps on the road and be catapulted into a nose dive that instantly downs you #6 Optimization this game isn t optimized very well at all especially in contrast to the competition (H1Z1 FortNite free by the way) I have a Gigabyte 1080 and the frames can drop as low as 50 fps and the settings aren t even on ultra ..RED Flag!#7 Reshade The fact that in order for this game to even look remotely polished is buy using a third party shader and that bums me out nothing against reshade and I m happy we can use it without risking a ban. Maybe they can use the reshade shaders and have a toggle in the menu for the player that want it and players that don t. Overall I m happy with the purchase and I have a ton of time into the game 292.5 as of this post. I really hope these issues are resolved soon because it will make a ton of people like myself so happy to play a more polished version. If you are on the fence just buy the damn game already its more than worth the $29.99 price tag

review: Lot of haters out there. I'm always enjoying myself in this game and honestly when playing a game isn't that the only thing that matters?Cons Sure it's got bugs. But a lot of what I see people complaining about seems to be recycled problems from Jan/Feb that as far as I'm experiencing have been fixed. Perhaps it's just me but my issues with FPS drops de synch and occasional freezing/stuttering when using nades went away months ago. Hackers? Where? It was a huge problem back then I'll agree completely but I can say I've only seen one or two in the last month entirely. Only real issues I still have are the occasional vehicle flipping like it's in a blender and about 1 match in 20 my chute will catch on something dumb and having to wait like 5 seconds before I can cut it. A five second delay when hot dropping is usually a death sentence. Now I just do my best to avoid dropping into weird crevices.Pros The replay value here is practically infinite because every match is unique. Some matches I'm dead 10 seconds after hitting the ground...no gun in this house while my neighbor comes busting out with an UMP. Others I'm dining on some fine chicken atop some corpses. Hell my first solo chicken dinner was due to some fool being stuck at the bottom of a cliff when the final circle was on top of the Radio Tower hill on Erangel. It was too steep for him to climb and the only paths up were well into the blue. When it finally shrank to the smallest one he was stuck out of it. Bad call friend. But I'll never forget that because of how interesting it was. Perhaps I'm a little biased as I'm a big fan of Battle Royale. Read the book seen the movie read the manga. All great. I've been waiting for something like this for a while. Fortnight and the others are foolish cartoony and don't have the realism and urgency this game has. You're tossed down with nothing and forced to run fight and survive. Hard to feel the same pressure when you can instantly build walls and stairs or wtfever that crap is in Fortnight. Makes no sense to me. And the colors too....ugh. They still only have one map?I love this game. Is it in my top 10 best designed games? No. Is it in my top 10 most enjoyable games? Absolutely. Top 5 for that matter. Up there with Jagged Alliance 2 the original Legend of Zelda and BF1942.So when it all boils down to it I love this game. I'm optimistic about the changes in the pipeline. I've been down this road before. I've been involved with games at this stage in the development and this is not uncommon. MWO finished up its open beta 'launched' and for about a year people were still ing up storms and claiming the game was still in beta due to performance and balance issues. "Why are you adding a new mech/map when LRMs are still broken?!" Sound familiar? Growing pains. It took longer than PGI claimed it would and much longer than us players wanted but eventually got fixed. New 'mech pack/hero mech money grabs ended up turning into performance and balance upgrades/work. People still though...because why wouldn't they?So don't listen to the haters. Give it a shot. Drop and get killed drop and get killed drop and get killed again. Then drop and start killing once you've gotten the hang of it. See you on the island.

review: Here's my ReviewLike many other's I stumbled accross PUBG via YouTube and watching Twitch Streamers. Initially when I first bought it I hated it. I just needed to come to terms with something this game is all about luck. You can land in a zone score a SCAR and a level 3 vest with no one in sight. Leaving you free to loot and prepare for later zones. Or you can land in a zone with 12 other players raid 3 buildings and get a pistol. This randomness is part of the games system. Each match you don't know what could happen.This game isn't without its faults regardless of what others have said. This game most definetly is not for low mid range gaming rigs. It's already poorly optimized for some of the best hardware on the market. Running an older rig is like tying one hand behind your back. I run a 1080ti and an 8700k and even I set everything to high just to get some decent FPS.The player base is unforgiving to beginners you'll lose and lose and slowly become frustrated after either playing matches where you're playing a running simulator for 25mins or a new session every 5mins because a twitch streamer is pub stomping. Pun intended. Now lets be clear this game has improved greatly. But for what it is I'd say it could be better.PUBG was an innovator the first true PC battle royal game. But the innovation ended as other developers looked on in awe and jealousy as this titan put a choke hold on the PC gaming genre. I for one am sick of Battle Royale. But I'm excited for who will take the genre to the next level. Game's like Islands of Nyne or Escape from Tarkov. If you have little time to actually game a few hours a night or a lower end PC I'd avoid this game. It'll just squash the expectations you had.

review: Imagine dropping thirty dollars at a pizza place and they set before you a bag of shredded mozzerella all the toppings you want and a full jar of marinara sauce."Deconstructed pizza " you say. How very modern and artistic.PUBG is a lot like sitting at that table jamming all the cheese and toppings in your mouth and then pressing your lips to the edge of that marinara jar and just guzzling the contents like a vacuum. To start "PLAYERUNKOWN" (an alias that tells you the developer is either 13 or 30) is a complete and thinks he invented the battle royale style of gameplay. Avoid this boy.The server lag and game itself are both kind of unbearable. Servers aren't reliable so no matter how much it looks like you're shooting someone if they have a better connection than you you're dead. The GUI and code in general is broken. In the early days of the game my client would crash any time a stun grenade was used. I think this went for other people too which made it a great weapon. Kill your enemy by just straight up crashing their game.Lastly the playerbase is depressing. Almost every player is a wannabe streamer and if not that they're the most hardcore of gamers. Really could have used this $30 on medical bills today but screw me for wanting to have fun a couple months ago.

review: People complain about so many things that I haven't experienced once. (Keep in mind that I know other people see these things in game this is just my personal experience). I haven't seen a single cheater. I've never had a problem with the fact that China isn't region locked. I've actually played on asian servers and still did not lag. I don't get frame drops almost ever. Glitches are rare and pretty much only happen with vehicles. Hit detection is good for the most part. Don't let these things keep you from playing I think there is a lot of exageration in the communityAside from these common complaints the game is very good. In my opinion it is the best battle royale game out right now. The gunplay is amazing and rewarding. Fortnite is more fast paced but I prefer the strategic approach that PUBG takes. I also love that you can play in first person.

I have seen them use it at cafes by multiple people at several cafes. Server can be laggy so could do SERVER UPGRADES!! Glitches with rendering is common and people found abuses for it.I suggest More maps (smaller maps and bigger maps) Bigger maps obviously more player limit. More variety and selection in squading up. (6 for bigger friends group since 4 is just ehh 10 for clans) Bigger player limit instead of 100 Weather! More weapons (bamboo darts throwing knives ninja stars Tear Gas guns etc.) Rocket Launchers (1 bullet at time and low bullet capacity like 5 max) kinda like Granade but more distance and bigger exlosion radius. Can strategy with big scopes as 8x+ isnt much needed currently) More vehicles and such (6 seat bus but 4 player teams?) Possibly tanks (Sorta like rocket launcher but armored transportation and can blow up cars. Need ammo and 1 bullet at time) Possibly planes (just for transport faster transport easier to shoot down)Overall great game loads of fun especially with a group of cooperating team mates!8/10 but can definitely get 10/10 with a few big updates
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So this game has some flaws and you need 2000 hardware to run this game sort of smooth. All true. But it's giving me a lot of fun while playing every day again and again for almost a year now. I love the fact that the game is just what it is and trusts that the game itself is fun. No grinding for that one perfect weapon that a lot of other players have no tactical advantages that can be obtained by grinding. A player with 1000+ hours has no advantage over a player with just 3 hours into the game other than skill. The game is just the game and I love it!

review: When i wrote my last review i downvoted due to what i thought was a ridiculous amount of hackers. I chilled on it a while deleted the bad review and vowed to start again a fresh start. What i realise now is the problem isnt hackers (although there are some) the game itself is out to get you with its hit registration. I studied every death in my playback folder to try and improve my game and every other death was just what the hell! Blood flying on my screen but a miss on theirs bullets hitting a different spot from where my crosshair is during CQC other players spraying and praying at me and the one and only bullet that hits is a headshot. This also isnt a one sided thing after watching some of my kills in slow motion i could clearly see that i actually missed when i fired but the enemy was hit. This needs fixing ASAP as every enemy you meet is either ungodly good or absolute garbage depending on how the netcode is treating them.All that said its a fun game and will (eventually) be awesome. Just grit your teath and bare with the choas and you WILL get a decent firefight every 10 hours or so )

Just play Fortnight. Also 50 000 players on means the servers are too busy yet this game can yield 2 million players. PlayerUknown you cheap sack of need to shell out the dough for those servers. Don't play this game if you want to have fun. It costs too much and hasn't imroved as far as gameplay since summer 2017. The new map has promis but probably won't keep me playing.Edit 2 WTF bluehole your award system ing sucks absolute It only awards you the points for whatever achevment if you don't die in the first ten minutes of the game. How the am I supposed to unlock the I also paid for the BattlePass which is a total rip off. For a 700+ million dollar company you'd think they'd take the time to iron out the t. review: INGREDIENTS2 sticks unsalted butter2 1/4 cups bread flour1 teaspoon kosher salt1 teaspoon baking soda1/4 cup sugar1 1/4 cups brown sugar1 egg1 egg yolk2 tablespoons milk1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract2 cups semisweet chocolate chipsDIRECTIONSHeat oven to 375 degrees.Melt the butter in a heavy bottom medium saucepan over low heat. Sift together the flour salt and baking soda and set aside.Pour the melted butter in the mixer s work bowl. Add the sugar and brown sugar. Cream the butter and sugars on medium speed. Add the egg yolk 2 tablespoons milk and vanilla extract and mix until well combined. Slowly incorporate the flour mixture until thoroughly combined. Stir in the chocolate chips.Chill the dough then scoop onto parchment lined baking sheets 6 cookies per sheet. Bake for 14 minutes or until golden brown checking the cookies after 5 minutes. Rotate the baking sheet for even browning. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

review: This game used to be fun and then it blew up to a point where there servers can't handle the load anymore if they ever could in the first place. Lag spikes are common and I know it's not my internet since it will happen across the game and desync issus are just part of the experience now. To make things worse the game is so poorly optimized my severely OC'd 1070 will max at 55FPS and it's been this way since day 1.Hackers/aimbots are common more so now than a month ago. From what I've heard through the grapevine someone released a free one somewhere and it's completely destroyed gameplay overall. I know I'm not the best but seeing some asshat rack up headshot after headshot in the kill feed with the most inaccurate gun in the game tends to be kind of telling. On the flip side there are also people out there doing something to reduce/eliminate damage received since I've lit up more than a few people with full magazines only to have them turn around and 1 shot me from full health and full level 3 armor with a pistol. Reporting does nothing since Bluehole has comeout and said they just compile reporting stats for records and not necessarily action.To top it off there some questionable company practices regarding actually banning people. At the moment the only people who get banned are "stream snipers" otherwise known as "anyone who kills a streamer in a bad mood". This hasn't happened to me and at this point IDGAF if it actually does but the only complaints the company seems to take seriously are the ones from streamers.TL DR Pass on this game until there is a massive server upgrade and they actually start cracking down on cheaters that aren't "stream snipers".

review: Original Review OK it has been like three months and the one thing that this game does not have is factial hair. Hey BlueHole maybe you could add in a little moustache a beard or some sideburns? Maybe even a Fu Man Chu? I liked the "small" customizations like APB. I don't want it too flashy but a few more small customizations would make the came a little cooler. I do like the trade system you have right now similar to CS GO. Items purely cosmetic but spice up the game. This can help you guys have the extra money to keep the game fresh and keep the hackers out. Please don't use all the money to buy a second Lamborgini you don't need a second one. Ferrari is much better.9.8/10Revised Review I had a friend that told me he wanted to be a game developer. He came to me for advice. He said he wanted to make this completely unique game. Something no one had ever seen before. He went into great detail about how awesome and original it would be. It really blew me away. Then I asked him if he had any development experience? He said no he wanted to put all his efforts into creating the most epic original game ever created. He just wanted to work on this awesome game. He told me more about how awesome it would be. I told him it was a complete waste of time. He asked "Why? Why is an original completely unique game a complete waste of time?"I told him if you have no experience about how to make a game and put all your sweat tears and sleepless nights into it then announce it to the world here is what is going to happen.... Someone with a whole boatload more money than you is going to see what you are doing and even though it took you two years to make this epic unique one of a kind game they are going to come along and make the exact same game as you over a weekend and profit off it 20 times over what you put two years into creating. So your game might as well not even have existed. He said "Jeesh I had never thought of that." I said "That's why they have lawyers. Lawyers always get paid." Now my friend says he wants to be a lawyer.Anyway PUBG is a really great game and I will keep playing it. Sometimes I tend to go off on these tangants. I apologize.

review: I been waiting till the release of the new map Sanhok to write this review because I thought it would save this game from the things I don't like about it. As much as I want to write a positive review for this game I unfortunately cannot. I have 200 hours on this game as of now and it is my most played game on Steam however fun this game may be at times it is outweighed by negatives that ultimately made me come to write a negative review. The Good PUBG can be very fun at times it has some of the most intense situations I've seen in a video game and playing with friends is an abosolute blast. The guns are probably one of the coolest things about this game allowing you to customize them with various attachements to suit your playstyle which completely trumps the weapons in Fortnite. If you're looking for a more realistic battle royale game this is probably the closest you can get (unfortunately). The Bad This game is often nicknamed 'The Walking Simulator' for good reasons the two maps (not Sanhok) are way too large at 8x8km this game is often filled with a whole lot of nothing and oftentimes it's hard to find vehicles so you can end up having to walk across the map only to be sniped as soon as you make it. Unfortunately about 95% of the deaths in this game feel unfair and like you never had a chance on top of that there's way too many glitches that are extremely frustrating and end up with you dying. As everyone else has stated before me this game is riddled with hackers. whether it's aim walls or any other type of hacks you can find them here. The Ugly The devs for this game are some of the worst I've seen for such a popular game tending to work backwards instead of forwards in most cases. Instead of making the crate system better by adding more crates that you can open up for free they decide to keep on adding more crates that you need to pay $2.50. Which I can ignore because cosmetics are not important at all. But they also decided to remove weather (like rain and fog) from the game which just made the game feel more bland. Optimization in this game has plagued its existence since launch and I personally haven't had too many issues till recently with the new map where I'm lucky to be getting 60fps+ on lowest settings and the only way to make it run slightly better is to play on 3rd person for me but there seems to be even more hackers on that mode so there's really no winning. As of now it just feels like the devs don't care too much about their audience and would rather introduce new ways for you to spend your money on a broken game. So even though I might continue to play this game every once in a while I would strongly advise against supporting these devs until they actually work on fixing their game and adding new content consitently.

review: I have over 2000 hrs sunk into Arma 3 mainly playing survival mods but have never bothered to play the BattleRoyal Game mode. My friend had to persuade me to buy it so I took the plunge on day 1. Initially I though the game lacked content to warrant the 27 price tag but the more I played... the more I was addicted.. looking for that 1st win! Since the games release there have been some great updates and bug fixes which is very encouraging. I actually recommend this game to FPS players that have a love for survival games as it really caters for survival and aggressive game styles. I hope they bring in more maps as I am getting too familiar with the current map but all in all this is a great game (apart from when you run into hackers or should I say when hackers find you!)

review: I've played my fair share of matches both with / without friends as well as in first and third person. and if im being honest havent won once (techinically I did but I died in the first encounter and watched my team win w/o me and thats a hollow victory if nothing else). There are games that I "pop off" in but those are only happen 1/20 games and are usually followed by a swift death outside the zone or to the hands of professional sniper leaving the majority of my expeience in PUBG both hollow and full of failure after failure after failure with no full sembalence of growth after each failed attempt no matter what aspect I change. Ive noticed that the "gunplay" is nothing more than a bucket of ship with a "realism" label on the side. Im all for realism but there is a fine line between realistic(ARMA) and idealised(CoD) that will make a gaming experience both fun to play and realistic to a degree (Wildlands) Pubg however leans slightly to far to the realistic side by design which makes the prosess of "lining up a shot and pulling the trigger" incredibly infuriating in short/med ranges and borderline impossible at long range(for me). On the other side of the barrel while being shot at 95% of times you cant even tell where the shooter is as there are no tracers to indicate positioning and even when you are hit there is no indication of the direction you were just hit from to even give you a chance at turning on them before your inevitable demise... so alot of the hardcore community are probably are going to say that "im just bad" or "why dont you get better" well id love too but I cant get better at the game if im having my head taken off while hiding behind a rock from a direction i cant even begin to aprehend. PUBG is incredibly hard takes alot of skill detication and luck. most likely to the point where the so called "cheaters" or "Hackers" from america are probably whats left of the casual comunity... and boy howdy do i want to join em. Im sure the game will evolve and get better iron out some bugs im sure but Im not stickn round to see it the devs dont care they've got my $30 but at least I'll be having fun everywhere else but here.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: NEW REVIEW PUBG was a game I loved it was a game I played the s**t out of PUBG. It was always fun to play with friends or on my own. But today I roll my eyes if someone asks me to play a round. But why?The Game has become stale it seems like the developer doesn't care about you. It isn't getting the support the game needs. What updates have we received since it released over a year ago?MiramarVaultingNew Scopes and GripsUhm... did I miss anything?Back when there were so many asian cheaters and people were crying out to region lock china to fix most of the problem instantly instead of fixing the game we were all called xenophobes. There is still a lot of lagg in the beginning of the game picking up items is still a chore (How do you f*** this up. The game is literally BUILT around picking up stuff!) Cars are a mess. They don't behave like a normal car would. Strange for a game that "tries" for realism.The circle will you up on a daily basis. They had a better solution for the circle in the lategame but scratched that because ... the do I know.And the most spicy part of it In case you were living beneath a rock for the last 6 months Entertainment is suing EPIC the company providing THE GAME ENGINE OF PUBG for "copyright infringement" like 100 people dropping from some sort of flying thing. The placement I am not kidding you of the MINIMAP (WHAT THE F!?!?) and other hilarious reasons. Essentially Blueballs is salty because Fortnite is more successfull than PUBG. This is entirely the fault of Bluehole. They are now instead of fixing the game and making people come back spending their money they should use on fixing the damn game on frivolous lawsuits. A you to the community if I've ever seen one. Hey Blueballs!The fist car in a videogame was Grand Prix. 1969. SONY should sue you!The first Ego Shooter was Maze War. 1973. Steve Colley should sue you!The first Game to feature a mini map was DEFENDER. 1981. Williams Electronics should sue you!The first game with Loot Boxes was Team Fortress 2. 2010. Valve should sue you!Seriously Entertainment?! Suing EPIC is the most greedy and the dumbest thing to ever do. There once was a companty called silicon knights. They sued EPIC to gain money. They lost and had to pay if I remember correctly around 6 million USD. Silicon Knights no longer exists.F**k you PUBG. F**K you. You POPULARIZED the genre not invented it! And your game is so f**king generic there is no way you can sue anyone. Most of your assets are BOUGHT from the UNREAL STORE which is you guessed it OWNED BY EPIC GAMES!The developers forgot how to talk they only know "money". They are worse than EA. They are working against the gaming industy and against what lead gaming to the height it is today. The Good They managed to deal with the cheating epidemic. I think. The one battle royale game that is closest to a "real" setting (Not that hard if your main competitor is a cartoonish game)OLD REVIEW with now added snarky comments to my old review "Just one more round." I whispered to myself ignoring my duties and the work I have to do."Next time I will be #1!" I muttered clenching my mouse knowing that I won't be because I am not careful enough.This game is very good (no it's not). Better than any other competitors(you wish) in the whatever genre of this game is.This game punches as hard as united airlines. (old meme.)Gunplay feels crisp (like a soggy potato chip)They mostly fixed lagg (if you have a NASA PC and NASA internet connection)Butt clenching moment. (moments. Good gammar there old me.)Heck. If you are interested in this game why have you NOT bought it yet? (And if you have not bought it yet save your sheckles.)

review: Product received for free. A friend bought this game for me so we had something to play together. Pros Not hard to find loot.Large variety of loot.Custom servers.Fast to find a game &lt 20sec.Can with friends up to a group of 4.Leaderboards.Realistic gameplay.5 main server locations.In game rewards that offer very little advantage (Carrying capacity).Very few fps drops on my pc (once for 2 sec every 15 games or so) Cons Crashes on some computers (You have 2 weeks to refund just dont go over 2 hours each time you purchase it).Very bad desync at times.Cant have a team &gt 4.Difficult to fist fight due to lag/desync. (but still fun)Only one official game mode (battle royale)Not many custom servers (for now)This is all that I want from a battle royale game.I would have bought it myself when I had the money because this game is worth it.This game can be fun to play solo or with friends.If you want people to play with you can join our discord (Age 17+) https //discord.me/trappinHave fun if this review helped you get the game and remember that you may refund it if you dont like it but at least you know you like it or not based from you playing rather than reading reviews and not buying it.
