review: Winner winner chicken dinner?You guys know what changed between test servers and launch day? The game runs worse now.I'm torn on rating because this still feels like early access yet I've invested over 100 hours with no end in sight and for the $29.99 I paid back when it launched (the first time not this "1.0" version) I guess it's worth it.Still needs work on lag early round rubberbanding hackers/aimbots etc. but the potential for great fun exists. I crash a lot too sometimes as often as 3 times per round but barring anyone shooting me in the face while I'm frantically rebooting the game I'm usually able to resume where I left off. I'd prefer that this didn't happen but at least I can rejoin a match in progress.Edit 12/29/17 Rubberbanding was improved in a patch last night. Still some connectivity issues servers too busy etc.Edit 1/4/18 In place of rubberbanding there is now just a fairly large item pick up delay at the start of matches. Visually less annoying but annoying nonetheless. This is also the only game that causes my system to CTD or blue screen even. (Windows you suck for putting a frown face emoji on that screen)Edit 5/13/18 I have a love/hate relationship with this game. I stopped playing for 3 months because my system would CTD or flat out BSoD. I've had this rig for 4 years and this is the ONLY game to cause BSoD. I reinstalled the game on my SSD and have to run my fan full throttle to prevent my system from overheating even with lowered graphics. I am by no means running a potato and recently doubled my memory to 32gb and popped in a GTX 1080. There are 2 maps now which is nice but fog and rain are now gone. A 3rd map is en route but I miss playing in thunderstorms. Cheating? Still bad. Anti cheat patches are sometimes worse than the cheating.Still I play and I have moments of crazy fun. I'm teetering in the edge of a thumb's down because content is starting to be removed. Also I am very angry about the crate system and the $2.50 keys required to open most of them. C'mon guys at least leave a 100% free option to buy with in game BP rather than a random chance of getting a free crate but more likely a crate that requires a paid key to open. This seems greedy for a game that sold so many units. I think I am going to give that thumb's down afterall. BRING BACK MY RAINSTORMS!

review: This game makes me feel like I have bi polar disease. Why? Allow me to explain.You load into a game thrown into an airplane with 99 other users forming a 100 player battle royale game. Each player hoping to achieve the same thing Be the last one alive. But as you can tell you have a nasty 1/100 chance of winning a game (solo mode) the percentage goes up dramatically if you factor in everybody's skill level within a game total wins etc however I'm not Einstein so I'll leave that for a later date.Anyway back to my point. This game makes me feel like I have bi polar because you can either be in 1 of 3 moods Angry Dying straight away to someone who lands on an Assault Rifle whilst you land on a pair of safety goggles.Happy Landing on an Assault Rifle whilst your opponent lands on a pair of safety goggles.Dissapointed Getting a tommy gun from an airdrop.However most of the time I am alive until late game and end up dying to the final person to a crossbow getting 2nd place. Which is ing stupid.Anyway as for the community and the development team. They are very communicative. Developers listen to the community the community give constant feedback which is great. But then they add ing crates.Let's not talk about crates as I will get triggered.I have 117 hours and I can say I have enjoyed about 80% of these hours. The other 20% of my hours consists of stupid deaths stupid team mates RNG loot RNG Circles and just about everything else that doesn't go my way.The game is also very fun if you have friends to play with. My personal favourite mode is DUO and I would recommend it to anyone if you have friends who own the game however if you don't. Just don't. Play Duo. Don't do it. Just. Trust me just don't do it. If you do you will get matched with somebody who either doesn't have a microphone or is incapable of communicating effectively thus resulting in you getting a bullet to the head from a Kar98K.Squads is fun too you can often random queue squads but it's a hit or miss on whether or not you're in for a good game.Finally let's talk about the system requirements.Running on my old system I would average around 45 frames per second in Georgopol (a big city) I'll be using georgopol as it is a very large city with lots of loot and players scattered around and my specs were as so OS Windows 10/64BitRAM 16GBGFX GTX 750 tiCPU i5 6600k 3.5GHzSSD 1TBAnd on my new specs (upgrades graphics card) I get about 130 fps constant in Georgopol.OS Windows10/64BitRAM 16GBGFX GTX 1060 6GBCPU i5 6600k 3.5GHzSSD 1TBYou need a good graphics card and CPU to run this game for recording and streaming maybe better.Thanks for reading my Novel on PUBG now steam. Stop asking for my review. Thanks.

review: Hands down THE Battle RoyaleLove the game. A lot of tweaking needs to be done but overall the game plays great. Optimization is a big issue. If the game was optimized better there would be less rubber banding and and glitching.(If you caught the intended double "and" then you get the point)Also to be fair ballistics in the game really do not make much sense. **Considering this is a game and not to rely on real world physics of bullet weight vs. environmental afflictions ballistics are not as important as the play ability.** Buuuuuuttttt..........In general a 5.56 round will drop more than a 7.62 round. The 7.62 has more mass behind it and delivers a higher energy transfer than the 5.56. The 5.56 is a lighter bullet with a significant drop over distance as compared to the 7.62 due to the fact that the 7.62 has a higher grain count behind the bullet. That's not even considering barrel length bullet coefficient temperature barrel temperature and so on and so forth. But there's no point in arguing semantics. Besides the God awful ballistics in the game it plays quite well.I should also note that rendering definitely needs to be improved but I feel once the game reaches a better optimization that will fall right into place. All in all I love the game. The close moments the feeling you get when you're in the final ten that absolute rush when you make the final kill......there's hardly anything that can virtually replicate the feeling. plus it makes for good time I get to spend with my son and that right there is more important than any other negative factors of the game. Good job BlueHole keep up the good work.

review: I pretty much have nothing bad to say about this game. I have experienced a few graphical glitches like a black box that bleeps around my crosshairs and a few color glitches but nothing that has taken away from the gaming experience or shooting people. Out of the many early access games I have purchased this is by far my favorite. If this game was left as is right now I would be completely satisfied with my purchase. I'd say some more optimaztion can be done to make the game run smoother or maybe I just need a better computer (Intel X5650 with AMD R9 390). Running the game on ultra I was hovering between 20 35 FPS depending on the environment. I turned all the graphics down to low except textures (medium) and viewing distance (ultra) and I feel like it didn't take much away from the environment it also doubled my FPS. You can solo or do teams duo or squad (3 or 4). Never had any issues starting with a team never had any issues waiting for a game Maybe 2 3 minutes max. Overall completely satisfied. Air high five delelopers keep it up! Excited for what new stuff will be coming out. Many more hours of gameplay to come.

review: After playing a handful of round I have to say I'm hooked. Every round can have an entirely different style of gameplay. What I mean by this is that if you land your parachute too far away from the "final battle spot" you'll be spending most of the round on the move hopping from building to field and will probably amass a good selection of firearms and higher level gear. On the other hand you may have landed in a location well within the radius of the final play area and you are more focussed on defending your "base". Solo play is terrifying but rewarding. I've made it to the top 10 a few times best was #5. I recommend playing with a friend in the Duo or Squad modes.As it is in alpha it does have a bit of bugs including some lag and FPS issues. I'm hoping future patches are implemented to correct these. Apparently there is a cheater problem but I have yet to encounter a blatent hacker. There is a weird graphical issue when inside a building where you'll see a black haze effect when your camera hits certain angles. Again I expect these to iron out as time goes on. Hopefully the developers take all the feedback into account and make this game even better.

review: UPDATE I can guarantee that there will be a cash grab method with every content update like loot crates that get errors and void your purchase or a game pass used by free2play games to generate revenue problem is we've already paid for PUBG.MENU The menu can't remember your preferences reverting you to a game mode you don't want each time. Multiple maps multiple choices right?... Not in PUBG. There is career AND leaderboards... They're same thing why can't we just click a player on the leaderboard and have their detailed profile comes up rather than multiple avenues to reach the same destination. There's a nice little button that takes you to a microtransaction so you can pay for your "reward".GAMEPLAY Sing this Run player run player run run run. None of these houses have a god damn gun. Here comes the zone there is no brum brum. This is why this game isn't that fun fun fun. Your shoesize is probably a higher number than the server tick rate. They're also full of ping exploiters from China. It runs like GARBAGE! Well for a game that mentions going in to e sports... You're trademark GTX1050/R3 1200 e sports gaming rig ain't gonna cut it. It ain't happening unless everyone gets a GTX1070/I7 7700K set up minimum. There's weapons if you can find a good one also vehicles... You probably won't find one.DEVELOPERS Brendan Greene the biggest problem in PUBG. Called us all xenophobes because we want a region lock. He can't code and he obviously can't manage staff... Slower than snail pace.

review: I gave it a negative review before but now I am changing it to positive.Every game has its pros and cons and this game which I spent 200 hours on it (u guys can get it from my profile) is the best survival game in general for me.If you like taking many MANY years off of your life from the stress this game gives your heart go ahead and get it cuz it is really fun and challenging.Imagine if u want to survive on a deserted island what can u do?Pros good gaming experience. the server is better than those games like left4death2 H1Z1 sth(for me cuz I can actually play all servers without any lags). multiple choices of transports weapons. Cons I heard many voices about 'banning players' sth but I don't know much about it Unoptimized(i use the very low graphic to play and my processor is i7 7700k graphic card gtx1080.i tried medium graphic before but it doesn't work well!!!) That is why I gave a downvote before.But though this is a fun game that has some of my best gaming moments. It helps if you play with friends in a Squad game.BUT I DONT KNOW WHY THIS GAME IS GETTING COMPETITIVE LIKE CSGO&amp DOTA!

review: This game is fun...the concepet is fantastic...that being said it needs alot of work.The latency is god awfull and that doesn't mix well with a hardcore shooter. Mesh optimization is terrible even if you have a top of the line card you will find yourself turning settings down to medium to get something resembling decent proformance. Audio needs alot of adjustment. Pretty much across the board the game is lacking polish. From what I have seen however the devs are updating often and working on things.If you are fine paying for a work in progress this game is fun as hell when the servers not lagging otherwise I would advise giving it some time.I will thumbs up when latency issues are fixed

review: While this game has a lot of potential to be amazing in its current state it's not a good buy.In just over 80 mins of playing I have managed to get about 10 15 mins of actual playing time the rest of it being spent on loading into games to only be instantly disconnected. Had major issues regarding key binding. Tried to change a few keys around to suit my playstyle more and every key instantly unbinded and could not be reset which meant I had to go into the app data settings for the game to completely reset them.Character customisation is very restrictive (which isn't a major issue) but the limited choices available bug out constantly and the character you choose to look like isn't what you end up as. Ultimately if this game was bug free and ran smoothly then you could potentially justify its 26.99 price tage for a game that is essentially a free mod on Rust a much more optimised game that costs half the price. Would not recommend this to anyone in it's current state as 26.99 for an early access game is absolutely crazy given its current state. DO NOT BUY IN CURRENT STATE.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There is a lot good about this game. The weapons the map character movement the way you enter the map and many others. In short when considering game balance PU Battlegrounds is easily the best BR game out there right now. The one MASSIVE problem is the speed the servers are running at. Which at the moment seems to be 20 tps. Which is bad. It makes luck a much bigger factor in every engagement than it should be. If I had known I probably would have waited a couple months before buying. It is still fun. And will continue to get better.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Early Access released at a good standard unlike DayZ or other early access titles that are released with poor content. Weapons are nice and fairly balanced from what I can tell from my playtime. Clothing options and layering of clothing system is very nice it is possible to create some really good looking characters. The map is very nice lots of areas with plenty of cover where some areas are flat and exposed. The buildings are spaced quite nicely too. Overall much better than H1Z1. The two cons that I have noticed when playing are that the game needs a lot of optimization (I feel the devs have this under control and will fix this issue) and second of all the game suffers from rubber banding in some games sessions. yet again I feel that this issue will become very easy to fix. However I would recommend this game in its current state great fun intense and a very fun multiplayer experience to play with friends!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's "The Culling" but with guns and any incentive to play it whatsoever. After getting burnt out on Culling's sub optimal melee system which is a heavy focus of its gameplay I've been looking for a different Battle Royale style game. ARMA's not optimized quite enough and other games just don't seem to do it right.PUBG is an interesting new take combining elements from other games into a coherent stream of gameplay. It offers you plenty of chance for success or failure and the shooting mechanics are fair enough for you to quickly know what you're doing.However while gunplay is skill based and relatively fair the entire rest of the game is luck and RNG which almost guarantees a loss for me. I realize the chances of winning a game are almost literally 1% in solo play but I've walked into a large number of buildings with only weapon attachments and non useful clothing in them which usually culminates in me being shot ten seconds after dropping in by someone who found an M16 in the next house over.There are some minor insconsistencies in the shooting I should note. I distinctly remember firing the double barreled shotgun at an enemy only 10 feet away and the shot completely missed when it clearly shouldn't've. Oh well. Game's okay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: An early access game that is already miles ahead of every other game in the genre. Full dev support and the devs focus on what matters first. Weekly patches. Monthly content updates until launch.What else could you ask for? I love it. Not many games can pull off such intense moments and such rewarding victories.If you are on the fence then I say try it and you won't regret it.

review: So Everyone compares this to H1Z1. Stop it. Just stop it immediately. H1Z1 is a Battle Royale yes and H1Z1 Let's you fall with to the ground with a parachute yes.... After that it stops being similar. In PugB first off you get attachments that you can find through the world for your weapons. These attachments include surpressors compensators stocks foregrips c mags and scopes galore. H1Z1 never offered any sort of attachments.Secondly the gunplay So in H1Z1 when you fire an m16 your gun sways to the right and up... (because recoil does that on all weapons..)... In PubG the weapon kicks at an 181 degree angle as weapons actually fire. So in short it's infinitely more realistic. Thirdly Hitboxes.... H1Z1 can kiss my whole with their hitboxes after Years of development when PubG can release an unoptimized early access game and capture the attention of the world with correctly placed hitboxes..... I could continue to express the significant differences between H1Z1 compared to PugB... But Know This.PugB (the guy who made a mod for Arma that SOE stole the idea from to make a video game) made a video game. He did it right. You should buy it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What DayZ gameplay wished it could be. The Game is 50% Luck 5% Skill and 45% having a good computer. The optimization isnt as good as it could be so everything has to run on low or very low unless you have pretty good computer specs atm (5/6/17). 40% of the time when i land into the world the fps is so low that i cant enter any houses because theyre literally just giant blobs. Other than that and then hyper op shotguns this game is pretty set and really fun. The shooting isnt to hard to grasp and the game is basic enough to were you only need to play a few games to understand it. If the devs fix optimization and loading screens and crashes this game is a solid 7 maybe 7.5/10. 8.5/10 wif friends

review: Game essentially comes down to luck and has given me more frustration and annoyance than enjoyment.There are good aspects about the game but I don't think it's worth the current price.The most fun I got out of the game was squadding up with a bunch of random people and chatting over VOIP and we went on to win the round. But most of the time people don't have mics won't stay together and will die leaving you wanting to quit and find another match. You also can't add people on steam via the game so you have to ask them over VOIP which is a hassle and usually doesn't work.Watching streamers play the game is a lot more enjoyable than playing it yourself.There are other FPS games where dying doesn't annoy me at all because you feel like you could have stood a chance if you played better. But a lot of times in this game it's unpreventable someone shooting you in the back from a mile away or someone camping in a bush waiting for you to show up or the game lagging out or getting stuck in a doorway jumping out of a car going 10km/h etc. Also the devs are terrible and shouldn't be supported.

review: I love this game. The devs have a lot of work on there hands. There are a lot of bugs. At least one of my squadmates crashes every few games. One of my friends can't even play it because the buildings don't load in for him. I can run to cover on my screen but to the enemy I am in the open for an extra second and can get shot. You can be driving a vehicle across a straight flat plain with no bumps then your car does a backflip for no reason. The car physics in general are just terrible. There are not enough different weapons yet. The weapons are not balanced the SMGs shoot nerf darts. There are much more things that need to change.This game is fun for me because I play with friends. I would recommend this game if you have friends that you would play with.

review: 24/05/2017 Done just under 2 hours on this and to be fair for my first battle royale game its quite a good start the gameplay could do with some more work as it can be buggy at times but with this being currently in early access i can look past it as one of the things that happen in game development the matchmaking process is very difficult as i try to get into team lobbies and find that its taking ages to do so so id stick to solo if i was you and it also feels a lot more scary as you are basically on your own until a guy comes to blow your head off.the gameplay is very reminiscant of films like The Codemned and hunger games minus the t drama which to be fair is good for a game like this no narrative or expansive choices just raw gameplay.as long as there are no microtransactions to the point where its pay to win then this is a solid game thus far.29/05/2017Done about 12 14 hours and safe to say i am very much enjoying the game btu there are still some gripes that the game still has not fixed the game has a big problem with network lag which at times moves your charcater in awkward positions which at times can mean life or death the game has an upgrade system in place for weapons so you will come across attachments to fit certain weapons the UI for this is still in the works but the overall pros and cons of each attachment are stated but again spending time look at an upgrade and not watching your own back can mean life or deathThe really good thing i have found about this game is sound and its usefullness in the game as your walking or running you will come across other players in the game for sure but the one thing that can save your life in this game is to listen to your surroundings one instance of this was i was in an old police station looting for some ammo as i did not have much to start with and in the distance i heard a car coming closer so i ducked into one of the reception rooms and went prone just for a minute or so so that the sound passed a few seconds after i thought the coast was clear i heard quick steps getting closer and eventually i saw someone come in the building look around and ran towards the stairs a mere 5 feet from where i was and all that was stopping from him seeing me was the small hole in the wall that was used to greet people and a slight turn of his camera so definate close call eventually i manged to follow him upstairs using an ac130 overhead as cover for the running sounds i would make and eventually had to utlilise slow walking to get closer to where he possibly was which was the roof which allowed good viewing spots for a sniper eventually i managed to find him and blow him away with one shot of a shotgun.so yeah safe to say that sound in this game is top notch . . .04/07/2017Done just over 40 hours on this and the game has gotten a lot better since the recent bug update and weapon update the game is running a lot smoother and the landings when the game starts are much better. there are still some bugs in the game but nowhere near as much as there were which is fantastic.This is a brilliant game to play with freinds but when playing solo the tension rises so much faster and gets to the point of splitting hairs especially as youve only got your own eyes and not 2/4 others to see other players about and even when playing 2/4 players it is very best to be as cooperative as possible and not going gun ho on your own.Specific communication is key so calling bearings when seeing players with the ingame compass helps. Sharing bullets med kits energy drinks painkillers etc. is a must when coming in as with everyone on equal terms will help you get that chicken dinner (That is literally what it is called if you win). Having certain attachments for weapons will give you the edge when it comes to combat shotguns for CQC or rifles and even DMR's each can give you a certain playstyle to run with and some can give you an edge that will mean winning outright but its not just weapons that will mean winning Situational awareness is something that will help big time with winning especially as it comes down to the final circle13/07/2017played just under 100 games and won 4 games thus far and to be honest im still enjoying it the game has had some updates very recently featuring 2 new guns and some new weather variations the game runs a bit smoother but still has some crashes from time to time. the overall gameplay is very smmoth to run but on older PC setups it is still a cause for concern i have a gtx 1080 strix with a i7 6800K with an overclock to 4.0GHz and get steady 60FPS when theres plenty of players on the screen but when looking to horizons easy 100 FPS.overall there is still a lot to do with the gamebut at this moment its taking a lot of my spare time lol
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yet another edit I love this game I really do. But the fact is that this game isn't free with a paid pass for missions and (IMO) pretty lackluster rewards makes it blatantly obvious that it's a cashgrab. There are still many issues with this game that have yet to be fixed and it's incredibly disappointing that a large update like this introduces a mechanic you can't even use without the event pass. (The missions and XP system.)I like missions I like to be able to aim for something while I'm playing that's what makes this update good but the fact I have to pay 9.99 for a limited item is ing riduculous and judging by the review bombs I know I'm not the only one with this opinion.I love this game but for love of god FIX. IT. BEFORE. RELEASING. THIS. DAMN. CASHGRAB.No more lootboxes locked behind keys no more event passes FIX THE GAME FIRST.

review: I was skeptical about this game for a while. I had guys in my discord channel talk about it guys at work talk about it and still I wasn't convinced. ARMA 3 isnt appealing to me and the same crowd that likes that raved about this. I decided to take a chance this past weekend and try it out. Turns out they were all right. This game is incredibly addicting. You probably already know how its formatted start in a plane jump out on an island last one alive wins. But boy is there a lot in between. While playing solo is fine playing with friends with headsets is an absolute blast. Diving out of the plane and landing far from everyone else looting houses and arming up then everyone gets in a vehicle or if your'e lucky you have two vehicles and roaming for kills. We were lucky and found two jeeps one round. Two guys to a jeep moving like a caravan it felt like something from a movie. Everyone armed to the teeth rolling up to a town where we heard a lot of gunfire. Slide the jeeps sideways for cover and get out and as a group move slowly through checking corners. Its fun. Its addicting. And I say this as someone who was highly speculative its well worth $30

review: "As every game it has it's pros and it's cons. To the pros it's funny enjoyable game that brings the hit and run gameplay to a whole new level. At cons there are so many guys that cheats there are so many bugs and so many glitches still that ruins the most part of fun. I recommend this game but hardly because of all these stuff that the developers should fix. Developers hear the plea of all the players and fix the damn bugs lags glitches cheaters or you will lose the community base the regular players."That was my first review of the game with a possitive recommendation. After 200 hours of playing this game more and a couple of patches released I have to change my review. Developers are possibly blind to all the requests of the players. They prefer to farm money indroducing high priced boxes and skins than trying to make the game better. They fixed 0 things in aspects that matters. Let me say some of them 1) How much time it takes you to take a breath? In game it's almost 10 seconds... You press shift in game in order to save your breath and shoot without breath target loss and after 2 seconds that you can hold it (the regular time in real life is 20+ seconds) it takes 10+ seconds to refill your lungs... Really?2) Bikes are UNDRIVABLE. If you take a bike and you go with 100+ km/h you are deralled and most of time dead... Like real life... Everyone who goes with more than 100km/h is dead... Really?3) Guns are unbalanced still. They made SMG's and DMR's to make more damage. That's a right thing but.. why all 5.56 weapons are doing so little damage? As a man that works in the army I know that it should have a difference in damage but not so much. 4) Can you do something for the hackers? If not shut the game down. Same thing for other games too.5) Last 10 days I have been kicked from the game around 27 times... Verify your installation bad module e.t.c. DO SOMETHING!

review: Fun even in Alpha.So this game has given me the same feeling I got from DayZ. I get scared I hide when I have to I shoot horribly at other people I make choices that lead to me dying a lot.I love it. I have reached the top 10 a few times already 3rd being the highest and once I didn't even kill anyone to get there. It's about survival. (However extra points are awarded for killing ofcourse).It's a 40 minute DayZ without zombies that with more updates I am sure will get better.You should get it. EDIT Follows A few wins under the belt now woooo.The game is still fun 89 hours in. The optimisation is fixing a lot of faults that I was experiencing at first but still with the occassional freeze or crash. Freezing I put down to Australian NBN quality however.Looking forward to the zombies update but hoping it doesn't get too much attention and it only goes in to the custom games not on to the official servers.Would love to see the 100 players broken down in to 10 person squads to see how tactical the game could be.

review: This game is loads of fun. It takes all the best elements of survival games like Day z and strips out the hours of monotinous grind and skips you up to the best parts of PvP survival/action games. It also oddly enough reminds a lot of the old Socom games for PS2 (which i adored) as far as the tense 3rd person combat (also can right click for first person). Really the idea of this game is just genious. Take a massive map randomly fly an airplane full of 100 players over the map and allow them to parachute to any city. The players then run around looting houses ala dayz and get guns (like 20+) all sorts of mods for guns armor healing items and then you just run around capping fools. There are vehicles to make it not so borning running from town to town. It all comes down to the last man standing and to eliminate camping the map constantly shrinks forcing all players to run around to the same areas or take damage until they get there. It can be played every man for himself teams of 2 or teams of 4. All matches play out totally different especially going from solo to team play. Other then a few bugs and some slight performance issues i really just do not get why people give this game a bad wrap. Its first of its kind executed very well and is casual enough to hop in and play a few rounds or hardcore enough to play for hours and hours and develop mad tactics to win. I give it a 9/10.Must buy. It will only get better and have more modes as time goes on. a ing RIOT to play with buddies.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Very enjoyable game and runs so much smoother after the most recent update. I notice a marked improvement with each update that makes the game that much better. Pro Every match you play is a completely unique experience even though it's the same map. There's no grind to get better gear or to improve stats each game is based on how well you play. Even if you're not an expert marksman you can still find a way to make it to the top. The RNG can be irritating. However sometimes it works in your favor and feels great when you beat the odds. No other game have I felt so pumped when pulling off a win. Con Early access status can sometimes linger and leave you wondering if the product is going to be finished or if it's just an excuse for bugs. Though I have never experienced it myself there is a lot of talk about the dev team being a little too quick to ban players for unfounded accusations. Personally I find it better than them ignoring the problem and cheaters running wild. However stream sniping is extremely hard to prove and it's a system that appears to be getting abused. The RNG on loot spawns seems to be really out of sorts right now. I've gone through large cities by myself several times and come out with not very much to show for it. Dropping in with multiple enemies can be extremely frustrating because it comes down to the off chance that you find a gun before they do (yes high risk high reward but with a little tweaking to the loot spawns and I'll be satisfied.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Why don't they just suspend the account? Well overall great genre of the game and 10/10 will play it again.

review: This is a revamp of my orignial review. As of today I can give this game a thumbs up they have improved all of my complaints and I feel this is truely a game worth the $40. Original review below. But again almost everything has been fixed. At the time of this review I have played over 330 hours on this game. But after everything I still cannot suggest someone (new) purchasing this game. The core concept is what sells this game (and the gene) and by far this is the best of the Battleroyal games out there. That is saying a lot because there are at least 3 other titles it blows away and not much at all since no (AAA) studio has stepped into the frey yet. It is still way to rough around the edges with way to glarying defects to bait someone else into paying money for it.Do I reget the money I spent No. Will I stop playing it no. Does it need substantial work to be a truly finished game Yes Yes Hell Yes.Pro Hands down best BR game out right now. Strikes the right balance between cartoon/arcade (H1Z1) and boring realism (Arma).Responsive Developer.Weekly Updates with more massive monthly updates.Confirmed future updates look very promising.Con Servers are run on potatoes powered by mice on wheels. Seriously they are bad. (Fixed)Vsyn and hitbox issues are huge. Youtube and enjoy the laughts. (Fixed)Hackers are real and you will run into them. Even with BattleEye they are still in game. (Fixed...mostly)Horrible way to report hackers it is no less than a 6 step process and you cannot upload video evidence. (Fixed)Quality of life updates kill cams HC servers weapon balance are all way out of wack but Devs say it will be fix over time. (Mostly Fixed)If you can deal with the horrible servers pathetic Vsync and hitboxes and play a game that heavily favors house camping due to 3rd person view. Than this is the game for you. If you feel the frustration of the BS and the hackers will put you off with all the other issues both large and small and too numerous to rehatch here then buy the game.Once this game leave Alpha (If it ever does.)(Confirmed it will here soon.) It promises to be a very good and enjoyable game. I only hope it polishes out the horribly rough edges before someone like EA steps in and makes a AAA Battleroyal.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I liked this game a lot and it still has potential but it's going to die unless Bluehole can figure out how to prevent the cheaters and hackers. I still play a few games a day but I find myself enjoying it less and less. Those saying the cheating/hacking is not a problem are the ones sick of buying a new copy every time they get banned. If you haven't purchased the game wait until Bluehole elevates their standards.Edit 02/15/18 Hackers/cheaters are still in about 80% of the games I play. I truly do not think PUBG Corp / Bluehole care about securing their environment and giving the players a fair space in which to play. I understand it's not an overnight fix but it has not gotten better since leaving early access anyone who says otherwise is a fool. Hoping Islands of Nyne can prevent cheaters and I can get myself off this hackathon game.Edit 05/28/18 Hackers/Cheaters almost non existent in recent games. Changing review to recommend. There are still some optimization issues that PUBG Corp and Bluehole need to work on but overall the game feels the best since 1.0 launched. Only real issues I have currently are the SMG meta AUG in a crate and a seemingly lack of vehicles. As of now SMG's in particular the UMP will win against any AR with exception of the Groza. Additionally the AUG is still worse than M4 / SCAR skip it if you find it. Finally the extreme changes in safe zone should warrant more vehicle spawns on the map. I can't tell you how many times I drop Prison / Mansion and have to run to military island or Georgie because there are no vehicles along the roads.

review: Firstly let me just say this game is fun or at least it can be fun. Just so we're clear I've never played H1Z1's version of this game but I have watched a good amount of it on twitch so when everyone started hyping over Battlegrounds I thought its probably time to give the game style a go myself. Gameplay wise this is a little dryer a little grittier than H1Z1 but otherwise offer mostly this same game again Playerunkown's third iteration of the same game and that is in where it's biggest faults lie there's very little new offered in this version the map's a little more populated and vehicles a bit more varied though if your big into your character customization then your best sticking to H1Z1 Battlegrounds offers little on that front. Bugs wise its the standard shacky start to any early release game though optimization is worse than a lot of other early access game keep the graphics low and you should be fine. Gameplay wise this game like all its counter parts has difficultly dealing with campers often the game would come down to whomever got the luckiest on getting the best camping spot inside the ever deteriorating circle making it difficult for any players heading into the circle ( just so we're clear I've won using this luck so I'm not being a sore loser) it is however sucking a lot of the gameplay out of what can at times be a great game. The best moments come from battles for the most defensive spots as the player numbers reach there 20s and lower the circle is quite small it becomes a competition for space these moments make the earlier grind worth it. Battlegrounds brings nothing new to genre but it does offer moments of intense fun. If they can add something new points for not camping better circle optimization (better optimization in general) more customization (if you're so inclined) or any number of other ideas then it could be the genre refresh it needs. Those thinking of switching I wouldn't not yet anyway these game are all still in early access though so let's hope they actually use that time to do something differant something new.

review: Great game. Purchased in early access on 11/04/2017. Pros Fantastic shooting element of the game hitboxes feel rewarding and due to blood spatter from bodies when hit you can tell when you hit someone even from long range. Stealth and strategy aspect of this game is really rewarding playing like an idiot will not get you too far. Playing with squads is extremely fun trying to loot as much as you can before the clock ticks down is great then moving into the "war zone" makes it feel like you've prepared for battle. If you make it to around the last 20 things start to get really sweaty dying at this point feels bad but going further feels really exciting! Excellent positive/negative reinforcement.Cons Performance is seriously lack luster at point of writing although the game looks good at low settings my pc ( i7 4790k GTX 970 16GB RAM) should be able to max this game out I feel at 30 40FPS +. Crashed out of the game more than once and lack of being able to rejoin a game you were in is a bit sketchy hope the developers implement that in the future but i can go find a new game instantly so not bad.Wait times at the beginning of the game start are a bit long understandable that this is to let people join though so not a major gripe.7.5/10.

review: I don't play multiplayer games they have never appealed to me however I saw people streaming BATTLEGROUNDS and couldn't escape how much fun it looked even in its Early Access unpolished state. So I took the plunge and it might be the best money I have spent on Steam. I say this even though I am so so bad and rarely get close to winning a round. My Kill/Death ratio is embarrassing.For the uninitiated BATTLEGROUNDS is a Battle Royale game where 100 people jump out of a plane decide where to land loot for gear and then try to kill each other until 1 person duo or team of 4 remains. To keep gameplay moving there are random zones that steadily reduce in size forcing surviving players closer together so they have to engage. Other game modes will arrive in the future My previous limited experience of multiplayer games is waiting around (looking at you GTAV) and then getting killed here you are never 2 minutes away from the next game. My average round time is 14 minutes the longest was 31 minutes reaching the top 3. All this means I can dive into a game anytime I want something that won't last for too long.The map available at the moment is varied and well designed. It is a game that is easy to play but very difficult to master especially when coming from playing against AI opponents but that makes any success so rewarding. I am constantly being killed and keep coming back for more.A week ago I had no idea who PLAYERUNKNOWN is now I do and feel confident he will guide this game onto better things. I can't wait.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Be sure to apply antiperspirant before playing this game due to severe sweating from extreme anxiety and heart pounding thrills. Such moments include running through a field while getting lit up from every direction or taking refuge in a bathroom while a full enemy squad searches your house.Some people say the looting portion of the game is too slow and boring but in reality it really intensifies each match by building up the engagements with other players. Battlegrounds is the most fun game I've played in 2017.

review: Summary A bit glitchy but fun and addictive even if your bad! (like me)8/10This complex battle royale style game is the kind of game that gives you that heart pumping feeling. It's that feeling of I just grinded 20 minutes of getting loot and now im running in an open field try to get to the next circle risking everything. It is extremely tactical with many different aproaches or playstyles camping moving looting killing "snaking" aka crawling and many more. Every gun feels different and the graghics feel great although just looking at them they dont look out standing. The updates are frequent and acctually change a lot. Every update adds some stuff like guns mellee weapons changes to the map and more. Although I have never won a game and have a solo kd of 0.73 I still lovce this game you dont have to be a pro to enjoy it!This game is glitchy. Very glitchy. Some games are totally lagged out and if you have a slow internet connection like me it can be extremely infuriating to be "network lagged" in the middle of a gun fight. Bad servers and being unfriendly to slow internet are prettyy annoying. However sometimes this game makes me soooooo upset. For example you wanl into an unlooted house and you start looting then open one door and get shotgunned by a naked camping in a bathtub. Also vechiles are buggy (haha a vechile in the game is a buggy get it haha) so you frequently die to bull car accidents hwoever mastering the motorcycle can be very satisffying when you pull of some sick jumps. Anyone who enjoys first person shooters and competive games like Call Of Duty or CSGO should definently pick this up on a steam sale! Good Luck on earning those chicken dinners hopefully I can get one myself!

All maps have places where you can get stuck in a moderately sized area and have to wait to be killed by a random the zone or your self.Also a lot of environmental assets across all maps are not properly touching the ground and so you can see under them and through the world.Scummy business practices that Bluehole participates in * Locked loot boxes in a full price game(which they allow you to play hours to earn the ability to buy a key to open)* Paywalled content(see event pass)I love playing this game on the rare occasion that I don't experience bugs crashes disconnects or have the fact that Blueholes decision makers are bad people shoved down my throat yet again.

review: I gotta say I loved this game at the start when I got it. It had great potential to become something fun and competitive like CSGO/Overwatch and actually the performance back then before the 1.0 update was decent sure it had bugs but it was playable and the new map they added was what I've been waiting for after the awful running simulator map (mirmar) which they kept forcing us to play.But the awful performance of the game is crazy stupid it's so clunky it's unbearable I thought of jumping back in once the new map was added but after playing it it's not worth the effort not for the desing (which is actually good btw) but because of the performace. And with the way pubg is going it's not going to change since all they care about is money which is clear from the amount of loot crates/keys and now a season pass which is just like fortnites. After complaining how fortnite copied them now their doing the same thing which is just funny in my opinion they're trying to rival the amount of money they gain compared to fortnite rather than focusing on the performance and drawing in the audience with a good quality game.So to summaries if you are a gamer that cares about getting better at the game and improving your skill I do NOT recommend this game in the slighest as you will definitely be disappointed. However if you play casually for laughs then you won't be much affected since the concept is fun. Personally i've given up on this game as I really don't see them fixing the performance issue at all. But i'm going to keep playing from time to time because you can save a decent amount of steam funds from selling crates so you can buy other games xD (I've basically bought the game back with the amount of i got from selling the crates which were like 2 at the beginning when they first came out but that's over a long period of time)

review: While I only have a few hours on this game at the time of writing this review I already love it. It looks beautiful and feels amazing. It released only a month ago and is already running smoother than H1Z1 is after 2 years. So far there are only a few issues i've noticed. Team chat. There isnt any form of it from what i can tell. i was trying to communicate with my team of randoms during a fire fight only for someone on the other team to say " Y'know we can hear you right?" This is definitely a game that needs private team communication but im sure that will be implemented at some point down the road. Weapon spawns. Sometimes you land and find the best guns armor and equipment. Others you land and are lucky to find a frying pan to defend yourself with. Again im sure this will be adjusted later on but its an issue for now. Lack of optimization. Again this is most likely a temporary issue but if you are on a weak computer or have a failing graphics card expect low frame rate as well as tons of lag. Im really excited to see where this game will go as it continues through development and will hopefully be one of the few Early Access success stories. If you dont have a powerhouse for a computer I would recommend waiting a little while for that game to be optimized to really enjoy it but I definitely recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

The question is when all is said and done will you be eating chicken dinner?

review: Good game great promisses excelent concept!11/4/2017The team behind PUB is the same group that created the famous Battle Royale for ARMA and King of the Kill game mode for H1Z1.The game maintains a certain pattern related to ARMA 3 such as controls weapons and accessories reality and difficulty.The game is extremely competitive fun and creates an impressive adrenaline (especially in the final moments of each game)It can be played solo with duo or squad.PROs Amazing graphics when on the ultra. But the game is still not optimized. Controls of the characters very well developed except the jump. Vests helmets and backpacks categorized by level. Interesting realism. No colorful and flashy clothes No premium or p2w items Steam Market Good length of time for each match (around 40 50 minutes)CONs Game still in early access Impossible to play with higher graphics without suffering with graphics lags Very low ultra vegetation option ends up being anti sports Low diversity of weapons would like to see weapons like G36C high caliber snipers supressed MP5 Tavor among others. The game could be by counting magazines not bullets (personal preference) Jumping is horrible needs urgent improvements Option to wait for the start of the match in a private shooting range or in the middle of that infernal mess. More military and camouflaged clothing.8.5 / 10Let's wait the next few months and see what news and improvements will appear.

Ninety some odd people dropping nearly naked and afraid out of an airplane onto an island filled with guns and machetes and frying pans all out to be the last person alive. Not to mention motorcycles you can die trying to pull stunts on or take out that random fellow you see running along in front of you. There's a certain grace to dying horribly in an attempt to best all of your peers. 10/10 would attack a man with a shotgun with a frying pan again. Better luck next time guy.

review: Played one round managed to stay alive until the last 15 players by scavening a couple buildings outside of the main cities had only encountered one player so far from long distance and managed to kill him. Had to move closer to the final circle encountered a player at like 20m distance frame rate absolutely itself I couldn't aim with 3 fps I died then the game tried to go back to the main menu and it froze.The tension was cool and I also like the beginning how you're flown in by plane and can choose when you want to go out and where you want to go but a game that almost f*cking CTD's when you encounter a player at somewhat closerange only to then have the game freeze when it tries to go back to the main menu? That's not even worth 15 imo and certainly not 30. Quickest refund of my life.

review: Playerunknowns BattlegroundsIn my opinion Battlegrounds the best Battle Royale game released.1)Built on a very flexible engine that is built to handle games of the FPS genre2)Core mechanics of the game are solid and function with little to no bugs (In my experience I've personally only encountered 2 bugs)3)Vehicles that have good physics and good controls to them4)The game in most aspects visually looks great5)Plenty of weaponry (For release)6)Gun mechanics themselves feel very solid and fluid weapons have recoil to them and for me feel "weighted" 7)Nice animations for all weapons currently in game8)The map size in my opinion is perfect. Large enough that you aren't always on top of another player (Unless you purposely land in an area with others) vehicles are useful while also being small enough that generally it's not a painful chore to run somewhere 9)SPECTATOR MODE IN TEAMS (No more sitting staring at a death screen for 20 minutes waiting for your teammates while also making your teammates feel guilty for "leaving you behind" )

review: Being of the player that got bit with a con of a founder access for WarZ (Survival Stories) years go I was a bit apprehensive at buying another game of the same genre. DayZ for me is so buggy and will very likely never be finished... menu arent user friendly which always put me off while WarZ is very arcadish and so many cheaters! I see WarZ as a money grab and still to this day I am convinced the devs are crooks.PUBG has easy controls. No more than 5min and you aree ready to go... games dont last very long so it makes it for a nice experience as even if you die early you jump back in another game. Abundance of wepaons make it so you dont spend hours trying to find ressources. I encountered very few bugs only a few teleports that got me killed when in top 5 last players... Graphics are decent although not amazing but overall it is well worth the asking price as it is right now! AS fun game to play either solo or with friends! )

review: First review I've left on a game. Hopefully this helps other people.For context I mostly play this game with friends not on my own.I've also never played any other Battle Royale game.Context Over.I'm absolutely addicted to this game.It is the most fun I've had playing a game in a long time.It has it's problems a bunch of bugs but usually we just laugh them off and continue. The devs seem to be working on them and regularly push updates. New content comes somewhat regularly new map is coming in the future and new movement mechanics. They post their updates on twitter and Discord (that I know of).The best parts about this game are the very beginning and the very end.There is nothing quite like running around trying to find a gun before your enemies listening for footsteps grouping up with your mates and running train on the enemy.And there is also nothing that will give you the adrenaline rush that the last minute of the game gives you. When you are on the verge of getting a chicken dinner and finally nail that last shot for the win... Nothing like it.

review: This game is awesome. Playing in the final 10 is the most heartpounding experience ever. I haven't gotten that chicken dinner yet but I won't stop playing after I do. The devs are working on this game nonstop. They want this game to be as great as it possibly can. The bugs are being worked on they communicate with the community they're working on better optimization... 10/10. Biggest up coming game for a reason. If you haven't played this you're missing out.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I didn't want to buy this game. I thought it was another group of developers rushing to make a quick buck off of this genre much like H1Z1. But my boss suggested I pick it up and play it with him. So for the sake of my future paychecks I complied.Ho Lee F*** was I wrong about this game. I have had more fun playing this game than anyother game I have in my library. The replayablity factor is where this game really shines. Each game is different and the playzone and how it shrinks is completely random every game. On top of that you are rewarded with points which you can use to purchase loot crates which drop COMPLETELY COSMETIC items for your character. Which is fantastic for not giving an unfair advantage to players.You should be aware this game is remarkably more fun with people to play it with. But it can get remarkably frustrating when you join the matchmaking queues and you get in a squad who either have no mic's or are in a ts together or something. To fix this I would heavily recommend you check out the subreddit for this game and hop on the discord to join squads. It adds so much fun to the game.Anyhow 10/10. I love this freakin game

review: The atmosphere and tension that this game invokes bears the weight of a thousand graveyards embedded in an arctic glacier quite reminiscent actually of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. in a slightly more arcade y and pleasantly fast paced way. Once you get used to the controls which isn't difficult to do you're set for a rogue esque survival of the fittest death race adventure that's different every time you experience it. I was blown away... &lt fade to flashback&gt The rain pitter patters all around you occasionally interrupted by the distant murmuring of thunder in the vast endless grey void of the sky. You are struggling to outrun the ever encroaching exclusion zone after an unsuccessful looting following your boots hitting the ground. Armed with a revolver with only six bullets and four quickdraw mags (but only for assault rifles) your motorcycle helmeted brow pokes over the tire you've madly scurried over to after a sudden "psching THUK!!" caused you to immediately find cover in this otherwise barren field you find yourself in. You frantically glance back and forth at every crevice object scanning the stooping boreal trees towering throughout the fog shrouded mountainous horizon for any glimmer of movement any change of a pixel's color "SCHFEOOOW!!!" 'mosquitoes' loudly a centimeter from your ear THERE! POKING OUT BEHIND A CONCRETE BLOCK!! A GAS MASK AND A MUZZLE FLASH!! But you're not gonna' die hell no screw this guy you couldn't help not being prepared you WILL be the last one standing! In the span of a second you aim down your sight and see a small red cloud where the gas mask was a moment before after firing off your second round. Thrilled by the appearance of a "1" in the top right of your HUD and the adrenaline high you've had bleed into yourself you storm to your attacker's location the iron price has been paid after all and fate has provided you with her favor. There! The box containing your fallen foe's items just a few more feet and "SHTUNK!!" your screen blackens as your corpse pirouettes gracefully into a ditch before being obscured by a large yellow eleven taunting you and beckoning you to try it all again. Yeah I really like this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Despite the recent negative reviews which I personally don't understand this game has provided me with hours upon hours of fun with many more to come. I have yet to even place first in Solo and Squad/Duo yet the META game of trying your hardest is just so addictive I see myself getting many more hours out of this game.As someone who loved DayZ both as a mod and the full title this game was just the best part about the combat in those games that I just cannot get enough of it. If you are a shooter gamer or just like to have very intense moments either with friends or without this game is completely worth the $30 price tag. A lot of the hate that I see about this game has to do with apparently getting banned for stupid reasons. Personally I stream this game yet never once thought that I was getting "Stream Sniped" or killed in unfair ways. So just ignore the string of haters and negative reviews. Bottom line this game is completely worth $30 and will provide hours and hours of fun for you and your friends.9/10 on the Jordan Rating Scale copyright pending.

review: July 27thDo not purchase unless you own a solid state drive otherwise you will be plagued with laggy gameplay and rendering issues. Otherwise its a very fun game but I cannot give it a positive review until these issues are fixed.August 4thThey updated the game same rendering issues which take about 2 5 minutes to resolve when in game to make it playable (every single match). Only now when the rendering is done whenever I enter a building I'll lag completely out. So all in all the last update has made the game even worse.August 11thAnother update they have fixed the rendering issues and lagging out I have now changed my review from negative to positive.August 15thNevermind still laggy to the point that when I join a game I can't even get to play all I see is "Player Unknown's Battleground" in big ing yellow letters on my screen. When I do get to play the game is still plagued by rendering issues which when I try to reload the game by clicking TAB (a one time fix so don't use it to early) often causes me to lag out. I'm changing my review back to negative becuase I realize now that nothing has been fixed. PS Rain servers should be a choice not a random chance.August 27thMy Brother kindly gave me an SSD game runs perfectly now.

review: I originally found Playerunknown battlegrounds fun but its mechanics the looting process and then the inevitable death after a long duration of farming becomes a drag. The game becomes a chore and whilst you play with friends its subtler problems become apparent. The constant frame drops the hackers the lag it all combines into one cluster of disaster. I've not seen much improvement since my purchase and the developers seem only interested in monetizing the game from this point on. Promise after promise has been rescinded I can t recall any that hasn t. It seems despite its obvious flaws Bluehole continues to take the game in the same direction it did with Tera. I do not hold hope for the furture of PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm guilty of buying this game simply because of the hype and the popularity around it. Bluehole and PU have their focus on the superficial t to cater to money whales that don't value where they spend their money. It's been a little over a year since it launched in Early Access which it STILL PLAYS like an Early Access game and the optimization is ing horrible. I have an i3 6100 GTX 1050 Ti 4 GB of VRAM and 8 GB of RAM. It can run Rainbow Six Siege just fine. It can run Overwatch just fine. It can run Fortnite just fine. Anything that I have on my Steam Library besides this game only is the one where I find constant freezing stuttering and map buffering. What I mean by this is that I have to wait for the buildings to load while I'm still free to move around. Netcode is still wonky but I personally haven't ran into that many cheaters as the other reviews claim to.Now that the developers have announced new DLC for this game instead of addressing optimization issues I now know that PUBG does not give a about accessibility only about filling in their pockets in the most easiest " you" way possible.

review: PUBG was a fun experience I think I got my 30 bucks out of it with the 120 hours I've gotten out of it. However notice how I said I paid 30 bucks for it? What that implies is that I'm going to have most of a full game experience maybe I have to earn some things maybe I have some luck to unlock others. Maybe there will be some premium content on top of that I could pay for if I really wanted something that looked cool that I didn't want to randomly roll for (look at most other FTP games). Notice how I just referenced Free to Play Games and the game isn't free to play?So if the game is 30 dollars and it has sold 10s of MILLIONS of copies you think they would focus on making the best game possible? Getting stuff out the door ASAP trying to solidify that player base with new free content stabilizing what is already there? Well kinda. But certainly not as quickly as a company that has made so much money should be able to do. The company prides itself on taking itself seriously why doesn't it take it's content customers or game quality seriously? Seems to focus more on suing competitors and protecting its image...both would be moot if their product was better.Lets compare this to another game such as Vermintide 2 also a modest success (with significantly less copies than PUBG sold). What did they do? They charged 30 dollars and you can have 3 other friends play with you (similar in two ways to PUBG) and have a complete game experience where I get unlocks (still randomly) but I feel fulfilled with the constant draw of rewards that it provides. It also doesn't have ANY OPTION to charge for additional content you just gotta earn it (this is great and I would be fine if they offered short cut costs to get the gear you wanted if it was guaranteed).Most games should have some kind of earned reward feeling to effort (it is a GAME after all) and I sit there after a hard earned win with my buds we appreciate everything we had to do to win but to be honest that kind of feeling can be generated from any amount of hard work....such as building as shed or painting a room in my house. On lost games..there can be some appreciation but I rarely have "fun" with it (and for a game where winning is 1/100 chance this can happen a lot).But at least I can use those hard earned points during the game to unlock something shiny get something for even my loss. Some kind of progression maybe I'll get a cool new pair of shoes YAY! .......ohh wait. even the free boxes mostly require keys to unlock which cost 2.50 a box....so I'm playing a game to earn the right to get random boxes to pay more money to unlock something completely random..which you can also get duplicates of?I will still probably play once in a while because my friends still play it and because I already own it. But for suggestions for people to buy it fresh? I would say you shouldn't buy this game . Definitely Not until the company starts changing their policies and appreciating the one thing that has made them so successful their passionate player base. Right now they are little more than a resource to exploit in the effort to make more money. You will get that from some large companies like EA PUBG is the same thing but at least with EA they (generally ...still mad about Andromeda) give you a polished product that attempts to take your money.If you want to play a game with friends pick up Vermintide 2. Its a good time and requires a bunch of skill for harder levels and if they release paid DLC I would be very inclined to buy it! If you want to play a game like this pick up Fortnite (its better for your wallet generally and you WANT to support them because they appreciate their players). I'm also suggesting Fortnite because of other people's recommendations I have actually never played the game but it is...Free.

review: Finally a game of the Battle Royal concept that is genuinely good. Everything just feels really polished smooth and well balanced (for an early access online multiplayer game). The developers actually seem to listen to the community and act upon request therefrom. Very few bugs and/or glitches and a great balance of anything from spawnrates and itemstats to gamepace (through stuff like the decreasing size of playarea and general size of map in relation to the amount of players) and time to get into a new game.It's satisfying and exciting without ever getting tedeous and only occasionally a bit frustrating but that's only because I'm fairly competitive in games likes these and getting #2 can induce a slight form of frustration eventhough it is only due to my own competences or rather lack thereof..The only major thing I feel like this game needs is better optimization and I feel like that is definitely something that will be addressed in future updates as it is still in early access. I have a 1080ti with a similar level to the rest of my PC specs so I run it on Ultra graphics with an absolute minimum of 60fps however I rarely reach over 100 and feel like that should be the case for a game like this in 2017 (granted the stuff I mentioned above I am fully aware of the game still being in early access and just mention this in case people are wondering if they should get it within the near future).Also the price is less than half of AAA titles which I feel is more than reasonable! Considering the fact that you have come here and read so far into a random review of the game I recommend you try it out for a match or two and if you don't like it you can always return it within 2 hours(?) via Steam for a full refund.9.5/10 from me!

review: **** SEE MY EDIT TO THE REVIEW AT THE BOTTOM ****Barebones and bugs galore BUT MAN IF IT'S NOT THE MOST FUN I'VE HAD IN A LONG TIME I personally hate the Early Access system but this is one of the rare games from it that I'd say is well worth it. Even if the devs stopped development today I'd still have gotten my $30 worth out of it as I've almost sunk 80 hours into it already. The core game loop is fun Start with nothingLootShootDieDo it all again.Sometimes you die right off the bat and sometimes you make it to the top 5 only to get shot from who knows where. But even after getting so close to the end only to die I'm still eager to get right back into another game. Man this reminds me of everything I loved about games like the DayZ mod back when it came out. Feeling vunerable looking for weapons and even after getting fully geared still feeling those "OH CRAP"moments like when you're forced to cross and open field because of the how the next circle fell. So much fun now and so much potential as it develops.(NEW REVIEW)This is by far my most played game in my steam library with well over 500 hours invested. It's still one of the most amazing games I've ever playedBUT.......Wow did they go wrong with their monitization methods. Their business practices are just plain bad. As in bad against your own consumers kinda bad. As in right up there with EA and ACTIVISION kinda bad. It's like a free to play money scam in your full priced game. You play to get Battle Points. Battle points are worthless. You save them up to buy a crate. And that crate that you just saved up for is random. Not only in what item you get out of it random BUT IT MIGHT ALSO BE A LOCKED CRATE THAT YOU HAVE SPEND REAL MONEY ON TO GET A KEY TO EVEN OPEN IT. Nothing like playing all week only to get locked crates or just crates full of duplicates. For a PAID title I personally feel that they should have made an in game store front to BUY EXACTLY WHAT YOU WANT. With the option to also purchase items with real money which would support the devs and give gamers who don't have alot of time to play and save up the Battle Points some cool looking gear. This would be fair to PUBG's gamers and generate some income for the devs. As it stands now though the current system punishes you for not spending more on the game you already paid for as you can get crates that you cannot unlock until you've given them more money. It would be sooooo much more satisfying to save up your battlepoints to buy that super cool weapon skin for your favorite gun. Or get that spiffy new pair of pants you've been wanting. This would have made playing the game all that much more fun because even when you die you're still working towards something that is a reward. Not just random garbage and locked crates. All in all this is still a one of a kind game that is immensely satisfying to play. It's just got a really bad monitization system at the heart of it between rounds / And even though I've played it and gotten my $30 out of it I still feel cheated by their system.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. It s a game. I d honestly give it a neutral response if I could but I think even then I still wouldn t be able to recommend this to anyone. I only ever play it with friends and it s funny because even they don't really like it. It s odd that any of us even own PUBG. I didn t buy the game it was gifted to me. I never had any real interest in it but figured what the hell it s something fun to play right ? I'm truly baffled by the amount of time I ve put into this game considering how mundane it is. I like arena and battle royale style shooters but I just do not care much for this game. It s very bland in my opinion. While PUBG has helped give rise to more battle royale styled clones that will no doubt be far worse than itself I do hope that something good comes out of it. Overall there s better stuff out there to play. If PUBG was homework it d get a C

review: So I got this game about 2 days ago and put 7 hours into the game Anyone talking about price of the game is stupid they are charging full game price for early access that is the risk you take.This is the first time I have played this type of game and half the time i get really annoyed because of team killing you can't assume everyone is a team player. Not all of us can play with friends and not all of us want to play on our own. You need to consider that when you are making a game. You also need to consider regular updates and basic bugs to be fixed. I cant just go back to the lobby and start a new game my game keeps freezing(i have a high end pc) i have to force close the game wait 20 seconds and restarrt. I also have been having a mic issue this is a huge problem because it is the only way to communicate.Look I understand it is early access but it has been on early access for a while and some of these bugs really put me off I would also like you to consider some of these idiots that I have joined a squad with. 2 of them shot me and the other squad member down Why? I have not got a damn clue. why would you want a team of 2 vs 20 x team of 4s espeicially when there is a duel team mode. You need to find a way to fix that maybe some sort of punishment or even banned from a ranked mode. Keep this game going guys I think you have done an amazing job in a market that is becoming more and more competertive but please consider the solo members that want to play in a team and for the love of got team chat would be nice.

I have geforce 940m and i can still play it (of course minimum settings) at 40fps and I have only problem at the start of the game because of my low cpu (buildings are not loading properly) but other than that I can play it with out any problem. I played only 4hours but already killed 5 times and never seen a hacker. And ı was in top 10 three times. We will get more patches and it is just a beta version of the game so why you expect to run it at 100fps and ultra settings? In my opinion game is great and most importantly fun to play even solo.

review: The very first time you open the game and start a match you will survive until it's the last 20 on pure luck of not running into anyone. Then you will think that you are an amazing player. For the next 5 rounds you will die in the very beggining but you will just think of those as a unlucky streak and still think you are an amazing player. After playing the game for a few weeks without getting up to eat or sleep you will start to consider the fact that you might be good. Then you play another game and get your first kill and you begin to believe you're a good player agian. You might want to play with your friends that are good at everything so they can help carry you and your squad but you will take all the credit for helping. This game will take your attributes that make ou human and replace them with desperate attempts to be the last survivor. Overall this game is too easy for an expert player like me but it's always fun to rek some noobs. 10/10 IGN

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a last man standing shooter gameplay. In PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS you have the opportunity to either play in fps or tps. In PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS you'll have to find loot such as weapons and healing stuff all over the map. The map is a huge square at 8km x 8km and the true survivor has the capability of moving around at the map in loads of ways such as swimming running boats driving cars and of course simply just running around. You can either pick the game mode solo duo or a full squad with currently a max of 4 men in a single squad. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is not just a game or another last man standing shooter gameplay no this game Is the BATTLE ROYALE.

review: For the generation that grew up with a cell phone in their hand and never stop fiddling with it. All others need not apply! Seriously the only way to spot enemy movement is to be able to notice a three pixel change on your screen. Just to make that point clear that's .00000144% that changes at which point you know to shoot at it.I have serious respect for people who play this well. They are all getting 20k plus subs on Twitch and they deserve it. For people who grew up with games like Battlefield 1942 I can promise you that you will not enjoy this game.You spend the first ten minutes praying to Steve and the Sound Guy that the rooms will populate the kind of weapons that should give you a decent shot at actually shooting something if you happen to see them. Then you spend the next ten minutes running to a circle that is ever shrinking the playing field. Only if you happen to make it to the thing chances are someone else was already there waiting and they shoot you before you get a chance to learn how to spot anyone. There seriously needs to be a learning curve mode for newb sauce players so as not to make them angry enough to write spiteful reviews. Only as an alpha/beta game that necessary mode is not available yet. Prepare to be frustrated beyond belief for the first twenty hours of game play or thereabouts.My suggestion is wait for them to release the game in a non early access format wherein they may have training available.

review: This is the current top tier king of the hill style experience in my opinion. It beats out H1Z1 and ARK's similar mode and scratches the itch well for solo duo and group survival deathmatch. PU BG carries the large map feel of other survival titles like Day Z or H1Z1 but keeps a solid liquid smooth shooting system with competent controls realistic weapons and attachments and useful but not overpowered vehicles and equipment. A match can last anywhere from 2 or 3 minutes to 25 or so minutes for a given player and once killed you can jump directly into another match no long lines or queues as of yet despite the popularity of this game.It feels great in 3rd person and instantly swaps to first person when you want to aim down a scope or hovers over shoulder for a shouldered/quickly aimed weapon... in a perfect system. Each round is innately fair with no way for a hacky progression or skill system or "unlocks" to cut an edge for another player and it's not uncommon for a player to place top 10 (of 100) in one of their first few rounds... something much more rare in progression enabled shooters or ability based combat games.I am happy with my purchase of this game and wouldn't be offended if very few changes were made as the formula has provided plenty of fun hours of gameplay as is. I look forward to the further development of this game and hope that it enjoys plenty of support and becomes a widely acknowledged e sport.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has promise but in it's current state it is not fun to play. A combination of factors make the experience quite frustrating to play. The gunplay is okay but suffers from some issues relating to colliders and hitboxes. It is all too common to fire 30 bullets out of a window only to discover you've been hitting the wall the entire time. (If you can see down the sight you think that would mean you have a clear shot?)As for the progression I opened 3 cosmetic crates and recieved 3 identical fingerless gloves. I'm not sure why the developers decided to double the crate cost each time... it really does crush the feeling of linear progression.I recommend scaling down the number of players until the netcode can actually support 100 concurrent players. The first 20 players to die experience severe rubberbanding and other lag issues.While the Battle Royale premise is great it still has a long way to go. I recommend saving your money until this game has more polish and addresses the underlying technical issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
