review: Graphics The game has great graphics but it's poorly optimized so you won't be able to enjoy it at 100% (unless you're OK with playing at 40 60fps for me it's not a thing since I'm used to 144hz). Masterpiece Beautiful Good Decent Will do Bad Awful Paint.exe Gameplay Great shooting mechanic but can be considerably clunky when it comes to first person view.Please note that the game is a battle royale meaning that it has a playable area which spawns randomly in the world so it has a certain amount of luck involved. Try not to get addicted Very good Good Nothing special Ehh Bad Just dont Audio Hard to hear any difference when getting shot from your back or front. Considering that this discernment is of great importance so you can properly cover in the middle of the fight I'll have to give the audio a low grade.Besides that the audio is quite good since I could properly distinguish enemys above/below me and it's also very simple to distinguish the distance the bullet was fired. Eargasm Very good Good Decent Not too bad Bad Earrape Audience Kids Teens Adults Everyone PC Requirements You'll need a high end machine to properly run the game with the recommended settings.(Recommended settings to be able to see players much easier and don't confuse your brain with moving pixels because of the low quality). Check if you can run paint Potato Minimum Decent Fast Rich boi Ask NASA if they have a spare computer Difficulity Should be easy to face players if you've already played any FPS game before. But the positioning highly matters in this game so if you haven't played survival games like Infestation or H1Z1 you might have a hard time learning how to do it. Just press a bunch of buttons Easy Significant brain usage Easy to learn / Hard to master Not so easy Difficult Dark Souls Grind Not much to talk about this the marking says by itself. Nothing Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks Isnt necessary to progress A bit grindy sometimes Average grind level Too much grind Insanity Story No story at all. The battle royale PvP thing is the focus. Doesnt have Something isnt nothing I guess Not great Average Good Lovley Will make u cry or smile alot Game Time Play as much as you want then keep playing. Long enough for a cup of tea Short Average Long Depends on u Endless Price Even with all the bugs and stuff I'd say it's a fair price for the experience you'll have. Specially if you play with your friends since some bugs can be a lot funny. Just buy it Worth the price Wait for sale Maybe if u have some spare money left Not recommended Dont throw money into a trash can Bugs The vehicle bugs are the worst and the most common ones. When they finally manage to fix them guess 50% of the game bugs will be gone. Never had any Minor bugs Few bugs Can get annoying Ruining the game The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs

review: Product received for free. S*** GOT FUNNY Added "Leveling" and "Event Pass($10)" Temporary items + couple permanent. Well the way they think it was smart to make is you need to basically play 5 hours a day every day for a month. UPDATE Just don't ing buy the trash game. They are intentionally killing their game.UPDATED NEW 1.0 15 June 2018Battleroyale game by Bluehole studio/PUBG corp etc.You either drop hot or don't you have to arm yourself to the teeth and survive.Last wo/man alive wins the chicken dinner what ever that means...That's pretty much the jist of it.When my friend gifted me this game we played it absolute s*** ton. I also played it alone with randoms a lot(I mean 660+hours).There were quite a few bugs and things that annoyed me but the fun was overpowering all of those things even cheaters and team killers. PAST (please stay there...) The recent patch/es with the weapon nerfs buffs fixes and the 'new' HRTF audio and all the things they've done/are doing with their servers and the awful anticheat just made the game so much worse that I'm afraid I'm not playing the game much or at all anymore. NEW The game got a patch that reverted some stuff and fixed other. Like having a feature where you can now enable/disable HRTF which was a massive upgrade already so now it's "far more playable". Hit registering seems also have been tinkered with to the better. But still having crazy FPS and server lag problems Ratings 1 10Graphics 5 (only if the assets were used properly)Audio NEW 4Gameplay 4 (You'll find your own play style pretty fast. Improved due to audio)Control 4 (before patches 7)Story 1 what story?Content 3 (in a form of lootboxes which you can buy with in game currency most of the boxes you get require a key that costs 2.50usd)Music 1 (after couple hours into playing I muted the lobby music so I guess technically 1 but it's not the worst music in a game)Mean rating NEW 4/10Personal overall rating NEW 1.0 1/10 Its straight up gameIf you are planning on purchasing the game and don't like it remember you can always ask for refund from the steam help page.TL DR Had 90 hrs played last two weeks. Game gets awful "balance/improvement" patches. Have 29.7hrs played last two weeks and going down. "How about optimization?" "Let's leave it to the players" "$$$" NEW Fixed s*** better to play but still lots problems NEW 1.0 HOLY THERE'S A LOT OF CHEATERS THE And they are taking off good features in the future so. GG RIP IN PEPPERONII don't even anymore.Played on GPU GTX 1070 8gb (for 3ish months used to have GTX 660 3gb)CPU i5 4460 RAM 16gb (used to have 8gb)Game on SSD
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUGB Simply put bad/good BAD Has lots of bugs/glitchesHas servers that aren't the best (better then ubisoft)Good Has so of the best game play of its typeHas a nice variety of weapons (which is expanding)Has a nice variety of vehicles (which is being added too)Has a massive map with varying end game locationHas little/no cheaters (as yet)Has a game that looks good and will work on some completely crap systems (like mine at work) I ve had the game a few weeks this game is addictive. From the first time I jumped out of the plane to the last when you jump you hope that there isn t going to be 99 other people all aiming for that little town you ve seen If you do you hope to god (if you believe in him/her/them/it) that if this happens you re the first to find a gun. If you survive the first 5 10 minutes then the pressure is on. I can feel the tension mounting as I check the number of players left *51* players left. Check the map find a nice place to wait it out (AKA CAMP) check ammo/guns/attachments sh*t need a better scope &gt step out of hidey hole &gt headshot &gt dead. RAGES F*&amp KING CAMPER! start all over.When playing co op/4 man it s even worse for me I get so focus on what I m doing I forget there are other people in my team the number of times I ve *accidently* shot one of my friends because I ve just seen a body moving and POW they are dead. Then having to revive them whilst all the time getting abused over comm s or worse looking in a direction then someone shouts something out and I myself because they ve made me jump.The game is intense fun and worthy of purchasing (even in pre release)

review: Let's just get riggggghttt intoooo the news.....I mean let's just get right into it.Pros (Compared to its current competitor)1) Better Graphics.2) Way better and satisfying gunplay.3) Better Visuals and animations.4) You can choose where you wanna be in the map instead of just spawning randomly. (That is the plane takes you from point A to point B without any turns so you're still free to decide where you wanna be at in between those points)5)Vehicle Handling is far superior to that of its competitor.Overall gameplay is very satisfying than that of its competitor.Cons 1) Optimization is just as neutral as its competitors...However unlike its competitors the devs have already revealed that there will be an optimization patch at april 14th which should allow the game to use your gpus full potential and hence give you the best experience.

review: I m going to be honest from the outset here I m not very good at PU s Battlegrounds. Being new to the Battle Royale genre combined with my ability to miss a shot on a target even if they re basically standing still is not a good mix. The sheer joy and satisfaction that comes with being an unstoppable killing machine with endless victories (Or indeed any victory at all) Well it s kind of lost on me. You see Battlegrounds is a pretty heartless and vindictive game. You can spend a good 20 minutes of a match scavenging for supplies and formulating a battle plan only to suddenly drop over dead from a single shot from a player you never ever saw. It s a title that s slow and methodical punishing your mistakes without mercy if you re looking for instant gratification or non stop action therefore it s safe to say this really isn t the game for you. Sudden death is something you just have to rapidly get used to in this world and when such deaths happen over multiple games and believe me they will especially when you first start out there will be moments where you really begin to ask the question as to why you re wasting large chunks of time on something that always leads to the same disheartening result. Yet as much as such things can drag the fun levels down a fair bit in many ways they work in the game s favour so much more. The knowledge that death is always nearby laces everything you do with an incredible sense of tension leading you to question all you see and do Is that house you re about to wander into actually occupied? Where were these shots coming from? Was that movement in the trees? So it goes on and as the play area closes in and the remaining survivors are forced together the tension only mounts even further. It s honestly draining to play at points simply because you re so alert to everything that s going on all the time it s an intense experience. Additionally the difficulties that come with surviving only make the kills you achieve feel so much sweeter. There s a sense with every kill that it s an achievement that your strategy and skill have paid off with noticeable reward. It also says something when the details of each kill remain etched in your brain for a long while after they ve occurred. I myself distinctly remember the guy I patiently observed through a window for an eternity before finally making my move or the one where a recently acquired shotgun proved highly effective mere seconds after I ve obtained it. Every player will doubtless have their own moments to share around the water cooler their own little victories and it s these moments that make the struggle beforehand all worthwhile. Group play is also available and this itself changes things up in new and exciting ways. Gather a team of your friends or just grab a bunch of willing volunteers and you ll instantly generate a sense of camaraderie each of you well aware that teamwork is the only way you re ever going to get out alive. It mixes up the gameplay dynamics quite thoroughly as well alone one person might be easy to take out. Team them up with three others however and the decision as to whether to engage becomes a difficult one... Can you really kill everyone? This can lead to tense standoffs each team knowing the other is there but holding tight and waiting for the right moment to finally start all out warfare. It s another thrilling layer of depth. Of course there s a great big elephant in the room yet to be discussed and that is the moniker of early access and all the baggage that term carries with it. Personally I ve been fortunate enough not to come across too many problems but by no means have I escaped. My main issue has been with lag and server connection issues the most noticeable example seeing me running alongside my squad on my screen only for them to suddenly question a minute or so later as to why I d ran out into the middle of the ocean and started swimming in circles. I ve seen a couple of gameplay crashes and freezes as well but they ve been in the minority for the most part my time on the battlegrounds has been a smooth one. It s difficult to saw however how exactly the experience might pan out for you. Take a look around other reviews or just the internet in general and you ll find hundreds of different difficulties and frustrations for every player out there. You may pick up the game and never see anything go awry you might start playing and see every attempt to find a stable match just become a sheer pit of misery. Put simply caution is advised. Updates should quell some of the pain in the future but a healthy dose of scepticism as to their effectiveness and frequency has to be adopted there s simply no way of telling yet how things will pan out in the future. In the end though there s plenty here that may annoy but when things get into high gear and everything starts going you way there s nothing out there that can match the experience that is on offer here. If this sounds like your sort of game and early access doesn t scare you off... Well see you on the Battlegrounds.

review: Really good game.However i'm going to make a list of bugs and issues that will be fixed in the future if not they should be so if the developers at bluehole are reading this pay attention.Bugs and issues 1. "The infinite fall" the reason why i have named a bug/issues this it's because when you or your character falls off small objects you will actually continue to fall and get stuck in the position of falling.2. HITBOXES... hitboxes are too big way to big... they are HUGE. You can tell this when getting shot through tiny hills and barracks when you can clearly see that you're not visible to the person you're shooting at.3. The UMP has a broken hit registration also the damage of it should be increased because its really weak weaker than a pistol if you will.4. General optimization issues that basically every new game has.5. This has bugged me for the past week but how SLOW does it take to pickup loot open doors and even get in and out of vechiles. I first concluded that it might of been just lag from playing on AS servers but once OC came out it was still SLOW. 6. There are already hacks for this game which is really sad i've been killed many times by people using ESP or wallhacks and they must be feel really embarrassed when playing.Overall not too bad considering it's in its early developing stage.Glad this game is killing H1Z1 the developers of H1 should now learn not to waste their times with skins.Keep up the good work BlueholeRecommend/10#KillH1Z1

review: I love this game. Overall I love most of the things about this game and I look forward to every future update when new content comes out or balancing occurs. The idea of new maps and gameplay changes make this game worthwhile on surviving through. I also hate this game. Lots of issues run rampant and the fixes are sometimes a bit late though understandable due to the amount of servers needed for a game with over a million concurrent players. Just alot of small things that can add up to some really crappy experiences for alot of players. the Chinese. I get team killed by them often enough that I want to stop playing this game and I can't defend myself because then I'd be reported for Team Killing and get banned. Seriously the comments saying Region Lock China? I finally have tipped over on to their side. I've gotten to the point where I hear a person speaking Chinese (I'm Vietnamese myself so I'm not being biased towards Asians) that I just want to leave because I don't trust them as a teammate. It's not all of them it's just enough of them causing trouble that I don't want them ruining my game as I slay bodies for the glorious Chicken Dinner. I'd say this game is a solid 4/5. It fluctuates a bit for me between 3/5 and 4.5/5 but It'll never get a solid 5/5 due to alot of small issues I have.Oh and don't get me started on those stupid crates.

review: After over 250 hours sunk into PUBG my review of this game must change. PUBG is a game that suffers from an identity crisis a big one. The crisis isn't that it isn't sure what it wants to be but doesn't know how to be it. It wants to be the best Battle Royale on the market and that's a fair goal... But its developers don't know how to do it or just don't care to do it correctly.This long after the release the game should be well optimized more content and very few cheaters. None of these ring true for PUB as optimization is still just OK content is drip fed and usually not very substantial and cheaters are everywhere. On top of that predatory monetization schemes just keep getting introduced instead of actually improving the game. The final nail in the coffin though is how they treat their competition. To be frank BlueHole is petty and isn't afraid to swing their ever increasingly small around. While they renigged their lawsuit against Epic Games the fact that they still filed it in the first place speaks volumes about how petty they are. The suit was over stealing copyrighted material and gameplay mechanics. The irony? Bluehole's ripped off Fortnite's Battle Pass concept quite blatently but worse... Because they're positively pathetic at this point.Don't support Bluehole because they won't support you. How the mighty have fallen.

review: The game itself it pretty damn awesome but there are several issues because it is a early acess. I have actually never felt any issues myself because of I started playing it a little late or of another reason. There is just one thing I want them to fix and that is V Sync. I have a G Sync monitor and it s still a little wavy.The game is just like H1Z1 but the only difference is that H1Z1 is a little bit tactically or strategic and PlayersUnknown s BattleGrounds is more realistic. I am running PUBG on low/med graphics and it s still looks amazing. I am playing on a Msi Gt72 laptop with a 980m graphics card with 4 gb VRAM and Intel core 4720K and my pc can handle many advanced games with high quality so you need a pretty damn computer to run this game smoothly and with best performance. The game is based on surviving and have a few things equal to The Hungergames. It s based on the same reason on how they play but PUBG has guns wich HG didn t have. Is it worth it? YES!!! The game doesn t even cost much either and when you buy it you can get your money back if you don t like it and can refund it from steam after owning the game more than 14 days and have played the game less 3 hours so it should be 2/ 2 and 59 minutes to try the game.

review: Now I've gotta say for an early access game that has been out for 2 and a half weeks this game has less bugs than most games at their 1 year anniversary. You can tell how thoughtfull and well made it is from the sheer amount of features that it has while still maintaining full playability. Since a lot of people compare this game to H1Z1 KOTK as someone who's played and enjoyed both lets compare the two. H1Z1 PUBG as COD BattlefieldWhile both are similar in a lot of ways PUGBis undeniably more filled with features and has more realistic features than H1.Think of it like this game is a median between Arma and KOTK. It took the principle and basics of KOTK and the design choices of Arma to make a more hardcore and realistic BR game. (not to say that realism is exactly better)The reason the game feels so good to play is how polished it feels over most games that have been out for long periods of time. Instead of 3 guns that are viable to have in your hotbar there are 10+. Instead of a couple armor and helmet choices there are 9. Instead of lots of major bugs crashes etc. there are near to none.The only big problem with the game right now is the optimization. Luckilly this is said by the devs to be their top priority right now so that should be fixed in the near feature.

review: I don't have a whole lot of hours on BGs but I have quite a lot in h1z1 battle royale back before it split into "king of the kill " so I have quite the exposure to this kind of game. First and foremost BGs is a HUGE improvement over h1z1's Battle Royale. There are more weapons weapon customization and the clothing/attire looks way cooler. (none of that colorful t people wore in H1Z1) except I have to admit the pants in BGs does look a bit too..."hipster ish"The map is much more detailed and offers a wide variety of interior/exterior designs so buildings don't feel repetitive. The sound effects are probably the best part of the game. Every gun has a great sound effect that feels satisfying when you shoot even the pistols feel quite powerful and intimidating. BGs seem slower than h1z1 in the sense there's more room to be "tactical." I don't feel very rushed as I did in h1z1 which is great because I like games that allow for slower paced tactical strategies rather than constant holding shift and run n gun type crap. Being early access the game does suffer a bit from stability and optimization issues but I still feel this game is much more put together and more improved on h1z1's Battle Royale. The price is a bit steep I'd say $20 seems like a more fair deal imo but an extra $10 was a safe bargain since it turned out better than I expected. In the long run this game is a great buy it's fun engaging easy to get in and out of and still offers enough slow paced/tactical gameplay which I prefer. Overall I give it an 8.5/10 mostly because of the fact that it definitely scratches that "battle royale" itch a lot better than h1z1 did however the $30 pricetag might be a bit on the steep side considering early access/server stability/optimization issues but these are likely to be fixed soon.If you like h1z1 battle royale at all or are looking for a battle royale experience get Battlegrounds it's definitely a lot of fun.

review: I was so hype on this game when my younger brother first showed it to me the only issue was that the game wasn't super smooth and felt a bit clunky when I pointed it out my brother said "it's in early access they'll fix it". That was over an entire year ago. So of course I bought the game in early access thinking that it would be awesome to support the company. Guess that was a mistake because I just uninstalled the game after the recent news that before they could invest their time or millions of dollars of revenue from this game into fixing it or making it better they decided to add a new map and the best part? They also launched an paid "event pass" to unlock new cosmetics because the thousands of dollars worth of crate keys people were purchasing apparently wasn't cutting it. Sorry PUBG I really gave you the benefit of the doubt much longer than a lot of my friends.P.S. I hope your player count continues to drop. Fix your game.

review: Product received for free. There's plenty of positive recommendations here but I just wanted to add my little review. This is for people like me who hated DayZ and didn't touch anything that even remotely resembled it. bait and switch barely functional early action survival shooters. The highlight clips of those games always made them look much better than they were. In my opinion of course many people have enjoyed those games and I don't mean to take that away. If you're like me and you detest this genre I just want to say that if you're on the fence you should just buy this game. Try it. It actually delivers. It has flaws but they're reasonable and do not break the games ability to deliver the experience it is advertising.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After playing for 24 hours since launch I can definitely tell this game is wasted potential. The first day everything was perfect loot rate where the plane dropped you etc was balanced fine. Now the circle will kill you in seconds if you take a single fight promoting hiding as a means to win. I looted an entire 5 building town and found only pants and fingerless gloves had a bombing zone spawn on me 3 times in a row so I couldn't leave to run for the new zone safely. The connection on the game is poor randomly I shot a player 30 times fully automatic he shot me 30 times and I died but he was barely scratched not to mention I shot first and got 10 rounds in before he even shot. The constant getting shot behind cover like trees and walls when you were in cover for 1 second but the game doesn't care. This is the biggest disappointment of 2017 thus far. If I could I'd refund it at this point.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: you're better off playing the mod still. It's got more to do and more maps to play on. Battlegrounds is a fad that got out of hand and gives players little actual incentive to play the game aside from the player themselves wanting to play it. I've in my 200ish hours played this game of my own choice. Every single hour that i've put in this game has been with friends who asked me to play. I've never played a single match playing solo (or matching with random peoplle) It's not worth the time you put in. No reward for winning aside from some mild satisfaction and in game currency that goes to cosmetics only but it also doesn't provide you with a consistent amount of the currency to make grinding out for customizations worth it.and since they've implemented the steam marketplace into the cosmetics system the boxes you can get with the in game currency aren't worth grinding for since the better items are in cases you have to purchase like CSGO crates.The games popularity has done nothing but inflate the developers ego to the point where they're now squeezing the player base for everything they can despite having the most popular game on steam.They promise things months in advance with no real talks with the community about how or when these things will be implemented into the game and in all honesty they've become one of the worst companies in the gaming industry simply due to their overmassive egos.Don't waste your money on this game go get fortnite.Fortnites gameplay is more concentrated and more accessible. The game runs better and gives players more feedback on what they should be picking up when they come across items.Fortnite is objectively a better game and i'm most upset by the fact that i didn't return this game when i purchased it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is honestly the funnest game I have ever played!!! It is very cool how you can drive around the map killing in pretty much any way. You can snipe people from across the map which is very cool! You can use grenades shotguns assualt rifles snipers molatovs and much more! There is a void keeping you going in! You can have car chases with guns and racing acroos the map in danger of being the fittest. It is sort of like the Hunger Games in a way with the loot boxes and Survival of the Fittest. Very detailed graphics and is just all around an awesome game. It is very tense and you have to play smart. Like is said it is the funnest game I've played! It is well worth the money! BUT REMEMBER THIS IS NOT JUST A GAME THIS IS BATTLE ROYALE

review: Product received for free. I had quit this game about five months ago. The novelty had worn off for me. I had won some chicken dinners and lost interest in spending twenty minutes mashing F and then pitching a tent until the last few people remain. The only joy I found was in the Dacia sliding around corners and racking up high kill games by ploughing through crowds of geared tryhards. Eventually I lost interest in this as well. The new car physics at the time didn't help either as vehicles became mudane and stale for the players who valued going prone in a bush more than bouncing sideways through a field. I had to take a break.Fast forward to December and the pickup truck is released on the test server. It felt light and nimble but not unlike a truck. It slid around corners like a manual S14 and sped through the desert with the grace of a rocket powered helium elephant. It was everything I had hoped for in PUBG. A reason to come back. A few days of roadkill and motorized joy later Brendan hammered the final nail into this game's coffin for me. A small update launched on the test server making the truck steer like a crippled cruise ship and have equal weight to that of a neutron star. Sure it was technically faster but it didn't feel faster. It felt just like the majority of other cars in the game slow unresponsive and mundane. It felt as if it was merely a means for transportation. My primary weapon had little more than a vessel for full geared people to travel closer to the inner circle. And with that micro patch that stealth change that 90% of the playerbase will never notice I have put this game back onto its metaphorical shelf until the next vehicle content is released.

review: Well I'm seriously impressed. I always liked the idea of King of the Kill but I know how H1Z1 started and I refuse to give those devs my money. But this is that concept done correctly. I have owned it for 3 days now and it is already in my top 5 most played games. I hate Early Access games I'm weary of Early Access games but this is the most promising example of Early access I've seen in a long time.Servers are strong gameplay is well tuned sound is great animations are good. I honestly can't think of a real negative that isn't just a suggestion for later on in development. This will be my most played game within two weeks. I'm sure of it.

review: Great fun can be had here. We all know the game is early access and that means you deal with the issues that come along with it. As far as my experence goes I have had a few issues with it being buggy. You get stuck in tight areas or on obstacles occasionally. Typacal server lag but honestly it hasn't been all that bad. For playing on Ultra settings I did expect more but I'm confident this will change as time passes.My biggest issue First off I have to say this because it's an issues with me. Games these days with the Pre release early access deal is crazy to me. If the game is a alpha beta whatever that's fine but trying to make money off a product that is not complete rubs me the wrong way. I get it this is the way games seem to go these days but personally its a $15 game (IF) it's to be released in this format. $30 is high to me. Maybe I'm wrong its just my opinion. I would say the same for a AAA title being droped as well. Again this is only my own issues with company's these days and doesn't reflect on this games playability or performance.Jumping in this game is ATROCIOUS! Edging and generally maneuvering over objects is a pain the the A$$. It can be the end of the match for you if you are not extreamly carful. I'm sure this will be adressed as updates contune to drop and its not a deal breaker just annoying.Framerates are up and down but never unplayable (for me atleast). I'm usually in the 60's.Plenty to do (for the moment) to keep you busy and screaming wondering where you got shot from!I would like to see more weapons in the game and interesting ways to kill. Maybe being able to setup traps with the environment or somthing would be fun or deployable traps to snag players chasing you.I think this is a fun game and with friends it makes the replay value high.My setup i7 6700k stock 4.0 clockAsus Progaming Z170GTX 1080Windows 10 Regular 7200 rpm HDD

review: Despite the fact that game is buggy (for now) I recommend it! The biggest problem I've had is with the video settings causing rendering glitches. I'm sure other people have had the same (or different) problems. Glad to know though that the developer has a lot planned for this game!I would say its a functional title now even at 30 dollars its worth a try for the fun. The added on content will be a great bonus to this!EDIT Post early access edit 5/3/18. I would just like to state briefly that the pacing of this game is awful. Loot ten minutes and get headshot from 200m with an M16 a tale as old as time. Over and over and over. Then watch killcams and see that the guy gets nothing but headshots even on people who have JUST started to peek around corners. Very frustrating game would not recommend due to the grating pacing.

review: Honest Review This is a BR game as everybody knows. Queue to start a game is 1 second. The Gunplay of this game is something that kept me come back even if I didnt like FPS. There is bullet drop bullet velocity that makes it challenge and rewarding to hit people in some hard situation.So from here we can say that the skillcap is kind of high but still isnt necessary to be the best at shooting in order to play this game and this was another thing that kept me coming.At start I would hide more and still I was able to achieve some win this made me continue playing till I decided to start go in the middle of every fight and learn how to shoot better.The game is playable from single player to 4 players in team. There is some bug here and there nothing really gamebreaking.Now since this is an FPS ONLINE it is important to understand the server situation which is not bad at all but the problem is something related with the Unreal Engine which means that every time a new game start and there is 100 people the THICKRATE of the server could be something like 10!The Thickrate is that thing that make you feel like somebody has shoot you while you were already behind a corner for example.During the game while people die the thickrate will raise according to the number of player remaning. So let's say the game is really playable when there is 50 people alive. I mean isnt like you cannot play it before but the server is just less reliable in some situation.So is PUBG a game to buy?In my humble opinion it is but is important that you understand that in order to learn this game is required several hours of playing I'm at 500hrs atm and still I know that I can improve a lot more. I never played seriously an fps game before so at start it was really hard for me with my very low shooting skill. About cheaters well I used to play in EU server and before happens to me sometimes but in 500hrs I could count it in my hands. Now instead blueball developed some anticheat stuff and is working cause isnt happening to me anymore.About future development and patch the game is pretty match always updated with patch and fixes I saw it just improved during the time maybe slower than I would but it shouldnt be easy task to manage a game with so many users playing it.I whish you a lot of chicken dinners!

review: "Get to the MILITARY!" I'm on a plane there are people around me they speak weird some are familiar some not so much I'm falling from the sky my parashoot its saved me. I've gone far from the others I begin to loot I find a pistol I'm ready over there I'm running look a car! I must travel to middle I'm rushing and I hear gunfire. Over the hills I see a firefight I begin to sweat and question my path I push down the pedal I'm going fast birds scatter I run one gunman down absolute euphoria. The other begins to shoot at me "dink" "dink" as bullets bounce of my car I'm hit a fleshwound I circle him gather some distance He sees me and I see him. I can do it I'm fast I begin to accelerate my car breaks 100kmph he's a statue in the distance. I fly across the landscape towards his position he's very still. The gap begins to close bullets of other gunmen from the hills begin to whistle past my car I'm close very close meters away. He shoots muzzle flash echo. I wake up ........."Jump now! Military!" this loop when will it end.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So this game is very fun (minus the begining when people just yell in their mics /) but it has its fair share of bugs and plenty of crashes. I kind gent told me it was just a drefragment error defraged my hard drive but crashes are persistant may hardwear should be able to run it but I think that's the problem (AMD support?). The second you start this game they tell you its in development and they will update and optimize monthly I've played early access games may times before and its all on the devs to make their promises true. This game seems to be on the right track currently but in its current state its very hard to play (eg I was in the middle of a game with 30/100 people alive and oh crashed. You always get the option to send in in a report and I do everytime). I still recommend people pick it up for later update if you wait your still not missing out on much. B

review: Great Game and concept!! but the serious lag is killing me figuratively and literally!!! I know the DEV's are working on it but holy cow the first few minutes which are crucial i either cant go in a building because it looks like a tent and hasn't loaded yet or i'm walking into walls as a result of the lag then bang i'm dead because i didn't either see the other guy who came in the room and or i couldn't pick up a weapon due to the above mentioned. The couple of match's played in duos and squad are great!!! The people i've played with on my team have been awesome in explaiining thigs i didn't know yet so thats been great!! will prob only play duos or squad going forward as it results in a better game play IMO and eventually when i get a few buds playing that will be great as well. Looking forward to the next patches and the LAG issue being fixed might give it a break untill these get sorted out like i'm sure a lot of other people.

review: I really want to like this game. I really do but it's just not good. At over 100 hours on PC and 500+ on Xbox it's just not worth the money. The game had so much potential but the developers keep finding new ways to screw it up worse than it already was prior to their updates. I gave this game so many chances. I paid $30 dollars for your poorly optimized buggy game and then instead of fixing it your new updates make it worse. The netcode is absolute trash. On my screen I shoot a guy in the face 10 times and on server side he won't take damage. The countless bugs can be annoying or game breaking making you lose to something that isn't your fault. Instead of fixing their netcode separating players based off of good ping and developing a structured game Bluehole does the opposite. Their "Fix PUBG" campaign is worthless and seems to be creating more problems than actually mediating the preexisting ones. I really wanted this to be a good game I was a huge fan for the longest time but it's just not good. COD BO4 and BFV will most likely blow this game out of the water. Stop with the cash grabbing and actually listen to those that are giving you honest feedback. This is not a AAA title and never will be IMHO. Spend your money elsewhere!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fantastic game! No babies ultimates or tracking rockets. No pressing the button to blow up the screen. You want a kill... you better use gameplay skill.Game reminds me a bit of Socom 2's gunplay and 3rd person gameplay. Great game devs. Love it. Please keep up the good work.*Edit*I'm getting pretty close to throwing in the towel on this game. I'm extremely fed up with campers who are so lacking in skill they will sit in a house refusing to move an inch until you walk into their gun reticle. This is a royal pain in the with 3rd person. Nothing much they can do about it. Pansies need to go back to Overwatch baby game. I am also sick of shooting people and it just doesn't work some games. I am assuming it is lag related. Sometimes guns work and sometimes they don't even register a hit.Update 2Now switched to thumbs down. Every game ends with me checking my shadowplay footage and watching as I rail into people and get blood splashes and just insta die when they turn around and press the button. No idea why this constantly happens and no longer care. Netcode and server issues should be #1 on their priorites and no one should even own this game yet if this is how it "works". Will revisit maybe on actual release.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After I was refunded someone else purchased the game for me and said "Just give squads a shot..." and I did. It changed my entire opinion of the game. Granted most of my former review stands there's nothing overly innovative about this title but the squad gameplay is much more fun.I can't give testament to the random match squads or the community though. I can tell you that it's a game like Call of Duty when it comes to mics. The game has open microphones (that you can change in the setting) for everyone in the starting area (lobby) and the plane before the drop. If someone wants to be heard they can be. That being said my settings have been changed to where I can only hear my squad since day 1. I don't feel like ear contributes anything to this game. There are kids that feel it necessary to scream or make obnoxious noises. It's the internet.Off my soap box tl dr Squad queues are what made me give this game a chance. It's something that's been there since day one I just didn't partake. PREVIOUS THUMBS DOWN REVIEW There's nothing innovative about this game. It's basically the Arma version pushed into Unreal Engine and given a leaderboard. As for the videos of ghillied snipers with a full loadout you have to have the best luck in the world for that. You're lucky to find an optic at all let alone a decent one. And if you find an optic you probably won't find a weapon suitable. It's the nature of the beast. You don't get an hour to go loot around before starting a fight. This isn't a sandbox survival game.And when I say Arma version I mean they took the choppiness and everything of Arma pre 64x Release and put it in Unreal Engine. I experienced frame drops with a 4.84GHz processor and GTX 970. Arma runs smoother for me than this.As for looting it's not super intuitive. I only played two rounds. Of those two rounds I probably spent half the game looking for a yellow sheen on things I could pick up. Then I had to find the perfect angle to be able to interact with it. And when you're looting something such as a supply crate there's no "Oh crap" button that lets you instantly control your character again. I don't know what "balancing" issues dev's think there is with that but if you can drop what you're doing in real life in an instant I don't see why making a half second delay is important. Edited for a more thorough opinion.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was going to buy Dayz standalone but went for this instead. So glad that i did. Although I'm only about 12 hours into the game i can get enough of it. Great balance between being too long and too short matches. The initial rush to find a gun before you encounter someone makes it all the more intense. Usually by the time you find a few bits its time to set a course of travel as the zones are begining to get smaller. This change of zones along with the red zone (airstrike zone) ensures players arn't all waiting for each other to make a move in a long drawn out AFK fest. It forces players to keep moving and in most cases have to plan ahead and think about cover from point A to B. Overall great game and considering its only just been released and theres a lot more updates and optimisation to come i can say you will have a blast. Specs for comparison.i5 6600rx480 4gb8gb ramgetting 55 74 FPS on High settings. most of the time in low 60's(Note that if you are worried about running this game they are in the process of making this game more optimised so i should run a little smoother for you)

review: After 1.0 the game completely tanked. The in game purchases were completely unnecesary to the games longevity and functionality. They decided they just wanted more money at the expense of rewarding their faithful players. Still has a decent player base but honestly don't buy this. You shouldn't reward bad practice. They took what could've been amazing and decided to let it all go to Optimization is STILL questionable. Hackers are STILL in the game. Loot boxes are STILL being pumped out despite these problems. And the developers are STILL not adding anything to the game that makes players WANT to keep playing. As funny as the statement sounds the only reason to keep playing is if you're having fun with it. Power to you if that's the case. But frankly it seems awfully unfair to the many who have poured hours into this game and only be rewarded with a lootbox system that gives you a chance to PAY to open it.If you REALLY want to play this game sure buy it. But I would honestly and whole heartedly direct you to other alternatives. Yes even Fortnite. The game isn't bad to be honest. But it has bad practices which we shouldn't reward. Don't buy into these developers not until they get their act together.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After I played this game once or twice I didn't think it would honestly keep my attention very long. But I gave it another go and I really really enjoy this game. It kind of forces you to play as though you were actually on an island in a mass game of manhunt. You have to always assume some is behind a door in a house or watching you. It forces you to work tactically and is honestly a lot of fun. I really enjoyed DayZ but that has just turned into a kill on sight game anyway. I think the optimizations are pretty good at this point (I'm a software engineer) especially for early access. I have a pretty good gaming setup but nothing fantastical. Therefore I think a large percentage of you Steam folk have setups that can handle this game easily. I play it on the 'High' settings and am pretty sure I could get away with "Ultra" if I wanted to. The only 'Con' is that on the odd occasion a server 'drops' but that's somewhat rare and is obviously only going to improve!I'd definitely recommend you pickup this game and give it a try at least for 5 rounds. It's very fun and I don't think you'd regret getting it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG Pros and Cons Pros No more guns on spawn island which is completely worth a 1.1gb updateCons The mcdonalds minecraft server you guys rent for $1.50 per month is rubbish Game hilariously crashes so often but only asks if you'd like to file a crash report if you alt + f4 RNG is the worst selling point to have. "You'll most likely get rekt by other players if the RNG decides there should be nothing but shotguns in every building for a 3km radius" The further into patches we get the more insanely broken the game gets but the devs dont care because the crates are rolling in dosh You'll see the "Servers are busy at the moment... Try again later" more often than you'll see the main menu The game strongly favours whoever doesnt have to move for the next circle. If you manage to get good circle spawns your chance of winning increases by about 200% Everything is still broken Hit three times in the head with an M4 no helmet survives downs me and my lvl 2 helmet in two Sometimes without warning your gun will dissappear and switch to single shot enjoy that fun moment in CQC Grass renders in at about 5 meters Everything else renders in at about 10 50% of the sounds have been disabled (footsteps vehicle noises GUNSHOTS) Anti cheat is hilariously sh!t hope you like dying to hackers Chinese hackers rule all servers but their own region lock china The hitreg is off Sometimes the parachute negates to disappear on landing causing you to get stuck in the air and allow people to easily take aim and get a free kill Game devs promised us no ingame paid for items until game fully releases releases crates mid beta. Very trustworthy devs and shouldve been my first warning to immediately refund the game 35 minutes matchmaking for OCE servers. Lovely Sometimes the gun jams idfk it just doesnt fire half the time The bugs outrule any chance of actually having fun Greenlights spawned better garbage than this When aiming from the hip you have the accuracy of a person with a broken wrist Shotguns could be considered snipers Damage is inconsistant tagged 3 times with an AWM to LVL 2 armour Seriously region lock china The game crashes consistantly and stops players from reconnecting REGION LOCK CHINA Character gets shot at refuses to stop reloading/healing I'm not downloading 9gb for an ANTI CHEAT ROLLBACK ARE YOU KIDDING THE F**KING MOBILE GAME WORKS SMOOTHER THAN THE PC RELEASE Events are usually unbalanced and garbage and help further show how terrible the game truely is Actually listen to your player base and add a map selector so no one has to play the bloody desert map (UPDATE This was added then sort of removed) I genuinely just played 3 games of the event and its put me off gaming. That is how bad the experience is within this game Servers are too busy try again later *Retry* S e r v e r s a r e t o o b u s y t r y a g a i n l a t e r *Retry* S e r v e r s a r e t o o b u s y t r y a g a i n l a t e r *Quit and uninstall* Played the new patch still sh*t DESYNC!!!!! labelling an update with "FIX THE GAME" and not actually fixing anything makes a lot of people disappointedConclussion E SPORTS READY!!!!Due to the fact that the devs have released crates means that we're going to have another H1Z1/CS GO on our hands. review: I enjoy the game but in this state i can not recommend it. Servers They are constanly down and when they work they are laggy as **** most of the time. Sound The sound in this game is unbalanced. Footsteps are too quite and airplaying and weapons are too loud. This can cause serious hearing problems IRL. There are programs outside of the game that can help but still . I should not be forced to use them. Gameplay The core is great but the overall "feel" of the game has problems. Nothing in the game feels responsive. Optimization The game runs like **** you need a really good rig to play this above 60 fps at all times. A 1060 is a minimum i heard what a ******* joke. They have not released a optimization update after the one around june/july. And in the last update they forced post processing effects in the game. Nice job bluehole. Graphics the game can look nice but u need a crazy rig for that so the graphics look like **** when you compare it how to game runs.When all the things above get fixed i will give it a positive review.

review: Rolling TL DR This game doesn't deserve the following it has. It's fun sure but it's early access as all hell and isn't receiving updates fast enough to explain what they're doing with the money they've received. Not impressed so not recommended. You should wait for more content and/or a Steam sale. Update Summer 2018 sale I would not buy it for $20 Read on for my ongoing thoughts about this early access experience including my first impressions in the review toward the bottom. More recent updates are posted above older ones so start at the bottom if you want to read chronologically. Blue text indicates the beginning of each new entry.UPDATE 2 (October 2017)Ratings on this review are being reset as I'm again changing to Not Recommended.FOV slider applies to first person perspective only (leaving a lot to be desired with 3rd person). Not sure how they think a 3rd person slider would imbalance the game (read it wouldnt they're idiots) so I deduct a serious number of points for this one. They obviously already acknowledge some players prefer wider FOVs (as well as the lack of effect this has on balance) hence the implementation of the slider so they're only sticking it up us by not allowing third person FOV changes.Game has received significant performance and networking updates all good things. Picking up items and interacting with doors and vehicles is still laggy (upwards of 500ms at times) and has room for major improvement. The time I spend standing there waiting for an item to enter my inventory is infuriating at times moreso when I have to click an item multiple times to get it to actually pick up. In a game entirely revolved around picking up loot this should be a top priority.The main menu options and ingame interface all need further work. Party system is still half baked often have to have members of your party refresh the UI in order for them to be able to ready up.Weapons still do not always hit where the optic's crosshair is aimed. Firing rapidly on semi auto is detrimental as clicking too fast can simply cause the gun to recoil outside of the scope even though the scope should be physically attached to the gun visualizing the exact recoil you need to correct for. Pro tip Either fire one shot per second at long range or automatic fire from the hip at short range.Content updates in the way of weapons and maps are trickling in. Can't really complain they're not a big team... Though for their ridiculous revenue from this game so far I also don't understand why things haven't sped up substantially.I continue to play the game on and off because I have friends who enjoy it and would probably play regardless of my participation. That does in no way mean I am satisfied with the state of the game especially with the honestly undeserved following which it has.UPDATE 1 (June 2017)Changing recommendation from negative to postitive. The game has received updates to improve performance and the gameplay has turned out quite entertaining. I dread the day first person only modes pop up because all my mates will be up for that yet I won't be able to play due to the FOV. C'mon devs you disabled the FOV workaround yet still haven't implemented a slider...ORIGINAL REVIEW (May 2017)In a nutshellThe game seems solid but needs some more work before I can recommend buying it at this price ($30). I understand fans of the genre might want to support development by prepurchasing a game for a premium price but the average gamer would expect a little more polish.The game feels good I don't want to detract from that. * o/*Emphasis.* o/* I may even change this recommendation to a positive one once I have more hours of good experiences to outweigh the negatives. I'll talk more about my positive experiences in it when I have some more experience playing. The following represents my first experiences playing and the most disappointing things I encountered. I'm also identifying the individual issues seperately so that the devs can act on or respond to each.There is no FOV slider (yet)Despite it being planned this should be a high priority for any FPS. I am among an admitted minority of players whom get migraines while playing low FOV games. It took me years to diagnose the cause but it prevents me from playing without mods a large number of games including World of Warcraft. I have also had no luck editing .ini files to "lock" the FOV (locked to what I do not know no one explaining how to edit the file seems to know what the script even does).Seriously fix this or I will not be playing much longer.Key mapping doesn't workRebinding keys in the options menu seems to have no effect. I rebound them reopened the game to find them reset. Rebound them again got in a match and found them once again reset. Rebound a third time while still in that match opened and closed the options menu to find that what was bound did not reflect what I was seeing in game the text fields change but the binds do not. I ended up reaching 8th place on my first match then died because of the keybinds (I stood up instead of going prone). &lt now fixed&gt Friends list requires manual refreshWhy? No other game does this. This item was a suggestion by one of the guys I play with I haven't noticed it yet namely because I don't organise the party. &lt still a problem&gt Offline players in partyI haven't seen this but my mates explained to me that quitting the game does not quit me from the party. Wut? &lt still a problem&gt PerformanceThis one's way down the bottom because it's understandable for a game of this type to suffer from an early access performance hit. It doesn't really bother me aside from a noticably higher than usual input lag on my mouse. I hope that they work on this ASAP as poor framerates can hurt the longevity of a game despite how fun it is. I can only imagine what people with lower end hardware are experiencing. &lt ongoing&gt More content will be added as I encounter it be that positive or negative experiences. The recommendation will be reviewed at each update.

review: Battlegrounds is a last man standing game where death means you have to search for a new gameI wasn't a fan of the game mode until played battlegrounds. This game is amazing! The map is huge but is completely filled with gear guns and ammo. You start of by skydiving off a plane that's on fire and lands g wherever you guide the parachute toUpon landing that's when you start surviving. Of course with a huge maps even 99 other players can be hard to find so the developers remedy to this is to have a forcefield start corraling players into a circle that gets smaller and smaller as time goes on until the game endsShould you catch yourself outside of the force field it will slowly drain away your health. Not an insane pace but a person with full health has about only a minute to get into the designated circle before dying Not only do you have the threat or other players and the incoming force field to deal with but if you get caught in a red circle RUN! Because random parts of the island start getting carpet bombed and the only indication of what area is about to be bombed is a red circle on your map. Rounds wise it all depends how long you live. I had one match where it took longer to load up the map than I stayed aliveI had another where I was in the top 10 died at about the 18 minute mark. Finding a match is quick as a lot of people are playing I take an average of 30 45 seconds to find a full 90 100 people server Optimizeation could be better but I'm not complaining the only real lagging or glitches I see are in the pregame lobby where all 100 people are in the same vicinity. With my gtx 1060 desktop I get about 75fps on ultra with my gtx 1050 laptop I get about 50fps on mediumPros Lots and lots and lots of weapon varietyLots of attachmentsQuick match timesGetting a kill is so satisfyingrealistic but not Arma realisticConsVehicles can be really hard to controlLoad times can vary wildlySometimes characters won't pick up ammo even though they bend over for itDoors take a second to open after the button is pressed which had led to a couple of deaths. UI can be confusing. For a full game its an 7/10 For an early access game 10/10

review: The game is a great concept but I would keep looking at other games with similar concepts until this game at least leaves early access. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS RAGE INDUCER!!! There are still several things in the game that are easily exploited by other players the most noticeable I've seen is lag exploitation. This game has terrible lag compensation and it tends to somehow make players move ahead of where they actually are. I've even noticed this happen to me (I would skip further ahead in a run or when I tried to run into a doorway at an angle I would skip to the otherside of the doorway and get stuck in the animation that makes me move my momentum in the other direction. Also doors don't always seem to want to open. I have an excellent connection and have seen this problem on multiple connections besides my own). I've noticed several players who seem to use that to their advantage to make it much harder to track their movements while aiming or if in the beginning of the game make them run faster than you while you're both at a dead run with fists out (had a guy back up while reloading a weapon faster than I could run at him holding shift. It's ridiculous how much of an advantage this is and how easy it is to get). I've looked up how to do this and it seems a lag switch in this game is much more effective than in other games.They have several other technical issues such as the third person aiming not being accurate (it pulls slightly to the left of where the reticule actually is)On top of all of that they have a knack for banning people based on the say so of whiny adult sized children (I mean a bunch of streamers). So yeah save yourself a headache and wait on this game it is not worth it at this point. Maybe it will be fine at some point in its life but right now it's a nightmare.

review: Personally I think the game is fantastic but I know that my opinion doesn't reflect the same as ya'll motha a's. So I will list some pros/cons for you. Pros 1. If you want realism I would say this game has hit a good amount of realism but not to the point of something like Sims combined with Arma 3 it has a great ability of balancing realism and non realism.2. The game will most definitely hit you with a HUGE amount of adrenaline ESPECIALLY if you're in the top 5 10. It becomes so in tents. (like camping). Idk about you but personally I love me some adrenaline. 3. It has REALLY REALLY nice gunplay. I.E. Realistic gun sound bullet sounds on impact and very nice fluid weapon mechanics.4. The games pace is a nice balance between Dayz and the BF series. It has those nice Dayz moments where you'll just be setting around talking about how your sister slept with your cousin and your dog ate your and then BOOM shots are flying and gone from 0 to High school virgin about to get laid on prom night. 13/10 would play again.5. The devs seem to be very proactive so far pushing out updates and letting all of it's fan base know what it's planning/going to do during the future/next updates.Cons 1. Now one of the biggest and I do mean biggest because it seems to be a huge issue is the amount of crashes I've had or have witnessed on a daily basis. There are at least 5 12 players every game who's clients crash. The devs have been diligently working on this issue (according to them.). I think that a nice temporary band aid for this issue would be to possibly add in a re join feature that lets you re join a game that you have dc'd from in the last 3 4 mins.2. It's a game of campers. If you're a camper you can get to late game very easily. I feel like the game needs to have some sort of counterplay to the amount of campers there actually are in this game. I believe that they should focus on implenting a First Person Only mode right away rather than adding new guns/cars/maps.3. Appart from your first few wins winning doesn't feel very good. I think they should give you some sort of medal that goes on your clothing or maybe even a special kind of clothing piece. (or weapon skin.) for every win that you get. I.E. 1 win gives you a bronze stripe on your clothing and 2 gives you 2 stripes or maybe a tick mark on your gun for every win. Then 5 wins gives you a silver stripe and then gold etc...4. It would be pretty cool if they could extend the times of circles by maybe 30 seconds. Because right now you really have to hurry up and find items then gtfo of where you are. (unless you get lucky and end up in the center so you can just camp.)5. Late game feels like mostly more RNG circle luck than actual skill. You're going to either be able to have the enemy leave their cover to run to you because you're in the circle or you're going to leave your cover to run to them. (also there would be counterplay to this if they removed/added a first person mode.)Anyway TL DR if Steam let you rate with stars I'd give this game 4.1/5
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I never thought anyone would balance this concept so well. The game runs smoothly with graphics maxed. The game style itself is unique and enjoyable in many ways. From gathering what you need for battle in hopes no one finds you before you have anything worth toting around. The character customization Which I've barely scratched and it's pretty good compared to most mass multiplayer games with survival like aspects. The vehicles you can find in game move smoothly as your character does and the mechanic or function for controlling the vehicles kicks that of any GTA game or any game claiming to be "realistic". The map itself is not only huge but it is covered in detailed architecture. There are very few reused prefabs compared to other games. The only serious complaints outside of the obvious are few. The number of points to get a "reward box" with a random item in it costs a bit too much and doubles in cost each time you get one. This wouldn't be such an annoyance if it wasn't for the fact that you don't know what you're getting. I got 3 dirty white wife beaters in a row and gave up on the reward box. There should be an item that you can find that alerts you to a general direction when someone is around because more often than not people are being shot in the back while trying to have a showdown with another player with no way to see it coming. Maybe a very vague radar with a short distance sensor. To the obvious problems. Even though the items are very customizable the character itself you choose from is very limited in customization. I'm sure that's on the list of things the creators will change. The one thing that irks me the most is with all the capability they have there is no training or goof around game mode where you can get a grip on the game. You're thrown right into the 9/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What is this Game? Playerunknown's Battlegrounds or PUBG for short is an online multiplayer battle royale game where you either alone or with a squad of others fight to be the last one(s) standing in this tactical game of survival combat. You can choose to go at it alone or pair up with 1 3 other players where the aim of the game is literally to kill or be killed. You will be air dropped onto an abandoned island where you will need to scavenge for weapons ammunition equipment and medical supplies all while encountering other hostile players and avoiding the deadly forcefield. Your mission is to equip yourself to survive combat with other players while also making your way to each safe zone in order to survive the ever restricting play zone. The longer you survive and the more players you kill the better the placement you will recieive which will yield a greater currency payout and better personal stats. In PUBG you have access to a wide assortment of weapons and equipment as well as a variety of vehicles to help you survive the various locations in the map. A Bit of Background When I first heard about this game it was back before the game went into closed alpha and my mates and I were still on the H1Z1 King of the Kill jams. Already being fans of the battle royale genre we were pretty keen for PUBG as we expected it to be the next big thing and thought it would be everything H1Z1 was and more.When the game went into closed beta and it became available to pre order with a beta key I took one for the team and pre ordered the deluxe version to see if it was everything we had hoped. Off the bat I was really impressed with the higher level of detail compared to H1Z1 and the game world felt a lot more real. I still remember that one of the things that impressed me most was the gun play the weapons felt powerful and sounded amazing. The more realistic approach to bullet drop and travel as well as the real to life audio mechanics of trying to find where a shot was coming from really appealed to me. Even if I was missing shots or shooting at nothing at all the gun play was enough to keep me having fun.PUBG also expanded on H1Z1 by having things we had always hoped for like weapon attachments a minimap no bleeding after taking damage alternate firing modes a leaning function and that's only to name a few. The game wasn't without its issues though as servers were incredibly unstable and laggy at times and game breaking bugs could cause your match to come to an abrupt end. A lot of these issues carried through to early access release but there were enough great features and mechanics there to keep you playing. The Game Today As of writing this review the game is now three months into its early access release having sold over four million copies. In comparison the population of my home country New Zealand is 4.4 million so that's pretty damn impressive. Today the game has never been better as Playerunkown and his fantastic team have worked incredibly hard to keep the game regularly updated with performance patches and new content. A lot of games go into Steam Early Access but in my opinion no other game has done early access as well as PUBG has. Not only is the game itself brilliant but the awesome team behind it has strived to deliver what they promised with regular updates that actually noticeably improve the game. Each week there is a new performance update to improve the servers and gameplay experience while each month there is a new large content update that brings even more fixes alongside new content such as weapons vehicles and new gameplay mechanics. With a game that at its core is so fun to play coupled with a large player base and hard working developers PUBG is a great gaming experience. In Conclusion... Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is an awesome game out of all of the games I have purchased since I bought my PC it is probably my favourite and is the one game I keep coming back to no matter what. With a dedicated team that keeps the game regularly updated with performance fixes and new content I'd say it has a bright future and is well worth the early access price. In the months to come we can expect even more new weapons including some more high caliber firearms as well as total building destructibility and new maps and gamemodes. I am defnitely keen to see the game grow even more than it already has. One note that I'd make is that although the game is fully playable as a solo player it is definitely more fun with friends but there is an in game option that allows you to pair up with other players too. 9/10 would Chicken Dinner again. Great gameplay great visuals and audio great devs just a great game. Can't go wrong with PUBG.

review: So from what I've played so far it's a pretty nice game. I like the whole Battle Royale theme and how everything to a point is balanced out. You could land on a scythe (a low end melee) just as easily as you could land on an M4 and level 2 body armor. The game is fast paced as a whole ending at around the 20 minute mark but has enough gaps and slow pacing to even it out.Some downsides however are the performance and the speed of looking around in first person. Now I have a high end computer but changing from max to minimum graphics settings got me almost no performance boost (not that I necessarily needed one) but I can see how it would affect lower end computers. The looking around in first person has a small "delay" which isnt hardware acceleration or any kind of input lag. It's similar to DayZ or GTA V where first person has a bit of slowness to looking around. The FOV can't be changed as well which affects me as looking around quickly looking at a narrow view and sitting like a foot from my monitor combine and strain my eyes but I guess thats more on me than it is the game.Overall if you like Battle Royale gamemodes or mods and want a decent one (this isnt a mod this is its own game) that has a lot of players quick entry to matches (matches easily get 96 players and start within 2 minutes) don't mind the performance and have the $30 to spare I would recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I feel that I can actually recommend this game it's really fun to play both alone one friend or many friends. You can simply say you drop from an airplane with 100 players with nothing but the cloth or no cloth you have on you. And it's your mission to find weapons armor health packs and so on to survive and kill your enemies until you are the last one standing or team standing. While you try to survive you also have like safe zones that you need to be in with a force feeld that comes closer all the time are you outside the safe zone you will lose health with time. You can easy say that the game force you on the map closer to other players so you can't just camp all the time. It's random also where the safe zone will be so every game will be different where the battle will be on that big island. You can win in different ways also some people like to stealth and simply avoid the battle and let other players kill each other or you can try to kill other people as much as you can but it's risky. The state of the game right now is not the best performance but the devs have been working on it and trying to fix it. It have been an update to fix some of it and it have been better. In such a short time they have been updating weary much and I hope they will continue on that and improve the game. But even at this state I have been enjoying the hell out of this game and think it's easy worth 29 99 .
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Quick break down to a very fun game.You'll start in a lobby where you can join a squad go solo or a duo modify your characters clothes check your stat's check other players stats check a leader board and keep tabs on points you're earned during gameplay. You'll use those points to collect rewards which so far just appearal to customize your characters appreance. I haven't seen any benifit to "armor" but camo wise it's something to think about.Once you've decided how you want to play (ie solo duo or squad) you'll check the ready button and you'll find yourself on an island of the Immortals. 100 players in total will load into this island where you can run around for an alotted time usually a minute. Although there are guns and such on this island which you can practice shooting players and such it's also a time for a bunch of immature players to yell racial points of view or hassle one another babbling. Because of this you can hide underwater you can't hear any of it. Admittingly though I've seen some cool stuff people forming prone snakes or people spread out into a milliary formation doing exercises with one player yelling at them to work harder.. but it's still not enough to get to get me out of the water.. So after the Minute is Up...Everyone from the island is packed into a jumbo jet and that jet fly's over a HUGE island. You jump out whenever you feel like it and parachute to whatever location you can reach. Again sadly though.. all the hat's are aboard this flight.. so you'll have to endure their immaturity once again... So... once you jump...You'll hit the ground and have only a bit of time to gather guns gear and if possible a vehicle. The map will tell you where you need to be as far as "in bounds" is concerned. It's a circle you need to be inside of or you'll take damage and eventually die from. The game will do this about five times making the "in bound" circle smaller and smaller and being out of bounds will take more life from you the smaller the "in bound" circle gets. This is a good measure to prevent campers and lazy players affraid to engage players. So the game will help you find Ballz you never knew you had... isn't that something!You'll be able to see how many players are left in the match at all times. You'll want to be the Land Man Standing or Squad. Great fun and with vehicles the strategies of game play... just makes for a great game all around. Really looking forward to the Beta.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When I first started playing this game I enjoyed it thoroughly having fun with friends kickin butt. During the early access stage I was more forgiving when I encountered a bug that would either A) break the game or B) cause a minor inconvinience because well it is in E.A. I took a big ol break from the game a few months after miramar came out because I started to get bored of it which is no worry because I can take a break and come back to it later. Thus my return I am welcomed by the full release of the game which I appreciate because it has been in early access for a min. The keys and crates dont bother me because it's only cosmetics so i jump in with some buds. First game it takes forever for me to load into the game which would always happen first match no biggie i die pretty quick first game and then onto the next one. Game crashes. HUH?? I thought by now they would have patched that preload crash i guess not. somewhere into my 4th game I die while behind a wall...................... poor netcode... after countless updates and "patches" their netcode is still garbage... Shots dont hit and getting shot behind walls is still a thing. I was expecting a polished game (dont get me wrong it has improved) but i get the same mess as before. Quite disappointing dont spend your money on this game. It's obvious their main focus now is making sure they try to cover up their terrible netcode with crates and keys and stupID EVENT PASSES.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I think these weapons should begin as auto fire mode since it is in auto you will not be annoyed at close or long range because you can spry or tap but when in single you will only be able to tap which is better for long medium range and defenitly not in close range.

review: First impression of this game not bad.Some things are still buggy... it isn't unusual to run by a boulder floating 6 feet in the air. Things I would change if I could WING SUIT! So many times I've wished I could get just over there only to land way short... then either a) change plans b) steal "acquire" a vehicle or c) the game becomes "Running Simulator/Please Shoot Me Simulator V1.2" (version 1.1 is BF1 on Sinai).Hitbox on the vehicles could use some work juking a dune buggy resulted in me being "run over" as the dune buggy passed 15 feet to my left (though that could be a latency issue). Attempting to run someone else over resulted in them standing on the hood of my truck for about a mile and a half.Game needs a "climb" mechanic. So many places to explore but no way to get there unless you parachute on top.More boats. Would love to get to a couple of the bigger islands but there are not many boats. By the time one is stolen "acquired" the circle is shrinking and here comes the Blue Wall of Pain.Vehicle mounted weapons? Maybe not. Then you'd just end up with people camping the circle center and creaming anyone stupid enough to poke their head up.Motorcycles. Or bicycles. Or even a pair of roller skates ANYTHING but (more) running... Some kind of randomizing mechanic so EVERYONE doesn't bum rush the same spots over and over (see military base control tower the tunnels just to the west of the sunken buildings at the map center etc). Move stuff around some.Different maps? Doesn't have to be on a fixed rotation... just something different... Just my two cents... it's not a bad game. Right now I would give it maybe 7/10? 6/10 when I'm off at being shot dead for the 12th time in a row by some guy camping a bush on a distant ridgeline...
