review: Was doing GREAT in the middle of a match. Found a SCAR killed a guy and took his 8x range scope to slap on it map started closing in so I started moving because I was sure there weren't any "edge of the map" players around to shoot me in the and then I get hit with a "server lag" and then by the time the issue was fixed I was well behind the circle and then ended up dying because of it. Keep in mind my internet here is good and I have NEVER dealt with lag issues with any game I play. I was in the top 15 of the match and stood a GOOD change to at least make top 5. I refuse to review this game on a number scale but apparently they are still having the server issues I've heard about before. Yeah you deal with cheaters and also t deaths but it's easier to get top 10 than you think. I've had situations where people magically knew where I was despite not moving or anything. The game is just an unfixed piece of trash. However I still like looting houses and getting the gear I need and then ninja killing people. My FAVORITE thing to do is out play the players who hug the edge of the map the entire match. Best update they did was to make the cirlce move in faster and increase its speed at the beginning. It makes it much harder to hug the edge of the map when you can't outrun the circle. You'll have fun you'll hate it and sometimes you'll hate yourself for having fun on this game. But I paid 30 bucks way passed being able to refund it so I am going to play it until I just can't stand it anymore.

Not whatsoever.Im going to list off some things that need to change before I can reccomend it.1. Lag problems There are some big server problems with lag. Once you land on the ground from the airplance sometimes the buildings wont even load in and if you even manage to get inside everything is invisible and there is no ground to walk on.2. Loading screen freezing Now there was a solution for this on the forums but it no longer works for me when loading into a game the loading screen will freeze or it wont disapear meaning you can hear the game in the background going on but you cant see anythnig because the loading screen is in the way.3. Cheating This is a pretty big problem. People can mod the game so that you can see through buildings add a player radar and some other stuff. The devlopers also dont aknowlage this stuff either.This game needs some major improvements before i can reccomend

review: Just recently hit 90+ hours on this game and decided it was about time that I right a review for the game and here it is. The game is a battle royale game similar to games such as H1Z1 Last Man Standing and Islands Of Nyne. This game is definitely the most sophisticated of them all despite it being in early access. It runs fairly well if you have a moderate computer (I average 40 fps on medium settings on a $1 200 laptop) and is optimized pretty okay especially after the new update which answered the communities cries for improved optimization. The development team seems to be involved with the player base and is always trying to improve their game for their players. Although I have almost 100 hours on the game and frequently play it I would confidently say this is not my favorite game on Steam. In my opinion the game can get stale rather quick if you are playing the game by yourself which detracts from the possible fun of playing duos or squads with a group of friends. The "auto match" system is a good feature but it's a pretty polarizing feature. Getting one game with auto match where you get placed with a group of 3 that just kill the odd one out can put a sour tast in your mouth for sure. I suggest if you are to get this game get it along with friends so you have someone to play with even if it's just a duo partner. The $30 price is an acceptable price for a seemingly fleshed out early access game such as this. Speaking of money recently there were microtransactions added into the game which was said not to be added until the game was released as a full game. Many people complain but if you really don't like the decision you don't have to buy them anyways. And this was most likely done to get some extra funding for the development team so they can keep bringing good changes to the game. With all this said how do I rate it?Dev team 8/10 Early access progress 8/10Overall gameplay 7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a really fun and challenging game. Its not been out for long but it takes a massive dump all over H1Z1. Suprisingly there are no game breaking bugs (that ive came across). The game is very realistic as in you sometimes don't have a clue where you are being shot from and theres no kill cam so you dont know where you got killed from. The game punishes you if you are lackadaisical. It can be frustrating at times but its very rewarding and one hell of an adrenaline rush once you build a chain of kills in a match. Its hard hitting as all your effort can go down the crapper in an instant which leaves you frustrated and annoyed which makes you want to put your hand through your monitor and rip your keyboard in half. Good game thoroughly recommend it especially if you have a few friends who also have the game as squad play makes it even funner.

review: The game right now is alright. Played all modes the worst by far is random squad 9 times out of 10 I got a team that did not communicate and many of them just went awol while I ended up facing a whole squad myself many times. If your playing solo solo fpp is probably the best mode. The maps are just too big what I have realized is that to reduce the game being a "walking simulator" many just straight up drop in to the hot zones and fight out for the best equipment. I found out the game tends to be a lot more fun then makes it a lot more tense quickly scavenging for material while trying to survive with other players few feet away can get your heart really racing.The controls seem floaty not very smooth or responsive depite maintaining a constant 60 fps. Its extremely fun with friends since communication is key. Overall I would say this game is meh...I mean the frequency of weapons and equipment is completely RNG which bothers me I someitmes end up in a popular area rush to a house and there is absolutely nothing (the house was not even raided before) maybe just a pathetic pistol. Sometimes I would end up landing on a house with levle 2 3 armor and high powered weapons so not all games are consistent which can be frustrating at times.Would reccomend if you have a consistent group of friends to play with would also reccomend it for solo only if you play with the style of always landing in the hot zones rather than in the outskirts where the game turns into a walking simulator and your biggest enemy is the big wall that is trying to kill you.

review: Hey there!I am writing to express my overall review of the Player Unknown's BattleGrounds! To be honest I am overly impressed by both the gameplay and the graphics including the weapons textures and maps.As a quick reminder for the following text this is early access which means that the game is under making/creating and by that it is acceptable to have bugs and crashes so keep up until it reaches the official release.My main points are based on gameplay crashes and bugs which I may reveal for you to help fixing them There are several hitbox failures around the map (for example at the abandoned castle near Rozhok) where the players can easily stuck behind a crate or any props. Also there is a movment section which appears when something fails e.g. getting stuck on the top of a car. The game "Doesn't like Alt+tabs" which literally means that it crashes or fails to load again on Alt tab ing. This may not be an official problem but I thought I must have a few words on the item spread. There are a lot of players who want to camp which might could be a reason for the items on the map to contain more sniper rifles or an alternate category of weapons which ranges between the faded line of sniper rifles and assault rifles. In the first minute before the game starts usually the players can't be seen but their hitbox are alive. The parachuting movment is a bit strange both in control and animation extremely at the end. There is a glitch where players burning effect isn't over after getting into the plane which shows a little red trail (sometimes 2) which is funny in fact but I believe it isn't ment to be ). When you are selecting your character's appearance the bald hairstyle shows a red hairstyle which isn't bald. I would recommend to place the play button on a more specific place or highlight it more because a lot of times while playing with a crew we are not able to see the ready to play button. In extreme circumstances I would prefer a bit of a ringing sound or a bell sound to hear the sound (even when Alt+tabbed)After all I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game to everyone especially who likes FPS/TPS/Multiplayer/Shooting/Action/Open World games. I hope that my letter catches the developers attentions and hoping for a reply. Thanks for making this awesome game.Yours Faithfully Laddze
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playing this game as Early Access and yeah it's Early Access IT has bugs the framerate dips making FPS Twitch play impossible sometimes. The melee combat feels like whiffle bat jousting blindfolded. There are graphical issues and it is one game type.BUT!It's fun man it's tense on solo hiding and hunting other players. Scavenging for loot and sniping fools who cross your path. Or in my case being shot in the back of the head.Team games are action packed as 4 of you drive your UAV around assaulting anyone who gets spotted machine gun combat avenging a friend and being the last man standing as your squad cheers you on.I love it.I would love to see optimisation but thats their plan... remember its EARLY ACCESS!!!Id also like to see a play area stay large for a slower hunting sniping mode maybe with more air strike drops.I think they will make crates a pay to win thing but as they only get starting gear that is cosmetic or minor upgrades i.e. Helmet Gas Mask it's still balanced.If people start getting assault rifles in crates as starting gear thats going to cause balancing issues.But... We will see High Hopes for this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Only downside is the optimization isn't the best but it's nothing unplayable. Best played with friends.

review: No other game in my life has ever made me feel the same way as PUBG. I've seen it a handful of times on Kotaku and a few "Best of" videos for and giggle but I've never actually played it because I'm not that huge of a PVP person. But I decided to say to hell with it and give it a 2 Hour Trial (you can refund games on Steam if played for less then 2 hours).Round 1 Died while wondering why my assault rifle wasn't on auto.Round 2 Got Falcon Punched about 30min in. Didn't even fire a bullet.Round 3 Laid prone in the shadow of a bail of hay for a solid 10min with a car as bait in front of me. Saw a dude flip over a motorcycle and die at #19. I should have been recording. Made it to NUMBER 2!!!!Round 4 yeah hiding in a bathroom till there was only one person left and they opened the door while you're prone on the floor.Seriously I've been feeling in a rut about games for a long LONG time (only really play WoW at this point and that's more because I can pay for the subscription with in game gold). Prey was a nice diversion recently but nothing super ground breaking or engaging there (I do enjoy Bioshock esq games). But PUBG has rekindled a dying feeling inside me that sense of pure adrenaline of actual fear and thrill that comes with it. I cannot endorse this game enough.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Nevertheless there are some technical issues. My game crashes from time to time. (i7 6700k + 16GB RAM + R9 480x 8GB) But mostly i just start another game.Due to the popularity atm matchmaking is almost instant.Common issues atm are the mentioned crashes some player experience and performance issues. i get around 60fps average in 1440p.

review: I would love to recommend this game and if PUBG Corp could quit shooting itself in the foot with petty lawsuits thoroughly out of place cosmetics and "event passes" I might but until then I can't play the game without a bad taste in my mouth.Objectively it's an okay game. The idea and the artistic excecution (pre cosmetics) is stellar the perfect balance between mil sim and playability however performance and netcode have been a long standing and seemingly unaddressed issue that is constantly bringing strife to the community.I know that the same people who push cosmetics into the game aren't the same people who write the netcode nor are they the same people who optimise performance but you'd expect a company to have the foresight not to spam the game with microtransactions and marketing before addressing the real tangeable issues that have been pressed by the community since day one.

review: I am having so much fun with this game! At first it was very daunting to go online in a battle royale type game against 99 other people. I didn't know much but there is plenty to learn along the way. There is no tutorial its just you and your wits. After playing about 1 15 games I went from being #97 to #8. There is something so intense about going into a house and finding somebody else after you've heard their footsteps. Its you versus them and only one of you is going to live. If you survive you get to do it again in the same match. The graphics have gotten better since I have started. The sound is amazing. You get all the ambient sounds as well as the intensity of the footsteps in the grass or on the hardwood floors. The game runs smoother too. The matchmaking is pretty fast and there has not been any real lag in the games. I haven't really been into PC games that much lately but this game has brought me back.Now onto the loot system. It is extremely random but at least wherever you find a weapon you will find ammo for it. Some houses you go into you will find nothing but melee weapons and attachments. Right clicking on loot is the fastest way to add it to your inventory instead of dragging it. Dragging it will just waste precious time that you do not have. Run around until you find something because chances are that people who parachuted in your proximity know your approximate whereabouts and they are coming for you. The crate drops happen in random locations so whenever you see or hear a plane fly over that is where they come from. People will be trying to get those because sometimes you can get an awesome sniper rifle. One problem I have had with this game are memory leaks for my particular GPU. I have a 980 ti reference card. I get crashes that tell me that the game runs out of texture memory. From forums I have seen that others have had this problem.If this happens to you. just restart the game because that seems like the workaround until they acutally fix the issue.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is the perfect mix of Arma/DayZ and something more casual. The gameplay is really clean and enjoyable and the rounds feel like they're the perfect length. The gunplay is near perfected and is the perfect balance of skill versus realism. I know for the Arma engine (which this uses) it's extremely hard to get it optimized but it does an amazing job and this is basically what I wanted DayZ to play like.Also they actually intend to get it out of Early Access in 6 months unlike many games that enter Early Access Purgatory. This game is incredibly playable for Early Access and even if they only made minor adjustments it'd still be worth buying in my opinion.IF YOU HAVE A BAD COMPUTER BE PREPARED TO RUN IT ON VERY LOW. Even with a good computer it's still a game that uses the ARMA engine so it won't be completely optimized yet.

review: Played this game for over 60 hours now and I loved the first 50. I don't know what happened but the last 14 hours have sucked. Maybe an update nerfed the play but it feels like someone came up with a wall hack that is rampant. I am fairly proficient a fps games the BF series CS ARMA Division and such. In the first 50 hours of this game I could hold my own and even got a few chicken dinners however in the last 14 hours I have had a total of only 5 kills. I die in the first 50 from headshot out of know where... even when I see someone and get the jump I get headshotted. It is ridiculous something is fishy and wrong. I have 100s of hours in fps games and I can tell when the game play is unbalanced for whatever reason. So unless it gets fixed I won't be playing this game much more. I routinely play with about 8 other people most that are far better than I aand they feel the same way. It is 5/29/2017 and if the game reamins in its current early access state I can't recommend it. If it doesn't change well it is just a quick fad that the developers forget about and walk away with millions of dollars.

review: One of the best adrenaline fueled games I have played in a long time nothing I've played over the years gives me the same feeling but for an extended period of time. The gunplay mechanics are pretty realistic feeling. Every weapon and its type of ammunition serves a purpose. Theres a huge island to work with you have to parachute down faster than the other guys and running to find weapons before the other guy who just landed too is pretty scary. What I enjoy is you can play the game however you want however the blue circle makes EVERYONE have to change/adjust their plans .Dont worry if its early access this game has provided me with nonstop fun just in solo queue alone with friends the game just eats away hours of the day.

review: I don't write reviews but i figured that i had to with over 400+ hrs of game time. PUBG is a great concept so much so that other people/devs have been constantly trying to rip off their gameplay. However the recent changes (aka no trading) have ruined the over game play and style of PUBG. PUBG is supposed to be a highly customizable game which includes the characters weapons and skins/clothing. It feels like bluehole has gotten away from this conecept with their last gameplay update.Bluehole should be focusing on improving game mechanics hitboxes and optimization. Instead of focusing on these issues Bluehole has decided to focus on earning as much money as possible in a cash grab monopoly on skins and customizeables. FOR THE LOVE OF GOD Bluehole focus on banning cheaters and updating the graphics/optimization. Who the cares if someone buys a skin from a thirdparty vendor.... Keep your game alive

review: one time i watched a youtube video of LGR playing this game. it looked fun... so i bought it. I had no idea what kind of a dark turn life had in store for me. I have not had anything to eat or gone to the bathroom in months. i sit and play this game until my eyes bleed on a daily basis. do not buy this game if you know what is good for your health and general state of well being.It lags like hell...I keep playing it and I can NOT explain why in coherent sentances at this point. I.. I... I JUST DONT KNOW ANYMORE. I WANT MY LIFE BACK. .. But No seriously If this thing didnt lag everytime i ran into another player it may have been the greatest game of all time. but it does that constantly and drives me to question the purpose of our existance as a species.

review: UPDATE So after having this game for over a year and being part of the journey I am so disappointed where we ended up. The sheer greed of this game is beyond comprehension. Everything costs money every dirty nickel and diming trick is being used. I am done with PUBG they simply don't care for their fanbase or have any love for their product. See my original review below I am a new comer to the 'battle royale' genre and PUBG is the first one I've played in it. I did a bit of research and this seems to be the more recommended game even though its in early access. I haven't played games much in the last 12 months but this game has me back hooked playing for hours each night. Such a great concept undertaken very well by PU. So far this is my GOTY. There are some minor issues being that it is in early access but they are easily overlooked by the great gameplay. If this game continues to get updated refined and hopefully see graphical improvements (the game is not very good looking.. at all) This could hit the mainstream and be the 'next big thing'. Worth the $30 easy.

review: I love this game I really do. It's like reliving the Counter Strike glory days all over again. But there is a fundamental problem with it that pisses me off beyond reason and could seriously be a dealbreaker for me if it goes unaddressed for too long.Being able to crank down visual settings and all but remove details like shadows and foliage is not a "competitive edge" as some like to call it. It's basically developer condoned hacking. What an absolute load of that you have to choose between playing a game that looks good and takes genuine skill or one that you can actually win because it looks like and you can see where everyone's hiding.I've always preferred online gaming on PC over consoles but goddamn does this ever highlight a glaring problem with PC's customization.

review: Great game a lot of fun and variety everytime you load into a game. Expected bugs may occur from an early release. Biggest concern I personally have with this game is the cheating and hacking other players seem to use. Numerous times now I've gotten to the final 20 or 10 and just fall over from a shotgun headshot that sounds like a sniper shot from across the map. Even behind cover or in a building I have just fallen to a hacker. I'm not one who shoots for number 1 on the leader boards in games I enjoy playing this game every day the frustration comes when another player ruins any chance I have at successfully winning. Overall great game and would recommend it to any player looking for something new and refreshing just be warned that there are some hacks in this game that may turn other players off.

review: Barebones but beautiful. If you are going to release something early access (LISTEN UP DEVS OF THE WORLD) this is how you do it. If your initial release content is going be an incomplete game that you charge money for you had better make sure it is fun and playable (IM LOOKING AT YOU ARK WITH YOUR RUBBERBANDING). This game is a lot of fun and runs smoothly. There are no game breaking bugs or overly frustrating lag/freezing (no more than your normal online game). The Devs have delivered on everything promised and they continue to quickly respond to issues and release updates (unlike he who must not be named *cough/No Man's Sky/cough*). Honestly I cannot explain why I love this game so much and if I was to explain it to you it would sound boring. But trust me it is everything but boring.

review: Have not played to much but it is really fun even better if you have freinds to play it with. The looting is really good but still somewhat challenging. You'll find good loot anywhere but the best stuff is hidden away in army bases or schools (I know right?). I found its really useful to read about the game and the weapons before playing alot and devoting you self to the game. Optimization issues are... abundant... If your PC isn't that good don't get it it won't be a good expeireince...Overall I give it a 7/10 but I feel that it will improve as time goes on.If you liked this review please give me a thumbs up! Over a year later and the game is 30 times as popular as it was when I originally wrote that review. Alot has changed but the core aspect of the game remains the same. It is still a great game but its way better then it was back then!

review: UPD 3 months later Cheats mostly fixed only WH left (and not so common).Optimization became slightly better but freezes are still here. Cheaters were the main problem of the game so now I can recommend to try it. Good game flooded with cheaters. An they don't use boring wallhacks no. They can shoot the whole clip in one shot. They can heal w/o waiting 5 secs for medkit usage. They can even kill you through the walls. Okay they could in the previous version (till dec 17 I guess). PUBG Corp TM/R/other proud need a year for fixin geodata ignore. An incredible achievment for the most profitable p2p game of 2017. And the new anticheat system which they introduced recently lasted for about a week. And don't forget about brilliant optimization. The best review I read about this game is "a right game from the wrong company" and I so much agree with it. I've tried to keep with the game for 270 hours but I am done. Playing for 20 30 minutes and being killed in the end of the match by a cheater is so frustrating. And it happens every second/third match. For the year of game lifespan I didn't see any promising changes. For this year I just got totally disappointed by the devs who are in my opinion extemely incompetent. The whole game is just a DayZ catastrophe on a larger scale.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is clearly alpha and there are many roads to cross before getting into the realms of a polished game however the gameplay is fun which gives you the opportunity to test your skills in a solo duo or 4 man group to see if you have what it takes to win a round. Screams og H1Z1 and Arma but I've played both and it doesn't have the polish of Arma3 but plays as well as H1Z1 in it's current state so can only get better. It's a filler not a main game. I can see our gropup messing around in it whilst playing other games more seriously. Either way it's a game which gives the fun factor I was looking for. Price wise it's an expensive alpha so look out for a really expensive released version or maybe BlueHole will have made the killing required to retire and drop the price for the masses.

review: My original review is below after they had wrecked the FOV for the game to a tiny window that made me motion sick (a common complaint which has since been fixed) and still had issues with rubberbanding allowing people to sprint into a room kill you while lagging then safely rubber band back out of the room. The server issues have mostly been fixed and those that have not are being worked on consistently. The patches are good and the new content/weapons have been a good addition all in all it's a solid game that's fun with friends. The 1 2 and 3/4 man queues are a great idea and work well. The gunplay is a little wonky and people eat bullets but its a cool game. OLD I enjoy this game and it's good fun to play but since the patch to prevent wider FOV's we're locked in at the horrid low FOV numbers consoles use unfortunately the low FOV numbers make me motion sick and they are preventing these from being edited with no plans to provide the option in 3pp. If you get motion sickness or feel queasy in low FOV or if you find it annoying I'd skip this one sadly. The game is pretty good though!Some issues with lag and rubberbanding but these seem to be improving with each patch. Sometimes bullets dont feel as if they are doing damage which is frustrating and the gunplay is a little dated but works. FOV killing me.

review: Loved the game in the beginning despite it's flaws. Whatever issues I ran into I figured would be fixed in a somewhat reasonable amount seeing as they were in Early Access and they were making bank. The game was still fun and whatever "quirks" you ran into were just funny due to their outlandishness. They then came out of Early Access released a sub par second map failed to fix well known bugs failed to expand their servers to meet player growth continued to let cheaters run rampant and overall just ignored requests from the community. I mean it took them months to add the ability to choose your map. Now they are going all out to milk as much money out of their remaining player base via loot boxes and battle passes and it's become painfully clear that they don't care about the players or the future of their title. At least I got my money back and then some selling loot boxes I earned from playing the game. Good luck doing that now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG has the best charicter movement and combat feel. It takes the best from popular games like Arma h1z1 Dayz so the game feels intense and realistic like DayZ but without the clunky complicated controls and it also has a dash of fun while not being rediculously over the top like h1z1 KOK.Why the bad review?I want the developers to know that they created a game that mechanic wise had me wanting more. I guess I'm trying to say that the mechanics are too good for a BA only game! I sincearly hope they add servers to survive on where you can travel all over and respawn if you die.I issued a refund because I was frusterated that I could not explore the game. It doesnt feel like a cheap shoot em up BA game everything you find and explore has weight to it and feels valuble the charicter models are good and I wanted to take my time and invest in the game! It felt better than Dayz/Arma/h1z1 it feels fluid while still having that slow solid feel and intensity you get from Arma/Dayz.They did a great job and I think they made the best shooter survival game mechanic wise Im just dissapointed I cant appreciate it due to the BA only game mode you basically have to hit the ground runing chasing circles on the map and you're booted off the server if you die. No time to appreciate or experence anything!Make a normal mode Bluehole! This game desserves more than 12 year old doritto finger mayhem you call "Battle Royal"

review: So. I'm sat wanting to try this genre having an old H1Z1 from initial alpha (king of the kill unplayed) and this on the store.I downloaded both tried this then refunded. To be blunt as someone new to both games and not sucked up in the fanboi/resentment politics from my perspective H1Z1 is (understandably) in a far more polished state at the moment and the better game to play. But still ludicrously rough around the edges it should be added.There are legitimate arguments Gamebreak have semi abandoned H1Z1 or consider it 'done' and a cash cow. There are also legitimate arguments this is led by the guy responsible for the original concept and has far more potential. Currently though this is unrealised potential and needs to be proven. I'd imagine they're already in the common early access situation of deciding whether to cut and run with nominal updates or invest everything and gamble on future success.That said I refunded not because this is a very buggy feature minimal early access. I refunded as the main question to me is whether anyone can get stable good netcode on this scale. This seems absolutely crucial when a dodgy hit reg is made so meaningful by the design concept. SOE/Gamebreak have years of proprietary IP and experience in creating MMOs and still H1Z1 is more than slightly laggy. Battlegrounds is ridiculously laggy. I see the team as having ticked the trivial Unreal Engine boxes large generic open world decent character animations etc. but still falling down on the hard part making the game work in the current constraints of multiplayer tech UE or otherwise.I'm not convinced they'll pull this off. They might have a great (and from the off putting name of the game and promotion something of an egocentric) lead but they need leading edge netcode programmers and tech otherwise this early access &gt beta &gt product cycle will repeat that of so many open world survival games content additions acting as bandaids to a broken concept technology can't quite yet support properly. Or they need to dramatically rethink design under pragmatic constraints rather than conceptual ideals.I hope they'll nail it as the concept if you ignore or better still solve the problems brought about by these technical constraints is a great one. The main concern with this as an EA is not that there's lacking content the odd crash or balance tuning needed because that can be worked on. The main concern is that multiplayer tech is still really not ready to nail this type of experience properly and fixing that may well be beyond the skills of the team or lie beyond it in the actual hardware and network infrastructure.In short and on the basis the reader is choosing between the two H1Z1 despite the flak ignoring future visions and all else discarded seems the better game at the moment. This may well have more potential but taking both off the shelf at the moment as someone without a commitment or frustration with either this simply isn't quite there.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: My PC is of some middling level performance and aside from the starter lobby where all 100 players are faffing about the rest of the game runs rather smoothly.The gameplay itself feels intense and there's a learning curve that takes a few hours of play to get used to.It's challenging killing you off for poor positioning and lack of caution. You have to stay in cover and move with purpose building to building wall to wall placing your car near the entrance for a quick getaway. You run around aimlessly or park too far you get gunned down... BUT when you finally turn into the kind of person who can FIGHT BACK and has learned to play right you'll see people make those same mistakes you once did and you'll punish them for it.It's a game that rewards you for learning from your mistakes. And though the rewards system is a bit harsh on the cosmetic side the sense of victory you'll achieve when you make it far is phenomenal.I do have to gripe about the rewards system though. You'll earn points to earn reward packages and they're capable of BREAKING when you open them (how does this even happen?) and the disappointment you get when the points you rack up vanish and all you have is an empty crate might seem like a total let down... but it's all cosmetics and you'll sooner end up customizing yourself on the field anyway. Also the cost to buy a crate increases each time a let down but again it's just cosmetic.You get this game only if you enjoy that thrill ride as there is no sense of progression other than the cosmetics (it's early access it has room to breathe still). And if you have friends the experience could be endlessly enjoyable regardless. Win or lose you'll still earn points for lasting a while or even so much as HITTING someone so you always walk away with something.In summary it's an incredible experience so far. It has some real potential to really stand out on the Battle Royale scene. For now on the adrenaline rush alone I recommend it. But if you're impatient and refuse to get with the learning curve it isn't for you. But still if you're impatient AND have friends then squad up and give it a go cause when you have people to watch your back in a game like this you'll have tons of fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

If you're looking for a hunger games survival game that has a more hardcore feel then this game is pretty damn good. At it's current state it's probably not worth $30. It's lack of optimzation really makes it feel like an incomplete game.

My game along with many others crash as soon as a stun grenade is thrown at me or even remotely close to where I am. It could be buildings away just the slightest of it and my game jsut crashes and it's very frustrating. My computer is new and can run this game perfectly fine on ultra settings so I know that's not the issue just a major bug that is very inconvenient.

review: Fun Game Great Gun Play Big Map... Early Access issues bothersome If i could mark it neutral then i would but for now the EA problems are very problematic Games great fun challenging guns feel like they should (calibers have meaning) bullet drop and zeroing can play into effect if youre trying to snipe. Map is H U G E (so much so that depending on where you land your whole session could be running on foot or driving to stay in safe zones). Loot is plentiful and you can gear up usually within a house or three (longest streak ive went with no gear besides melee is 12 housesand about 5 10 min of play time). Aiming down sights is like Arma (not a fan) Early Access Issues Constant Server lag with bouts of rubberbanding Major sound issues at times it cuts in and out completely which makes it impossible to tell where your getting shot at from or what side someone just passed you by. For some reason the game eats your CPU and wants more Graphics are extremly wonky for my AMD card (big black pixels and boxes every which way i look. Doesnt matter how i change settings can literally get you killed as it has done to me multiple times) I've also asked multiple people when in groups some have the issue the same or even worse. Parachuting is horrid when landing animation is buggy and freezes when landing for split second. Doors are a complete pain in the as some times if not all the time you have to double tap the "F" key to open and if you shut it while your in the doors radius it bugs out and teleports you back outside the door. Loot has same issue sometimes you have to double tap to pick up or spam the interact key in order to grab the item and even still it might not pick it up. Backpacks bug in and out sometimes not registering for a few seconds up to a minute after equipping

review: A breath of fresh air in a market flooded with battle royal style games. Aside from latency issues the game is quite fun. I have only a handful of complaints some of which include the interface and inventory system being a bit confusing for first time players. There is also a slight delay when entering and exiting the player inventory. It's as though the game unrenders textures in the enviroment when opening your inventory and reloads them when you exit. Not sure if everyone has that issue but I seem to despite running a 6GB 1060 and 16GB RAM at the time of writing this review. Also have a wierd distortion in the audio for loud noises during explosions when using a system with 7.1 surround and Tiamat Elite headphones. Nothing that truely breaks the game just minor quibs. Otherwise a great game and hours of good times with friends.

review: Games like these are games that make me wish steam had a "so so" setting for reviews. As someone that's played every platform of PUBG I really love this game. There's nothing like it honestly. You can add attachments to weapons during the round which I've wanted in a game like this for what felt like forever and it has a certain degree of challenge and a learning curve that comes with it. Trying to find what attachments are the best with what guns. Also the maps are all pretty big and take a while to explore. While this game is really fun and is worth 30 dollars it is still pretty buggy for a full release and still isn't optimized like it should be. I understand that the maps are all huge and take a lot to handle them with the graphics but it seems like time after time especially on the new Sanhok map random fps drops happen that cost me a kill or the entire round of the game itself. Like a totally perfect loadout and about to get an awesome headshot but then the game freezes and the guy i shot at just lasers me. It really is a shame that this happens frequently but it seems like the devs are working hard to fix that. Anyways that was my 2 cents on PUBG I don't hate it nor do I want it 24/7 but it is a solid BR option.

review: So... obviously the game is good. I have 1100+ hours on PUBG. Very fun to play with friends. It has its share of glitches still and every now and then you encounter a hacker. The hacking situation has gotten wayyyy better than it used to be. However BlueHole/PUBG Corporation doesn't seem to care too much about its consumers. For starters... you have to pay to buy the game. You would think that should give you access to everything within the game... but you're wrong. Apparently paying for things up front is not enough anymore. Everything seems to have microtransactions. You earn credits by winning games only to obtain crates that require you to spend $2.50 to buy a key to unlock it. If you thought that was bad... that $2.50 you spent may not even get you an item that you want. The crates are like gambling. They have anything from super rare items to absolute ones that nobody wants. So... if I'm paying money to get an item... I should be getting the item I want. So they finally acknowledged that a little bit and said "Hey you don't wanna gamble on our goods? Here's this!!!" Now they offer crates where you know exactly what you're getting. Yay! WRONG! The new crates cost $10. Holy As of 1 A.M. this morning (6/22/2018) PUBG released their new map leveling system and of course... a season's pass. A season last one month in PUBG and a pass costs $10. What do you get from this pass? A CHANCE to earn you can buy in crates. The new leveling system is also based off this new season's pass. You get missions that once you complete you can only redeem if you are a season's pass holder. Stupid.Now. I have only myself to blame (and FortNite users) to show that people are willing to pay for this stupid because you bet your I am going to buy this season's pass. I play this game too much to not get the full benefit of it. I am super at how much money they are trying to milk from us. For these reasons I can not recommend this game even though I undoubtedly love it. If these things don't bother you. Buy the game. If they do... stay the hell away from this money pit.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Changing my review back to positive. They've done a great job blocking the hackers Bravo!This review is coming from someone with 750 hours in Arma IIIs version of this game and 330 hours of PUBG who ranked up to 140th place on the NA 3rd Person servers. I left this game with a 4 5% win ratio (that's good BTW).This game is infested with hackers.At least every other game you invest 30 40 minutes looting and prepping just to get mowed down by a hacker who's half a mile away with an 8x scope hitting you with every shot while you're zipping along at 130 KPH in a dune buggy. I loved playing this game but it's a total waste right now and they're doing nothing about it. Uninstalled it over a week ago and haven't looked back. I'll be back if they fix the hacker problem but that's it unless something major changes. Sad. First some Background BR on Arma III I love BR on Arma III I probably have around 700 hours on it.I like the varied terrain I like the looting and how you have to put together a good kit to win the gameI like the tactical aspects of picking a good route to the circle.I like the fact that there are some very good players in the game it's very challengingI don't like the close combat shot registrationI don't like the close combat movement mechanics as they feel a bit clumsy.I don't like the long waits to start a game.I don't like that this game has a small following due to it's complexity It's a key binding nightmare for a first time user.H1Z1 I hated H1Z1 and refunded it. I maybe played 40 minutes of H1Z1 and couldn't handle the shot registration (the first 5 minutes into the game I hit a guy with a shotgun who was at least a quarter mile away he looked like two pixels and there was no way I could hit him with a shotgun except in the world of H1Z1)I don't like how the map is built on an obvious grid the smashing a car into a rock with no damage the jumping out of a car at 50 MPH and jumping around like an idiot to shoot in the general direction of one's enemy hoping you get the random shot.Couldn't understand why people liked that game. On to Battlegrounds I really like this game. It's very polished for Early AccessThe shot registration seems to be really goodClose quarter combat is more like CS GO than Arma IIIThe map is beautiful lots of detail and obviously different areas with different building typesThis is more of a shooter than Arma III BR as the tactical aspect isn't there you don't have to plan and decide as much you just find the biggest gun and equip a scope and hope you see them before they see you.If you die you can start a stopwatch and before the watch hits two minutes you are back under your canopy flying towards the ground.It'd be nice if there were more crevices and varied terrain to hide in but no biggie.I'm running i5 8GB RAM all SSD drives980Ti &lt The version I have is on the higher end of the performance spectrum of the 980Ti'sI have literally no issues running this game don't know how many FPS I'm getting but it's smooth and there are no issues.Seeing how my system is on the lower end with the exception of the video card it's possible that anything below 980Ti might give you issues until the game is optimized.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

(they think they own the genre)bluehole has a "apple inc." mentallity i.e. they make subquality product and threaten others that may raise the bar beyond blueholes' sub level product.

review: This game has so much potential!I like the battle royale gamemode since every match feels different from the others. The fact that a random factor such as the safe zone's position is in the game is at the same time good and bad. RNG can destroy competitivity but it also adds some spice to the gameplay.The gameplay feels very rewarding when approaching the game by learning the map guns accessories and whatever there is to learn.It is less rewarding when optimization problems and connectivity issues pop up but the development roadmap and the fact that it still is in Early Access actually lets you close an eye on this.I would like the developers to improve EU servers since there is a notable difference between them and the US servers.EDIT This game is out of early access but is getting worse and worse. Every patch makes it a little bit less playable and makes the performance worse. Right now you will die or get damage behind cover so often that you will realize that the only way to go at it is to just get good at aiming and pretty much crouchshooting everybody you see without even making use of the cover available. The new recoil making you shoot at the sky after just a few bullets isn't really helping the already missing flexibility of the gameplay no crouching or no accessories mean you better stop using ARs. The actual meta lies in getting airdrops and sniper rifles to just one shot headshot everybody since Level 3 Helmets have become impossible to find outside of airdrops.I keep getting stuck with my parachute I keep having FPS problems even though I have good specs and I keep dying to unexplainable shots.I reached the Top 1000 many times but I feel like right now I need to learn to play at a whole new game and honestly you can bite me Blueballs.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its so sad to see a game being ruined by its own community this game is a heavy game hard to run but then the idiotic kids with a PC without a graphics card start crying saying the game is badly optimized then they removed 1st person in the plane weapons at the lobby weather and other features which made this game unique and fun. Furthermore the Devs arent helping it used to be fun to play this game win loose and get battlepoints where you could open crates and get cool cosmetic items. But then they had to ruin it all by adding different types of crates which require keys to open that is one of the most annoying features this game currently has most recently weapons skins have been added to the game if they had added proper skins such as tan woodland ETC... and made it so you can get it without having to spend your money on them it would be OK. But no they decided to make some nerf looking skins (not all of them). to summ it up Dont buy this game if your PC cant run it properly and have patience with the stupid decisions made by the Devs. hopefully some of the removed features will be added to this game once again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG took me a while too get into mainly because ive never played any game like it and the more realistic styled mechanics are something i really wasnt used the only other high skilled shooters ive played are Gears of war and CSGO both of which are nothing like PUBG. However after playing it on and off for about 30 hours i started to get better with the shooting mechanics and my tactical decisions. Although PUBG takes alot of skill it also has a lot of luck to it in terms of the equipment you find and what the circles force you to do. This makes pretty much every match different so it gives it good replay ability. Going forward id like to see better optimisation for the game as sometimes i get massive frame drops which leads to me getting killed in some fights and also the game crashes a bit. In terms of content id like to see more weapons added to pick up (not in supply crates) especially some older guns and some more LMGs.Pros Good shooting mechanics that are a lot more realistic then the majority of shooters out there A Lot of weapons Overall fun and tense gameplayCons The reliance on luck to win can be annoying especially when you get bad circles at the end A Lot of weapons get added to supply drops which you hardly ever get Doesn't have a mode where you can practice Vehicles are glitchy

review: The more and more I come back to this game the more I am driven away from it. I've been playing since the Early Access and it still feels as boring and repetitive as it was when I first purchased. I come back to check out new patches every once in a while but half the time i play I end up dying to someone who I can't see or hear. The sound design is jarring. I can hear a teammates footsteps nearly 20 feet away but someone is sitting on top of me and I have no sound of them whatsoever. I bought this game in early access expecting fixes and changes over time. But Im more dissapointed now than I ever have been before. If you're thinking about buying this game save the money and play fortnite FOR FREE. It's really sad that they offer a better game for 0 cost. I was hopeful for PUBG. Not anymore. Oh and Lootcrates/Keys were a huge middle finger to everyone. Just sayin

review: If you're into realistic military shooters you'll want to add this game to the list.If you're coming from H1Z1 or are new to this type of game I still recommend trying it but made a pros/cons list in case you're on the fence about it.PROSThe Weapons They feel and sound great to use. Large variety that are all impactful in different scenarios.Game Tempo A great mix between downtime/intense ramp up and blood boiling firefights. Sound Great sound design! Learn to pay attention to receiving and making sound from footsteps gunfire vehicles etc.Tactics/Strategy Decision Making at every turn. Hint Its different every time!Co op Unrivaled team play! Team up with a friend or 3 for some good times.CONSEarly Access Expect lower FPS server lag random bugs.Pistols Near useless except for the first minute of the game.Cheaters Not game breaking since the games are relatively short (5 20 mins). But they're there.Luck of the Draw This isn't CS GO. You can go into it with a pro mindset only making the most logical decisions and still die to random scenarios like a vehicle clipping through a rock to kill you.There's much more to this game than initially meets the eye. It almost feels like a roguelike in that you learn something new almost every playthrough. 400+ hours in and having reached top 50 in solos and duos but I still have a lot to learn.TLDR You can wait for the full release to try and avoid dealing with early access issues but you'll surely encounter them anyway after a major patch. Its the nature of an online game. Just pick it up and enjoy it with your friends while the hype is there you wont regret it!If you've read this entire review good on you! Heres a little secret the game's 3D sound is wonky. Even if you have it through a sound card or a nice headset w/ software just turn it to stereo. It'll work wonders for you. Cheers!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm writing this review in the time it takes me to log into PUB and start a game. It takes countless minutes to even launch the game if you get past the countless times it says "Servers are too busy at the moment". Which brings me to the big selling point of PBUG the bugs. The bugs make and literally break the game. Though it is funny to have your buggy crash randomly and spin 7 times in the air the bugs also make you lose countless games which you wouldve lost anyway to hackers. If you hadnt noticed REGION LOCK CHINA! I truly enjoy the premise of this game but the execution is still deeply flawed (I could make a really long list of bugs but for my sanity's sake i'm not going to) which is why unless the devs actually work on fixing stuff instead of adding new cases i give PUB a negative review.

review: * Bugs &amp Glitches. * Game Crashes. * Lag/Desync.* Rage inducing lost games because of these issues.When you do get the opportunity to play one of those rare games where PUBG runs well it's a fantasic experience.Unfortunatly... In most games you are going to be faced with one of the issues listed above. But oddly enough I would still reccomend that you try this game out Just be aware what you are buying into.********************************************************************(October 31 2017)At Paris Games Week Today the developers of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds announced it's leaving Early Access this December. "Late December " to be more precise. WTF!!!Unless Bluehole Studio magically fix all of Battlegrounds glaring issues in the next few weeks I don't know why the hell they would even consider leaving early access. That early access tag is the only thing making this games problems even half acceptable.In no way is it ready for a full commercial release in it's present state.

review: Overall an okay game 3/5 stars(My Opinion)I think the game is alright. I haven't played in a little while but from when I used to play a lot there were a pretty large base of asian hackers/cheaters (On NA Servers) To me the game doesn't feel very consistent especially shotguns you can end up shooting people in the chest but your bullets just disappear or don't get registered (not just shottys) The game also has really long matches so it's really devastating when you die to BS after you just searched around and looted for 22 minutes. I would recommend this game only to some people I would say buy it and try it out and jus see if you like it and just return it if you don't also miramar is a bad map in my opinion so at the time of this review 6/29/18 there is only two maps. review: This game is fantastic and could very well qualify for a game of the year only reason it is Negative or Mixed is mainly due to cheaters microtransactions are fine all cosmetics. The new event pass gives players incentives to play different and weird playstyles. The maps are phenomenal and they are currently working on a snow map. PUBG listens to their playerbase and do their best against cheaters no one gives them credit for banning a lot of hackers. Hackers only roam freely due to the sheer amount of them. Gunplay and mechanics are very well done and polished compared to the early accessMost of the negative reviews are complaining about microtransactions/cases when the solution is quite simple JUST DONT BUY THEM they offer no advantage and you dont need to look cool the only thing worth buying in this game is the event pass with cool challenges that are very fun to do with your friends

review: If you're cool with 12GB updates every other week enjoy driving into invisible rocks that flip your car and half kill you love nerfed weapons are fond of the die gettothelobby joinagame waitforfiveminutes skydivetotheground die waiting cycle and can't wait to get murdered by auto snap hackers then by golly this is the game for you!The general gameplay is fun when you're lucky enough to have a good run and manage to avoid most of the things above but the game still well and truly feels like a work in progress. Heck for the last few months there's been a daily 26MB update to help prevent hackers.Not to mention that even on a state of the art computer graphics and performance are patchy at best.I still play the hell out of this game because it can be fun but almost every time I play I walk away angry or upset at the experience. I must be a glutton for punishment or have a very short memory... edit Another 12GB update. I'm done. I don't have the bandwidth to cope with massive downloads every time they change a font or update a texture and redistribute the entire bloody package.

review: Abhorrent. Probably the best word to describe this game. Don't fall into the hype or be pressured by friends to buy this game. Simply put it's awful. Terrible controls terrible gunplay poorly optimised buggy as hell. The loot system is horrible too yes the whole point in it being Battle Royale is the randomised loot and the uncertainty of doing well but far too many games have awful drops leading to me fighting with a pistol against those that are fully equipped. The mid game is awful everything happens within the first/last 5 minutes of gameplay. It all depends on when you depart the plane. There are plenty of connection issues at least in my experience. The hitreg seems off too plenty of shots I've taken never seem to hit the target it could take an entire mag to kill an enemy even if you have decent aim. Time To Kill seems off as well as stated before you can unload an entire mag into someone and not kill them OR you can 2 shot someone which to me is inconsistent leading to an awful experience playing the game.TL DR don't waste your money on this game and purchase something else.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Everything you want from a Battle Royal!I have loved this game from the day I got it yes this game has some flaws but what this game has that other games don't is a great team behind it working at what appears to be at a pretty good rate. I have seen constant updates with game connectivity issues and overall FPS performance. We have seen multiple new guns as well as new footage of up and coming character jump and abilities. The downsides to PubG at this time is definitely the slight learning curve some players run into. One example that comes to mind is switching from 3rd person to 1st person and when to use it to your advantage in a fight. Other is team work unless you're in Solo this is a communication game.Overall this game is everything I would want to see from an "Early Access" game. Constant updates with a Dev team that appears to be on their A game at giving us new content to improve our chance of a chicken dinner.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is overall a great survival/battleroyale. I've spent alot time working on tactics how to survive in this game the longest and the best one is stealth and trigger dicipline. You can basically win this game playing snake mode and only kill if nesescary. After some time I started testing different weapons and how they work on different situations and seems to be that shotguns are the most powerfull at very close range smgs are great at surprise attacks close range. Assault rifles are pretty equal long range and sniper rifles well.. they're sniper rifles so pretty damn op long range. The only major issues with this game are hitboxes and hit registering. I know early access game but the developers have had alot time to fix stuff so don't care about early access t. Some times you come to situation when you enter 1v1 with an enemy manage to shoot him first around 10 rounds with 5 6 hits that should already down/kill the enemy but surprise surprise mothafuk* he fires 3 rounds and you're dead and he leaves the situation like nothing ever happened. That's the only ttery you have to deal with this game rest of it is pretty neat and worthy of a purchase.

review: Bought game jumped in played a few games got decent at game it's a simple concept fun with groups.Pros Game is geniunely fun in the beginner and intermediate stages.Squad up with friends! Have a blast. Squad up with strangers if you want. (not recommended)Decent selection of Assualt rifles and add ons if you are lucky enough to find them.Shotguns are good in this game just like real life.If you get blasted as soon as you land you can join another game right away. (salt removal factor)Decent amount of cars on the map so that if you're hard up for a vehicle because of the area closing in there is usually some salvation.I like that there are consequences to firing randomly firing at others driving a car around.I like that your play style can be utilized however you see fit. (30/100people becomes camp central.) &lt that's fair.Cons This game has plenty of bugs I or some of my friends have experienced that have ruined multiple games.Car physics are absolute trash. Ex Hit a small rock car will flip as if cars on this ambigueously slavic/russian/croatian island don't come installed with shocks.No selection of guns except Shotguns and Assult rifles everything else will pretty much get you killed unless you are literally within skin rubbing distance.Not fun when you get sniped by a submachine gun from 800 yards away on a bridge far far away from anyone. Aimbotters will ruin this game unless something can be done.Latency isn't terrible but it can be gamebreaking at times.Community is something to be desired you will be shot by teammates if you have gear they want and decide you don't need it anymore.Every other problem I have can be chalked up to alpha. (excuses I know) This game needs some polish for sure but it aint asking for 60$ either.Giving this a Yes for now. It's Alpha I feel it's worth your time especially if you have ever played a battle royal game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It's ridiculous that there's a chance a player can start a match and have the possibility of not even playing it.

review: I didnt get to play the game as I wanted the lack of triple monitor (Nvidia Surround) and the fact that your progress from PUBG Mobile could be transfered to the PC was a complte let down (something I wasn't aware). While the game itself show a wide area almost 180 degrees view the inteface itself is another story. The menu inteface was there but all I could see from my character was his mid section all crotch and there was no way to fix that but to change the resolution to use one monitor. After I switched and managed to customize my character I started a round I was very disappointed by the washed out look of the graphics even settings on ultra and two 1080 ti in SLI mode. Its really sad since I was looking foward to play on PC since playing on my S9+ put a lot of strain on my eyes after a few rounds. I guess im going to stick with Fornite and maybe get a tablet and play PUBG mobile on it from now on.

review: In all realness the idea and foundation of this game is absolutely amazing and ik it's dumb as to say region lock any game but this game needs it people join Us servers from other countries to explot the ping Also there truly are a ridiculousy high number of hackers in game Now this isn't just speculation this is fact. there are people who exploit the ping and also people who just legit hack Invis hack 1 shot pistol kill hacks And some people going so far as to use the Ethernet cable D/C trick that many other FPS shooters on PC fail to recognize and it's one of the reasons games like this in particular tend to die out in due time In account of everything said I'd recommend this game for somone who doesn't just legitimently mind dying to absolutely nothing at times or being killed by hackers who cannot kill people without doing so. It's kind of sad my impressions on this game when i first started playing were astounding and sound. It's always been genuinely fun to play. Even at the note that there could or just WILL be the enevidability of a hacker taking their course on the innocent bystandards that genuinely enjoy Shooter genre games. And legit teamwork. This game souly revolves around team work and communication and twitch reflexes even. And it's why i think so many people are encouraged to find any explot or just straight up turn to aim bot or hacks. Because they cannot keep up. This i do not blame you for I blame souly the individuals who bought the game legitly just to hack and troll people and lets be fair 99% of hackers hack to troll. I hate saying hacking this hacking that but i've played the game long enough to know the chance of running into one is quite high i've seen everything from speed hacks with falling from the plane to people actually unplugging their internet cable punching people in the starting countdown then reconnecting the ethernet cable and getting the kills to people just ultimately using aim bot or damage hacks for instance having a lvl 3 helmet should ensure your safety from and projectile to the face. Meaning even the highest of dmg weapons cannot 1shot you. And i see people get one shot by a 9mm pistol. So this is definately a problem. I souly think it comes down to wheather you can stomach being hacked against cause you're better than them. Lol Anyways this is my review. i hope i didn't steer too many people away but this seriously needs to be fixed. It's quite sad to see such an amazing concept get wasted by people who cannot enjoy a good made game this is the first game i've ever played and continued playing without the abcense of hackers. It's that fun. So hit or miss the buy it's ultimately up to you " the players " Anyways.. Peace out..

review: obviously the game is in early access. but for having such a large following im surprised it has this many issues the main one being the gun play. at long to medium range the the gun fights are alright. but when you get close range or in a building your bullets happen to disapear into any surrounding surface that is "in front" of where you are aiming.the main cause is because unlike most shooters where your bullets come out of your line of sight. In this one they actually come out of the barrel of your gun. this is optimal to reduce headpeaking but it causes such clunky encounters when you fight from inside a building. even if you are ads in first person the game just feels really bad up close. even when ads from behind cover your bullets hit your cover more often then what youre aiming at. Good execution on getting the game popular but now its time to fix your game blue balls.

review: Product received for free. I want to start out by saying that this game is extremely fun and addicting when you have a full group of friends to play with. I personally love this game hands down the best free game I have ever gotten. I however cannot reccomend this game at the 30 dollar price tag right now. Even though I have put almost 100 hours into it there just is not enough content there to justify the price. There is one map and one game type with three different modes ( Solo Duo and Squad. Death match is the only game type.) and one map. There's also the usual Early Access ( or paid beta if you want to be honest about it) issues. Most noticable would be the issues with player to player interaction lag that can sometimes lead to you being killed after you have hit cover and the game straight up freezing for a few seconds when you try to loot items. Also driving is absolutely horrendous you hit one tiny bump in a field and all of a sudden your vehicle is in the air flipping around only to briefly land on the roof causing you to take a fair amount of damage and then keep rolling over onto the wheels again. The circle is another very frustrating issue with the damage it does and the speed it moves but that will most likely be tweaked very soon so I won't complain about it here. All in All though if the price drops or a significant amount of content gets added I would definitely start telling more friends to buy this game there is a ton of fun to be had even if you don't get that chicken dinner and there is a lot of potential here. If you don't mind dropping 30 bucks on an unfinished product you will enjoy the absolute hell out of this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Where do I even start with this game. Oh I know 1. Crashing Jesus Christ this game crashes alot. Just landed? Crash. Picked up some loot? Crash. Got into a gunfight? Crash. Then the game is all like "Oh just go ahead and report the crash ahaha kek" and then the crash reporter crashes. 2. Unoptimized YES I KNOW THE GAME HAS IMPROVED ON THIS. But still framerate is all over the place. Sometimes when I get shot the game drops FPS down significantly but only for a second yet that second determines if you live or die. (Spoiler Alert You die.) 3. Netcode I'm going to have a stroke just thinking about this. Okay okay I'm not the best shot in the world but I can get a kill here or there. But when I point blank someone with any weapon and said weapon does not do damage resulting in my death I want to throw my computer out a window.4. Looting You expect to press the F key once to pick up an item but when I have to press it seven times to pick something up it gets annoying. Also weapons will sometimes not appear in the inventory even though you picked it up. 5. Rubberbanding Severs lag like crazy. Probably the reason for the looting issue.6. Miramar I don't need to expain.Uh so please fix these issues. Oh and one more thing

review: OK. I would like to start out saying that I was very skeptical of this game and while I haven't spent a whole lot of time in it it is enough to say that it does get your adrenaline pumping. There is a different kind of feel to a game where you know you only have one life and a large map. Sometimes you can hear your enemy. Sometimes if you're lucky you can see them. Most of the time you've already been sized up by your opponent and they're only moving in because they're certain it'll be a clean kill. This game totally gets into your head. If you're new like I am then don't go in expecting to win or even come close. The formula for survival is up to you.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Set in what I consider to be a rural suburban hills setting with a post apocalyptic "where the heck is everyone?" feel Player Unknown's Battle Grounds is worth the early access purchase! Although the game is in its early stages and with it comes the occasional unpolished gameplay the game comes into its own when it presents as a "Last Man Standing" 3rd Person Shooter with a sort of military style "Hunger Games" flair. Picture being 15 minutes into a game your crouched behind a wall of an abandoned building peering in through the window waiting for player number 23 of what seemded like 200 to step outside and face your uzi which you stole off the last player in a mexican stand off with a crowbar and a gas mask all whilst you avoided being run over by another player in a tandem motorcycle. And just as they burst out the door the game engine reduces the map size so you quickly fire off a couple of rounds at them while you sprint in the other direction towards the safe zone to avoid the impending death that awaits you on the other side of the forcefield that is closing in on you...If camping is your style of FPS game strategy then this game isn't for you but if you love the idea of a game that forces you to constantly look over your shoulder for another enemy player and to actively search every room of every building you come across to find guns ammo clothing and an energy drink then this game is for you.I give this game an 8 out of 10.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Really fun game. Though my computer has been having problems when I play this game especially at the beginning of the game. I can barely move due to lag and the buildings look like they are made of playdough. After a minute or two everything finally loads in and I can play (but of course that's not due to the game it has to do with some computer problems. Though it also doesn't help that the game is quite fully optimized). I fight through the lag though because it's a really great game keep in mind it's still early development so bugs and glitches are prone to happen but even with that it's addicting to play. In my opinion it's much better than H1Z1 as they are very very similar games. Pretty much exactly the same since the creator of this game made the original Arma mod then licensed the idea to H1Z1. So this game is by the original creator. Super fun absolutely love the gameplay. Gun customization wide range of weapons large map unique gameplay and even with there being only one map the game always ends differently.

review: Coming from an Co op Arma Wasteland Breaking Point Dayz background I can definitely recommend this game and I believe it solves many of the "issues" I've had with previous survival/battle royale games. Namely in the sense of frustration and time investment to character and ultimately death.The game is setup in matches of 100 players you have the option to go solo duo or a squad of up to 3 other friends (sometimes you're placed in a squad of 3 other times 4). Each match lasts on average 10 30 minutes depending on how long you survive. Each match starts with the entire map unlocked and concurrent circular rings that start to shrink at different times forcing players closer and closer together till there is a last player/squad standing. There is an interesting gear/customization mechanic where you earn in game currency each match depending on your performance that allows to you unlock loot crates which definitely gives you something to strive for. The loot crates allow you to spawn with additional items of clothing that from what I can tell are mainly cosmetic. The gun play itself for the game is fun and doesn't seem at all arcady but I believe has a low enough barrier to entry that it's not overwhelming as say Arma is to some folks.If you've got a few friends that enjoy the other battle royale type of shooters you will certainly get some enjoyment from this. It is very plug and play intuitive and all in all a grand time especially if you like playing in some bouts before moving on to something else and coming back.I do have a few cons to the game that aren't necessarily game breaking but things that I hope will be fixed or a different direction is considered from the developers. Several of these or Early Early Access woes that I have no doubt will be changed while others are more game design direction. Graphics/Sound Optimization Could be better but the game JUST came out. This is usually something that's fixed very quickly and I've already seen work being done so not too concerned. Minor bugs Buildings not loading in right away graphical bugs two different super imposed reticles etc. Again Early Alpha woes. Content/Consumption of Content In the current state of release the game is lots of fun. But I can see this getting bland relatively quickly. I hope more content/different maps/more guns/just more stuff is in the pipe. OR the consumption of said content decreased some. In the current state you don't have long before the first circle of starts closing in on the map. I'd like to see the early match extended a little by another 5 minutes or so. Some of my favorite playtime so far has been the initial scramble of weapons and positions. I hope we could get more time to get able to explore more of the map. Hit Registry/Player bullet sponges Although there isn't a hit marker in the game (nor do I wish for there to be one) there might as well be. When you hit a player a gigantic dense bright cloud of red puffs up around them. In my opinion it just seems a little jarring and kind of out of place maybe I'm the only one. But more importantly it's the amount of rounds it takes to bring someone down without the glorified headshot even if they are "naked". I think the overall bullets to knockout needs to be decreased by 1 or 2 rounds across the board. Current "naked" vitality makes sense when you've picked up the level 2/3 body armor but people running around with a t shirt or underwear shouldn't take 3 4 rounds of 5.56 to the chest/arms whilst still sprinting at full speed before going down. State of Weapons and choice Although there is a small plethora of weapons in the game whether it is a mixture of play style preference time to knockout or balance by the end of the match (20 30 people alive) just about every player is running around with either an M16 or an AKM with a 4x/8x scope. Even in the beginning of the game some weapons because of their time to kill barely seem viable. Then because the beginning of the game (first 10 minutes) moves by so quickly you don't really get a chance to utilize the "lesser" guns anyway.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love this game. I run the game with the minimal specs (I have 16 gigs of ram instead of 6 and a 2gb nivida geforce GT 730 instead of the GTX 660). It run pretty good in windowed mode (I lagged in full screen mode). I got about 30 to 50 frames fps. Then i used this guide http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 889517165 Now I get about 40 65 frames per second. Sky diving and the lobby though are complete lag fests. I get 15 30 frames when sky diving and 20 30 frames when in the lobby.

review: This game is one of the best early access games I have played in a long time. It has so many Pros that outweigh all the Cons. You can run this game on a potato and get the same frames as on a multiple thousand dollar PC which is weird but whatever works. I have been playing nonstop with friends and alone and have had unlimited fun. Do not compare this game to H1Z1 it is nothing alike it is much more realistic. There is not those people who drive around hop out going 90 miles an hour and kill you like in H1Z1. This game is more like a hybrid of Arma 2 and 3 and DayZ. They devs on this game are constantly improving it and it will only get better.I 10/10 recommend this game even at full price.
