title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While the game definitely needs some optimization (Coming in just a few weeks per the developers) it is an absolute RIOT. I haven't had this much fun with a shooter in a long time. IMO this game takes everything H1Z1 KOTK does to the next level.Pros+Gunplay is awesome. ADS is a real thing.. Your hits are registered clientside and the registration feels really good.+Intensity is great. You can't beat the adrenaline when you're surrounded or when that circle is closing in on you fast.+Feel. The slightly more tactical feel/pace of this game is just so superior to KOTK imo. It just feels right. +Guns... All of them feel like they have a place and can get kills. Theres many different guns too.. unlike KOTK where you have 2 AR's 1 Hunting Rifle and a Shotgun. Off the top of my head there are 4 AR's 4 Sniper Rifles 3 Shotguns and several pistols. They all are good in their own areas.+Gun Mods... Gun mods offer a bit of customization in the game. You'll find different sights (red dot holographic 4x acog 8x scope 15x scope) and other things such as Extended Mags Stocks Compensators and even Silencers. And let me tell you... unless you are really close to someone with a silencer you won't have a damn clue where you're getting shot from. They work FANTASTIC and add another aspect to the game that causes you to play even more tactical.+Leaderboards... They exist.... and they work really well!+Crates... Completely bought by in game currency that at this time cannot be purchased (at least not that i've found). Items are purely cosmetic. You do not need to buy a key to open the crates.+Map... I like the map! It has all kinds of diversity when it comes to different areas to play in. Obviously you're constrained a bit to where the circles end up but learning the spots that you like fighting in best makes the begging jump that much better.+Jumping From Plane... Skydiver simulator 2017 is well done. You have good control over your parachute and you get to decide when you jump.+Devs... Devs are actively patching all the time. They have been very responsive and have outlined future patch plans. Optimization is their biggest focus right now.Cons Like I said the game needs to be better optimized. That being said I get 70 110 FPS on low unless im in a very large city (then I usually see around 30). It's definitely playable but the game looks gorgeous on the higher graphics settings. It would be awesome to play on those settings and get good performance. Optimization is coming a couple weeks into April so I'm excited for that. Server Lag/Desync. It happens. Fairly often. That being said its usually at the very beginning of a game (and not every game. I'd say probably half). After a chunk of people have died its usually pretty smooth for the rest of the game. They have been making updates to this on a very regular basis and I am confident they will get it resolved. It does ruin a game every once in a while but for the most part the fun of this game far outweighs this issue.If you have a decent computer and can handle running the game on the lowest settings right now get the game. Its a BLAST. If that doesn't sound like you wait until mid april until they have some of the big FPS optimizations in and then pick it up. WARNING.... this games super addicting. Forcing myself to go to bed at night has become a tough task. Thats the sign of a great game.

review: (i copied my arguement from the forums where they tried to compare pubg to h1 and i feel i expressed my opinion enough)after playing 20+ hours this passed weekend i tried playing h1 while the servers were down for a bit a few days ago my first game i died and just exited because i had absolutely 0 fun its just not as good as pubg AT ALL imho. one of the huge throwoffs is the nearly 3rd person only gameplay. spawning in pubg you can choose where you land (you can yourself whereas h1 will you without you being able to choose where to go). this so far is a selling point for me but ill keep going. you dont have car parts that you have to stop and steal every car you see. while im on the car topic you cannot just jump out of your car while going 50mph just to shoot somebody in the head with a shotgun like an idiot. you actually have to stop the car to be able to get out to shoot somebody... one last and probably the biggest WEAPON ATTATCHMENTS in pubg you can pickup and put attatchments on your gun which is another huge selling point compared to h1 where you have to look at a tiny head thats 70m away and take shots hoping to land them. the amount of pros outweigh the cons even for an early access game it feels more developed than h1 the biggest throwoff is performance but if you have a decent computer you should be fine with some tweaks and that problem will be fixed soon. sorry for the wall of text but i like to compare. oh and if you want to call pubg a clone of h1 then h1 is a clone of arma br mod but they are all based off the same thing.(sorry for any spelling errors i didnt care to reread and correct them)

review: EDIT (9 7 18) I am leaving what I had reviewed a few months ago from this date. Most of my complaints for the game have changed. Issues I found are being fixed or have been fixed. I feel very encouraged for the direction Blue Hole has taken to get this game where it needs to be and where it should have been. The game right now finally feels like a full release compared to Nov 2017. I will leave my old review up for people to see what I was complaining about. Some of that stuff still seems to be an issue. Like desync their loot system and their vehicle physics. But it feels like they are going to get past those issues with future patches. OLD REVIEW I have been playing since long before the "full release". And I am sick of no progress towards becoming a complete game. They have focused on loots crates more than their optimization. I have an RX580 8gb and a Ryzen 5 1600 with 16gb of RAM and I need to play this with setting very low to get a good FPS. Look I really love to play this game but it is discouraging that I haven't seen real performance progression.To the people that are considering to purchase this game I write this for you PROS Addictive gun play Survival Strategy Nice variety of weapons The maps make it great for strategy and competionCONS Hackers/Exploiters/Cheaters Not Optimized Desync during gun fights The maps are not made well. You can be driving along and collide with terrain that shouldn't have cause collision Pay $30 for the game and then receive a random loot crate that can be free to open or spend an extra $2.50 to open a lock chest you might not have wanted. Get a patch that is one step forward and then takes two steps backwardsOne part of me says to "Buy this game" if you can put up with bullcrap for as long as I have. But the sensible part says please don't buy this game until Bluehole actually uses their money to improve their issues with gameplay and optimization. Also read this reddit post to get a summary from someone else how I feel about this game https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/comments/8sp9e4/we_have_supported_this_game_since_early_access/

My main problems with the game are (minor) Clunky vehicle physics (motorcycles are very dangerous) RNG is sometimes frustrating Weapons sometimes aren't loaded when you land Parachute gets stuck when landing They took out fog and rain (Other than these minor complaints this is fun game for when you have friends to play it with.

review: This game is popular becuase it has no real competition H1Z1 is even worse just want to say in my opinion. Think about if you heard about a game that was in early access that had one map that wasn't even finished and had errors on it like jagged edges in random spots and fields. The game had problems with hit detection and at the start of the game was so laggy to the point when you open a door it takes 3 seconds to open after you hit F. When you shoot someone some times takes seconds after you shot them for them to go down. Also have the game crash sometimes and for the lobby system to get messed up and to make it better to be honest seems like with every update it gets worse. Then they say in December we will be leaving early access. They also need to add optimizations to the game and fix the hacker problem. So all this needs to be fixed before December. They also say we will be working on the game after early access which I do think is true but to say a game is 1.0 and out of early access means you feel that game is good to ship today to a store and be 100% ready to play. Like the old days when you bought a game and it was done no updates the game was just the way it is. Even if all the things I said were fixed and they added vaulting and a new map is 2 maps one game mode and 21 main weapons (as of 9/14/17) a full game? Then if yes get the game. (By the way I play this game because I have not seen anything out there that grabs my attention fortnite is fun but not really into the art style.This is the only choice so I play this)

review: Love that it combines the Battle Royal type survival scenario with FPS MMO and co op. The landscapes are beautiful and fun to explore. Within a single game multiple different mini games unfold. Many player choose to drop into hot zones and battle it out immediately. Others opt to land in the fringe and slowly make their way through the game to the end game. It can be frustrating for a newbie to pick up the skills to survive in gunfights against seasoned vets but the sneaking aspects of the game allow for even the newest of players to get some kills. I recommend watching some Youtube and Twich content to pick up useful tactics and strategies.

review: This game is truly the more immersive joyful and alive version of H1Z1. It is an early access game so expect some lag glitches and running into players who themselves have no idea what they're doing. Once you enter a lobby you wait for about a minute to enter the battlefield then it cuts to a birdseye view of a large plane carrying everybody participating in the match. You fly over the map until you decide to free fall out of the plane (with a parachute duhh). Unfortunately until you decide to drop out of the plane you can still hear everyone talking so this leads to somewhat of a toxic moment created by toxic players in the match but thankfully it doesn't last long. Once you drop your objective is to rush into houses and any nearby buildings to acquire guns ammunition body armor clothes and medicine. Much like H1Z1 you are given a time limit until the playable areas in the map start to shrink by a force field rather than toxic gas. If you don't acquire essentials quickly in a populated area chances are you're dead as someone probably looted close to you and hit the jackpot in comparison. Dropping in an unpopulated area has it's advantages as you can loot more of an area that may be smaller in comparison yet take a gamble on what items and essentials may or may not be located in that particular area. Overall I highly recommend this game if you are big into survival hunger game esque games that require focus get your heart racing in intense fire fights and have a stong desire to be the last man or woman standing. Also if you don't easily get off when you die in 30 seconds from someone in the building next to you who picked up an AK47 and slaughters you and your teammate with it you'll love this game )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Lovin' every second of it.The game shall be very familiar with all the audience of DayZ/H1Z1 obviously but it can be good for somebody who loves survival games like Rust as well.Battlegrounds made one great thing which I admire the most there is no crafting involved in the gameplay. You start as a "naked" character (no guns/melee weapons only cosmetic clothes on no armor) and you need to find your gear and weapons with ammo for it and a lot of gadgets for each type of weapon (scopes mags red dots you name it). No PvE type of encounters are present which is another great thing.The game is pretty fast (it lasts for about 40 mins tops in case you'll make it to top5) and with no need to craft anything it keeps you focused on your whereabouts and the gameplay itself. You don't hover over countless menus you don't spend time with meaningless micromanagement (like feeding yourself and looking for some warm clothes) you just play fast paced engaging battle royale match and go for another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. And another one. title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: At first it worked poorly..o wait it still works poorly and yet i have to admit its unmatched in every regard. Smashes its competitors out of the F**king park. Do not pay any attention to its minimal requirements just keep upgrading everything till you can get near a decent framerate one day it'll probably have accurate requirements but right now its a guessing game. The game itself is unforgiving and terrifying at first then later its unforgiving and terrifying. Team games can range from infuriating as two of your friends die immidiatly to downright hilarious as you spring your slow rolling jeep bridge roadblock and watch a confused car full of 4 enemies hit a jeep and flip into the air emptying clips into where you think their heads might be then desperatrly running from the barrier you forgot was coming as you were too busy laughing at the one guy who flew off the bridge and somewhere into the water 50 feet away. The controls are good but movement isnt smooth you really notice this when in small spaces and buildings. Other than that the mechanics are pretty spot on and the variety of weapons (which seems to be every increasing) is pleasing and provides a varied feel to each game.

review: This game... its ing garbage. The Fix PUBG campaign is a ing insult nothing more than a PR scheme. I can gaurantee that they spent more time creating the website than they have creating any kind of fixes. They are too concerned with adding new weapons and 3 wheeled ing tuktuk vehicles to the game that no one has asked for or even cares about. Fix the real issue that is killing this game DESYNC. I'm so ing sick of prefiring on people that don't have full health seeing tons of blood off their body just to be killing instantly then watching the death cam and seeing that somehow none of my shots hit or that none of my shots even registered. I'm sick of getting shot when I'm blatanly behind cover and seeing players lag around everywhere. I used to think the audio in this game was great now I can't even tell which way the airdrop planes are coming from I've heard players that were behind me sound like they are infront of me. This game is dying if Bluehole actually cared about the progression and life of this game they would fix the issues that they players are asking (begging) them to fix. We don't care about new weapons. We don't care about new vehicles. We don't care about these "tournaments" and "invitationals" that are complete ing jokes. Fix the desync fix the audio ing region lock if it's necessary (which it is don't kid yourself). FFS get your together.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Alright time for a revision to my previous review. With more hours under my belt and plenty more matches played I can give a more accurate take on my opinion of the game. Overall it is a fun game to play when you want to feel pressure and stress or have fun if you play with friends. The gunplay can be good except recently I find that some guns seem unreliable in the departments of damage accuracy and actually being counted when you hit your target. When you play on the new map make sure to pick up the QBZ as soon as you find it it boosts your chances of winning tenfold. Miramar is still the worst map. Server ticks seem better than before with a few hiccups here and there. This season pass they've added is a huge attempt at cash grabbing don't buy it if you have even the slightest amount of common sense. There was a fit involving their anti cheat where innocent people got perma banned myself included. I was well compensated with in game currency. The crates that have the best loot are still locked away behind a pay wall which is another attempt at cash grabbing. The 7.62 revolver oddly still requires three to four body shots to drop an unarmoured opponent even when the first shot deals nearly half health with the follow up dealing half that amount of damage. This was tested among some friends of mine recently so I do have some evidence to back the claim. All together the game still needs work still needs to not just be a cash grab when the game costs thirty dollars more than its largest competitor of which has a name nearly identical to the term used for a period of two weeks. I don't recommend this game because as the consumer base we need to take charge of developers. We have the power to conform them to what we want not the other way around. This does not mean the game isn't fun I just think we need to help the devs understand that we are the ones with the true power. Only then will true change that can improve the longevity and the experience in game can occur. (Also Miramar)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's really remarkably fun. I'm not a fan of the whole "Battle Royale rip off" genre but this is probably the best you're going to get out of it. THAT BEING SAID it's not worth $30. I was lucky enough to get a lot of money at once and already have enough friends playing it to make it kind of worth buying. Two potential game modes on one map is not a $30 game and I sincerely hope they don't try to raise the price when it exits early access. I'm actually looking forward to seeing what comes of this game and hope that some day I can change this downvote to a hearty recommendation.UPDATE Thank you developers for making your game actually worth its asking price. Like decent people.

review: Very addictive. Unfair in places due to lag and desync but even if it was the "full game" it's still not nearly enough to call it a serious issue at this point especially in todays mmo climate. Maybe not as survival based as one would hope but it's still harcore enough to keep you coming back... aaand back hahaha. Casuals beware this might be one of the easiest games of its type as far as battling the elements and getting copious amounts of loot... but that's where the gravy train ENDS you will be hunted down fast with little more than a footstep giving away your exact location so it's not noob friendly at all. If you are knew to mmo battle royale keep out the way in the woods till you are 10 games deep and dont puff your pants when someone aproaches is the best advice for newcomers. Learn your nades fast as the stuns and smoke will help you more than anything. Be wary of takinnng advice from youtubers saying punch oor shoot windows out while the bomber flies by etc... as if I see a broken window and a house full of closed doors then there will be a cooked nade cooming through the window and rolling between yoour legs. My looting skills are terrible and this game punishes that. The entire UI and looting system is made to be seamless and rapid but I'm getting caught out looting due to not playing enough of these games recently. I'm looking to get super fast on the looting side on this game so its with me on all future games that's not a gripe or a negative in my book but just so you know it will severly punish slow looters if you parachute in at a base or high loot area. BTW&gt &gt Frying pans are OP... If you're empty handed or even toting a pistol and you see some loonball running at you with a frying pan then you need to Forrest Gump it NO EXCEPTIONS!! Overall 10/10 for op frying pans alone D
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I review PUBG... I am not reviewing the Dev or the twitch community.. just the game I paid about 30 dollars or so for... and that price point is important because F2P games are getting better and better... onwards. FUN gunplay believable bullet drop decent selection of guns to loot GAME SOUND has great bass sounds of bullets whizing by and directional for good headphones.. I LIKE! First person ONLY modes make this much more tactical and competitive if desired but 3rd person available ADRENALINE fueled Decent community... 350+ hours on my record and I enjoy queing with randoms stillBOTTOM LINE If you enjoy a first person shooter experience with the mix of loot teamplay and the ability to talk crap to a defenseless enemy with proximity chat before you dump a round into their forehead BUY THIS IMMEDIATELY.

review: Has potential to be greater than what it is now if they would put time into fixing the major bugs everyone is talking about. For the type of people playing this game they expect it to be semi playable instead of dying as soon as you land because of network lag. I could go on for hours about how good it is but i could equally say the same for how buggy and bad it is for such a popular title right now. who knows it could just be another fade because so many lose interest becasue of this very reason or it could keep going strong for a very long time. Its up to the devs on this one... If you do end up buying it i hope you have alot of patience dealing with the ingame bugs and in general.

review: Amazing. If you have ever played Miscreated just imagine that but an arena style game instead of open world. The map is huge and should be with 90 100 people per game. This game requires actual skill and stratgy so for all you COD or battlefield players out there this isn't for you. The only downside to this game is the fact that it requires a good system. Even on low I can only hit about 60 70 fps. But with other games i hit all the way up to 250. As a side note alot of asian people will join the lobby(not racist) and will just scream into their mics china number 1. 10 out of 10 would play again. Go IGN.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Me and my friends play this game alot. It's really fun makes me salty as hell and I usually end up getting a few laughs in every match. While I definitly reccomend buying it here's what I question the most. 1. "WHERE ARE WE GETTING SHOT FROM??!!"2. *Shoots person point blank with shotgun* They survive 360 noscope 420 blaze it and kill me instantly with a P1911.3. Jump punches remind me of Mike Tyson's "Punch Out". You will die if it actually connects.4. *Bails out of car moving 5mph Blood covers the screen and nearly die.*5. Motorcycles are a trap hitting an ant at 70mph will cause the bike to flip several times and spontaneously combust.6. It takes nearly the same amount of time to pop a few painkillers than it does to inject yourself with whatever is in a med kit.7. Trying to shoot someone through a window? Your AR willl have no effect on the the windows little trim thats always in the way.Don't let any of that stop you from buying this game ( it's usually what makes me laugh most ). It's best played with friends IMO.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) is a great concept game. Mixing survival/scavanging with team elimination combat makes for excellent gameplay. There are still bugs in the early release which causes lag and glitches in the early match. When you start with 99 players what do you expect? Even being outnumbered and sometimes losing quickly I keep coming back for more!

review: Finally.It's been months and they had yet to release anything impactful. Now? Finally SOMEthing.I can finally say I'm happier with this game. I don't die because of random glitches or freezes the interactions aren't as slow or tedious and overall it's finally getting trimmed up. I'm excited to see what future updates hold.This game still makes me want to jab my eyes out but overall I enjoy the ever loving out of it.Plus I'm rather pleased to know that the game has gone through it's row of filtering cheaters. I have run into plenty and they have definitely gotten their just desserts. Thus far over 25 000 of them have been reportedly banned from the game. It's not too bad but compared to plenty of other games it means a lot to have a company actually caring about the fairness of the game (whether or not the game runs like .Battleye keep doing your thing.Game on ers.

review: I don't review many games. But here is my review This game has been very fun you start out on this small starter island at first you may realize a lot of players talk a lot of junk. You can go around and test out weapons and the controls before the match begins each match will start with 90 100 players on a plane and each one gets to chose a spot to land in order to loot different guns and equipment to stay alive. The game outlines a white circle shortly after landing that you need to be in otherwise you die so depending where you landed. It could be a make or break situation desperate scramble to find a vehicle to get inside the white circle. The time begins to count down and a blue circles comes in and rounds up players into the white circle after that the circle gets smaller and smaller until you are the last one standing. So now you know the gist of the game is it worth it to you? To me it kinda is the game does lack in features although must give it that it is a early access game. In reality there aren't that many weapons and equipment to chose from there really isn't much. As far as vehicles go there isn't much of a variety there are only things you can drive not things you can fly. As far as modes go you get to choose either solo duo or squad. There are no different types of games only the one unless you try custom. The map. The map is great... only for a while. You get sick of it they only give you one map when this game could do so much more with more variety. Optimization you've gotta know if you get this game you should really get a solid state drive and make sure your computer is beefy on my computer i can run almost anything at medium settings but this game with simple graphics? I need to run all low settings. The game can glitch a bit sometimes and give you unreliable speeds depending on your system again this is early access and they need time to fix that all up. Overall this game is good fun I do actually like this game you can be sneaky stealthy and hide really well or be aggressive however you want but in terms of features we are very limited at the moment there honestly isn't that much at all. At this stage we have no idea whether new modes or items will be implemented within the game. This game is worth the purchase but its for sure still in develoupment.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There should be a warning on the splash screen for this game. *WARNING ITS ADDICTIVE**JUST ONE MORE GO IS A LIE*PUBG pits 100 ish players against each other on a small island and the last man standing is the winner. Its a simple concept but so well orchestrated that it does have you going back for more and more.You start the game in a plane before parachuting out and steering yourself to a position on the map. I love this bit where you can watch people just tumble out of the plane... everyone of them looking around them at the other skydivers and thinking about the fact that every one of those other people is a player who is out to kill you on this small island. As soon as you hit the ground you go scrambling for equipment. Now this can be frustrating as sometimes you will end up super equipped with no other players in your vicinity before you go out hunting or there are times you land with a group of enemy circling and find yourself not with the 8x Scope sniper rifle but with a frying pan and a pair of fingerless gloves.People say the game is repetitive but personally I find every play to be completely different and equally rivetting!You can play the game as a single player duo or squad and it is great to team up with your friends and go into battle co ordinating your jump and landings to be near each other. You also get the option to play the game in either 3rd person or first person perspective. The 3rd person perspective has the option of switching to FPP if you so wish.All in all a good game with a strong following. Give it a go and you wont be disappointed.. unless you find yourself sporting a frying pan instead of that SCAR L.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PREVIOUS REVIEWUnfortunately even as an early access game this wasn't ready. It is basically unplayable. There is a very common glitch where the world won't load and you can't move or interact using your character. I ran into this in every game I tried to queue for and I have really high specs on my computer and I can't get it to load the world. Poorly optimized and not worth the money yet. I will check back in the future however because the game LOOKS cool it's just unplayable. Others are reporting terrible crashing and lagging issues if they can even play the game. I understand that this game is early access but this is way too much.P.S. Loading the world takes 2.5 GB of usable RAM at the best of times and 4.5 at the worst.NEW REVIEW Since the game has been optomized significantly better I am comfortable saying that I will recommend this game. It is fun and addicting (and also frustrating).

review: The game is some of the funnest I have had in several years and I really enjoy playing it specially when you have friends running in a duo or squad. The game itself is making strides into fixing the lag issues that arise while it's fustrating it's still playable and the lag only jumps in randomly. There are glitches that are steadily being fixed by the developers which I appreciate. The one map that is always played is becoming a little boring but because nothing is ever the same it keeps the game interesting with these notes I give the game a 4.5 star.Now comes the part of the review that makes this game a lackluster 2 star review. The cheating has gotten extremely bad head shots with shotguns from 4 5 houses over people jumping from vehicles and headshotting entire squads and nothing is being done about these cheaters. Hopefully the developers are going to run an anti cheat very soon and all those players get perma banned. If not this game will die as fast as it was made.

review: I think this game is pretty great. I hear claims of hackers from other players but I don't see many of them. I've probably ran into one once probably. Aside from that it's really just players being good at the game. As for an actual review The game has a good sense of balance with the tiered weapons and armor and playing with friends makes for a more tactical game. There's not much to the game aside from the one map and options to either play with friends or by yourself. However because of the large scale of the map and the procedural generation of the weapon spawns each playthrough is different. Definitely a game worth 30 dollars especially if more content is on the way.

review: First ever comment...So I stopped buying new games because I was constantly disappointed. A girl at work told me about this one and just kept going on and on and on... OMG she can talk a lot...Anyway finally she said if I didnt like the game she would pay me back for it... So I am out 30$ because this game is great...Its simple to understand and play. Nothing too complex but still fun. Get supplies find a backpack to carry it find weapons and guns and ammo get add ons for the guns (sights stocks etc). survive. Thats it...Very difficult to be a camper because the map keeps shrinking... Longest game time I have played is between 30 40 minutes and that was me finishing in first place...good graphics easy controls and just plain fun.

review: In it's current state the game is fun but overall I must recommend waiting until some of the obligatory early access cancer is cured.Firstly the game runs terribly on lower mid range hardware. I have a Computer from 2013 that is not a modern horse but it's not bad and I constantly get micro stutters and freezes in mid combat that make the game unplayable. I cannot explain the number of times my screen has just froze after the first shot I've fired in CQC situations only to show the death screen a half a second later.Also in 3 out of 5 matches the game is unbearably laggy and stuttery for the first 15 seconds 2.5 minutes of each match. The buildings sometimes completely fail to render in. I can't chalk this up to my 15 megabit internet connection. Other games run flawlessly. I'd also estimate that 3 out of 20 games just freeze and crash the game completely. The loading screen times are abysmally long and often I can hear the game going on around me but have a loading screen plastered in my face for 15 30 more seconds.Relevant Specs i7 4770 GTX 760 2GB 8 GB RAM 1TB 5400rpm HDDNow that I've ragged on the game for its early access buggy flaws I'll rag on it for some very awful game design choices that have nothing to do with the early access status.1. The squad knockout mechanic This mechanic is absolutely game breaking at times. Killing lone players outright but giving squad players the chance to revive their teamates infinitely without any healing items is moronic game design. I cannot explain the number of times I've gotten in a firefight with two people in a building and knocked the two of them out a combined total of 4 or 5 times. This mechanic makes ranged combat a joke. It should be removed outright. 2. 3rd person camera This mechanic introduces a problem that is nothing new to 3rd person shooters PERISCOPING. With the abundance of buildings rocks trees and cover a person can hide completely out of sight and use his 3rd person camera to look around corners windows walls and gain extremely unfair advantages. In dense urban settings the game really turns into a periscoping cess pool.3. Adamantium Body Armor Body armor is ridiculously overpowered to the point of allowing someone to survive multiple sniper shots to the torso without consequence. Just get behind cover use a medkit and you're ready to survive another two shots to the chest. Body armor should only be able to reduce the damage of at MOST intermediate Assault rifle cartridges like 5.56x45 and 7.62x39. I've had people take two shots to the chest with .300 win mag from the AWM just by healing in between shots. Again this makes ranged combat pointless in many situations.Conclusion With all this being said I have had a plethora of fun times in the game. I've found myself being frustrated too much by all the things mentioned above to keep playing it. Maybe in the future it will improve but for now I cannot recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have never played a shooter type game on PC I mostly played WOW and D3. I picked this up after seeing some of the reviews and game footage on Youtube. I played maybe 10 games and killed only 1 person but yet I am having fun learning the game controls and the differences in weapons. I know this game is still in Alpha but I have figured out a few things that I would like to see in the final version of the game. 1. More maps but figure that is going to come. 2. A spectator mode after you die option. 3. An ability to split Casual vs Ranked (experienced) players. I know most of this will probably be included in the game. Just my two cents. I recommend this game if you are tired of BF1 or COD.

Updates and tweaks regularly just keep making the experience better and better. Great job by the team for bringing a more fleshed out survival battle royale experience to the table.

review: Great game and super fun if you've got a team of friends. The game doesn't run that well but I've been able to stay above 60FPS by dropping the settings down so it is definitely playable on a weaker system (I've got an RX 470) and will only get better as time goes on. This game sets a great example for what early access games should be. The devs listen to the community and are updating the game frequently with new content and optimizations. Check out some youtube vids and streams if you're on the edge but I'm sure you'll love it. I can't stop playing! Pro Tip Stay away from big cities and popular areas if you keep getting killed within the first few minutes of the match.

review: Love the game itself heres the issue. After spending huge amounts of my time on this game to get my first pioneer crate for 700 coins I finally was ready to open said crate. I was surprised when an error appeared that said "Failed to open crate" I thought that this was simply due to lack of connection but when i went to click on the crate again i found that it had dissapeared completley. After accepting this loss I then put in more time and attempted to get the second pioneer crate for 1400 coins. When I tried to open this crate it also dissappeared. I understand that the game is in very early stages and there are bugs and glitches to be expected but this was extremely annoying as i put in a large amount of time to get the crates. While there is no doubt that I will continue to play the game I will not be purchasing anymore pioneer crates.

review: first match dropped in picked up everything died.second match dropped in.. decided to drop as soon as possible.Spotted a guy drop about 10 seconds before me so that gave me roughly... 1 minute to prepare if I was in another building before having my head blown off.I was anxious to get the show on the road... he spotted me fleeing a building got me in the leg *ouch*I ran into a bathroom and slammed the door armed only with a p250 so was he from what I could hear.I peaked open the door I had the upper hand as I could peak around corners and knew he was behind me outside there were no windows on that the backside. I waited he flanked me from the other side and shot me in the face... 3rd match I dropped again asap.got in a really nice house with loads of attachments for my UMP45. Suppressor compensator extendo clip. The works.Heard someone downstairs...*hehehe*Decided to let him know I was here."I'll find you and kill you"I ran away like a hid behind a door then decided... ok well I have 30 seconds to flee and get to the white circle.I ran downstairs and shot him a couple times before he dashed up a flight of stairs."I can wait"I said calmly.*I coulnd't wait*I moved slowly to another side of the room knowing full well he saw me before in another spot.He moved downstairs likely to make a break for it thinking I had left. Prior to him coming down I slammed a door and walked forwards and backwards slowly faking him out.He came down. I shot him in the head.I took his things.Sprinted to a nearby town found some good loot and a motorbike. Bike was out of gas got shot at. Hid behind a tree... we traded blows for a while. Then I peaked too much and lost my face.10/10 would drop again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is the sweet spot on the spectrum of arcade ish to competitive.I give it a good 9.9* out of 10.*Number may vary depending on how long they stay in early access and on how much they update and optimize.* These are the things that told me that this purchase was worth it. It's competitive aspect due to its relative realism and good physics. You can press shift to move faster while crouching or prone. i/ At first the game being unplayable in a very short time has moved to playable. You can't jump out of a car at 80 mph and shoot someone with a shotgun and take no damage. Even though I have a 750ti the minimum being a 660ti the game has run really well and looks beautifulMy hopes for the game. Optimizations netcode improvements that don't stop coming till they can shrink the minimum sprec to a gt 720. That this game gets out of Early Access before Half life Three comes out.. Devs continue to listen to thier community. More content no DLC. To buy H1z1 at this point would be a waste of money. Save up extra ten and buy this rollercoaster of a game.

review: This game has many bugs optimization problems and cheaters. Plus new battle royale games are coming out consantly and they all do the things that PUBG wasn't ablle to achieve. And with Call of Duty and Battlefield battle royales coming out later this year it is going to be a lost cause for Bluehole to try and compete with these huge companies. However there are two things that PUBG does better than every other royale game tension and friend play. When I play Fortnite or Realm Royale with my friends it doesn't feel like we are actually fighting for the win together and it instead feels like we are competing for kills. It also feels like we are solely pushing for the win and we forget to have fun altogether. In PUBG there is nothing better than sittign in a room with your friends listening out for footsteps while having a fun casual chat in the meantime. Unlike the other games there is just something about PUBG where I just want to chill out and talk with my friends. Secondly the tension in PUBG is unlike any other game. In other games ou feel like its okay to die because you can respawn with new people and pick up from where you left off. In PUBG all the kills and loot that you've acquired makes you want to win so itr doesn't all go to waste. I can literally feel my heart pounding and my fingers numbing when it gets down to two teams. If you're looking for a game that delivers strategy tension and good times with friends than this is for you.

review: It may be in early release have some hillarious bugs but its addictive and a relatively "complete" game. Lets get the initial bad out of the way. I've got 10 hours in and only a few obvious things that jump out. Movement glitches and bugs you have to "jump" over ankle high fences and walls. If you time it wrong you're jumping on the spot and probably about to die to the guy aiming to kill you. Car/Bike mechanics drive too fast hit a minor bump and your car is going to do a barrel role. Grenades... oh how many times I hit a wall that is NOT where the red line is saying its going to go. Bullet Drop? I've yet to fully figure out how the mechanics of ADS are suppose to work with zeroing distance. Sometimes I'll get a headshot other times it feels like the bullet lands at his feet. Shrugs I'm marking this as a bug as it doesn't 'feel' consistent.Now onto the good.BATTLE ROAYLE! That is all. Seriously go watch some Twitch Clips of good moments.If you jump out the plane at the start go for the main building on your planes route and land with about 10 other people. Unless you are the lucky guy who gets the gun instantly the armour and all the ammo you are going to die. Very fast. Alternatively you're gonna get some kills and have a frantic start to some thats fun.I've found a bit of strategy and some basic tactics go a long way in this game. My reaction times have gone down hill over the last decade I'm no longer the cometative gamer who can out AWP 99% the player base on Dust2 in CS 1.6 / Source. But I still have map awareness movement use of cover and in this game. It pays off in in the bucketload.Yes there is still luck involved in what you find in the houses you first raid. There is also luck in wether you choose the right/wrong time to come out of a building if someone else is nearby with a better gun/scope/ability to aim.But thats the fun of it. I've played about 20 games now solo. Thats not a lot but i've got a 20% top 10 finish and 1 win under my belt so I'm doing ok in my book!I still haven't bothered to figure out what guns best for what occasion what part of the maps have good cover/los. How long it takes to run across a grid reference full pelt etc.. the stuff that differentiates me from the great players. But with time I think anyone can get into this game. With more time you'll learn the above and inherently get better at the game. The best bit You can't "CAMP" and win. You can Camp early on and get a kill or two but the second the 'zone' appears you gotta start moving. It forces you to move unless you are insanely lucky with your initial drop. It pushes you together and then the funstressy times begin.Final Thoughts.The Frying Pan is the best body armour ever https //clips.twitch.tv/CheerfulPeacefulPassionfruitDBstyle

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: SPECS I7 4790K GTX970 16gb ram Z97 MB Average FPS 58 Low FPS in high density/laggy areas 24 Highest FPS 76 (In other words here you should probably have a beefy PC that isnt barely cutting it) CURRENT STATUS OF THE GAME Overall PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is very much in early access. This game has been in development for some time but it is still VERY early.Pros Better than H1Z1. Even in its somewhat laggy and new state it is still more fun to play than H1Z1 KOTK.Very fluid and good movement. Inventory makes SO MUCH SENSE THANK YOU. You will find yourself used to most controls etc. within 5 games which is insanely nice. Also the gun mechanics are very familiar and forgiving and the game treats players who use first person with respect since third person aiming is a bit off.Map is well rounded and is a great size.Cons LAGGY. Dont expect to play a single game without a bit of lag courtesy of slowish servers and player load. Also the optimization in highly detailed areas is pretty awful. The red zones will lag up your PC very hard so not only should you avoid them (but theyre random) you also happen to lag inside of them... Fun stuff.If you have a controller plugged in it will vibrate when you get hit or die etc. If you unplug your controller mid game to stop this it will pause your entire game and screw you over. Currently there is no off button in the game options menu to turn off controller nor is there a controls menu for the controller which doesnt make sense. (I use mouse+keyboard but use a controller for other games that require/are better with a controller)NO HITMARKERS. This is a huge problem since at longer distances or in darker areas you cannot tell if you hit someone since it only spills dark blood.The sounds in this game are AWFUL. I mean they are the WORST. I have a 7.1 surround sound HyperX Cloud II headset and there is NO specific up or down sound whatsoever. AT ALL. You wont even be able to tell what story a person is running on the sounds are so bad. The sound distances of weapon fire are also horrible.Vehicle Jump and Bump physics are basically Battlefield 4 but the vehicles will always tilt in akward directions and flip over. This is a bad thing if you want to try and escape a red zone because you wont be able to go full speed on any surface (even the roads have some bumps that can screw you over).Welp. As of 5/8/17 I can very clearly say I cannot recommend this game to ANY solo players really at all unless you want to rage until your head explodes. You may win one game... out of 20... if you get lucky enough to not have any glitches or lag or crazy car flipping happen to you before then. This game is a TERRIBLE solo queue game right now and the lag along with bad hitboxes make this game frustrating to play. Want to win a solo game? Just hide in a shed for 20 minutes and you will be all set...Also what the actual hell... You cant hit people in water its ridiculous. Ive played two matches now where I have seen someone swimming and have not been able to hit them in the water even when my shots make the water right above them splash. This is a stupid thing and NEEDS TO BE FIXED NOW. There are CRATES that DROP in the WATER and you CANT hit people swimming. It sucks. Current state of game 3/10 Solo Queue (High Likelyhood of glitches lag and terrible sounds make solo queueing a nightmare even for people who have good headphones)5/10 Duo Queue (Better with a partner to cover your back but still not a fun experience when one person dies)6/10 Squad Queue (Best game mode for this game your squad will have sights in all directions making those bad sounds insignificant. As well more action per gunfight and higher risk in cities)5/8/17 Re Review (I just cant recommend anyone looking to solo queue without some friends to be able to play with to get this game) For this game to be fun (and funny when it glitches or you die in stupid ways) you need some friends to play with. Otherwise the SOLO queue aspect is absolutely GARBAGE.

review: Think H1Z1 but with competent game devs and this time it's actually fun. This game is Amazing. Whether you play with a freind a group of friends or solo you are still bound to have a good time. This is a perfect example of a battle royale stlye game done right. The adrenaline rush you get from being in the top ten is unrivaled by any other game I have yet to play. Other than being a perfect example of a battle royale game done right this is also a perfect example of an early access game done right. Unlike every other early access game this one has competent game devs updates that actually fix problems in game and developers who listen to the community! For example the community says they don't like the current jumping mechanic in response to that the game devs show us their progress on the new vaulting and climbing mechanics. It's so rare to not only find game devs that genuinely care about the players and the community but that actually listen and implement their feedback into their game too. Overall for a 30 dollar price tag this game is a bargain and I definetly suggest you pick it up if you are able to. Thank you

My game 4 time out of 10 when loading into a match will crash on the splash screen2. Random crashes out of no reason in game3. General performance issues (this is much better now after recent updates though)4. My freind was constantly getting a crash every time he would exit out of a matchAppart from that its a very good game it is definatly the best and most fun of all these battle royal games. Gunplay feels smooth and has some meat behind it loot for the most part feels consistent ( a few minor cases of bad loot spawns). Would recomend to anyone looking to get it if they can look past the current bugs that are in the game because of early access.

review: Do you have too relaxed life?Do you want to be a little more paranoic?And mostly do you own headphones?If all answers were yes then you are ready to start with this game.100 people including you are thrown onto an island. Not actualy thronw so you can choose where you land. Then you run around looking for anything that shoots in worse case scenario you try to avoid or beat to death other players before THEY can find any weapon.After this part random part skill based start you check map wheater you have to run fastest as you can to the safe area or you chose well and dont have to move at all. In first case you run or drive if lucky or other players where so kind and did not shoot thru every car wheel they saw before they left. If you are already in the safe zone its even worse. There are probably more people than just you and they all want more loot same as you. You are before a dilemma leave your safe spot looking for loot risking being shot at or stay there and being shot a little later.You deside to leave and cear up. You find something you really like and feel invincible.. at least for a few secs. Then you realise a lot of people did the same. Your ears and eyes are you biggest friends atm you look for a slightest movement or sound. You scare yourself a few times but thats expected. You continues to smaller circle. You happen to see someone having the same strategy as you but left his building just moments before you. You shot him into his back. He falls and dies instantly. You feel good you sadist. You grab his stuff and continues on your jouney into the white.Thats it only you and several other people. You chose a spot for camping and if you are lucky you wont have to move until the end. You have to move in the next minute. You have to decide once again if you will move immediatly or wait and risk not being in time but having nobody in your back.. most probably at least. You decide to wait. After few moment you decide not to wait and move forward.Thats it you moved and now its you and only few more people you scout the area but see noone. You hear shots constantly. You are ready with your upgraded weapon. You see an enemy. He is shooting. Somebody dies and he hides behind a tree. You aim and wiht three quick shots you kill him. You feel great. You hear shots. And you are dead. You feel sad. Just two trees next to you was somebody hidden. You finished 3rd.You are proud but disapointed that you made mistake.You try again and you also die in first minutes you try again and again. All attemts worse than your first one.But you keep trying until you get to the last 3 people again....... and then you get shot again.Solid 5/7 would try again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I waited for far too long to buy this game. In summary it does everything about right. For my part I didn't buy because of the reports of poor performance and in game cheating. I can now attest that it works fine on my bootcamped Mac and I have seen no evidence of hacking. I have been killed a lot in circumstances that seemed a little to quick but I am sure that was because of my lack of ability at FPS and not cheating. The game is much more strategic than you might think. The best players only need to kill one or two players per game to win. I have got to the top four and am gradually getting better. The game really rewards careful play and practice. If your rig is up to it go for it and enjoy.

review: Tons of fun insanely immersive. One of the few games to actually make me jump when I was shot. I could easily reccomend this to anybody with the system to run it. The optimization isn't the greatest at the moment however it does seem to be getting better as time goes on. Quick note make sure your directx and visual c++ 2015 is updated correctly. It could cause you a nightmare to deal with if it isn't. There's a host of bugs and a memory leak that could make some systems crash. The devs are very aware of this and are vocal with what they're fixing in their patches. Remember if you see the argument about paid crates don't let it worry you. Most people dive onto the island wearing almost nothing and trying to scavenge their camo just like they do with their weapons for the added immersion. Paid crates will help generate new money for things such as tournaments and esports broadcasting. Just look at how well Dota2 and LoL are performing. Pitting 100 of the best players against eachother in a match would be quite the spectacle

review: Very much worth the investment.For those of you who play DayZ this game should help you stomach the bitter taste in your mouths left over by that ridiculously underdeveloped mess.PLAYER UNKNOWN while at first can be very difficult to get into you will quickly become hooked and discover that the combat and organic gameplay is very rewarding.The gameplay structure goes as follows Jump out of a plane land loot as fast as possible kill whoever is nearest by loot more find a car escape the gas head to the centre dieWhile the game is addictively fun and puts an engaging spin on the modern survival shooter there are some major issues the Devs need to address1 The plane is far too loud people cannot hear eachother's mics when waiting to drop2 The gas cloud is far too quick it moves at approximately double the running speed therefore if you get stuck in it and cannot find a car you can pretty much be certain the rest of your playtime will be chasing the safe zone and using up all your health supplies just to die when it moves again. SLOW THAT SH!T DOWN3 Bullet damage feels a little unbalanced It seems like 10 quick fire rounds to the chest with an Uzi simply allows the other player to line up a headshot without so much as a stagger (Aka the game is rather unforgiving in expecting accuracy but hey some people love that)4 More loot sure the weapons are well balanced but a larger variety in assault weapons explosives and clothing would be nice5 Car physics even Princess Diana would say the vehicles in this game are deathtraps6 OPTIMISATION it runs like mud through a sandbag even on all lowest settingsOverall PLAYERUNKNOWN is well worth the investment. It's fun intuitive and there is nary a dull moment and as soon as they fixed the aforementioned issues this game will transcend into something much greater.

review: Would have been such a fun game ( Went through the trouble of buying windows and running it through bootcamp deleting almost everything off of my computer. I did plenty of homework 8 straight hours of research clearing space purchasing and installing Windows 10 on my mac only to jump out of the helicopter and have my game crash 5 straight times at 3AM. Turns out I ignored a major detail. AT LEAST 6GB OF MEMORY(RAM)! I only have 4 on my Macbook Air some how the "Genuises" at apple decided that anyone who purchases a Macbook Air would would never be in the market for more memory. I have hit an unsurmountable and non refundable wall. About $250 bucks spent after purchasing an external hard drive a windows license the game and redbull to keep me going all for nothing. Shouldnt of gotten a Mac. I do not blame the game nor its creators and I still highly reccomend this game. Just make sure you know what you are purchasing and if you computer can handle it before downloading and then complaining that the game sucks and you keep crashing. review: I already hated bluehole as they're devs and Playerunknown himself is more than a bit of a They just released an apology saying what they've done wrong and they'll try to fix it but it probably won't be happening. They also just decided to sue the guys behind fortnite Epic Games developers who update frequently and make new and meaningful additions to their games. I don't even like Fortnite it's not my style of a game. Bluehole has been pretty open about their dislike of fortnite because of it's similarities and Bluehole can't seem to grasp that they can't have the sandbox to themselves. (Kind of ironic since pubg started off as a free mod like DayZ)The game is fun with friends but a lot of things can be fun with friends. Stuff is still wonky shooting is entirely random and physics bugs are still around and rampant with vehicles. It is a fun multiplayer experience and I prefer the gameplay over fortnite's but Bluehole is terrible.It really is a shame that Bluehole and to a lesser extent Brendan Greene had to be the ones in control of pubg. Under most other devs this game would be amazing.

review: I have had to change my review from positive to negative. When I first got this game it was a lot of fun. Simple mechanics some minor problems and a lot to look foward to. Today there has been very little to show for progress. Yes there are two maps and one more on the way but second map they added was garbage and the third I have yet to play. It seems the devs spite their overwhelming success with the games launch and the amount of profit made from it they have decided that the loot crate system was more important to monetize than focus on the games lack of content.Although I have yet to play Fortnite the devs have shown more dedication to making their games experience a priority than PUBG even with a similar cosmetic system as PUBG. It really doesn't help when PUBG is suing EPIC GAMES over Fortnite over the fact that Fortnite was more successful than PUBG. Yes Fortnite is a ripoff or PUBG but PUBG is a ripoff of Battle Royale the movie and you don't see them activily going out of the way asking for royalties for their product from everyone else.There was time when this game was fun and great but the devs have become nothing more than profit driven and love to hate hate on people who copy them because sticking people inside an area and hiding weapons on the map and making them fight to the death was their original idea and Hunger Games and Battle Royale totally didn't have this idea first. In anyway I think Fortnite will eventually overrun this genre of games and eventually the entire genre will blow over in about a year when the next fad comes out. It is sad to see a small humble dev team become like almost every tripple A dev team out there and money has become more important than the passion of making their game.

review: PUBG is overall a fun game but is has some problems in its current state poorly optimized performance buggy animations and server issues come to mind. But if you can make your way through all of that what you'll find is a highly suspenseful and rewarding battle royale shooter where each kill feels like you've earned it and each victory makes you feel like a god.The way I see it there are two ways to play PUBG Going for the win and going for kills. If you try for one it's not likely you're going to achieve the other. In my opinion going for kills is much more fun as you spend less time camping and more time in gunfights. Yes your games may be shorter and you aren't as likely to win but killing another player and taking his loot is extremely satisfying. There are some players (mostly Twitch gods) who are just beastly at the game and rack up kills and wins. But that is a very difficult thing to do for the average gamer since you give away your position every time you shoot.

review: great gameThey are trying their best on cheaters and I can see that as long as their is valuable items there will be cheaters.The game has gotten way better the optimization is better then ever. The servers still need some help but they are trying to fix it. Releasing on Xbox is a mistake though.Fortnite is quite a diffrent game I like PUBG and Fortnite equally.Fortnite is more a game I would play when I was bored and not trying to focus on just the game itself.PUBG can be very intense and the rounds are a bit longer then Fortnites when playing PUBG you must have to focus on only the game and watch your surroundings carefully. PUBG is harder to learn and more tactical then Fornite.Updates for PUBG make me want to keep playing and I look forward for all the fun updates to come but they must focus CHEATERS. They should have server admins in the lobbies and maybe should even create their own cheating system to detect hackers and report hackers more efficiently. ATM 7.5/10 and when they get rid of cheaters 9/10(Also I heard a region lock was on its way pray to the lord)

review: I am writing this review as a formal resignation from PUBG. My very last match I drifted a Dacia into the front of an oncoming enemy Jeep. Bullets flew cars flew bodies flew. The end screen had me with three kills from the enemy squad in the Jeep and my body flying accross the map. I have decided that the previous events are where I will peak in PUBG and since there is no possible way I can improve I shall have to stop and move on to improve my skills again. I am fully satisfied with my time in the game and feel that playing any longer would be almost robbing the world of my time. There is no conceivable way for me to enjoy this game any more than I just did and would like to personally thank the developers for the heart attacks cereberal edemas headaches laughs cries break ups and all other events inspired from this game. Seriously. I broke up with a girl playing this. How much more value can you get from a game. Bluehole Thank you

review: This game is really fun but oh boy is it buggy. As this is an 'early access' game this is expected however a number of these bugs are not only game breaking. But just logic flaws by the devs allowing very easy cheating.But how!? There is anti cheat?Well for example today my client failed to load the modules for the houses. Allowing me to tell my teammates exactly where weapons are and other players. (I disconnected ofcourse as I want a fair game) but when a normal bug can trigger this it means that everything is drawn even when behind walls. Allowing wall hacks etc. This is extreemly poor for a game in '17 (devs read up on ray casting). Same with the foliage turn them to low so other players can hardly hide..Then again the game is fun and I really hope they adress these issues for now I'd give it five out of seven!

review: Great game runs well for early release. Definately a little stressful when someone is hunting you down or vice versa for your first couple of rounds. Multiple game modes for team play is a welcome bonus changes the game entirely to have some friends have your back. Devs are doing a great job with fixes. Final product should be a block buster. For diversity in the current gaming arena I give it a 9/10. Once the performance issues are fixed theres endless fun to be had. General consensus on game modes.Solo play Stressful man huntDuo Mad max mode/loot and runSquad Search and destroy

review: This game gained it's fame from streamers and not so much the actual compotence of the game itself. It'd be fun to play with friends when you're drunk and can ignore the infininity and beyond problems that the game has Pros *Lots of guns*Tiers of armor and weapons*Vehicles that feel pretty good to drive*Armor in this game has a noticeable advantage*Firefights aren't too long and they aren't too short. They offer response time.Cons *The game is very unstable. When I first bought the game I wouldn't even be able to load in before being parachuted down to a bunch of other people who had the same problem as me. No PC problems it was a game problem. Cool. Seems to stop after an hours worth of trying.*FPS Drops like nobodies business for absolutely no reason guess you should restart 20 minutes of progress because you couldn't react in 1 fps (another game problem Ark and GTA don't even have these problems for me.)*They seem to be very money hungry. Instead of fixing the game up they expand onto mobile and release new content this is paired up with content that can only be bought. These keys are more expensive than a FTP game like LoL in which a key can cost $1.25 but these losers want $2.50. I wasn't even interested in it when I noticed something interesting . . .*As a newcomer you can be easily tricked into wasting credits. You don't unlock clothes normally they want you to unlock it with RNG so you look like a ing disaster until you're a veteran or have spent money. (FTP system.) Special boxes that you unlock with credits can't even be opened without wasting $2.50 or so with absolutely NO disclaimer. I don't want to spend money on a game that I've already spent money on.*They are using FTP techniques in a game that you had to buy in the first place.The problems with the game are just so overshadowing that It's difficult to say I'd play longer than an hour. It's frustrating and the devs have no intention to fix what isn't making them money it appears to be.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Even with it's problems...this is still the best Battle Royale option available imo. I don't care for the building aspect of Fortnite and prefer the tactical style of play in PUBG. Additionally 60hz tick servers are on the horizon and should improve the gunplay further.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can't support a company or a game that actually thought it was a good idea to threaten lawsuits on other developers. Almost as lame of a thought as If Mario tried to sue every side scrolling game ever made. Get over yourselves cucks.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As you can see by my playtime I've played my fair share of the game. I loved it. At first. But it has been letting me down so much lately that I would rather have not bought it.First it's full of bugs. Small things like physics not displaying till the hit boxes not being in the right place. But lately it's has been game breaking bugs like disconnects game crashes and the likes.What finally made me delete this game was the anti cheat service BattleEye.I'm playing on a machine that I work on also. BattleEye now disconnets me for having a disallowed program running. Which is VMWare Player and Workstation. I will now have to disable my VMWare services everytime I want to play or uninstall VMWare completely. Not going to happen. I uninstalled this game instead.Supposedly they found a hack which they could not detect but was run from a virtual machine so they just blocked all virtualization software. I'd like to know what they do when they have a headache? Cut of their heads?Do not buy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

You just need to realize that there are cheaters in every game and it's something that needs to be done by PUBG with its anti cheating system. And it's not every time you die you die because of cheaters. Just admit that your skills are still not there yet not to mention a lot of people out there (including my squad) have killed cheaters before. There are losers cheating and swearing in every server regardless of nationality. Racists are as bad as the cheaters and both deserve to be killed in this game.

review: The game on its own is acceptable for 30 dollars assuming your PC doesn't turn into a personal heater. The gun play has some rough parts but nothing that ruins the overall experience. Luck and RNG definitly exists as they will always play a large role in Battle Royal games but there is still a high skill cap and the better player will win most fights. Lootboxe$ do exist but they don't affect gameplay and can be sold in the market. There are also extremely few games that can even approach the levels of stress and exitement that come with being in the top ten survivors. The game is just an overall enjoyable experience that gets amplified with friends.My main complaint is that the company that made PUBG just seems lost and childish. After all the money they've made developement is still slow and emphasis seems to be placed on squeezing the most money they can out of their players before the game dies. Also sueing another company for creating a more succesful clone is like a child getting angry at an adult who was influenced by one of their 1st grade macaroni arts and crafts to create a massivly successful art piece. If they truely wanted to be THE battle royal game they should have created a masterpiece that everyone played and stayed ahead of the competition not relying on lawsuits to get their way.TLDR Game is good company is bad
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm not a huge fan of multiplayer games but this game is doing it for me. I really like that it has essentially taken Dayz boiled it down to its most essential features and given you a task to perform. The length of matches is perfect (about 20/30 minutes). It's also really fun to play coop! I can't remember feeling such palpable tension as I feel when I get into the top 10 in a game before nor have I experienced the satisfaction of winning rounds. Definitely a thumbs up.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is for more or else AWESOME.They have done same thing here that will keep getting better and better and keeping pulling in more and more player base. For a early access its close to be done! Still got some work here and there to do but it is the funnest game that i have ever played never a dull moment always something new that happens. The thrills and spills in PUB is amazing.These guys can only get better and better they need the support from us as players our feed back and input matters to them and that is something Great!!!.I wish PUB all the best in the future!!!See you guys on the Battleground!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Still haven't figured out how to run and when you are running and turn slighty it basically stops running and it tried to side step.When using a sight or zoomed in for aiming it is VERY sensitive.The game is still one of my favorites but for now I will not be playing with a controller.

review: Pros Game is incredibly addicting Graphics are pretty good if you're not running on a potato Gameplay is fun and easy to pick up on Has the potential to be something seriously amazing Developers are actually working on the gameCons Take these with a grain of salt it is Early Access... Sound is sometimes buggy especially when entering the plane Graphical assets sometimes take awhile to render in Some matches you won't see anyone until the end of a 20 30 minute match No real customization menu or reward systemAll in all I think this is a great game that has a ton of potential. It's addicting nerve wrecking and just hard to put down. I wish there was more of a reward system for cosmetic items but that is something that could be implemented later on this is early access. The developers seem to be cranking out updates and working on the game which is promising. Help support the game and give feedback and make this a great game!!!!

review: DISCLAIMER LOVE/HATE REVIEWPlayed the game religiously since launch Despite not having the best top of the line computer i suffered through the countless optimization and stutter flaws of the game. Has there been t glitches? yes. Has there been times in which the game is literally unplayable? yes. Did i still enjoy every moment prior to the most recent update? absolutley. However with the game going P2W im afraid that this masterpiece is falling down the same path as H1Z1 and won't hold its tread for too much longer. This game is fun but it's not worth spending even more than the initial cost price for microtransactions in an early Is just pittiful. I sincerely hope that something is done about this in the future if so i have absolutley no doubt that PUBG can hold it's title as the best selling steam game. Until then this br&gt Tl Dr Microtransactions suck they're milking their cash cow and it's pathetic.

review: TL DR PUBG was once a good game now it's worse and it's only going to go downhill because their priorities are in wrong areas.During the beginning the game was amazing. It was what H1Z1 hoped for. Good gameplay an okay optimization and the fair amount of bugs. Being that this was an early access game and it was a W.I.P. me and my friends expected these bugs. We played this game thinking it would only get better and we would love it. That is clearly what is not happening. It's been almost a year since they released their early access game. Has much changed in terms of connectivity gameplay mechanics and optimization? Yes. But let me say not all of them are in a good way. I'll start with the good things. The optimization has gotten fairly better I achieved a decent 60 70 frames pre release and 100 110 post release on my 1060 on medium settings. However the connectivity has gotten worse. Early access I would maybe lag out once every couple days while my friend for the other part lagged out once every 10ish games (We got through maybe 40 games per session yeah we have no life.... we both got 400 hours in 2 months... even while playing other games). But it wasn't to a point where it's intolerable. Now I lag out once every 4 or 5 games while he sometimes can not even load into the game. The point is the latency issues have worsened. The same can be said for gameplay mechanics. The hit registration and driving mechanics are just plainly put horrible. From personal experience I have rage quitted from headshotting people with level 1 2 or even no helmet with a kar98 and they survive. The driving mechanics are just as bad. Driving along the road could get you killed now. Sometimes just out of nowhere you will flip your vehichle and send you flying into the air and landing in an explosion. Instead of fixing all these issues you know what PUBG decides to do? Put in more crates put in an "event pass" which is a straight copy from the battle pass. Which makes absolutely NO sense. They're sueing Fortnite for copying them while they go and do this? I don't understand Bluehole right now. I absolutely loved PUBG at one point. I hope they realize what they're doing is going to hurt them in the long run and focus on actually fixing the game.

review: March 2018 Don't trust the shotgun's.Jan 2018 The new patch broke the game. The game freeze's middle of the gameplay sometimes to me and other players. I couldn't pick up my teammate sometimes when they are knock down and they also haven't fix the disappearance of your teammate name on top of the players head and sadly it leads to friendly fire. The only thing they fix is shooting through the fences. I'm sorry to say but this game is not finished. It should be still Alpha. They only lied to the consumers that it is completed because they wanted sells on December on for multiple consoles. Even though i appreciate of the making of this game but I'm going to have to thumb it down now the game is not finished. It's still Alpha and they need to let the consumers know.Old review ( Jan 2017) Still a great game. They just ban 1.5 million hackers. Which that is really great but they still got hackers every once game out of 20 games. New map is okay..... it's buggy and you can't shoot through the fences. Hopfully they will patch it soon..... and also adding the climbing skills made this game even better but some odd reason they removed the weather effect map's from the original map. I feel like this game should be published as "Alpha" and not fully released. I will say wait for it on sell or you wanna show the developers some love get it.Old review ( Dec 2017) Great game only problem hackers and the game is still being develop because of funds I assume. I recommend wait til their update on December 2017 and see if it's really worth to buy.

I have a pretty good conputer and don't have issues with FPS. My only annoyance is the server lag (sometimes). Some games I get in and takes like 2 seconds to open a door. This game definitely is an adrenalin rush though. Can also be very frustrating at times. A lot of the frustration comes mostly from me being new to PC and will occasionally do stuff like hit R to reload instead of E to switch my over the shoulder view that has gotten me killed numerous times. Overall good game that I recommend.

review: I haven't played too many hours in this game just like majority if not all early access games its got its issues to do some bugs and some t moments. They have released creates that need keys to open i can see the worry behind it as H1Z1 seems to fcked up their game cause of it but the devs have said that the money raised through the creates and keys will go towards events etc. Which in my opinion is a good idea.I personally dont care about the current micro transation as it is only clothing that can be obtained however i would not like to see this game having strange fcked up skins for guns that glow.In the end i would recommend this game i find it fun and i feel like with the constant updates you are unlikely to get burned out.But thats just my opinion agree or disagree with my thats your call.
