review: Update This game is made how every gamer wants to be treated. The developers are SOOOO progressive. It seems every thing we complain about in the game seems to get a patch fix every few weeks. There will be little things we wish were there or not there ... and poof ___an update starts ___ bam!! half of our complaints gone ... these guys are listening to thier audience and are doing a great job!!______________________________________________________Original Post This game is solid ... most pre access games leave me in terribley buggy situations. This game in general is very stable and very playable! The feel is like DayZ but with a much faster constant combat playstyle. The controls are easy and smooth and combat is very satisfying. People are saying framerates are low and unoptimaized what people are complaing about I can relate to (mildly) I have a GTX 1060 im running the game 55 70 fps on ultra where as my little brother is running this on a old CPU and gtx 1050 and still gets 55 70 fps on medium to high. Sure its not running 120fps like my other games do but this is what you get for a 30$ game made by an unknown company in early access.Pro's Play solo duo or squads of 4 no pay to win mechanics fast paced strategic minor customization!Con's/ Things that need fixing Grenades are clunky and take way too long to utilize in most situations especially for thier low aoe damage when playing in duo/squad helping kill other players with your team gives little to no assistance points Overall I am very pleased with where the game is at right now. Just a little bit of cleanup and polishing and I think its in a good place!!

review: very fun/addictive gameplay lack of a quick requeue option at this time can make death sometimes frustrating. But matchmaking is pretty fast.This is still early developement and there are various performance issues affecting lots of users. Personally i find myself having to wait a while (up to a few minutes) after first dropping into an area or after a burst of fast travel particularly as of the latest patch not doing so means lots of brief stutters in gameplay interupting otherwise smooth fps. However optimisations are ongoing and devs seem to maintain good contact with their playerbase so this doesn't affect my review much to be expected in the early days.Do buy this if you want a well populated shooter with solid core mechanics (gunplay movement and looting mechanics are well implemented thus far). Don't buy this if you want release quality performance with a GTX 980 i7 6700k 24gb ram and on an SSD I only consider the game playable after the first few minutes loading time and this is only with graphical settings relatively low (very low or low except view distance which is on high)Hope to see vastly improved performance before release with that exception I'm pretty happy with this $30usd purchase.

review: Okay I'll start by saying this I love this game I really enjoy playing it especially if I'm with my friends. I don't care to play this game solo (nothing wrong with that) the solo gameplay is great though. Other than the annoying kids online (easily muted) this game is really fun. For people who complain about the "skins" which you can buy they aren't mandatory h*ll almost none of my friends buy them and even I don't. So if you are going to knock this game because of the micro transactions maybe you should learn how to spend your money better. As for streamers being all powerful? I can't say for positive if that's true or not. But overall I would rate this game at least and 8/10 there are some bug issues in the game but they are constantly working on fixing them when they get reported. Full conclusion I like this game more than H1Z1 and that's saying a lot since I fell in love with that game very quick and still play it occasionally

review: 3/28/17 The rules are simple but the gameplay and survival tactics you choose are what make this game so damn fun to me. I'm extremely impressed with the fluidity of a game that's still early access and I'm hoping the devs continue to make it even more reinforced and smooth and in the future if they choose to make microtransactions make it appearance related ONLY (like rocket league). Other than that I see a very bright future for this game and would certainly reccommend even at it's current state.Pros Smooth movement Graphics are georgous Gun mechanics are realistic Easy to pick up control scheme at least for someone exposed to PVP games Have had a 90% positive experience with the communityCons The audio is sometimes misleading Random frame drops (I usually have 60 90 sometimes it drops to the 30's) Occassional lag and you don't get to choose your server You won't get much sleep because you're still playing this game )

review: I really enjoy playing this game and I cannot get enough of it. I have played it for 4 days now and even though I am not as good as those who have been playing for a while I have been able to win 2 times. I have read many other reviews and have read about many people getting banned from forums for speaking their minds and even the game itself for breaking the no stream sniping rule. I will continue to support this game until I am banned for stream sniping as getting banned for this without proof seems to be a common thing. If I am banned for that then I will most likey update my review but so far I love the game and I am excited to see where they take the game. There are micro transactins in the game but there are so many other games out there that have them as well so I cant see why its any different in this situation.

review: Game does NOT remember game settings so after every single game you have to reselect solo squad whichever youre playing and if it was first person or not eventhough you JUST played a game with the exact same group of people you have to go through that every goddamn time. Pathetic. One of the worst sounds ive experienced in a shooter game. And im talking about the direction you get shot from to where people are moving its the worst ive seen a dude two houses away from you on the second floor sounds exactly the same as a guy on the same floor in your house. Someone shooting at you DIRECTLY from infront of you can and often sounds like its coming from behind or side or quite literally from the sky its just that bad its the worst of the worst in any fps ive played the last 10 years. Shooting is kind of precise so thats actually sort of well done good for you. Kind of fun with friends absolute trash alone. Better with beer. Overall overpriced pile of 4/10

review: EDIT A few 100 hours of gamplay later and a few months later the game has turned to event and battle passes has been added 10 dollar weapon skins too many stupid lootcrates. the only good thing is the decline in hackers but they are not fixing any buck but just adding things they can make money on. The new map is complete t with broken mechanics unfindable door t unbalanced weapons and no care put into graphic design while my computer has to work fulltime to render it all. there is 0 optimisation whatsoever. im really considering to uninstall until this game goes off of the money hungering path the developers have taken.Obviously this game needs a lot of patching and developing. In my experience this game almost runs on your harddrive alone. it was spinning full speed and nothin in the game was loading. if you wanne be able to play this with decent FPS buy an ssd or you'll be having a bad time. furthermore as you probably read in all the other reviews there's alot of streamers that report and ban paople without reason and there have been a bunch of hackers lately. I hope alot of this will be fixed soon the game is still really enjoyable but we're not like "there" yet for this to be one of the better games ever made. but there is an open road ahead.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is fun but it has turned into such a cash grab. The loot box system has gotten a little ridiculous. You can buy them with in game currency but the catch is over 90% of the time you have to pay real money to unlock them. I have 20+ loot boxes that I won't open because I refuse to spend over $40 to unlock them. I understand it is totally optional to pay to unlock them. But at least give me an option to unlock them with in game currency. Or put keys for the locked loot boxes in the unlocked loot boxes. Again fun game but also annoying to see how it has evolved over time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Cons Pug Squads have been invaded by Chinese folks who's idea of a good time is dying in the first minute after drop.Chinese have flooded the NA channels and do not want to play as a "team" plus noone can communicate.Many pug squadders have no mics. Some of the snipers are a bit too strong imo.Last couple circles you become a dirt and grass farmer. Not very fun but it gets chicken dinners so were stuck with it.End of the day a bunch of hilarious and awesome youtube content has been created with PUBG. It's a fun game with a decent community. Lots of good memories in matches thus far!Side Note If you are reading this please pass this on and adhere to it. If you are playing public pug squad don't be a potato no mic using jerk off. Try and play as a team make some friends some folks will insta add you if you play well. To the DEVS Put in an option that sends a duel request out if in a final 5 or 3 situation. If accepted by all everyone loses everything but gains a frying pan and chicken dinner goes to the last one standing with the frying pan! That would make the final minute or two so much more special!

review: At this stage the game is very raw and unfinished. Despite the early stage basic vehicle and gun mechanics are established well. Shooting is made realistic and fun and the 3 level gear system adds to the overall experience. Suprisingly looting is not a boring process allowing a player to get prepared for the upcoming firefights. I would recomend this game only if developers continue to improve it with better mechanics and new features. It is annoying at times but overall a great exiciting game everyone should try.Close quarter combat is laggy and unfair.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its a fun game but you spend most of your time walking around getting gear to only get killed 10minutes later without even shooting your gun.... Played four hours so far and I was only able to shoot at 3 people other times I don't even see who killed me. I've only played squads so in solos its probably 5x as worse there. And theres only 1 map so it gets very repetitive or you drop near the edge of the map to realize the zone is on the other side and you can't find any vechicles. If you have a friend it probably will be a better experiance but when I hop in with a random squad most of the time only one of them has a mic. So if you're looking to buy pubg just beware that the gameplay is very very very very slow or you drop in and you get insta killed because someone found a gun before you.

I play a lot and generally do very well but it takes forever to earn it. Second if we're going for realism (and I know this won't happen) but bullet penetration would be a big plus in my eyes. Third MORE GUNS!! Lol I feel so limitied and it gets boring after a while seeing the same thing over and over weapon wise. I have a bunch of other ideas so Ill edit this over time with more. AMAZING GAME &lt 3 KEEP UP THE HARDWORK AND DEVELOPMENT!!

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is currently my all time favorite survival shooter game. Now it is in early access so there's still a ton of bugs to fix. On my PC the first few games once I load in I have issues loading textures e.g. buildings. Which is irritating but that could be my computer. So I suggest having a rig that can handle this game because it's graphically demanding. Game crashes every once in a while but the game makes up by being a lot of fun. Crazy things do happen and every game is different which is why it is so unique. I suggest the developers try to optimize this game before adding any other features so everyone has a fair shot at winning.

review: I haven't played this game for a while now about 2 months to be clear. When I played it today I've been greeted with enormous sized mini map which took about 1/4 of my screen. Constant fps drops on 1080ti rig. Laughable recoil system which makes the gun in your hands act like your character has an epileptic seizure. The reality of this game is that if u shoot any number of bullets higher than 3 shot bursts u wouldn't hit a stationary target on 10m range since recoil system in this marvelous game is random. This and numerous netcode/ping related issues make this game a pure 'masterpiece'. Even joining the game is painful u are greeted with stutters opening the main menu and the loading screen. Seriously this game makes my head itch after just 5 minutes of starting it. Don't get me wrong previous version of the game had the same issues and I've enjoyed it a lot to be fair it was expected from the early access game. The implementation of in game transactions and constant flow of updates which include maps and new guns without the major bug fixes are killing its player base.Edit WTH is wrong with the sounds even after setting it on max it didnt' change in decibel.

review: It was a good game for the first couple of months. But there are some major problems with the game after a long time of the 'Updates' that they have rolled out.1. Hackers are still abusing the game and runing the fun. Simple wall hacks and aimbots are being used to destory the game and those people gain money from hacking the game from this way.2. Updates. After all of the updates the game has had PlayerUnknowns has lost its most important concepts and also destroyed its origionality. These updates sure have made the game looked better but by doing this makes the game somewhat unplayeable in most circumstances.3. Viariety. There is no other alternatives in the game. Yes they are releasing a desert map but other than that what else is there? Same old weapons same old map same old game type. No diffrence.4. Logic. There seems to be none of this. Driving your car through a flat and open field suddenly lose half your health due to a small lip in the ground which could make no diffrence but sends your car up in the air and explodes on impact. Really?Im not ultimatly slamming this game and or attempting to destory its integrity but it is a very boring game after a long time of playing the same thing over and over again. It does have some good qualities on the other hand.1. Unique. This is a one of a kind styled game when it came out and has some very well done parts in the game. The area is detailed greatly and the weapons made and calculated in a really good mannor.2. flexibility. It is great for multiple ways to play and land with friends. Many options are made and the assortments of challenges that you can do with friends is immense.Although it is a fun game i would not reccomend buying it until the programmers have fixed the issues with minor details that can flip people of and fix the reporting system as many hackers are out there and in lobbies destroying the integrity of the game. PlayerUnkowns BattleGrounds is virtually unplayable with the immense amount of hackers that exist in the game and they will ruin the fun that you could be having.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pubg you've probably heard all about it and you should be hearing about it. This game is FUN on lots of people complain about optimization but I have no trouble my pc is on the cheaper side but I can run 1080p high settings 60fps smoothly in the normal game (unless there's network lag). In the test servers its not nearly as clean rubberbanding is common at the beggining of each match and the game crashes once or twice every five hours HOWEVER the desert map is fantastic and a blast to play and explore. I would say playing it with a friend is what really makes the experience worth it so try to squad up with people you know but if you can't the randos aren't awful and the community is less cancerous than most.

review: Pros The concepts/ideas the game has that makes it stand out from other battle royales are great. Variety of weapons/equipment Well designed map Quick to get into matchesCons Tons of bugs/glitches Shooting/Melee can be terribly broken Extremely unoptimized so even with a powerful rig you're not going to get great fps and expect big drops Driving is really poor/unrealistic Server lag is prevalent in most games at some point or anotherConclusion The game is really fun especially with friends but still very very unfinished. If you like well made polished games I wouldn't recommend it. Only buy it if you're ok with a game that needs a lot of improvement.

review: This is not a fun game. I suppose if you like constantly dying to some idiot camping in a room or getting sniped from a billion miles away it's a hoot but for people with any kind of self respect it's simply not a good game. It controls like a wet sponge sluggish and barely responsive. It's ugly as sin. I spend more time sitting in lobbies waiting for games to start than I do playing the actual game. I can't understand the hype around it. I guess it's like heroin. You watch helplessly as your loved ones get hooked and eventually you lose contact with them because the drug got 'em. PUBG is a drug. And not the fun kind.

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a great game the most fun I've had in years on a certain game. There are a few set backs though (as expected it is an early access game) but there are even more pros to getting this game.The servers at the moment are terrible I gotta be honest with the ones wondering if they're going to buy the game or not.It isn't the best optimized game but has gotten better over the past couple of patches.The amount of fun you get from playing this game is unreal it can also be really emotional as well. The sudden gun fights will put you on edge. The adrenaline when you're in the top 10. The happiness when you get greeted with that Winner Winner Chicken Dinner! Or the anger/sadness when you're the one being killed in the last 2 remaining.The graphics are really good for this game but do take a beefy computer to run them.Overall this is an amazing game and I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to buy the game and are unsure.

review: I don't like this game I never like this game. It's glitchy random and in order to win there's a lot of hiding/waiting around. The optimization was abysmal for the longest time but I tried it recently it's been fixed. However unfortunately it's the same gameplay you'd expect from a battle royale.I can see why it's popular though... If you manage to get a good position find some good gear and have a competent team you can absolutely ROAST other players. Usually you just shoot them and they can't even fight back. But that happens so infrequently that usually you're just chasing the dragon.Finally after sometimes hiding 15 20 minutes in the same spot with no action the radiation circle moves in and you have to move closer to the center where one of two things will happen 1) you will be killed and never know where you were shot from2) nothing at all...The game has varied gun types scopes magazine and other attachments frying pans (for some reason?) grenades vehicles and different graded gear. But unless you're a mastermind strategist with a lot of patience you're going to have a bad time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I stoped playing this game due to the fact that other better BR games are out and run better (not fortnite). I also think this game will die with other better BR games coming out eg BO4 Blackout Mavericks Proving Grounds and Rings of Elysium/Europa so I have no motivation to even considering redownloading it. But heres some features that could improve PUBG OptimizationsCompetitive SeasonsRaniking/Leveling SystemFaster paste maps objectives/ Daily challengesBetter AnticheatStop thinking the BR genre was your idea

The addition of the First person only mode added a new level of difficulty to master but it has also made the game more fair for players who do not like to play in third person mode. Developers are constantly fixing the bugs as they arise usally providing quick patches every week I also like that they keep adding new weapons and other content to the game. Can not wait for this game to offically release.

review: Durring its development phases this game was a bit glitchy and very laggy with poor optimization. Now that it has been fully released within one update almost all of my problems vanished. I wasn't experiencing a huge ammount of lag or fram drops though a few times it did crash but not for long. I gotta say I am not a huge player of Battle Royale games but man let me tell you this is one hell of a fun game if you don't play like a wuss. Though that is a draw back to this game if you want to have fun you probably aren't going to win very much. though if you want to win you probably won't have much fun unless you like to hide around for 15 minutes waiting for something to happen. In conclusion its a great game that I like to play and others might as well.7.5/10

review: I have 230+ hours now in pubg and I mostly play squad or duo with friends.Despite the fact that it is early acccess it is really enjoyable and we are having a lot of fun.Yes sometimes we just quit for a couple of days when a new cheat hits the market as on those days it is unplayable but imho Bluehole reacts pretty fast so it is not a big deal and we can play other games until. Usually within 2 days max they clear these stuff from their servers.Also despite they had a huge success and had a lot of sales a lot of new content is on the horizon I am looking forward to which means they takeing care about the game.Glitches are getting fixed continously. This is important as some people seem to overreact this part on their reviews and not taking into consideration that the game is early access.Overall it is a great game with great experience. Until the team is taking care of new wave of hacks each time i do think that is neither a big deal.

review: The first impression of this game is not really that good. You will have no idea where to go you will fail to gear yourself and you will probably die from a direct punch in your face or get killed by the out of playzone area.However if you don't give up if you dedicate some of your time to it you will notice that this is one of those games that looks really simple but it truly has so much more to offer once you get the hang of it. It's easier and more fun with friends. The game keeps you on the edge it doesn't get boring and it kind of teaches you on what to do and what not to do on the go. Most of the things you will learn the hard way. For the price this is a really good bargain.

review: PlayerUnknownsBattleGrounds is a very fun game even though it has a lot of glitches and bugs i can get past that the rush you get when the circle get continuously smaller and there are only 5 people left keeps me coming back and its even better when playing with friends all the people that say you need a god tier pc to run the game properly to be playable is wrong im using a intel core 2 quad Q9400 and a GTX 650 and 8gb of DDR2 ram i get about 15 50 fps and average 30 sure it limits how well i can play but overall its playable so don't not buy it just because you saw a review saying you need a good pc and that there are too much bugs because really you don't need a good pc and probably the most noticable bugs are buildings not loading in right (which i'm pretty sure is more of a proccessing power issue more than a glitch) and your vehicle occasionally blowing up when you land too hard. Don't let these t reviews discourage you from getting this game unless of course you actually find a reasonable negative review that actually states facts of course.EDIT yeah its kinda unplayable now xD i need a better pc
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Has promise but until Brendan Greene gets his finger and wallet out of his and focuses on improving performance the game will soon die once a better funded more experienced studio gets to grips with the genre. Pure lag for the first 60 seconds of a game makes the initial fights which should be most fun and exiciting utter pot luck. Not even close to being ready for official release yet they ported to Xbox just in time for Xmas funny that isn't it. Clowns chasing the almighty dollar instead of improving will hopefully backfire when a decent Studio who care about quality get involved.

review: I was hesitant to buy this game 3 months ago but quickly fell in love with it. There are tons of great concepts about this game and with each patch it gets improved. Even the short amount of time ive been playing its night and day to how to the game preforms since when I first started. It has a very steep learning curve and is extremely hard in the begining. No aim assist each gun performs different love the ability to have different play styles (rambo or more strategic) finally getting your first chicken dinner is an amazing feeling. Watching yourself improve throughout the weeks feels awesome. Yes it still has a lot of tweaking to do as it has its glitches and annoyingly loud bombs every 5 secs but its just an awesome game with so much room for improvement still. Over the last 2 weeks my love for this game has ended its just not playable anymore. Tonight after about an 6 hour session ive finally had enough. The game is just full of hackers now. over the last 2 4 weeks ive seen suspicious shots on me that i brushed off as luck or crazy skill. getting headshot from 2 400 meters away by an AR that was shooting at fully auto. It happened a couple times but tyically not more than once a night. I shrugged it off and kept grinding. The last 2 nights of playing tonight specifically it has gone from the occasional macro abuser to just blantant hacking. getting shot by people through walls through trees i mean they arnt even pretending anymore. The game allows replays it has deathcams it shows them just standing in building and auto fireing through the wall then bam player has killed me with a headshot. 99% of these hackers and macro recoil users all have chinese names too. its not a coincidence. The asian invasion on NA servers are just too much especially if most of them are hacking. out of the 6 hours i put in tonight about 20 games total. I was wall hacked by 6 people. auto macro'd another 7 times. I have all the recordings. Its absolutely ridiculous to play this game anymore. hackers will always find a way but when its to this extreme where literally 4 5 players in each game are hacking its just no good. Im done until it gets fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Literally one of the worst games ever published and it gets worse and worse every update. After the new map arrived the so called " fast royale 4x4 " i thougt i'll give it another shot. Well after just two rounds i uninstalled this crap again. Unplayable performance and the jungle seems more like a cartoon. The colours are literally utter Every green colour looks like it was made with neon green spraycans which makes enemy spotting almost impossible.As i see it BlueHole was like " Well we get so much hate for popping out so many lootboxes how about we make a map to shut them all up? " Then they sat down for like 25 Minutes created this shitmap in the Unreal Engine and were like " Now let's troll these ers and release it not now but in 10 months ". Brandon Greenie " Yea and till then bust out another crate my dudes ". The story of Playerunknown's NotRelevantAnymoreGrounds.But this is just one out of many problems this game has. The launcher looks like a free to play game the loading screen doesnt even support higher resulutions than 1080p ( results in black borders right and left ) ESL tournament ad banners are everywhere and the performance is the worst ever.

review: I've had my ups and downs with this game. I love it and I hate it fairly equally. it can be fun and dull at the same time. It can be joyus at the same time as being infuriating as is life with a game such as this I suppose. However my feeling's right now is 'meh' genuinely. I apparently cannot find reason to put this game down despite enjoying other games right now I all ways find myself throwing at least one session into PUBG yet I simply cannot recommend this game right now. If you are craving a battlegrounds game then yes this game will scratch that itch and then some. But currently this game has let me down too many times and has disapointed beyond belief at times that to say "Yes i recommend you buy this' would be a p*ss take imo.It has it's fun moments. It has a lot of annoying moments too. But probably one to keep an eye on for the future for sure.

review: Very fun to play especially with friends. That's what i said when i buyed it but many things have changed. The developers now only care about money they introduced a ton of crates that can only be opened with keys and also these crates have the highest chance of dropping. To make the matters worse if before a key could've open every type of crate now there are 3 types of keys and with the same price 2.5 euros. Also the game is going to worse because the game still even after almost a year out of early access it isn't optimized. BLUEHOLE FIX YOUR DAMN GAME AND AFTER THAT I'LL CONSIDER GIVING YOU MONEY TO BUY SKINS. They also have put a new map SAHNKOK and at least in my opinion it is a very bad map it also quite resembles the FORTNITE map. And don't get me started about the ing lag on the new map. The game was better with only those 2 maps it had before MIRAMAR and ERANGEL 2 maps that were preety stable and now with the new map the game feels again like in early access. I really hope that the devs will pull their toghether cause i like this game more than i like other BR games but i am afraid that this game will die and all the money and progress me amd other players will vanish only because BLUEHOLE is in my perspective AN INCOMPETENT COMPANY THAT S IN FOR THE MONEY INSTEAD OF DOING THIS LET OTHER COMPANIES TAKE OVER YOU INCOMPETENT PIECES OF

review: This game is amazing. It has great graphics it's fast paced gameplay(if you land in populated areas) as well as fun to play with friends.But there are a few downsides the game is quite glitchy which makes for frustrating deaths. Ex. you think you're in cover but than it glitches/lags and moves you out of it. I know it's still EA but its quite annoying dying like that in top 10 20.The game needs to be improved some what in closed range combat as well shots that should be hitting don't even at point blank range. Even if you have a shotgun it really doesnt matter usually the first to land the first shot wins.Other than minor things like glitches and close range combat the game is amazing. I enjoy it even with those frustrating deaths I would highly recommend the game to anyone.Anyways have fun and I'll cya in the BATTLEGROUNDS! (still need my first chicken dinner )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The gameplay can be solid for sure. The drive to finally win a game is quite compelling to be honest. It took me around 40 hours to finally win a game. After that though I still haven't played a single game. It just felt like after trying for so long and finally winning you lose some of the motivation to keep playing. I had high hopes for this game but seeing that now they plan to remove any way of aquiring cosmetics for free upon full release is absurd. I understand if there is one crate that costs money to support a tournament or whatever but at the same time there should be multiple free alternatives to spend in game currency on. I would absolutely hate to see this game go in the direction of CSGO (a game that has a "loot" system that I absolutely despise). With only 1 actual gamemode currently there won't be any feeling of "progress" or "reward" for your time investment if you can't obtain any cosmetic items without spending real $$$.

review: It showed potential in early access to be one of the best battle royale games. Now unless they optimize the game and fix the reacurring problems (hackers bugs directional sound issues etc) then save your money for now. It's not a bad game but as of right now I wouldn't even justify the 30$ price tag until they fix their for once. They are happy to sell cosmetics but ignore that base core of the game is broken and problematic the battle royale part.It's a solid shooter but from the RNG places where the guns will spawn resulting you in getting shot by a person that simply killed you because they had a better landing. While a highly technical shooter that requires a lot of skill to be good at there are parts of the game where it feels like you have been cheated and it has felt this way since early access. If you're thinking about getting this game hold off until they actually fix the core of the game.

review: PUBG ... Pros 1) Long sometimes stressful gunfights2) Multiple weapons + many attachments and random drops3) Teammates are generally reliable and responsive4) Realistic aiming + bullet drop5) Decent graphicsCons 1) Servers disconnect often and lagging + glitches still occur on initial parachute jump. (Started several matches stuck 1 000 feet in the air and I had to fall to my death each time...)2) The game auto starts you connected to AU or EU servers instead of A) The region you play in most or B) The region you reside in.3) Occasional hackers take the fun out of gameplay.4) The blue zone moves a tad too fast especially if you're far out. (Constant movement is key!!)5) ADS system is wonky and difficult to pinpoint a target and due to realistic bullet drop and gun physics it makes long range sniping near impossible without an incredibly steady hand.Graphics 7/10Gameplay 8/10Overall ... Great game. Definitely worth the $30.

review: I bought PU's Battlegrounds today after hearing about a lot of the hype around the game and watching streamers play the game so I decided to check it out since I've always been a fan of shooters. Going in I knew that there was a survivalist aspect to the game but I don't think I completely understood that survivalist effect on the gameplay. In the few matches I played I would often times run forever to the play area spend most of my time picking up items see small bursts of combat to get maybe 2 or 3 kills and then get killed myself and have to start all over. I understand that this is just personal preference but if you're a fan of shooters it doesn't mean you'll necessarily be a fan of PU's Battlegrounds.Also I like to play my shooters with an Xbox One controller (I know I know M + K vs gamepad but I do fine with a gamepad) and I found that this game didn't really work well with controllers. Even when I could figure out the key mappings for my controller in the Steam gamepad configurations it still was not excellent.Maybe I haven't played enough of the game but I requested a refund because I just don't enjoy the survivalist aspect of the game. I enjoy shooters in general but just not this game.

review: Rating is now Negative due to various reasons which I may eventually outline but honestly I probably won't because I really don't want to spend any more effort on this game anymore.Old (Positive) review below (January 2018) It's been a little while since I first posted my review and some things have changed. First off the game "released" in December. While there's still very legitimate arguments to the game not being ready for it's 1.0 release I believe it's quite close to feature complete. There's still bugs to iron out more optimization to be done and only 2 maps (made even less by the removal of the weather effects) but the underlying systems are functionally complete enough for me to argue for this game's status as 1.0.On the topic of optimization GREAT strides have been made since my last review. The 1.0 update brought with it months of optimizations which immediately boosted me to triple digit framerates in some parts of the maps and usually a steady 60 even in the most trying locations. With a Pentium G4560 Dual Core CPU and a GeForce 960 that's as good as I can hope for in a newer game.The hackers which I previously said was what hinged my decision on recommended/not recommended have been significantly reduced since I made my original review. Don't let this fool you completely there are still hackers. But I only get maybe a couple per week as opposed to the one every match back during the time of my original review. I still feel that it's a bit too high for my liking but it's definitely made great strides. The upcoming ping lock that they are planning on introducing should offer another large burst of hackers disappearing at least for NA/EU considering that many of the hackers were located in Asia usually belonging to crate farmers looking to farm BP from wins to get the lucky expensive item drops. There are still NA/EU hackers but they are a minority I feel.The ping lock is also nice because of it's primary function as well removing large ping differences between players. Extremely high pings can be very detrimental to the player who has said high ping but they can also affect other players' ability to take down that person which results in you getting shot around a corner you ran around 5 seconds ago or your own shots not registering on them resulting in them having extra time to take you down.As for the servers they definitely increased the capacity in order to handle the numbers they're now reaching (which has recently hit 3 million concurrent users nearly a million more than at the time of my old review and around 2 million more than the old servers could handle). There's far less connection drops and all around lag though the first minute or two of matches still often have delayed item pickup times which can be frustrating at best and deadly at worst.I think overall the game is still incredibly rough around the edges and could perhaps use a little more in the way of different maps or different environments on the current maps and needs networking improvements but overall it's in far better shape than it was previously and is currently highly playable. My current review stands at Recommended but I still say that with caution.Old review (October 18 2017) PREFACE The game is fantastic and I absolutely recommend it. It is the best Battle Royale on the market as far as the actual game goes. HOWEVER It has huge problems.First off The servers were not designed to handle over 1 million people. Which would be fine if we hadn't broken 2 million recently. The servers are hot garbage and the game severely suffers from that alone.Next up the main menu party system and general working ness of the game gets worse with every update. I don't know how but every patch they release makes the main menu more buggy and fail often requiring constant refreshing of the main menu (That that's an option at all already says things both good and bad) and making even getting into a game a complete hassle. Sounds are also extremely bad. Vehicles make no noise sometimes but other times run full volume while idling. In fact vehicles are just a host of new problems all on their own as they have difficulty navigating the map their one true purpose without hitting invisible walls and bad geometry ending up with you dead or vulnerable.But the biggest problem by far are the loot boxes. The funny thing is they're actually very consumer friendly so much so that they're actually too consumer friendly. Because of the ability to earn loot crates through simple playing of the game the fact that you earn more points by winning and getting more kills the fact that you can open said crates for free and the recent killing of AFK farming all combines to mean that there is a massive abundance of hackers all abusing various hacks to win games and earn a ton of points all for the purpose of loot crate farming for real world money. It doesn't help that it seems like hackers rarely get banned.The game is fantastic and I probably won't stop playing it for a long time (unless it somehow gets even more broken) but the servers severe bugs and massive hacker issues mean that it's rarely an enjoyable experience for long.This review will change to positive when at least the hackers are addressed even if the other two issues are still present as the hackers are by far the largest issue.

review: WATCH THE LINK IN THE COMMENTS! For the Beta PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS would definitely have to be a meh but I miss some of the old issues but for the game that is now after the 1.0#2 PC launch it's definitely a thumbs up now 1.0 was very laggy and the #2 update solved most of these issues. Framerate (fixed depends on what settings) Lag /Update 2 (Doesn't seem to be an issue now) Graphics (improved) Optimized map (terrain texture sea world effects UI elements) Decreased terrain loading time (Some issues with the Distance view still) Redesigned lobby background (it looks far better than before in my opinion but could do with an off option) Your last 20 matches can be saved and viewed from every angle you want (On update #2 can report hackers with out going to the forums) The second map its added (Miramar) with also 2 weather types (clear &amp sunrise but they have removed mist!) Vaulting it's added officialy and it feels really smooth (one of the most important steps still some glitches.) Off road driving is alot different (Now!) from on road driving which adds a more realistic feeling to the game and means roads are useful. Deathcam feature (Again great for getting the hackers!) More weapon balance/damage balance with the VSS welll.... Still yeah... Projectiles fired from firearms are affected by air drag and bullets now penetrate water (Best weapon is a pistol!) Improved mini map (First I hated and has grown on me along with squad directions! WOW!) Redesigned HUD (New #3 will make it even better!) and many more features coming and in the works like a SNOW map! I hope they add all new guns for that map only!. With the 1.0/#2 update this game is worth the money and will give you hours of fun with friend! (Ohhh Bullet proof pan also!).

review: Personally this game has made me hate the Chinese as an entire race but I'll take it within myself to move past that in this review.First things first you will be paying $30 for a steep learning curve battle royale game that has gracefully KILLED H1Z1 or any other battle royale game. That is ok though Daybreak needed a kick in the because H1Z1 is literally a hellhole now. Brendan Greene returns to the BR scene with this title that literally has more players than the 3 games below it in steam charts COMBINED(per time of this review being written). Granted I will cut reigning lords of Steam Charts CSGO and Dota 2 some slack where slack is needed. The majority of this playerbase is of course CHINESE. Gameplay First off you spawn in kind of a lobby waiting area both are different depending if you get Miramar or whatever the hell they call the Russian map these days. Old lobby has guns new does not but whatever that isn't a big deal considering you are only in the lobby for minutes at a time.Next you are spawned into the plane where only 1 side of your headset is activated through VOIP and you either hear A REALLY LOUD Chinese who are in internet cafes B People playing their music over their mic or C North Americans retaliating against the Chinese Insurgence using profanity and racial slurs all the live long while.After losing hearing in 1 ear you may choose a place to land you either drop somewhere where there is absolutely nobody and no loot or you drop somewhere where loot IS and hope you come out on top in that area against 10+ other players. You will die no doubt unless you have 50+ hours in the game. If you somehow make it to the top 10 congratulations because you will die anyways because when it comes to final 10 EVERYONE just lays down in the grass and waits for someone else to screw up good luck. You either die a hero or live long enough to become the villain or in PUBG's case die anyways to a Chinese more than probable hacker Pros and Cons Pros Probably the best BR game on the market as of right now 1.0 makes the game not feel like a clunky desyncy or just unpolished. Friendly UI now thanks to 1.0 1.0 literally SAVED this game Nice weapon modding system and OK inventory UI Gameplay is really intense especially with friends.Cons No region lock Hackers are becoming a HUGE problem 1.5 million or so accounts banned as I write this Game feels unpolished to some extent Miramar is literally running and waiting simulator No option to change name Microtransactions showing its ugly face in this now Takes hard work and determination to get to top 10 and not die Learning curve is a bit steep but do a ble Bluehole tried to sue Epic Games for "copying their idea" bluehole actually shut the up pleaseIn my closure PUBG has made me racist against the Chinese thanks Brendan. Brendan calls it racist and xenophobic to request region locks because he "doesnt understand why we think like this" Brendan you don't even play your own damn game dude.6/10 I've had my heart valve give out on this game before
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TL DRI'm not saying that PUBG is a bad game I don't think it is. However at the moment there are so many "features which would work really well if the game was finished" that I think it's time to address this as a warning to anyone who's willing to chip in for the EA. I originally gave this game a positive review under the condition that you bear in mind the downsides of early access and the fact that the whole concept is very frustrating. I changed my mind since lately the game seems to be running worse in some aspects.For one if you're not running this on an SSD it's outright unplayble. The huge map comes at a big loading cost and well if you're unlucky the match will start 5 10 mins before you finished loading. If you happen to get loaded any earlier you still get ed over because the buildings are not rendered properly so you may not enter so your better rigged opponents get about a 30 second head start so you get shot by those opponents after those 30 seconds. You can also get the holy grail in this which is not even the basic building placeholders render in which case you are guaranteed xray vision and bullets. This is just something you should know before buying in.Another story is sometimes not rendering said opponents. I have vast experience with flying into places with no other parachutes visible for at least 500 meters and getting shot by someone just seconds after landing. This can technically be mitigated by spawning in less populated (less loot rich) areas which in the long run is more frustrating than joining the meatgrinder because then you don't even get to shoot at anyone for the most of the game.Speaking of shooting there has been an extensive research done by player base on the weapon damage TTK and armor effectivity which you can learn from and utilize to your tactical advantage. This all goes down the drain in practice because the game often doesn't register the armor you're wearing or inversely the hits you land. I've seen blood splats coming out of my body even though no damage was taken. People kill guys with headshots and then take their level 3 helmets in pristine condition. There have been discussions about client side bullet trajectory calculation and I think it's currently the biggest open wound this game has.Another thing to consider is the sound design. There are people reporting they feel like they're cheating with a 7.1 headset for knowing exactly where enemies are based literally on footsteps and there are also guys (myself included) who have to turn 7.1 off because it's more confusing than helping. In flight simulators I can find a bomber hidden in clouds solely based on sound. Here I can't tell if a car is driving in front of me or behind me. Sometimes I get shot from the opposite direction than which the sound is coming from. (this actually seems much better now)On the acceptable end of the EA spectrum are bulletproof railing gaps wooden window bars and glitch stuck holes. Forgivable for gameplay once you get used to it. What's also forgivable but much more frustrating is the inability to peek over cover rendering most windows useless as a firing position. The absence of usable cover is complemented by the fact that there is essentially zero loss of weapon control/accuracy and player movement speed while sidestepping during ADS. This leads to close medium range encounters looking like a silly Quake match and not a tactical shooter. Only combat mechanic which particularly succeeds in this field is long range encounter which you will more often than not enjoy from the view of the sniped party since you are more likely to find oil than a decent scope...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's hugely popular and for many reasons. Most deserving of note is that the developers are capable of improving the game they really turned the game performance around close to launch (this might be due to the engine makers and not the game devs) and doubled the games content by adding a new map with its own vehicles and weapons. Similarly they added a custom vaulting system which works great and was an undeniable upgrade to the games flow. Outside of the improvements the game had a winning formula from the start. Rather than a shooter where you're in a little arena and death only matters to a scoreboard your life is precious and you don't have anything to defend yourself with as you are thrown from a plane. The play space is so large that scopes are game changers if you have one you can confidently kill at a distance if you don't have a scope you have to play sneakier or just be an aim wizard. Equipment matters sometimes good loot falls into your lap and sometimes you have to take down larger prey to pry it from their cold dead hands. No matter how you get it it feels good to have it I started as nothing and now I am a verified killing machine and that chicken dinner is gonna be mine.Where you decide to drop determines the pace of the match. Go to a popular area and you are gonna be in a slug fest that 90% of people die in. Go sailing off to the far reaches of the world and you won't see a soul for the first 20 minutes and the first you see will be fully kitted and no chump.There's also the confusing elements called luck and game sense and I can't tell the difference between them atleast in my gameplay. Some games I get 6 kills and win and it's because every enemy i ever shot was in their back because I just so happened to walk up behind every single one of them. Some games I shot in the head from an enemy I never knew existed. Some games you walk into 5 different firefights and you get a new level of ptsd from each one and then the god of war is the final boss and you lose all faith in your skill.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I gave this game a fair chance. I really did. At one point the game was really playable really good and really fun. At 800+ hours and 170 wins i have given this game a solid run and i feel im qualified to say its just a dissapointment that is slowly devolving into a cash grab.1.) Hackers. Since the inception of this game there has been a non stop plague of hackers from speedhackers wallhackers and aimbots after a year between beta and full release they are unable to stop this. Why is it that every other massive online game such as dota 2 CSGO WOW Runescape has managed to eradicate hackers almost completely but this game company simply just cant? PROTIP Its because preventing hackers earns them less money than banning them and letting them buy the game again.2.) Garbage netcode garbage servers and garbage internet integration in general. Since day one the game has been plagued by server issues servers disconnecting half the server for no reason planes force dropping all 100 players at once. Hit registration is notorious trash in this game ive shot at people standing completely still with 0% chance to miss at all and missed meanwhile ive shot at people who i KNEW i was missing when i shot at them and still somehow hit them. Ive seen people with no helmet get shot in the head with an AK and live with the bullet blood hitmarker directly on their eyeball (i have a screenshot of this). Looting still hasnt been fixed after a year of this game being out. Some games you can land and instantly pick items up while some games you can stand on an item and press f inventory drag or inventory right click and still cant pick the item up after 10+ looting animations. Theres also a bug that makes you parachute vector off in a completely different direction than where you are leaning like some giant hand grabbed you from behind and sucked you into the distance.3.) Awful gameplay. Around november of last year this game was at its peak. The game was running its original build the guns were balanced the hitmodels were standard the directional sound was amazing and it was overall a fun experience and i enjoyed the game at that point. Since then they have overhauled the entire shooting system making certain guns complete lasers of destruction and making others basically worthless. The ump is the most popular primary at this point simply because it has almost no recoil i have used it myself with a 4x scope to full auto people who are running 50 100 meters away only missing a couple rounds ON FULL AUTO. The 5.56 rifles take 4 6 shots to take a player down but can take a player down with 1 headshot and 1 bodyshot which is just completely a waste. They can no longer be used to take a player out at any sort of distance because landing 6 shots at someone who is 200+ yards out moving and getting in cover is impossible. Your only other option is the SKS which still takes 3 4 shots to kill a target and its now harder to land the shots and you have less ammo. I dont mention the SLR because its rarity is a complete joke and the bolt actions KAR98 still takes 3 body shots to kill a target. The damage models are a complete waste of time. Weapons do a specific amount of damage and that will be scaled down depending on body part with max damage being done to the upper chest and a bonus to headshots the game also has weapon classes smg ar sniper etc which get different body part bonuses. IMPORTANT PART Pre 1.0 the game had fair damage models you can shoot a player in the head and get headshot damage or shoot them in the body to do body damage but if you hit their vest you would do less damage. Now the game is the same with vests but if you hit someone in the feet???? NAH SON YOU DO 10 DAMAGE WITH AN ASSAULT RIFLE. How is it worth your time to shoot at someone but if you hit their feet that shot is basically wasted because youre only doing 10 damage? How is a gunfight fair where if you full auto someone center of mass but hit their hands or arms you only do half the damage youre supposed to? Imagine you both fire at each other at the same time. You shoot their center of mass like youre supposed to with a firearm but since their hands are in front of them you hit their hands 3x. The other player hits your chest and arms 3x. You did 35 damage but they killed you instantly. You really expect players to be compensating for hitting body parts in the middle of a close range gunfight? 4.) Microtransactions. I dont have a problem with these. I really dont. I bought skins myself ETC. What i DO have a problem with is their box/opening system is ing broken and its been broken for 6 months. When you open a crate you have 2 options a.) the crate will open and you will get your itemb.) the crate will sit on your screen with a loading icon for 30+ seconds essentially freezing your game and then tell you item delivery is being delayed right now. Then you have to refresh the lobby and go through your items individually to try to detect which one is the one you got.What kind of stupid s cant even get a microtransaction system to work properly? The above bug applies for buying your daily crates ETC. The entire main menu UI is such a joke you cant even switch skins properly without spamming the button 20 times until it actually clicks the button.5.) Dumbed down gameplay. I mentioned earlier about the overhauls to gunplay and sound and damage and damage models. What these have done is severely dumbed down the entire game from what it was at its peak. The guns used to take skill to handle skill to shoot at people effectively and take people out at range. Now they are all just laser sticks where you just need to pull down a bit on full auto and they were made this way because the guns dont do enough ing damage. 5 6 shots with an ASSAULT RIFLE? God damn fortnite doesnt even require that many. Sound was dumbed down and reworked so plebs with no headset can play the game 10% better but still end up dying every game because it still doesnt work on speakers.6.) Awful skill incentives. The game is basically call of duty now you can pick up any gun no attachments but a red dot armor and a helmet and win a game without even trying. The guns dont feel realistic anymore they take comical amounts of shot to kill they are pushing new respawn modes heavily which are essentially TDM modes like call of duty adding weapon skins vehicles are basically armored blockade runners that take TWO TO THREE SHOTS to pop a tire. The main meta to gaining rating right now is to get a car get to a building in the center of the circle and just camp there until the circle moves and then drive to the next building. 7.) Garbage rating system. Since the game uses an ELO rating system (easy to find on wikipedia about how an ELO system works) basically instead of being rewarded for YOUR performance in the game you are rewarded for who you beat ( who you outlasted) per game. I can get 25 kills and die early and i will get less rating increase than someone who did literally nothing but lived to 2nd place because they are also getting rewarded for outlasting those 25 players THAT I KILLED. What this does is makes it so getting out there and using your skill to get ahead kill players and get top 10 is useless because you can just hide until 2nd place and get the same results.8.) No incentive to keep playing. You won a game? Ok i guess go play another. There is no trophies achievements were only added extremely recently and were too easy to earn no daily/weekly challenges nothing. Nothing you can earn from grinding out the same thing over and over again. The only the game ever added that was good was map selection.This game had great potential it really did but was ruined by literally just making all the decisions who couldnt even fix problems the game had since day one.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Really fun game. You can sink hours into this game and still have fun the only problem with that is that you'll always want to do one more game. The game looks decent could be better but could definitely be worse. The Dev's keep in touch with the community about what's to be expected this or the next month what they're working on letting us know about unexpected server problems etc. Your first few dozen hours of gameplay is adrenaline rushing until you learn more about the game.The game starts off with 100 people parachuting out of a cargo plane to a location of your choice. The better the spot for loot the more people are going to drop. When you land you'll see people dying left and right but the real game hasn't started yet it's more of a "loot phase." Once it gets to around 50 people it gets more intense and you should have decent equipment by then and it turns into a "caution phase." You've made it to 20 people left now it becomes the "Stealth phase" try not to be seen as your play area is becoming much more limited much more quickly. You've manage to make it to the last 15? Now the real game begins everyone but you (because that's how games work) is going to have the best equipment so you're going to have to out do them by sneaking up on them or letting them kill everyone else but you. If you make it to last 5 no matter how many times you've gotten this far your adrenaline will kick in and it will feel so good once you win.I'll try to make a decent Pros/Cons list of the game now Pros Decent graphicsMassive area mapEvery situation is differentCompletely random loot even if you land in the same spot game after gameIt's hard for the game to get old because of the random lootCons Playable area while starts off reasonable it gets WAY too aggressiveMap may be massive but it seems lacking at times tooPeople seem to be able to turn down the grass rendering to easily see people who hide in the grass (should be a fixed value to prevent this)Normally I would've recommended this game but however Playerunkown said that he wouldn't release microtransactions until the game is out of early access it's purley cosmetic so it's whatever. However during this latest patch (as I type this 8/4/17) a new "loot crate" was released needing a key to open as you would in CS GO and TF2 and KF2. It's said to "test the system" but why would a system that's been used in other games need testing? Why not test it when the game is out of early access? A promise was broken so I cannot recommend the game. Over 6 000 000 copies of this game have been sold so far (check steamspy if you don't believe me) so they aren't hurting for money anytime soon. So take back the promise and release microtransactions early is a move
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The developers have created a great game in concept. They lack the ability to follow through with an optimized game that can actually run on mid level gaming computers. Lag (be it FPS or server related) is a common complaint and it has yet to be addressed effectively. The developers have had plenty of time to work on the common issue's and at least attempt to fix them. It seems that the game dev's are not focused on these issue's. I'm running a GTX 1060 FTW 6Gb GPU and the game is unplayable at all graphics settings.5/26/2018 Update. The game is still laggy. Dev's have spent their time putting in new gun accessories rather than working on the core of the game. I played around 15 20 games and realized that I died to bullcrap like FPS dips or hit registration failure in nearly half of the games. At this point I am convienced that this game will never reach it's full potential.

review: Pros + The Best Strategy &amp Teamwork Game or just Battle Royale (Better than H1Z1 and Squad)+ Not very expensive (only $30 USD compared to games like GTA V Squad etc.)+ Loved by the whole community (It's the most played game on Steam!!!)+ The devs try to listen to the player base although they are struggling with the chinese cheaters they have slightly reduced them and the cheaters won't affect that much the casual players+ Frequent updates and solid developement+ You can have MUCH fun if playing with friends+ The random gun spawns are ridiculous xDCons I don't know if "killing a streamer" is illegal anymore and gets you banned but the only good streamer who doesn't cry when he gets killed is Shroud &lt 3 You need at least mid tier gaming desktop PC (Well I can rush everything on Ultra at constant 80 90 frames *up to 100 sometimes* but it's not worth it because you would play the game itself or just look at your skins?) They ban you for having fun with your friends while teamkilling them (like CS GO...) Requres much practice but it is understandable

review: I have to say I reallly like this game it is a great way to get your heart racing and burn off steam.There is a few problems that I would like to note though 1. Hackers. The game at the moment is riddled with hackers and they devs dont seem to be doing as much as they can to try and stop them It is very annoying when you are in top 30 with your friend with 2 m24's and randomly get shot once and die from a guy all the way at the spawn island 2. Glitch Spots There is a very large amount of holes and spots you can get stuck in on both maps and this is one of the number one things that makes me want to be done for the day. 3 Diversity of weapons In my opinion I think that they should add a lot more guns and not only into the crates like they have been. If they took half of the guns currently in crates Gave them a nerf and shoved them onto the ground of both maps it would make it so much better. Overall though there has been a lot of improvment since early acsess and this is and will continue to be a great game

review: Fantastic EA survival/battle royal death matchie game with a fairly easy learning curve. Progession is quick as you learn how to be more efficient as you die in a massive 100 person battle to the death. Servers for me have always been stable with zero D/C's and minimal lag. Graphically the game is built for everyone but shines for some. Draw distance and reflections are impressive for what the game is. Even in EA "bugs" are few and far between. The servers were hit with some aimbots early but dealt with fairly swiftly. PUBG could use a kill cam to show player v. hacker improvements. Avoid if you are expecting a finished and final product understand that many EA projects never come to light. This game has also been successfully refunded via Steams Refund policy.Recently the game added the ability to buy Loot Crates (aka the dreaded microtransaction). Previously the only way to obtain these cosmetic containing crates was via "currency" earned via winning. The change in policy has not changed gameplay in any way for me or my crew as they are currently cosmetic items.

review: Where do I start off?Here If you had experience with first person shooters like Counter Strike or Overwatch or Call of Duty this game shouldn't feel like playing on a VR for the first time. I'm sure many of you all are familiar with the "battle royale" genre that has been popular among gamers. (especially the Chinese) The first battle royale game on steam that many took notice of is H1Z1 and now you might be wondering why H1Z1 isn't on the top 10 played steam games... H1Z1's developers ed up the community and the game overall thus destroying its popularity among gamers and when PUBG became the next big battle royale game people that wanted a battle royale based game immediately started hopping on to this game. Well the people that could actually afford the game that is... The main difference between the popularity of H1Z1 and PUBG is that PUBG's developers and publishers are not money hungry and seems to listen to the community. The growing popularity led to streamers on twitch streaming this game and further helping the game evolve. PUBG's developers saw streamers as VIPs and started to listen to streamers' opinions and thoughts more than the community's. When streamer said that one individual was "stream sniping" him/her Bluehole the game's publishers would ban that certain player from playing the game. This often led to streamers growing too big of an ego *cough* *cough* Grimmmz. Another issue I would like to address before I move on to the Pros is that the state of this game right now is riddled with cheaters using cheats such as aimbot wallhacks speedhacks etc. Many of these cheaters seem to be of a Chinese background and the community has openly stated that. This is one of the biggest problems and if it were to be fixed the reviews on this game would likely go from a Mixed to a Very Positive. Other problems include bugs lag and the fact that this game is not region locked. This game is beautiful the scenery the weapons the vehicles etc. The gameplay is fair (except the fact there are cheaters) if you have bad equipment you'll likely be dying an early death if you have skill you'll likely be living longer... The mechanics are not confusing and the game is easy to learn. If I could give this game a rating it would recieve a 7/10. If the cheating stops the rating may change )

review: This game has numerous UI bugs that make it unplayable. Specifically if you play this game with a game pad connected to the back of your PC the game will not function while the pad is connected. KB/mouse won't work right and the game pad won't work right either. You won't have a mouse in menus access during game play including the leave lobby game. This means you must crash out of the entire game after a match is over and you can't change any settings in the menu. You also will be treated to all of the key hnts being wrong and constantly glitching out. When you press a keyboard key the hints go away (rather than change to keyboard binds) and then as soon as you let go of a keyboard button the hints for game pad come back.You also can't remove or disable (or even rebind) the game pad hints. So when you want to open a door or pick up an item the game tells you PRESS X. When you press x on your keyboard you put your gun away. This is because X is interact on the game pad and x is unarm yourself on the keyboard. What a ing joke. This game really is a buggy piece of I'd rather play DayZ for a thousand more hours and have all my guns eaten by the bag monster than play another second of pubg.

review: Not going to lie Battle Royale is a really fun game mode. This game will provide some entertainment. However once you get passed the sheen of playing a new game you will start seeing gamebreaking issues more and more. That is if you have a great computer. Otherwise you'll be getting a unoptimized crapshoot from the get go. I consider my computer decent Ryzen 1600 and a 1070 however I still get insane framedrops fairly consistently. Textures not loading are fairly common and sometimes buildings do not load in at all. I guess a SSD is a requirement to play this game. Now this may sound petty considering the "Early Access" designation the game still has. However at this point in development it is quite clear that this game is not progressing in any sort of an healthy manner. Instead of focusing on the plethora of game breaking issues water invincibility jumping through windows horrendous netcode leading to at least 1/5 of my deaths being due to desync terrible optimization vehicle physics melee item hurtboxes seemingly being non existant bullets completely bypassing armor textures/buildings randomly not loading shotguns in general etc (there are probably many more if I was willing to spend more time thinking of everything wrong with this game) but what do they do instead? Host an esports tournament with one of the biggest prize pools in any recent memory Working on adding a new map (now 2?) working on a new vehicle adding fog (requiring them to force post processing just to have it run correctly) added a new gamebreaking gun (Mini 14) threatening lawsuits against their main competitor (Fortnite) and now partnering with a VPN company and advertising it in game for Chinese players. Like the game or hate it I don't really care. This is absolutely unacceptable and unforgivable. They have made over half a BILLION dollars on this game and just added in game ads. Think about it the leaders at Bluehole clearly only care about money. I honestly don't see this game ever being near a state where a "full release" would be acceptable considering the monumentous work ahead of them. Since there is already a free alternative with AAA companies sure to follow suit soon just save your money and DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. I really see them abandoning this game after these companies step up to the plate. Even if they don't you will be stuck playing a vastly inferior game to whatever comes out in the next few months. Just play Fortnite BR until then and spend your money on a game with decent leadership/devs.TL DR Battle Royale is really fun PubG is a hot piece of garbage ran by people with Martin Shrkeli levels of greed. Fortnite already exists for free/runs better overall. If Fortnite doesn't satisfy your needs wait until a real game dev company makes a BR game. SAVE YOUR MONEY DO NOT BUY.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Now...Is this game good? Yes yes it is.I played Arma3 and DayZ. I'm not a stranger to battle royale games so when a friend bought me this I went into it expecting much of the same. I even waited a week before I even bothered installing it.Boy do I wish I'd given it a shot earlier.The game is all around fun. It's quick intense gameplay that keeps you on your toes 24/7. You never know when a guy with a shotgun is gonna come bashing through your front door while you wait for the limit line to reach you so you can move on.GAMEPLAYGameplay is pretty straight forward. You jump out of an airplane to choose your own spawn point. This is the make or break moment as it's far more likely to die early on if you drop in a frequently dropped in zone where like 30 people are on a 1 sq mile block with 3 houses of loot in it. Things get hairy and 29/30 are most likely going to die in that place. In this game getting kills is not the Priority name of the game. Survival is. Staying alive until you're the last man standing is the ultimate goal so it's important to differentiate between fights worth picking and to just stay low and let the convoy of friends pass you by rather than hope you can pick them off one by one without them seeing you. You'll find progressively better gear as the battleground shrinks in on itself and sometimes if you're lucky you'll drop in a place that's smack dab where the game is gonna end leaving you with a playground full of epic loot that'll leave you stacked and ready before anyone else.There are 3 versions of the game(Not counting custom) which are solo duo and squad(4). GRAPHICSGraphics are not exactly something to cheer about. They're 'adequate' but definitely could be a lot better. Due to it being an early access game sadly this also means that there are bugs and texture glitches relatively often but unless you literally get PTSD attacks or something from seeing slightly faulty graphics and serrated edges on building corners from time to time it won't bother you at all.PROS A mediocre community(Why is this a pro you might ask? Because voice chat is entirely optional and there is no such thing as text chatlog) Intense fast paced combat that'll have you sweating bullets for hours. Fair hit boxes and no wall clipping(Can't shoot through walls in certain situations etc.) Outrageously fun with friends. Goes up at least 5 stars extra if played with friends! Smooth clear voice chat built into the game(And of course there's perimeter conversation as well) No game breaking bugs that I've seen thus far. Highly customizable weapons and clothing for a personal 'build'. MASSIVE map with up to 100 players in it. Low price ($30) for a really damned good game! Fast and simple entrance to games. The longest I've ever waited from queue to joining was 3 seconds. Over 5 million copies sold and an extremely active game with an average of 280 000 people playing on the regular and over 450 000 at peak hours(Source Steam Charts)CONS Poor sub standard graphics Infrequent but catastrophic server connection losses Very rude and obnoxious community(Well at least it seems that way. I guess the trolls and idiots spamming slurping noises are more vocal and active than the more serious and mature gamer) Developer promised no microtransactions till the game is done which was honestly a pure 24 karat s*** nugget of lies. Loot is RNG based. (You might land at a building with no weapons in it at all while the guy next door comes over to say hello neighbor with an AK47 a pump action shotgun and a level 2 police vest.)FINAL WORDLike I said above is the game good? Yes yes it is but it has some definite issues which is not really the game itself that's the problem but the slightly unscrupulous developers. Go down the negative(and even some of the positive) reviews and you'll see the lies coming from the devs mentioned over and over and over again specifically the whole lie about microtransactions not happening till after the game was finished and released. The devs also claim that they want to use the money from the microtransactions to fund an Esports event for the game except the game revenue that they earned on it is so high they could easily fund a massive esports event to rival Riot Games' League of Legends championships with the utmost ease(An estimated $100mi was earned on the game so far).I recommend the GAME itself definitely but if the devs do not clean up their act and stop spewing lies to try and convince people to buy their game with empty promises? I'm going to rapidly change this review to a negative.It's so unfortunate too. The game is simply astonishingly fantastic.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So in my original review I expressed my frustration with trying to get the game to work on Windows 7. After spending many hours on troubleshooting I finally gave up on trying to fix it.If you're still running Windows 7 I would still recommend waiting until it's out of early access to try it out. There are still a lot of bugs and glitches and for that I would say wait.However I got the game to work on Windows 10. I don't like the fact that the only way I could get it to work was to upgrade but it works for me now so that's water under the bridge now.If you do have Windows 10 and a good system I would recommend trying it out. It is a lot of fun when it works and there's a ton of good times to be had playing with friends.Don't expect too much from this title though as I said before there are still a lot of bugs and glitches. You could be doing really well and the game will screw you over anyway by crashing or getting your character stuck in some weird position. So take that into account before buying.

review: Yes there are still a lot of issues and bugs. Yes you will get your a** handed to you over and over again and Yes there are hackers. Does this ruin the game?Hell naw.PUBG has been a blast since early access and i've had so much fun with this game. They just added a new map (desert) which creates its own unique set of challenges. Sure it's definitely irritating that game ending bugs and exploits still exist but i rarely encounter serious issues in gameplay. No better game to binge on for hours with several friends. Aspects of stealth realistic and arcade style shooting action a huge open world a big challenge with a huge skill cap and endless replayability make this game highly recommended in my book. Don't let the armchair nazis turn you away get this game and enjoy it.
