review: Based on the Arma mod "Battle Royale" the premise of Battlegrounds is simple. 100 players parachute onto a massive island and duke it out until the last man (or team) stands. During this process players scavenge farmhouses industrial areas forests and towns for weapons body armor and vehicles. Sounds simple right? The catch is the playable radius of the map is decreasing at certain intervals. As you can imagine 100 players scavenging while moving into a smaller playable area eventually leads to contact and firefights. You can either play solo 2 man teams or 4 man squads. If you play with friends it may quickly become one of the best teamwork oriented experiences you've had (as it was for me). If you play solo the direness of the situation quickly becomes apparent and you will find yourself in fight or flight situations. Either way there is an excellent time to be had.Sound plays a big role in Battlegrounds. You will hear footsteps or vehicles of other players nearby causing you to literally freeze in your tracks and quietly listen. If unarmed you may feel yourself become nervous and even hide praying you are not found as the sound of footsteps swarm the floor below you. I have never played a game where at times I feel like I am being hunted. It's very intense and leads to some amusing situations such as stealing your persuers vehicle ). Gunplay is thankfully tactical and slow paced in Battlegrounds but weapon damage can be a bit hit or miss. Let me remind you again this game is in EA so there are many issues. Weapon damage a desperate need for a hardcore mode and sound issues to just name a few. The game is also not well optimized and server lag rears its ugly head every so often. Even with its current issues Battlegrounds shines as the new king of Battle Royale. It's really an exciting game and stands out in a genre filled with mods and weaker contenders I'm truly excited for the upcoming fixes patches and content.EDIT Once region lock or ping lock is implemented I will change my review back to thumbs up. Tired of the high pingers cheaters and random players that don't speak English in the NA servers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I used to be a huge advocate for this game. I would always back this game up and say they plan to do better. honestly I feel like an idiot for doing so. The game was fun at first but since it reached 1.0 I began to see that the game will not fix a lot of its bugs. A small company it seems cant properly create a game like this. I never thought i would be excited for a call of duty title until now. save your money dont buy this game they literally made way more then they should have on this game. I do respect shroud and his love for the game but we really need a game backed by a well known developer. They do rework a lot of the crappy mechanics like throwables but it is not enough I would also have to blame a bit of this on the community. They constantly bash on the game and criticize asking for skins new guns new content when they really needed to refine what they had. They have the money to hire engineers. I do hope that one day they get thier stuff together. it was fun while it lasted but ended up with a lot more frustration then anything.

review: If you can cope with the servers and netcode it's a great battle royale with rewarding gunplay. If you can't steer away from pubg.Few highlights why I can't recommend this game in it's current state 1. Server tickrate used to be 8 (EU FPP) at the start of a match now after a fix it's still 12.2. Rubberbanding and desyncs e.g. action delay (looting doors grenade throwing) unregistered shots dying after you already went to a safe spot.3. Sometimes when you land loot hasn't rendered yet.4. Long standing parachute bug ruining landings with forced hook to the right or left.5. No matter the graphical settings some distant terrain/rocks do not render (common problem you shoot distant enemies but invisible rock keeps eating your shots).

review: Who wants to learn about the Grain Man? No too bad I'm telling you anyways&gt Be me&gt Playing PUBG with my freinds&gt Let's call them by shortend versions of their PUBG names (Maxi McRoonie and Piper)&gt We parachute near the shooting range&gt Another team had the same idea as we "happy" few&gt We chase him around using our fists&gt McRoonie finds an AK and shoots him&gt His partner stars shooting at us&gt Maxi scares him off so we're realativley unharmed&gt We move into a town&gt SURPRISE Maxi gets shot&gt "WE AINT GONNA LEAVE YOU MAXI"&gt He dies&gt Our best player dead&gt But we don't give up&gt We kill the assaliant&gt We book it to the safezone&gt We shoot at a passing car but it's relativley calm&gt Cut to a bit later&gt I have 7 bullets down to the ultimate showdown (of ultimate destiny)&gt McRoonie and Piper are dead&gt I'm being shot at but I'm saved by my trusty pan&gt Fire off my remaining bullets&gt Dive into the field of grain&gt Something awakens in me&gt The Grain Man&gt I hide in the feild of grain as a shootout commences&gt I'm not sure if it's because the people I was up against were blind or they decided I wasn't a worthwile target but I got off without getting shot&gt The grain man stays where he is biding his time&gt Everyone is freaking out (read mildly amused) that this is working&gt I have to cross a road with no grain to protect me&gt I start on the journey&gt I get shot at and die&gt Still get 5th placeThere was also the boat story&gt Everyone parachutes into a costal town&gt Find a boat.&gt We are way outside the safezone so maxi take the driver seat while we all kick it in the boat&gt "I spy with my little eye something blue"&gt "The ocean"&gt Maxi is informing us that this is as fast as the boat can go&gt The boat stops dead in it's tracks&gt Everyone goes dead silent&gt I'm expecting Maxi to start up the boat&gt It's out of fuel&gt Evertone panics and starts swimming to shore&gt Thankfuly we make it to shore&gt Cut to later where we have good gear&gt Everyone has their own car&gt We have a shootout with them&gt I die first with Piper going second.&gt Maxi and McRoonie make a valliant last stand but ultimatley die.It's a fun game.

review: Update 5/8/17 They actually fixed it and it works even better now! well that's one heck of a support.hope they keep up the good work on fixing stuff quickly. it's all about the player never forget that.Update 3/8/17 After the patch the game is unplayble in any mod lags FPS spikes. Don't get it if you can't stand stuff like these. Oh and they broke their promise and pretty much don't have respect for the comunity.Previous Well My bro got me this game because I was skeptic about it at first didn't want to "waste" 30$ on a game that is in early access (ahm DayZ ahm) because of other experiences. But damn man even though it's not finished and it has it's set of bugs and glitches it is very enjoyable as long as you play it with a squad or duo. as for the game Graphics 7/10It's not the most beautiful game on the market but it has good graphics the design is pleasent on the eye and well not every PC can run it (requiers Optimization).Gameplay 9/10This is key. The gameplay is what makes this game great the guns work well the sound system is fantastic (too loud sometimes) you have to use headphones in order to have an advantage on your opponents and you have to be careful in each step you make. Very Strategic you have to think fast and act swiftly otherwise you're dead. There is not delay the game is very competitive and it ain't pay to win.Technical issues Well it is still in alpha (or beta) stages which means the game is not complete so you expect to experience some bugs and glitches from time to time. So far I've managed to find a fix around them lowering my Graphical options and avoiding memory leaks by restarting the game after 1 or 2 games (requiered when you have 8GB of ram) from time to time the game may lag and freeze but it usually happens in the beggining and stops after a minute or so.Updates and Dev involvment The Devs are very responsive to the community they look after what people say and they really put their heart and soul in the game they seek to perfect it in the end and that's what you look in a game like this. Constant development and updates which keep things fresh and fun. They fix bugs regulary and add content from time to time which makes it very exciting they plan for more gamemodes and new maps which is what will keep the game going hopefuly.TL DR8/10 (early access)Worth the money get some friends to play thank me later!

review: My average PUBG experience so far Dive into area with little or no enemy activity. Find a car head to new circle. Get shot before I get there.Start again.Dive into another area with little to no enemy activity. Find 1 rifle 30 60 rounds for that rifle level 1 vest and helmet 20 SMG addons 200+ rounds for a weapon not in the area. Not in circle. No cars in sight. Run on foot to circle. Loot. New circle is on opposite side of old circle. Still no cars. Run on foot. Get shot and die.Start again.Drop into high density area. Gear is bad. Hear a guy enter the building I'm in. Hide until he enters. Shoot him. Another guy enters. Shoot him. Leave building Get shot and dieStart again.High density area. Average gear. Nobody in sight. Run to town in next circle. Spot a guy going between buildings. Start shooting from 3 5m while he jerks around due to a lag spike. Die to the first shot he takes.That's how the game goes. It's battle royale. There can be only one. You die then you do it all again. You're 1 out of 100. The odds aren't in your favor.

review: For me this is the game of the year 2017. You can play it however you want Go full retard with your friends and try stupid things and you can try to win the chicken dinner.PROS The devs are really listening to the community.It's so intense if you play it for the win (last 10 20 people)At a reasonable price 30 EUR other games like Overwatch or GTA V cost 60 EURA very big communityYou can also make some money with the crates if you sell them for about 0.30 EUR or you can open them and have the chance to open a 7 EUR T Shirt or a 200 EUR Skirt.CONS The servers are bad but that's because the huge amount of players out there.Yea..it has some bugs but they are like 1/10 matches.There are hackers out there but not as many as CS GO for example.In conlcusion The experience with the game is great...new updates funny community.Pretty much the kind of game you want to play to have fun and also be competitive.

review: $ PRICE / QUALITY not worth it acceptable absolutely worthExplination $30 dollars for a game that lags harder than ricer stuck in snow? Not worth it at all. Avoid until issues are settled. Not to forget that the developer took forever to deal with the hacker issues and they still have these problems. ϟ REQUIREMENTS Mac potato PC minimum medium high end NASA computerExplination This game can be run on computers and laptops that have a decent GPU. Probably to render a lot more than it has to but whatever. A GTX 1050 Ti will still have to chug along just to play normally. GRAPHICS Glowing missing textures are preferable to stare at wear glasses to protect your eyes bad OK good eye candy (low to medium) masterpiece (high and up)Explination ARMA 3 tier graphics but the performance like you're trying to play GTA V ENB enchancer on a low end computer. Meh. GAME TIME download took longer short few hours plenty of hours long Fallout New Vegas with mods endless Explination It's a multiplayer shooter. It ends when the players deciede to quit. STORY it doesnt have the Last Jedi tier still better than Twilight semi decent good fantasticExplination There isn't a story. It comes down to "aim and shoot" after landing somewhere and grabbing some loot. ENDING what ending? ME3 tier limping along but got done sums up good fantastic conclusion game's so good it didn't need oneExplination It's a multiplayer game. It doesn't have one. DIFFICULTY I should be insulted easy medium easy to learn hard to master hard dark souls it exists to spite you Explination PUBG is pretty straightforward. More or less point and shoot while compensating for recoil. Well that's assuming that you're not shredded before the other person kills you. Or you suffer at the hands of server lag. BUGS worse than a bug eaten rotten tree termite infestation baseball field ant mound (mods) few bugs (no mods) nothingExplination PUBG is probably one of the most laggiest games one can play. It performs like butt in CQC and okish at long distance combat. Random car flippings lagging through the floor vehicle spazzing out getting stuck on objects you aren't even colliding with shots not even matching up with your target. The game even way after its release is a buggy mess.

review: This game was fun... before it was overrun with Chinese hackers. I am playing with a I7 8700K with a gigabit fiber connection and a GTX 1080 video card.. yet the other players are always de synced and you can never hit them. I see a guy shooting at me I have a sniper rifle. I return fire sight right on his chest alll missed. He is able to fire across the map with 2X sights and kill me with two shots. None of my shots hit. I watch the death cam and it is de synced by seconds YES SECONDS! This game has made so much money how about we finish it. I refuse to play until they use geographical locks to keep the game fair. I am deleting this game as we speak. I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT. I quit H1Z1 for the exact same reasons. I don't mind being bested by someone who plays fair.. but not by a laggy player or someone who uses cheats to de sync the game. All the Chinese players are using VPNs which increase their lag it makes them hard to hit and the game isn't fair.

review: In the beginning PUBG was terrbile for me. It was lagging crashing frames would drop enormously it would take some time to even load the map in game! It was terrible. BUT when i went online and i searched up the problems i was having i looked up some things on how to fix the problems i was having. IT WORKED! After all the problems were fixed the game ran beautifuly and with a steady FPS rate of around 100fps. The lag the crashing and all the other problems were gone! And now that they are gone i cant stop playing this game!Here are some pros and cons (Most of the cons are due to the early acces which im sure will be fixed later on)Pros Amazing mapGreat gameplayLag has been fixedWeapons are greatCons The game feels a bit clunky when shooting (early acces though im sure it will be fixed)Some times I do have a little but of a lag spike (Not that big of a problem)I would like it if maybe they could add more weapons because i have come across many of the same weapons. (again this is only the early acces so im sure they will add more)Text me anyone if you disagree with me and i would glady explain why i think its a Pro or a Con ) EJB

review: PUBG is a multiplayer only game that revolves around picking up guns scattered across a map and trying to eliminate the competition to finish first. There are three modes available &gt Solo &gt Duo &gt Squad (3 man squad included from 3 to four teammates)The game starts with a large map containing various landscapes ranging from forest to mountains lakes and towns. You begin with no weapons inside a plane going in a straight line over the map and you will have to launch yourself from it and glide towards the desired zone on the map. From then on you will have to find weapons that are randomly generated all around the map and kill the other players/teams. A white circle will appear telling you to which zone you should go. Soon a blue circle will join the borders of the white one and everything outside of the zone will take continuous damage until they get inside the circle or die. As time goes on the circle gets smaller forcing the teams to face each other or die outside the playzone. There are two different views each with its on advantages and drawbacks FPP(first person) and TPP (third person). The game relies heavily on RNG be it for the circle's first appearance or for which weapons appear and where (for example there could be entire houses with absolutely nothing in them) which can lead to very frustrating situations and can discourage many potential players. Though when played with friends (which i recommend) the game becomes considerably more fun and bearable creating funny and unexpected situations. The voice chat can be extremely annoying but can also provide its own lot of fun depending on the players in it. The graphics are decent. However playing with ultra quality will surprisingly put you at a disadvantage since objects like grass and small bushes can be disabled in the lower qualities resulting in situations where a player with high graphic settings crawling through a field can be killed easily by a player with low settings since for him the grass of the field will not have appeared. Depending on whether you survive to win the first place a single game will usually range from 1min to 35 minutes. In the end PUBG is a decent game that requires a certain mindset to fully enjoy. RNG can become quite annoying and cheaters and lag can somtimes ruin an otherwise perfectly good game. The DEV team is still pushing update after update and the bugs are progressively being corrected one after another. My final rating for PUBG ? 13 / 20Thank you for reading!

My computer is pretty decent (It can run GTA V at 60 fps for comparison) and a lot of times the fps drops which can lead to me dying. Now to the thing I love about the game. I love the battle royale genre I'm not quite great at any of these games but they're fun to play and mess around with friends. Overall game is incredibly fun and I recommend spending the $30 or whatever it is for you to buy it.

review: A true Curate's Egg of a game.One the one hand it's fun to play against others who are not algorithm driven NPCs but who act unpredicatbly. It gives the game legs. It's also interesting to reflect on your defeat (and you will get defeated a lot) and learn from your mistakes poor luck or just misjudgement.But.You really have to go into this with your eyes open at the moment.There are a LOT of hackers. Yes you can use your DeathCam to see who got you see if it was a hacker and report them if it was but you're still dead.The hackers are attracted by the marketplace for crates and until and unless that marketplace is removed this problem will continue.There are of course the famous glitches problems with optimisation ping differences etc. but it's not as bad as some AAA games have released and they keep fixing it.IMO there needs to be a mechanism to select maps as they play very differently.Also the Miramar map does not lend itself to thoughtful play. Too little cover and without a scope you are dead.Personally I'm going to stop playing for a while until these issues are fixed and this is after having sunk hundred of hours into the pre launch game.If you can live with those caveats go for it but if not wait for them to fix the problems or look elsewhere.NB If the above get addressed I shall revisit this review and recommendation.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Will not waste words nor time here. I read about the game. Waited some time. Purchased it. With Star Citisen game of my life. Huge maps. Lot of space for using tactics/camping. Very intense. review: I just love it. I was a bit unsure about it at first but i fell in love with this game. The thrill of being in the last circles is just amazing I never thought i could get so much adrenaline from one game. When it comes down to the last 10 guys alive you start feeling the pressure you listen to every gunshot every step. You try to figure out which aproach is best. Will you go slow and track the guy you just saw for a few minutes and ambush him while he's healing from a fight he just won or will you go full Ivan mode on this . Then its just you and the last guy. His palms are sweaty knees weak arms are heavyThere's vomit on his sweater already mom's spaghetti. And the feeling from getting your chicken dinner is pure bliss.And I'm not even talking about how much fun it is to play with a group of friends.

review: FYI I have never written a review on steam but this game is just to good I had to back it up.First off I have to say thank you for putting duo in the game me my best freind havent found any game this fun that we can play co op EVER!!! The rush and excitement you get from start to finish is amazing and uncomparable to any other multiplayer game. I was playing Overwatch for a while with my freind but it didnt quite satisfy us it wasnt enough to keep us entertained. But this game has gave us that satisfaction we were looking for from dropping out of the plane sky diving then parachuting to racing others in the area to find a weapon of any kind or falling to close to another player and fist fighting your way in to buildings and getting a weapon before they do. There is alot of fun in this game I personally love looting and there is alot of towns farms buildings and other giant structures to loot EVERYWHERE!! In the game there is a blue circle that closes in the playable area it gets really small towards the end and if your outside it you take damage escaping taking damage to get to the middle of it and fighting others to get there is one of the best parts of the game. The most exciting part of all is the last part of the match when th circle gets realllly tiny and there is like 15 20 people in it just brawling to survive its a real exhilerating feeling. And being the last one alive with one other the fight for that chicken dinner feels like the most important battle you have ever had it is really intense and heart pounding!! (There is also vehichles like cars jeeps and boats to help you get farther into the map which help ALOT when trying to get to the center of the playable area before dying.) P.S. I havent been banned for anything i know people complain about it but havent encountered it yet so this review is based on my expierience as of today.

review: The game is fun and the game has potential but with the state it's in right now I cannot recommend this game to anyone. First off the game is POORLY optimized. My computer is pretty decent and is able to play most if not all of my current games on ultra with no struggle but I have to play this game on the lowest settings and it still lags. Not to mention there's the chance buildings won't spawn in correctly and sometimes the game will just close itself. Honestly a game like PUBG is pretty cool on paper but it is being executed the wrong way. They should have worked on getting it out of early access but I believe the fame has gone to their heads. If the game gets a major fix or at least get out of early access hell then I'll change my review. But until then it's a no from me

review: I purchased the game yesterday (as of 3/272017) with my brother because we are fans of open world type games that require tactics and most of all patience. It's so much fun and I enjoy this game a lot whether I play with friends or not. The game is balanced as it should be the vehicles don't protect you from shots which is also pretty sweet and the game just grabs you and makes you want te become the last survivor of this sick and twisted show!Now that doesn't mean this game has it's faults. This game does have a couple of issues which I will list out below This game is terribly optimized at the moment even running on the lowest settings my Overclocked 1080 DDR5X with a i7 7700K is not able to run this game perfectly. Now of course I will excuse this 'SOMEWHAT' because it's currently in early access and for some developers it takes time to fixing performance issues like this because everyone has a different outcome to one game. Another thing about buying a game in early access that relies on 100 player onslaught for each match and with many people currently playing it there are going to be a lot of connection issues. There have been times where the servers were not behaving the way that the developers intended them to do so. But it's only happen once or twice through a 7 hour playthrough so we'll see how quickly they'll get to this issue. Lastly (and I'll make this short) some items on the ground that you would literally kill to get sometimes will not allow you to pick them up mostly due to a glitch in the system which happens but can get very annoying when you see a Kar98K and you want to go it.... then sadly you're not able to because the game denies your happiness. So those are some of the issues that I have with the game but besides that it's been a blast playing this game and I am so glad to be a apart of this community and hopefull work with the devs on finding and solving these issues! Superb job so far in my opinion and you're still not sure you want to buy as well as my opinion isn't up to your standars I reccomend watching these players just to see how you really feel. YouTube JackFrags FrankieOnPCAt1080PTwitch Summit1G Trick2G (though I believe he still plays H1Z1 a bit more than Battlegrounds but I hope to see him switch soon)Hope you take the time to read the review and you'll have a wonderful time whether be you playing this game or playing something else that grabs your attention. Have a nice day!

review: It's a great game. From the simplicity of the concept to overall smoothness of the gameplay. Nothing quite like the thrill of getting your first chicken dinner and having won several over the short time that I've owned it I can say that the feeling never gets old. I see a lot of negative reviews here from people who are unhappy about the new micro transactions. To me this is kind of a petty gripe. The gameplay is really good and I definitely feel that I've got my money's worth at this point. Who cares if they're trying to monetize a bit more of it? That simply makes them the same as every popular shooting game right now. The difference is this game actually offers a great experience without the repetitiveness of most of those other games. All that said here are what I think are some legitimate gripes about the game 1. Poor performance optimization causes semi frequent game crashes and you'll need to turn your graphics settings down pretty low to minimize this issue. 2. Vehicle physics are broken. Not game breakingly so but none of the vehicles are particularly stable and it gets annoying being able to crash through wooden fences but getting stopped cold by a hay bale. 3. Not being able to climb and mantle is a pain but it looks like that one is getting fixed soon.

I have DEFINITELY gotten my $30 worth and then some. I highly recommend picking up PUBG now as when the game is finished the price will likely double. There is MASSIVE potential here. BUY. THIS. GAME.

review: EDIT Stream sniping should not be a bannable offense IMO. If the enemy is dumb enough to brodcast his location for money he deserves to be "sniped". Streamers are definitely good advertisers due to their fanbase but they should be smarter about it.This game is a blast. Please don't listen to the negative reviews about paid loot crates. The transaction is vouluntary. This is the equivalent of going to McDonald's and complaining that they offer diet Coke to customers who want it. You have more say (collectively) in what goes into this game than just about anything else in life and you choose to cry about microtransactions that affect gameplay zilch. The point of any video game is to make money. The only people who care about this in a negative way are the same people who will buy all of their games on a Steam sale since they're too cheap to pay full price. The gameplay is quite fun. I play solo and it can be frustrating but the best advice I can give you is "git gud". Sometimes you get a good draw and get some sweet loot at the first drop and sometimes you get high top combat boots in the first house and die coming out the door. I'm really glad that they added first person mode only servers since third person seems a bit cheap to me. Just my opinion.The sounds of the guns are quite distinct and if you play enough you can tell the difference. Matchmaking is a dream. I love the fact that if I die I can get into another game almost immediately instead of having to wait for matches to be over long lobby times waiting for players etc.Give this game a go. Stop finding things to complain about if you already own it.TL DR Shut up and play the game you paid money for.

review: Update the game is better now that it's out. Still needs quite a bit of polish though. But most importantly I find it fun now. So I'm changing my rating.Time spent in this game Matchmaking queue (varies) Wait for players to connect (up to 2 minutes) Plane ride (30 seconds) Parachute down (up to a minute) Start gathering gear (up to five minutes) Die Rinse and repeatAnd then you can actually start playing. Unless you got killed during that last phase.The game has lots of potential and is fun when you are a group that's for sure but it would benefit so so so so so much from letting you try your luck faster seeing as how it's so easy to die without even knowing how it happened. This is the single biggest thing holding the game back in my opinion. You need to be able to get back into a new game much much faster and by new game I actually mean the part where you start playing.

review: I like it. It has glitches and is not optimized/runs on an old engine. If you make the game boring it'll be boring (land in a low loot area on a corner of the map and run a lot just to get killed by a random guy in a building) But if you land in a high loot area it'll get interesting. People camp a lot but it makes sense since that's how people typically think that's how you win the game (survive don't get the most kills is the mentality). But if you play in First Person it gets better.Great feeling killing everyone else in an area and even better winning the game. They revamped the vehicles and driving mechanics the sounds and vaulting was necessary so it's great they added it. If they just fix the server issues 99% of the problems people complain about will be solved.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Even though PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds is still in Early Access it s already a groundbreaking online shooter. Each game starts the same way but its remarkable ability to feel like a fresh new adventure every round has kept me coming back for hours on end. It manages to approach the Battle Royale style death match made popular by games like DayZ with relative simplicity without sacrificing the essence of the hardcore survival sim creating a tight focused and no frills experience that places it leagues above the competition.

review: Extremely intense gameplay constant paranoia of being seen or attacked and constant torment from the blue zone.This game requires high levels of concentration at all times. It cannot be played casually if you are aiming to win. Difficult to master the mechanics yet highly rewarding when you do get kills and win. Solo play is generally more worrying although it is also the best feeling if you win one. Fun with friends can be a laugh a lot of the time you decide if you take it seriously or just joke around. Close to full PC 1.0 release many of the aspects are near completion with optimisations and more content updates to come after the official release. I personally have not had many problems with hackers however you may have some encounters with them.This game has already taken the world by storm and has so much more potential. Frustrating yet very addictive. Worth the money.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off don't listen to the people that are pissy at PlayerUnknown about paid crates. The game is wildly successful and it's your choice to buy them or not. What's wrong with a game trying to make more money?This game blows H1Z1 out of the park if you've played that. Eliminating idiotic mechanics like being able to jump out of cars and survive Battlegrounds brings Battle Royale to a whole new level. With realistic physics akin to its original Arma mods this game is an exciting rollercoaster every game. It's hard to explain if you don't have the game but it's so very rewarding. The reality and immersiveness of it brings killing extremely satisfying. There is something about hearing the huge bang of a gun go off and hitting that headshot you lined up from 500 meters away. It's inexplicable. Don't get me wrong it's a game and I'm not a murderer.I love this game. A wide variety of guns and attachments allows me to customize and pick what I want to play with. It's fantastic even on the lowest settings. I highly suggest it. Watch some videos before you get it and you'' understand! (Aculite is one of the best PUBG YouTubers look him up)Great game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First issue is the crates. As much as I "love" micro transactions you can't just go back on your word like that. Also the rates are abysmal its not even fair. Let's say there's 500 000 people online at a time leaving you with several million per week each person gets a few crates per weeks for free and there's still only 2 skirts for sale at a time in the market? Seriously that only leaves your imagination as to how rare they are. So going back on their word and then making the rate for rare items astronomically low? Please.Now for the other issue the game is alright but the rules being enforced kinda ruin it. This game is "supposed" to be chaotic anarchy whatever you say goes kind of attitude. Now you can get banned for what you say and team killing. Don't get me wrong it can be annoying to be killed by a teammate but isn't that why they're adding ranked? Just enforce it there. There's no penalty to dying in this game you can just start up a new game 3 seconds later. Simple things like that made the game what it was. The game itself isn't the fun part it was the communities toxic racist egotistical bs that gave it that unique and fun flair that you were allowed to do it without repercussions. Now that that's over I find myself rarely getting on. I feel hacking should be the only bannable offense outside of ranked play in this type of game.Don't get me wrong though I'm still gonna get on at least once a week to get my chest and sell it at least I'll be able to make my $30 back eventually.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'd like to say first of all that (in my opnion) the microtransaction arguement for not buying this game is completely unjustified. Yes it may prove the devs to be somewhat untrustworthy in delivering promised aspects of the game but it does not change the gameplay AT ALL. So judging this game poorly based on it the fact that it has microtransactions is ridiculous to me. Putting that aside this is one of the most heart racing and exhilirating games I have ever played. I personally don't play any multiplayer games unless they're with friends but this is a game I can solo play and still have a blast. Even when you die you feel hyped up because of the situation you were in. Sure if you get randomly headshotted in the middle of a field you're gonna be pretty but this is a video game where all choices can have consequences. YOU decided to walk in the middle of a field. YOU decided to run to the next house when the area wasn't clear. Sometimes making these calls can be tough which just adds to the tense experience.The bugs in this game can hold it back a little bit though. For example my friend and I occasionaly experience an issue when first parachuting out of the plane. Sometimes if we go down too fast our textures won't load in properly and we will be screwed until they decide to load in. Other than that I reccomend you buy this game if you're looking for a good time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is not a run and gun game. If you don't believe me feel free to try. You will either die immediately or find no action for about 10 minutes until you are suddenly gunned down with no idea where the bullets even came from. Skill matters more than quick reaction times although having both helps. You *can* win a game without any of your victims fighting back if you are cunning (and lucky) enough. Firearm and balistic mechanics are modeled quite well almost everything you would see IRL minus wind. The guns fill their roles as they do IRL as well. Consider which situations military and police use each firearm in and that will give you an idea of what you should be doing. Of course you don't always have the luxury of choice. When I do I opt for an close range UMP paired with a one of the autoloading center fire rifles for medium range engagements ideally an SKS or min14 if I can find one. Long range is fun but often a waste of ammo and time as well as a quick way to reveal your location to everyone around you.My advise to noobs don't drop in dense areas until you have some kills under your belt. Once you find a decent gun find a good place to camp and spring traps on anyone in range. This will get you actual experience as opposed to the mindless shooting you will find if you go to dense areas first. Save that for later to test your new skills.

review: Great game. Essentially goes like this 1. You hear some autistic screeching while in the plane2. You jump out at a small house area praying no other people jumped there too3. You realise it's 3 guys parachiting alongside you so you yourself.4. You land run into the nearest house praying to find a gun5. Grats you've got a pistol6. One of the other 3 guys that landed near you runs into you with an AK7. You shoot him 4 times before he somehow kills you in only 2 bullets.Rinse and repeat )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First I must warn you. This game is not about winning. It may look that way but it is about the journey. Even the top people in each region have less than 25% win rate. It is about the little wins along the way and finding your game play. You run into campers run and guns and military style players. Just when you think your safe that is when you are most vulnerable. This game is based on luck most of all and skill second. Luck is the loot battle zone circles and vehicle spawns. Skill side of it is based on sneaking camping shooting. All of the fps shooter games you have played up until now have prepared you for this game. In my first weekend of play I got a solo win and then a duo win with a friend I have played CS GO with for years. Each time you die it is basically oh well what can I do differently next time. The only cons I can say about this game are the one map is starting to get old. They have confirmed more maps with release. The second one is and they may like it to be more realistic but it would be nice to see how you died to help you learn for next time. Just remember when you die it is over. No respawing allowed.

review: Hi
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Player Unknown PUBG GHonestly it s been a lot of fun sinking hours into this game with friends. This is by no means a polished game at all but a lot of the Not recommended reviewers have sunk 3 4 or 5 hundred hours. Doesn t that tell you something? If it was so bad why have they kept playing? Maybe there is some enjoyment from this game after all regardless of all the crazy things that can happen. This game can be absolutely soul destroying. There s been a few heart breaking moments when myself or my squad have gotten to the final circle and in an awesome position to win against only one or two people left only to get killed by a hacker amazing player at the end. Or my squad just looted an area and is absolutely geared up for the rest of the game then jump in a car only to randomly blow up in a vehicle moving 10km per hour after touching a bale of hay. Or catapulting one vehicle into space after it accidentally clips a squad mate in the vehicle driving in front. Or climbing on top of a fallen loot crate only to fall to your death jumping from the top to the ground.There are many many more dumb stupid things that happen in this game. And whilst some of them are stupid and really rage inducing others have been absolutely hysterical and have created fits of laughter on discord for hours. If you re a serious gamer who hates bugs and playing in teams and prefers to play things on your own I d best avoid a game like pubg. But if you enjoy having bants and a few laughs with mates this is a good game. Just don t take it seriously. The developers certainly were not expecting this game to be so successful. TLDR This game is crap but crap in a fun way. And OMG it feels great to win. Play with friends or not at all.*Technically I made money playing this opened a few loot crates and sold an item for $110. Loot boxes are dumb people who pay that much for an item are dumber*

review: This game has not recieved any meaningful updates like major bug fixes or performance boosts in the last year. Instead it recieved microtransactions and pricey skins. Maybe some weapons and 2 new maps that are both far less superior to the original. And also we have been bombarded with PUBG Invitational ads everywhere from the lobby to the plane and even inin game objects. The gameplay itself hasn't really changed since release. I have had the game since launch and 1 year would have been enough for any developer to turn an unpolished early access game to something fun and polished. Not bluehole tho. They saw their numbers dropping and instead of fixing the game they filed a lawsuit to sue Fortnite thinking that would make the players come back. The players didn't leave because of Fortnite. They left because they had faith in a game with huge potentional that didn't evolve how it should have.

review: Battlegrounds is an amazing game. A large map large number of players and a variety of weapons there is so much that can happen. What makes it so great is the tension. That feeling you are being watched at all times knowing a scope is zeroed on your head. Then you hear the shot but the bullet is not for you. Relief washes over you but it is only temporary as the sniper has now noticed you. You pray to God you can evade him but alas his aim is true and you are cut down.As you expire those words appear seemingly taunting you. "Better luck next time"10/10 would get sniped again
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has caught me be surprise. For an early access game it ticks quite a lot of boxes. This game has brought the joy of online play back (for me).The Australian playerbase is strong at the moment and the general attitude is great I'm yet to experince a toxic group.I've heard about hacking and have seen the youtube videos however I feel I'm yet to experience it. (that I know of). Pros Servers fill up quick minimal queue times Devs are rolling out update after update Graphics are alright Sound is alright Drop rates are good It's $30.00General premis of game and how its been put together works.Cons Lots of small and some large technical glitches that need to be overcome (which I presume will come with updates)I feel like they should be squeezing more out of the U4 engine considering the lead designer chose to avoid propriatary engines like on H1Z1 and ARMA which slowed development.I'm excited to see where this game goes I really hope it doesnt follow suit of most early access games these days and just quietly get mothballed.

review: Gunplay mechanics are sort of decent however graphically it's been down graded heavily on the other hand performance is better. It looks like a game that came out in 2012 to be honest it reminds me of that era which is not good for a open world game that came out in 2017. Net code is still awful that again is not good for battle royal open world games in general. There are tons of issues with server connectivity this issue has been around since it was in early access. I highly doubt that these problems would get resolved soon but here they are.It's clucky AF even though it's been "released".Do you hate having to deal with hard campers in every little hole in a freaking open word game? this game is filled with them and that's the only way you can get to top 10 out of 100.

review: Feels a lot like the DayZ Mod (not standalone) with better controls and easy to use UI. One minute youre scavenging and the next you've been surrounded by four cucksters looking to steal your crap. Once you've learned to be the cucker and not the cuckee you'll have a lot of fun with this game.One of the DayZ feels is when you're walking through a seemingly empty field and get your wrecked in 7.62ms flat by some little cuckster hanging out in a bush. (legit strat you'll get lots of BP if you play in the end game circle).The points don't mean though. Won a game with 1 kill because I was prone the whole time and killed the last guy. As of now the points unlock crates which give you one random clothing item...which you're going to change out once you get in game anyways as soon as you find a better piece of gear.Honestly pretty good for a game in Alpha stage. Better than the DayZ standalone even to this day unless you like running around for gear all day and not seeing a single person to use it on. Vehicles/weapons/looting/PVP all on release. It does need to be optimized as many have said. I have a Lenovo Y50 laptop that's 3 years old with an GT 860M and i'm running on low.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In a brutal savage dystopia future. 100 men and women are airlifted to a remote island in an attempt to find a Swanson Chicken Dinner. However once the paratroopers land treachary is afoot. A blue electrical field is deployed to zone in and find the chicken dinner but only one person can enjoy it at the end of the day.In this game you can go alone in the Squads game mode achieving the 2nd place team rank after killing 12 people.Alternetively you can beat another person to death with a frying pan and then place it over your butt as a protective plate.PUBG is a brutal unforgiving shooter rife with political intrigue. Will you work together to find the Chicken Dinner? (You won't.) or will you slaughter your fellow man for a sub par frozen entree? (You will.)

review: If you buy this game prepared to keep your task manager open while playing it the game is not unstable per say but sometimes the game will crash mid game...Besides crashing (Not a huge problem) This game is great for a competitve setting. The guns are fairly balananced.The devs are amazing and post weekly updates on their website. Their latest push is to make the game more compatible to lower spec pc's.This game has a lot of potential and the dev's seem like they want to take this game out of beta.If you are reading this you probably are on the fence wondering if you should drop $30 like I did. You definately should.Solo is alright and rewards you the most in game currency just for playing. Duo and Squad play rewards great too but only if you make it far and get tons of kills.You will feel at first like you can't hit anyone but just aim ahead of where the player is.Would recommend 9/10.

review: I really like this game. The concept is amazing the execution is getting there and the devs seem to have player opinions in mind as they work. There's nothing like getting down to the top ten and feeling your heart beat accelerate as you struggle to be the last man. This game is more addicting than any moblie " play while you poop" game. Probably the only gripe i have is the plane intro. Its too hard to space out from other players to get some good equipment. But its definitley a challenging concept. Maybe have some kind of spawn system where each player/team spawns in a random house with no others. But not a big deal honestly. Great game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The loot system of DayZ the vehicles of H1Z1 and extremely satisfying kills/ gun mechanics. I have been burned by DayZ in the past and although this game isn't the same thing it is from a similar line of thought. There is something about PUBG that is satisfying. This game is doing very well and I am going to remain optimistic that this game will incorporate more modes to directly compete with DayZ in the future. At this time I recommend this game to fans of DayZ ArmA H1Z1 and other similar games. I honestly wish A3 had as satisfying of kills as PUBG does.

review: When you first start this game You will dieProbably didn't see anyone all gameGot caught outside the zone Got your ears blown out by man children in an airplane... But perseverance is key! Don't die... Use TAB to free lookRun to the circle before the countdown hits 10 Just turn you voice to team onlyOk so that first part is to show you this game has a large learning curve you can't get off COD BO3 and think you can play any fps! This game is a tactical shooter it requires lots of patience practice and perseverance. You will SUCK you first few hours... so all the negative reviews calling this game too hard play the game awhile!This game is so satisfying dropping in the school killing the 3 people on the roof with nothing but a pistol jumping down collect guns 2 more kills... you clear a largely populated area and get out alive you have 5 kills 2guns on you back riding a motorcycle across a field... this game is tons of fun and will only get better at time goes on. This game is frequently updated at least 1 update per month. Tips for new players YouTube is your friend your best friend... good luck and keep it up! P.S. zylbrad is sniper god...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: its a really intense game. It can be strongly action driven but also more stealth like kinda like MGS series. The more you realize at a certain point you can get #1 you literally feel your heart racing. And the moment you actually did it the first time will really feel like a huge achievement )Nevertheless keep in mind that its early access so it still struggles with performance issues. Its possible that buildings are not rendered properly or your screen freezes in the second you want to approach the enemy. Its absolutely not optimized yet so be prepared to play on low/medium even with a good PC. lags. The enemy is watching in a different direction (as you see it) but you are still shot by him first. Im playing from Germany on EU server dont know if its different in different place wordwide. no story purely multiplayer. And the MP has no "story" as well. Well its not claiming to be more so thats not negative but be aware of it. Some ppl might think there is no meaning to the game. as every big multiplayer game there are hackers here. The good news is the developers ban them on a regular basis and more counter measures are being implemented soon (like reporting). The game itself is really fun but keep it mind its still early access so you will find the issues listed above. NOT ALWAYS but sometimes. Also i feel like this are typical EA sicknesses that will be dealt with as soon it reaches release Q2017. I recommend to watch a few youtube videos or twitch streams to get an impression of the current state.Cheers.

review: Too buggy to recommend in current state.Main issues for me Third Person Mode is the default for this game although when you aim it goes to First Person.. game doens't know what it wants to be TPS or FPS. Apparently FPS mode is coming but it's doesn't exist for oceania/aussie players yet. Connectivity. No ping indicated in the game however occasionally 'high latency detected' will pop up so I presume I'm playing on the Sydney server and routing latency sometimes sucks. There should be more (local) servers available for a game with literally the most concurrent players on Steam constantly. Hopefully will be fixed in time. Hit registration. I shoot a guy several times he turns around and hits me twice. So i've had the drop on him i've emptied a clip into him. Somehow he takes i tall and then kills me. Annoyingly common and probably related to my connection to the server.The hype is real and the game is OK. Plays like Stalker Shadow Of Chernobyl. I hope the dev doesn't continue to waste time on cosmetics and instead fixes the myriad of fun breaking bugs / server issues will update review if that happens.

review: Well at least I learned that Battle Royale games are NOT FOR ME. Ever. I enjoyed the first 2 games I played but after that I just sort of kept on getting peeved by the fact that each new death taught me NOTHING I DIDN"T ALREADY KNOW. Now steam keeps recommending battle royale games. off please.Not that I'm bad at shooters. I'm quite good at a number of them. But I'm only good because when I play I control my pace hold my nerve and proceed methodically. PUBG allows none of this because the pace is set stupid high the sound design volume is all over the place and you have insufficient information at your disposal at any given moment to have any idea what the best method forwards is and have to rely on pure ing guesswork.It clashes with my playstyle and I wish there was a "royale" tag to spam into all 3 slots of my DO NOT SHOW ME THIS CRAP preferences.It is however a good game well thought out well implemented with good controls. It's just not for me.

review: Too many cheaters/hackers! The developers do not seem to care much about fixing them or there arent enough developers to keep up with all of the issues. Most matches you play if you pay attention you can notice cheaters. To name a few cheats happening aim bot speed hack esp no recoil macros lag switching people modifying files to remove grass rocks and bushes. On top of that you have issues with damage bugs and server tick rate/netcode issues. The sad part is it keeps getting worse. It doesnt seem like the main issues which are above are being dealt with. People will suggest playing first person.. but the issues are still there. There might be less aimbot users but the other issues still apply to first person as well.Its sad because if the issues above were fixed or even reduced to where you could play a few games with out seeing them then the game would be fun enough to play. At the moment I wouldnt suggest spending the money until the issues are dealt with.Its really a big headache and will make your blood pressure rise!

review: An absolutely wonderful game that has been plagued by so many hackers and scripters that it is crazy. The game at its core is one of the most fun experiences that I have ever had making for fun times with friends and intense moments in the fray. Ever since release the game has had many stability updates and optimizations and the game now runs really well on a relatively mid range PC like mine. The hackers are a huge problem as I run into at least one every few games or so. However I cannot give this game a bad rating for that reason. The game is still super fun to play and hackers cannot ruin a good mechanical experience.TL DR Worth the purchase if the occasional hacker doesn't you off.

review: Honestly hoped that all the problems would be fixed after 1.0. But no. Frame stuttering and drops persist and there is no place for that in a competitive game. Somehow my game runs worse after 1.0 having 60 70 fps on ultra before the update and having 50 60 fps on very low after 1.0. Frames for some reason like to drop during intense firefights or when driving on uneven slopes basically exactly when i can possibly something up.For gameplay it is VERY fun for the first 50 to 70 hours or so of gameplay even when i replay it now it sends me an adrenaline rush coursing through my veins during tense moments being in top 10 or just simply trying to survive a firefight. but after 100 hours i just can't seem to find anymore interest in this game and the games seem to draw out 20 to 30 minutes in length where you run for hours on end not seeing any enemies at all but getting shot from far away by a baby with a rifle and an any times scope. I mean that helps with the adrenaline rush the fear of losing it all but the reward for such a triumph is 1000 to 1500 BP which is either just enough or not even close to the price of getting your second battlepack for the week. It would be better if winning awarded you with 2 or more battlepacks atleast or more than 1500 BP. Sure you get "bragging rights" but since literally millions of players own this game winning Chicken Dinner isn't much of a feat as it used to be.It could be that my connection is bad but usually during the start of a round where there are usually 85 to 100 players in the game it sometimes lags and picking anything up can become delayed. I mean it is 100 players but the main selling point of this game is the fact that you are in an arena with said hundred players.So i think that i won't recommend this game (for now as i may come back in a couple months) because of the poor optomization bad servers and repetitiveness. Even if the two of the problems on my list could be that "my computers quot or that "you probably just have bad internet" but it doesn't mean that they're not contributing to the problem aswell. For the final verdict i'd give this a 6/10 as even though i have alot of problems with the game at times it can be very fun and exciting to play and if my friends would like to play it i wouldn't complain. Its fun to come back to every once in a while but playing it continiously is just impossible for me to do. Hopefully most of these problems will be fixed later on and i can finally recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is unresponsive which it terrible for a game where you need to pick up items or open doors fast. Movement is also very unresponsive it feels very slow clunky and imprecise. Would have expected better performance from this game considering I have a GTX 1080. Framerates is not stable. The UI is poor for example it does not remember the last game mode you selected. I.e. if you were only interested in playing first person you need to manually select it each time. Gun fights feel very clunky and feel very imprecise to compared to other big shooting games. As far as gameplay itself is concerned it's very very slow action wise. There are few moments of actual action. Most of the game is spent walking or driving around finding a gun. Map design is very poor games will often end with you dying to someone peaking behind a tree miles away.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

If you don't like that duos and squads are always fun if you're not too much of a rager and can make light of some things.Gameplay (not including quirks) 8/10Replayability (wanting to play again and again) 10/10Current Full Game Rating 7.6/10 (I'm not taking note of the defects of the game but I am taking note of the overall "fun" factor (I guess considered by most ??) at the current date 1/2/2018.I will recommend for people who don't get easily agitated and for those who do (so everyone) just don't break your keyboard if you die to something stupid )

Lag is a big problem on OC server i shot a player with full burst micro UZI he didnt die then he shoots me once with pistol I die. this was all at close range I was obviously lagging behind the other player. The game needs to match the ping of players. If a players ping is to long then he shouldnt be aloud to connect. Chinese and Other Asian countries jump on OC server because their servers are full. this should not be a choice. If their server is full they shouldnt then be able to flood the OC server. I know this game is still virtually under construction but these are problems that if not fixed many wont return to play. Other than that when the game works it can be a lot of fun.

review: After playing this game over the past 5 6 months I've had it it has really come a long way. The developers have listened to the players and fixed bugs they regularly update the game and regularly add new content to the gameEDIT After some more time playing the game on and off I would still say play the game Its fun. But the issues that I have with it that many other people also have with it is that its too buggy and most of the bugs still haven't been addressed in anyway by the developers. And you would think that after being in alpha/beta for almost a year that it when it goes into full launch it should have minimal bugs. I had my fun with this game. But i find that its competitor (fortnite) and its other competitor (H1Z1 realisticly isnt really a competitor because of how dead it is atm) are just better games. Fortnite is less buggy and H1Z1 developers are trying their best to make the game more enjoyable. Overall Buy PUBG if you want its fun. Just have to accept the bugs for what they are and hope they get fixed.

review: I have updated the review since the 1.0 release and I can tentatively recommend it... i'm basically on the fence but it has improved since I first reviewed it... enough I give a 51% to 49% recommend not recommend.Why? Server lag has gone significantly down Hackers are becoming much less of an issue New events that mixes up gameplay Introduction of War Mode (only custom games for now but still)Still Existing Cons Every maintenance and update/patch seems to create new issues that lower performance of the game Loot has gotten significantly worse... especially on the desert map. Now early battles are between those with a shotgun or smg and those with nothing. I'm fine with not finding high level loot as much but can you at least have more low level loot everywhere so it's not fists against guns in the beginning? Desert map is just way too big... it truly is a run simulator if you can't find a vehicle. There aren't as many vehicle spawns as people claim on the map... they are just getting lucky with finding them lol

review: Really wanted to like this game but after over 10 hours of laggy gameplay the tech issues finally got to me and I uninstalled it. First what I liked... Closest thing to a battle simulator out there. The realism was what kept me coming back for more. Finally a game that doesn't pamper the player into thinking he's/she's the chosen one. Has great potential the maps were awesome and it's really cool exploring them. Nice weapon selections and design. The way they behave and sound is pretty close to real life.Now the bad stuff... The latency oh dear god the latency! At first I was blown away by the super human reflexes and aim that everyone in the game had except me. Here I am crouching at that perfect spot in an ambush. Player pops up and already knew I was there even though I was silent the whole time. But after I got shot when standing behind a brick wall I wisened up and decided to check. Turns out the best ping I get is well over 300 ms. The only time it goes down to 50ish is when connected to a server in India. All other servers (even those in Asia) are pathetic as best. For those who don't know what latency is it's the time for a movement made on your computer to register on everyone elses. The slower this is the slower you will seem in the game consequently those with better latency will always have an edge.This was further substantiated by death cam replays where the player who killed me is always aiming like 10 15 feet behind me and still hitting me. I realize this could be because of my internet connection too but the fact that other players are facing similar issues proves that it's a system problem. Bluewhatever please fix this! It's totally ruining the experience! Maps. Really? 50 million in sales and all you have are 3 maps?
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game was great when I first got it but now the game is nothing but hackers. I still log on and play a few games but when I get killed by people with names like 90009274003 from across the map with a pistol or through a wall the game gets old. The limited time modes are fun but are too short and far between and the game has got me wanting to switch to Fortnite. To be honest even after 103 hours I find the game fun but if Steam would give me my money back I would take it and run to Fortnite.

review: I've played this game now for almost 90 hours. I had some fun with friends it WAS nice.I'm quite disappointed how bad it actually still runs on a good computer. I would have expected it to be optimized more by now. Waiting for friend to come online can take as much as 3 minutes.I can definitely say that I hate the desert map. There is no way where you can select a map.I hate the way you cannot really control what you pickup from the floor which results in changing pants 10x before picking the weapon you really need. You can also press 'TAB' but then you won't see your surroundings.I get tired of having to wait more than a minute before every game and than spending another minute or two in a plane or in the sky before the game actually starts. There are some bugs in this game are not acceptable getting stuck in the world invisible walls while driving and there is a bug in which you won't get your BP after a game.Speaking of which you played a lot of battles trying to collect as much BP as you can for a chest. Only to find out you need to BUY a key of 2 00 to open the chest.And last but not least cheaters.

review: Having played a month of the beta (it's going live 1.0 in a few hours) I can say this is what I was looking for in other similar games like ARMA and DayZ.Good The open world is great explorable and exploitable for tactical purpose.Each play through is unique as you never run into the same exact situation.The game does get your heart pounding during intense fire fights surprise encounters or sneaky ambushes.1st person play mode is great as 3rd person is just cheesey hide and wait while no one can see me t.Actual bullet physics that require you to adjust your attack depending on your weapon type.The Bad There are some latency and graphics performance issues that need improvement.Graphics are inconsistent for different players leaves a question as to how hidden you actually are in grass/bushes/windows. I swear I die in 1 hit every time but it takes multiple shots for me to kill anyone.

review: When this game first came out it was super fun and a change of pace. However now that time has passed I have lost that feeling. PUBG seems to have gotten too cocky with what they are doing resulting in them neglecting this game. First off there are so many areas where this game is broken and they still have yet to fix them. Rather than doing this PUBG Corp. wants to add new content into the game to try and distract everyone from the issues. The issue with this is that it is pretty difficult to enjoy new content WHEN THE GAME IS BROKEN. I have been a fan of this game for a long time but with the recent blatant hacking and PUBG doing barely anything about it I have been completely tunred off of this game. If its on sale for $5 sure pick it up with friends and get a couple hours of entertainment out of it. Other than that I dont see this game being worth it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm going to give the "Readers Digest" version of a review (I doub't many of you even know what that is)PUBG to me is that chick that has that hot model banging body and then smiles and has some jacked up teeth! (Houseguest reference) This game is a BLAST but there are bugs that have been around for the longest time that need to be addressed. I mainly play this in duo or squads with friends and we enjoy our time (most of the time) fragging together. One of the biggest things is the crazy amount of desync this game has...Holy cow...So many times I've been shot while in cover or behind walls due to desync. You just have to laugh and say screw it and move on. There are MX but its all cosmetic so there is no reason to spend money if you don't want to after you purchaseOverall this is a very fun game when playing with friends and I would recommend it to all my friends if they want some BR action. No cartoon BS here my guys!P.S. Just wanted to say bluehole is making improvements This game is 10x better then when it released So if you tried it early on give it another shot!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a battle royale shooter which can be played in first or third person perspective. The fact that its battle royale means you'll face off alone or as a team against other players on a large map. Each match consists of 100 players facing off against each other to claim the #1 spot. When you start a match you are dropped onto a large island by plane. Where you are dropped is up to you though since you can jump from the drop plane at any point and decide where to land with your parachute. From this point the rat race begins as you hurry to find any means to defend yourself against other players that may have dropped near you. You simply never know what around the next corner. So being well prepared is a good idea and be prepared for the worst at that. You can find a variety of weapons at the numerous locations on the island from machetes to assault rifles. Aside from weapons you can find different ways of protecting yourself in the form of helmets and bullet proof vests. These come in 3 different levels of protection. You'll need these to give you the edge over the competition so finding level 3 protective gear is in your best interest. Speaking of survivability you can find various types of healing items aswell. When you take heavy fire but manage to escape by the skin of your teeth these items will help you get back on your feet and continue the fight. You have your standard med kits but there are also energy drinks which replenishes your health over time and can even give you a movement speed boost if you chug away enough of them. Vehicles are also present and will be needed to escape groups of hostile players and the dreaded blue circle which you will be running from over the course of a match. This blue circle will shrink in size as the game goes on and being outside the blue circle will drain your health. Not so much in the beginning but as the circle gets smaller the damage over time also increases. Therefore the circle is super important to keep you eye on later in the game. It forces the players closer and closer together and will ultimately force a confrontation between the last standing players. Being one of the last survivors really puts you on edge and you'll want to win especially if you've come this far. As if the blue circle and all the players out to get you weren't enough on occasion red circles will appear on the map. These indicate that this particular zone will be bombed. If you find yourself in this zone your best bet is seeking shelter indoors or getting out of it ASAP. You can imagine all these element make for a fun and addictive gameplay loop and it will make you want to go for another round to get that elusive #1 spot. Playing with friends is the best way to experience most multiplayer games and this one is no exception. Being able to strategize with your team and plan your next move as the circle is closing in is a very satisfying experience and one that pays off. That said the game is not perfect and suffers from some lag issues from time to time. There are also instances where you can get stuck on the environment or take unnecessary damage trough some wonky hitboxes and physics. These things can happen from time to time and can certainly diminish your enjoyment of the game. Especially when you are on a losing streak and you get a cheap death trough one of the game's many bugs. Be mindful of that but let it also be known that the core game is a ton of fun regardless. When all works well you can have a blast and you'll find the hours flying by as you keep pushing yourself to be number one. Be it solo or as a team you'll find yourself on the edge of your seat as you try and survive and end up on top and get that famous chicken dinner!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly they need to do something about server connection with this f#cking game. Every time there's an update for the game or at random times the servers are down for hours. Usually how it goes is that you can buy lootboxes for cosmetic items or play enough and recieve in game currency to buy them. I've always felt that system was fair for multiplayer games. With this one however first you pay for the lootbox then you pay for the key to open it. That is such utter horsecrap.

review: Awesome game. Runs pretty well on my old machine. I am using a gtx 660ti on my I5 4670k and i constantly hit above 40fps minimum and around 60fps on average with settings on 1080p everything very low except textures on medium. I cant complain about the performance. A friend of mine runs the game on a 1050ti oc with 90 100 fps on average. Most fun is garuanted on duo mode. My heartbeat droped several times to zero when we were the last remaining team. Pro tip hide in bushes am ambush anything that moves!Edit 2018!After more than 400 hours in this game i am still some kind of addicted to this game. Actual i run this game on my GTX 1060OC without any FPS problems. Some friends of mine said that a lot of cheater are around. I guess i never seen one. I can still recommend this game to everyone who loves BattleRoyal games. The combats are still pretty good and immersive. At the moment i am looking forward to the new map.

Unrealistic and frustrating.Clumsy gameplay it feels that you always walk on ice you can get used to it but very annoying for new players sometimes I even struggle to get trough doorway not mentioning peek and shoot situations.Met few cheaters but it's normal in such games (except maybe first one which at the end wen two of us left teleported behind me and death cam was saying "unusual movement detected playback is not available"). Automatic guns by default has semi auto mode on which is bit unusual and annoying. Ofc you can get used to it but when you get SMG the last thing you can think of that it will not spray enemies in close quarters but just shoot like pistol . (Add 1500 rpm sniper rifle mode by default to balance this crazyness haha).Overall I think marketing of this game is excelent but game itself is just "playable" and not worth the money. review: This game has gotten better in terms of optimisation but currently feels so poor to play. I was 15ft away from someone I hit them in the chest perfectly three times and not one of them registered and I died to a mini uzi.I have sank around 120 hours in to this game and since the most recent update i have been put off massivly and uninstalled the game. War mode stay away! It's the most awful attempt at a team deathmatch mode I have ever seen. I don't see why it isn't possible to split the main maps up into seperate mini maps and put some proper effort in to create a proper team deathmatch style mode that we have come to love from Call of Duty and Battlefield.Hopefully the new map will play ok when released but I just see all these new things getting released for the game are a poor attempt to keep people interested.I don't see how hard it is to get it right!?I tried for so long to convince friends to play it but im sorry I can no longer justify doing it. Especially when it costs money unlike other BR games which are better put together and thought out.Do not recommend...

review: No doubt the game can be fun to play but its ing terribly optimized! I personally find the graphics ing terrible yet I get terrible performance on very low settings 720p 70 screen scale. I run a i7 6th gen 3.2ghz overclocked to 4ghz 16gb RAM 256gb Samsung SSD AMD R9 360 2gb. THE PERFORMANCE NEEDS TO BE FIXED close quarter gunfights are unbearable FPS average when taking fire is like 20fps and often capable of dropping bellow 10fps for the duration of being fired upon. I'd recommend this game to everyone if they can just fix their before they call it 1.0 this game seems like it just came out of alpha barely on beta stage. Red dot recticle also appears as a very distracting + throughout the entire optical more often than not significantly disadvantaging my capability of engaging the opposition if I only have a red dot available as it it obscures your view.

review: You know you're in for a grand time when you check if your server is set to NA and more than half the people in the lobby are speaking fluent Chinese. I don't care if I win and I don't care if I lose I just liked playing with my friends and enjoying the stupid moments we had. What I absolutely cannot stand for is the fact that the hacking issues have present from even before the game left early access to now and more than likely untill the end of time.The game devs like to make you think that they are taking care of the issue by handing out reports of an unreasonable amount of accounts they have blocked that were linked to hacking in game or lawsuits they filed against those selling the hacking programs. But what they continue to refrain from doing is IP bans on said hackers or region locks to keep the area responsible for a vast majority of the issues that most players have away and confined. They would lose too much money if they did that being that it's much more profitable for them to force the banned player to make a new steam and rebuy their game to play again and letting them run rampant through all the servers gives more players the chance to suffer and report the hackers resulting in even more meaningless bans.These people do not care their game has made them all the money they could have asked for and then some. Remeber when they said micratransactions wouldn't be a part of this game till it left early access? Or even better how they called this game E sports ready....This game and it's developers are a joke. DO NOT buy this game DO NOT give them the time of day you will only ever come to regret your decision. Take your money elswhere and give it to a game or group of devs that are truely worthy to be paid for their product.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a fun game. Even better if you win but that always seems to evade me.That is what I said when I made my original review back in September 2017. Pretty much when the game was in its prime. However I just wanted to say a few more things about this game. I haven't played in a long time but that's because I don't have much drive to keep playing.I kinda stopped before hacking became a big problem a little while after 1.0 released and everyone still liked it so I never delt with hackers (as far as I know of). But every match felt the same. I land and try to find a gun I kill others in the area and look for more weapons and players while the circle is decreasing. I thought maybe I just needed to change tactics so instead of the ambusher and stalker style I played the aggressor. Still didn't feel that much different.Now I am bad at this game. I always have been and that's probably a big factor but it just seems to random. I check a house and find a crowbar and armor while that guy next door found an smg and guns me down. It seems out of my control and I keep wondering what's the point. I never won a game and I don't have interest in trying again.It is a fun game and I do see why people liked it so much back in the day but the fun wore out for me even before all the technical issues and hacking problems. I have the same feelings about fortnite but at least that game is more stable than pubg ever was and the devs seem to give a crap about their game and their community. I know I'm in the minority here but battle royal just seems to random for me to keep trying to win. Just my 2 cents though.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
