My ingame name is MikeHawk for those who don't believe my ing skill level. BluHole needs to take their heads out their asses and fix their game or I will make myself play ing fortnite and spend $25 on that game as a dumb statement. For the players who want to try this game watch literally any streamer that doesn't have 10k viewers and watch the average player and see what they go through. review: Well over a year after release."Hm I'm a bit bored. Maybe I should check out the new PUBG map." Install game. Crashes immediately on startup 3 times. "Would you like to send us an error report?" No bugger off I've done it 100 times since release and it's still broken. Finally get to menu. Servers too busy. Servers too busy. Servers too busy. Servers too busy. Servers too busy. Servers too busy. Finally get into game. Still poor performance on a high end rig after countless "performance" patches according to the patch notes. Walk around rubber banding occassionally due to desync issues and bad servers. Find a gun. Walk outside and get killed by a set of arms and a gun stretched out from behind a corner. Close and uninstall.And that's it for the 2018 health check of PUBG. Keep buying lootboxes and keys kids. Remember when they said there would be no microstransactions? Lol. Maybe if the Chinese hackers give them another few hundred million dollars they'll be able to hire some programmers that can fix this pile. See you guys after awhile for the 2019 health check.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'll be honest here 2 issues have been raised many times but I haven't seen the problem in them. A lot of people are saying that the game is filled with hackers. This may be true but I have played both on NA &amp SA without encountering a single hacker since I started playing. The second issue seems to be about skins and crates. PEOPLE IT'S JUST COSMETICS PLS! I'm sick of complaints on the fact that we have to pay for cosmetics when they are completely useless in game. All it does is make you look good.Secondly I want to note that yes the game in it's current state is not at it's best. Yes devs don't quite listen to the community. Optimization is actually amazing considering that I had a intel pentium and could still run the game at 15 20 fps constant on lowest settings.Finally don't listen to all the negative reviews you can have so much fun playing this game. (Especially with friends!) Even though you'll encounter couple bugs and have to deal with the horrible d sync issue you'll have a great time. In the upcoming months they'll be releasing amazing new content so get ready for that!

Kill cams are also delayed and you get a buggy and delayed video where you end up dying before the person who killed you even shoots. I would probably wait about a year before considering to purchase this game.

review: This game's idea is amazing and the concept as adicting and fun. But the who ever wrote the code for the game is horrible. the mechanics are awefull. the close range combat is garbage because of how laggy character motion looks on screen. They developed this on the unreal engine but still found a way to make it stupidly demanding on the CPU instead of the graphics card. which makes the over all game just aweful to play. you will crash. you will lag when the game starts resulting in your death. It just seems like who ever wrote the code and design the mechanics have never developed a game before. its soo unprofesionally done. This game has to be the most poorly optimized product I have ever seen for a game who's graphics look like it was made for the first xbox. some year 2000 games look better than this does and can run on old systems yet my GTX 1080 w/ i7 proccessor some times can't handle it. that on top of the servers being god awefull and lagging you out makes some of the experience seem not worth booting up. i write all this before it releases because it comes out tomorrow. i cannot believe they will this game in its Garbage state. that being said... pubg is best aweful game I have ever played. Im not recommending becuase the developers should be embarrased at the lack of optimization of this game for when it releases. .

review: Well after 203 hours into the game and being with the game since its birth I can honestly say at the current state is definitely playable with some deaths and events that happen being questionable. Mainly the bulk of the issues are surrounded by hit registration desync although that has came leaps and bounds some vehicle lag in certain situations and the occasional parachute lag and the latency when you open doors at the beginning of the game. With that being said they have also added a lag switch detector to minimize the chance of people being able to use a lag switch and if I recall an overlay that will run behind the game that is looking for ESP and spinbots as well as other hacks. I love the guns in the game each gun has its own feel and action to it that you will more than likely grow accustomed to a few weapons depending on your playstyle. Do you wanna play CQB when the zone gets small or run a sniper rifle for long range engangments? That's a choice that you have to make depending on the zone and how its collapsing to the end play zone and what kind of position you have on the map as well as what your teammates are running.Loot crates make the game more dynamic as well camp the crate and try to pick people off or make a run for it and hope for the best. The weapons also have tons of attachments that add another dimension to the game being able to choose your sight and barrel attachment.Right now I would give the game an 8/10 with the last two points missing because of overall server optimization and some in game bugs that are being ironed out. The game is being supported by an awesome team over at Bluehole and there are weekly patches as well as one large monthly patch.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hello.OK. So after playing it for a week this my rating for this game in its current status 7.75To raise that rating I think...Some major points should be Improve performance. This is very important otherwise a big number of players will not be able to play (buy) the game. No one enjoys a low quality lagged gameplay. Improve physics on vehicles. Its current physics are bringing disturbing bugs / gameplay. Add a new map/s with completely different locations and atmosphere. I know the current one is so big but in the end it's the same and some variation would definitely help.Some important points should be Improve damage caused by guns (not 10 gunshots to kill someone in short range) and/or create a "hardcore" mode. (I know this has already been said). Hardcore mode should be first person camera only. Make sure that long distanced enemies are surrouned by properly loaded textures. It's very important because this game aims to offer a realistic survival. Add more weather effects / time of the day for new map. Night survival with thermal / night viewer would be awesome. Add wild life (animals) to some parts of the map/s. I've seen some birds as fact. Some cows or such would be great and also could cause distraction / noise. More realism. Add more weapons / technical war elements. Add different type of games capture the flag find and eliminate etc. Keep the weapon spawn ratio low. We don't want this game to turn into a CoD.These are just some suggestions sure I could make the list longer. Anyways this is a good game in its current status is playable and it seems that (as I hope) it will be improved more and frequently.To me this could be the definitive realistic survival game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I still play this game. I also still enjoy it. But I cannot tell anyone it is worth buying. Bluehole and Plunk seem to only care about "Hyping" this game up. They are adding another map adding new towns to the current map. But they are completely ignoring critical issues that the game has.Combat is trash This includes everything from Player movement to firing a weapon. Landing a punch is the equivalent to trying to hit someone with a foam pool noodle. You swing but you dont really know when or where it will land.They are working on adding Vaulting to the game but at this point people have waited so long that it doesn't even matter that much. We have mastered the "PUBG Parkour".The guns are not too bad. I mean really how can you mess that up. The biggest problem with guns is aiming inside of a vehicle. It is absolute cancer. I swear being in the passenger seat while trying to aim a gun you would think you had Parkinson's. For people that play in First Person only it is even worse because they don't have the option(at least I dont think they do) to use the 3rd person aiming. Which while it would make your accuracy slightly worse at least you wont have an epileptic seizure while doing so.Hackers? I have seen a lot of complaints about cheaters but I cannot with honesty say that I have noticed or experienced them for myself. There was one moment when me and 2 of my friends got sniped on a rooftop a ridiculous distance away by an UMP. I don't want to straight up claim that was cheating but at that distance either it was cheating or Bluehole needs to fix the UMP. Because an ump should not be that effective at that range.Rewards for playing/Reasons for playing We can laugh about this. The only reason to play is to have fun here. That is the way it should be for any game. The only reward system is in the form of Battlecoins(or whatever they are called) and they can be used to buy some loot crates. Inside those crates you will find cosmetic items that take the award for "Most Lackluster Experience". I have opened about 7 crates myself. I currently have a Hat 3 black tank tops 2 Black Combat Pants and a couple striped shirts. woo.About the Devs LOL! No seriously where are they? We don't get anything from them other then the periodic Map update that seems like it will never come. And the continuous post poning of the vaulting system. It seems Bluehole and Plunk thought it would be a good idea to start working on a generic money grabbing korean mmo(a review for another time) rather than focus their resources on this game.Overall Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a buggy mess developed by people that have no sense of priority. You will not be rewarded for your gameplay other then with terrible loot chests that have the worst RNG in any loot crate you will ever find. HOWEVER! Just like a bottle of cheap wine the taste may be bad but you will still get drunk and have fun. So if you value the having fun part over a completed game with trustworthy devs it is all for you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Despite what everyone says about Chinese hackers this game is amazing. I play on oceanic servers and the amount of times I ve come across these low life s is little to none. The game itself is beautiful such an addicting style of gameplay that ll have you analysing your kills and your deaths to try and find a better way of doing it. Frustrating as when you get killed in the first 2 minutes of one game and then the next you last until the top 10 30 minutes into game. I think it s this fact that everyday people can make it big in games simply due to the unpredictability of the games R&amp G. This is what keeps people coming back. For the hope that the next game will be better than the last. And cannot forget about that feeling you get when you get your first chicken dinner. Put simply you re gonna buy this game sooner or later so you might as well do it now. 9.5/10

review: Yea yea i have less then a day on record but I have played enough games to know when I dislike something and why. I stopped playing this game a couple months back becuase of the cheating and honestly some poorly optimized mechanics of the game. They recently released a big update (unless a 7 gig update was steam going ) and i have yet to realize any improvement in any feature of the game. The only noticible change though not an improvement was the creation of a new lootbox which of course requires you to buy a key and there goes the freakin cash sink. Really my main issue with this game is the lack of reward for actually being accurate with your shots and the lack of penalty for being inaccurate. Maybe its just a visual bug but there are too many times when the enemies crosshair is not even close to me or their red dot is a whole 6 feet to the right of me and i continue to get shot yet i never manage to have the same luck. Call it recoil randomness but its not like the gun actually seems to change direction or angle. this game is now up to 14 gigs of hard drive space and you cant even easily vault a half wall....April 20th tried it again now uninstalling it everyone knows where you are and you have no clue where anyone else is.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is not the first battle royale the best battle royale or even a GOOD battle royale game. PUBG is just a stain on gaming with a novel idea but flawed exectution. The game is laggy has no region lock the report system is a joke and you are going to die to a cheater almost all of the time. I wish I could say there were SOME redeeming qualities such as Crates being valued highly but since they are putting keys in a game that is thirty dollars not even that is redeeming.First off this game runs so poor on a gaming computer with all of the settings minimized that it is annoying and frustrating. I have everything at Low and I still will get major lag spikes for no reason at all which is something you should not have happen in a game like this as that can mean Victory or Loss for a player. That makes it so either the lagging player is at disadvantage without being able to retaliate to gunshots or is put at advantage and ruins everyone else's game.Next is how there is a lack of Region Lock keeping people off of the servers where they can basically lag hard enough that they effectively can win the match through teleportation from the lag. You will often tell who these players are by their habit of eating through an entire clip of your gun then somehow being behind you and killing you.The Report System in theory is supposed to allow players who were wronged to report those who cheated have an offensive username or teamed up with another player to kill you. In reality however the system has shown no evidence of working with players using it to hopefully have the hacker banned or take away all BP or SOMETHING but there is no support nobody who got banned that we know of.This allows the Cheaters to run rampant through the game. A telling factor is how a lot of players can either shoot a gun with no recoil whilst having no attachments on it making it so that SCAR L that they had was basically a godsend. There is also the people who will spawn themselves weapons then snap to a headshot there are people who have god mode enabled and can eat bullets like nobody else and there are people can shoot you before they see you.Crates even are a bad factor of this game. You saved up 700 BP from your games win or loss. You are feeling happy to get this crate Desperado Crate... You must purchase a $2.50 key to open this crate where you won't recoup the cost unless you happen to get lucky. Overall PUBG is a game that knocks you down by taking $30 for a bad game and if you want to recoup the cost from the game with crates you are going to wish you never paid the money as it will take so long to grind out the crates with all that is wrong. Read through the other reviews you will see "Hackers everywhere" and "Region Lock China" to prove that it isn't just a "bad" player trying to make myself seem good. We all either have problems with hackers and the lack of Region Lock or we are hackers or use region lock. Do not trust the good reviews if they are not addressing anything with the game and even then do not always trust the reviews that say it is good besides the fact of it being full of hackers. This game should not make money anymore H1Z1 is completely free now and Fortnite is free and they are 100% free to play with Cosmetics being the only items on sale.

review: Awsome game. Never had any expierience with battle royale (who comes up with these names anyway) but a friend got it and he kept playing so I've decided to take a peak...and so I've got lured and hooked. Game while still in early access is already very enjoyable. Rules are simple you jump out of perfectly good airplane along with up to a hundred other guys and gals naked in terms of any equipment and you rush towards the ground so that you can pick up as many tools of individual distruction as posible as soon as posible. Then it's just you (or you and up to 3 other team mates) against the world on an evershrinking battleground. If you are looking for another clone of CoD where you rush troughout the battlefield spraying bullits as if they were seeds well that's not it. Here you have to be patient clever and a bit lucky too. There is no camping in this game only tacktical ambushing. Due to early access the game is still a bit faulty when it comes to techicalities and ugly too (then again it's one of those games which you want to play on the lowest settings anyways). Can be a bit frustrating when after several minutes of gathering equipment you die because of a nasty lag. Optimisation is not its strongest point either but the developers are working on it and they do publish weekly updates that do improve the expierience. Besides even if you do get killed by a lag your vains will be filled with adrenaline and you will jump to another session right away. If you are looking for something different than mainstream CoD clones where tacktics matters and adrenaline builds up like crazy this might just be it.

review: After one year the frustration overweighs the positive effects.Generally the game is very exciting but the following problems make a long term usage quite annoying Biggest problem is the fighting system. This includes problems of visibility from different angles (TPP) and the hit box. Sometimes you see and shoot at players but because of glitches you cannot hit them. Though you get hit by them. Biggest problem is the damage dealt by weapons. The game is very unrealistic in this regard. You can shoot somebody in the head/face from 1m with a pistol and the guy is NOT dead immediately. Or shots to the neck should be fatal too. This frustrates many many times. The game play is very exciting at the beginning because 1. u don't know the map 2. u don't really know how to shoot because you have no possibility to train. However once you managed to become good with the weapons and know all the good spots you have to decide whether you want to have fun (shooting) or win (looting and avoiding fights). If you go for confrontation chances are very high that you'll never reach top positions and die at an early stage. If you go for the last circle you are basacly sprawling around for half an hour with almost no enemy contact. Though what is VERY ANNOYING is that if you go for the low key game mode you might get shot at a random point and just die with the best equipment. Thus you played for nothing. If everything goes well you make it to the end and get a chicken dinner with 1 3 kills. No thanks It is of course good if a game gets extensions/improvements. However I cannot count how many GB i have downloaded for PUBG and the main points (except frame rate which as actually only improved because rendering has been reduced dramatically to object within a few meters) is still very poor (s. fighting mode etc.). Balances of weapons shift. So there is no continuity. Still waiting every time 1 minute to start the game??? Once 90 is reached the game should start within 10 secondsPro Cheating has been reduced very wellAt the beginning very exciting. (However then it wears off and eventhough you get frustrated you play it more out of habit/addiction then enjoyment)..Summary PUBG has been one of the biggest promises but also one of the biggest fails. It has it's moments but if you want to go for points and statistics you'll get annoyed by the many bugs and imbalances. If you go for fun you'll never make a chicken dinner.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDITED AGAIN They cannot get optimization right. This game should be passed on as a result. I do not regret the time I have played but would not reccomend this to anyobdy now. Often times it seems like people kill you before you even see them around a corner. The game is fun but highly frustrating right now due to overall stability issues. Honestly it is quite a disapointment considering the popularity of the game. Don't buy until it is fixed if they ever fix it at all (early access devs tend to cut and run with their games...)

review: PUBG is characterized by long periods of quiet mixed with frantic brutal quick firefights often in cluttered urban environments. This is not the meatgrinder all fight all the time of COD this is a much more tactical game. If you want to win you need to learn to watch and to wait and to know when to move. You need to learn not to take every shot you see. Sometimes the best move is just to let somebody drive on by and get lit up by the next guy down the road.Does PUBG have problems? Yeah I guess. The occasional hacker some lag for the first minute or two of every match but nothing that makes it unplayable.Every time somebody asks me if PUBG's worth buying I tell them "Are you okay with occasinally getting shot in the head by a guy 500m away who you had no real chance to see?" If you're not PUBG isn't the game for you.

review: after putting 200 hrs+ on this game and owning it for more than a year i can say that the game has evolved so much in this year. i started playing before the vector was added i played during the time when my pc (i5 6500 1070 16gb) couldnt run pubg on more than 60fps on medium settings i played during the UI updates sound updates i also remember when in E3 2017 they teased the "desert map" (miramar) and vaulting and now they brought great changes to pubg made it more interensting and less repetitive. after seeing how this game evolved in just a year from a badly made early access game to a full blown action filled BR game i strongly recommend PUBG to anyone who has patience for honestly stupid bugs and glitches etc (uncommon) and wants to have hours of fun and develop his aim and skill.also where is my snow map?

review: A very solid game that defines an eraAlthough this isn't the first battle royale style game I believe it is the best and most true to the formula as it was created by the father of battle royale. Now don't get me wrong it is not perfect and I'm not just praising it for its creator. Graphically it is very realistic and is certainly the best graphics wise of any battle royale game. Obviously it has its issues sometimes however personally I am a huge fan of the art style. Now bear in mind it is not optimized the best so you're gonna need a pretty decent graphics card for the max settings but it's worth it.Now this wouldn't be a PUBG review without talking about crashes hm? Personally since the full release I've only experienced two or three crashes which I am fine dealing with. I know others have dealt with a lot especially on poorer quality hardware. Hopefully the gang at Bluehole continues to improve this as it is probably this game's biggest issue. Other notable aspects include the gunplay. Automaticv guns have learnable spray patterns in the vein of CS which I like. It makes the skill ceiling quite high as you must be able to use any weapon you get since there's never a guarantee you can get the gun you want.Overall score 9/10. A personal favorite high skill game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Region lock China
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Before I bought PUBG a friend told me "if you don't find a scope you are screwed" and that couldn't be more true. So a huge portion of being successful depends on RNG and not actual skill. If someone has a sniper rifle with a scope and all you have is a carbine with optics you are done unless they are really bad. Event modes only last a few days which is silly. Why not make more game modes permanent? No weather Always light never dusk or night. If someone throws a grenade and you are turned around you will not hear it even if it goes off directly behind you. That goes for both frag grenades and stun grenades. Stun grenades will have no effect on you if you aren't looking directly in it's direction. Hit detection is just stupid. You can head shot someone with a pistol from 100 yards away but miss an entire mag from a M16 from 20 feet. Vehicles rolling back onto you. When you leave a vehicle you can somehow end up "in the way" of what you were driving or riding it. It makes absolutely no sense. Driving or riding in vehicles is absolutely nauseating. If you play in FPP which a lot of people do now then good luck with the field of view while driving and I wish you even more luck if you attempt to ride in and defend a vehicle while doing so. It will hurt your eyes and head. Never ending updates. Literally every single day there is an update. This might not seem like a big deal but before the majority of them you'll have to restart your computer to get them to start downloading. Why this happens to some people is unknown. Update times are Wednesday night at 7pm PDT. To have that as your server downtime is yet another boggling thing about PUBG. Region resetting to Asia after major updates and/or server maintenance. After every match when you exit back the menu the default solo and third person are selected. That may not seem like a big deal but when you constantly play squad and first person then you always have to select that and be careful not to start the "default" selected game mode. If you play PUBG and then close Steam and decide to play PUBG later you will again have to restart your computer. This doesn't happen to everyone but it does to me and many others.I've only had the game for a few weeks now and have 30 hours played but I don't think it should take anyone five minutes to think of at least ten things that are wrong with a game. PUBG is better than any other game in the genre but still has a long way to go before I would recommend anyone pay full price for it or invest hundreds of hours into it. It has honestly already about run it's course with me when it comes to being fun. I look forward to the next best game of this type to come out down the line because all the issues aside PUBG is honestly can be fun if you play just for fun and overlook the things you will find wrong with it.

review: I've had nothing but issues from the moment i purchased this game. Apart from being poorly optimised the game simply will NOT work no matter what I try. At first it was just connectivity issues with the make and model on my router instantly blocking any traffic from the game for some 3 months I'm not using that router anymore but it wouldnt suprise me if it wasn't fixed. I've had a fresh install of windows 10 with a brand new SSD and it wont even get past the title screen. It crashes as often as an early acess title if not more. This company is as poorly run as any I've ever seen. They focus more on getting asmany people playing as they can to get as much money as possble instead of just FIXING the versions of the game that already exist. It's beyond pitiful. It's downright criminal. F*** the PUBG corporation. I've spent 75 hours playing this game and half of that haven't seen a fully finished game.
